name: Speedboat Racing
description: A simple race game. Throw dice and move, and obey any instructions

name: Stellar Prospector
description:
Stellar Prospector is a light game for 3-5 players vying for the chance to run a start-up franchise that prospects rare elements from stars in their planetary system. The first candidate franchisee to complete five specific delivery missions of specific rare elements to particular planets wins the right to run the franchise (and thus wins the game).

Players start the game with a small amount of money but no ships, pilots or fuel. In order to prospect and deliver rare elements, players must hire pilots and buy ships and fuel. Ships may be bought and pilots hired either at auction or from the shop. Higher level pilots and ships have a better chance of success but cost more money. Players make more money either by prospecting and delivering rare elements or bumming around the home base planet doing odd jobs.

Players must learn which stars contain what rare elements through trial-and-error missions and taking note of other players' routes and deliveries.

So players must balance observation with action, knowledge with uncertainty in their race to complete their missions, because star mining is a risky business, with pilot error or ship failure resulting in a fiery end to both.
categories: Deduction, Dice, Print & Play, Space Exploration
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: HeiNasH
description:
HeiNasH is a connection game with some luck.
Two players try to connect their sides with pawns, as in Hex game.
The board is made of hexes with numbers from 1 to 36.
The player roll three dice. He has now to create a number with the 3 results. If he find a solution, he places one pawn on the number found. If he doesn't find any solution, his opponent can show him one solution and he has to recover this number. If nobody find a solution, the active player places a pawn on any free number.

name: TSL Shooting Game
description:
A target shooting game. The target is three characters, on the end of a stand. The box illustrates this very well.
Players take turns and the one who has the most successes after a pre-set time has run out, wins

name: Das Feuerwehrspiel
description: There is a fire and the firefighters must help and need their equipment, helmet, axe, oxygen mask and hose. In his move a player rolls the die and moves his firefighter, several may meet on a spot. According to the kind of spot reached one can move the fire engine and thus receive equipment or one looses or gains equipment directly on meeting a firefighter. Who has collected all equipment and reaches the fire first, wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Electro Star Finde das blaue Auto
description: The child plays with elefant Milly and has the choice of two variants of the game, a discovery variant a quiz variant. In the discovery variant Milly demonstrates how to use Electro Star, the child gets familiar with the colour families - red, blue, green, yellow, pink, orange and white. Milly explains to the child what it sees and gives out the corresponding sound. In the quiz variant the child places a card and Milly asks for the corresponding second cards and gives out praise for a correct card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Trivia

name: Electro start
description: An electric first "computer" with 80 different lectures in several subjects, optical and acoustic signals stimulate hand-eye-coordination and an optical self-correction mechanism shows the correct answer after two false ones. The colourfully illustrated cards are numbered according to difficulty, a button lights up beside a question and the child has to press a button for an answer, correct and false answers are marked by different sounds. Who answers most answers correctly wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Trivia

name: Familie Bär
description: The Bear family is having a few surprises, things are disappearing from their surroundings, leaving only white spots behind. Of course the bears try to remedy matters and to bring things back. The game consists of 12 picture cards with motives from the bear family life, on each card a simple geometric shape has been left unprinted. 24 forms, 12 red and 12 yellow, are sorted by color and put into a bag each. Cards are tourned over one by one and the players reach into their bags and try to find the necessary shape by touch alone. The player who is faster and produces the correct shape, gets the card, when all cards are turned over, the player with the most cards wins.

name: 10 Commandments Dominoes
description:
This is a card game published by a church in Singapore, to teach players the 10 commandments and how they should be applied.

The 'dominoes' are cards divided into two squares, with a commandment (either the number or the text of the commandment), a name (of a person or place), an action or a picture (e.g. a golden calf). There are also two six-sided dice: one has the numbers, 1 to 6, the other has special symbols.

The 61 dominoes are dealt out evenly to all players (up to four) and the remaining card is placed face up in the middle. Players then try to lay dominoes down by matching them with the ends of the domino line on the table (like conventional domino games). Squares match if their content are related (e.g. the number of the commandment will match the actual words of the commandment). Any player can challenge a match, whereupon the person laying the domino "must explain himself with proofs from the bible or they can seek an outside moderator".

After making a match, the player rolls both dice to determine who will play next (based on the number rolled and the symbol that comes up).

The winner is the first player to finish all his or her cards.

name: Presenting Elves
description:
Family board game for Christmas, hunt for the presents in a winter village. Build the board to your own design including snow and cobble textures, 3D trees and 3D cottages.

Players are dealt toy cards and have to move clockwise or anti clockwise around the winter village board. If they land next to a cottage door square they can examine a present inside the cottage. The first player to find all their toys amongst the presents is the winner.

A simple, seasonal fun game for all the family.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Stock Collector
description:
It is card game based on a stock markets behaviour, mostly on market direction. Direction of the market and the game depends on player decisions. Players are investors with stock portfolios and have a chance to by stocks or sell them. Their activity decides will it be a bull or a bear market.
Players have a chance to predict the market trend and act accordingly.
Who grows his portfolio most wins. It is fun, fast and easy game to learn.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Digitronic
description:
Digitronic takes players to a virtual world. The characters are trapped in there and trying to find a way out. In order to get out they have to collect important data and eliminate all threats and enemies on their way and get to a portal to return to the real world.
The return to the real world is obtructed by two mighty viruses, Black OS-s, which has a Special code in them.
To return to reality player needs to find the same two Special codes and use them against the Black OS viruses.
In the digital world, player can also look for a Powercode, which is hastens players journey. Powercode also could have bit of the Special code.
During his fast ride through the virtual world, character encounters many different viruses which themselves are combination of codes.
To defeat the viruses, player has to attack with the same combination as does the virus.
PS. No dice involved.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Escalation
description:
From the author Chiry2000:

A board game Monopoly like with new features and new mode to earn money. The players start working, buying needs and travelling around europe. Whenever a player want can start to manage shops, hotels and companies with workers that at the end of mounth require payments to maintain. The goal of the game is reach an amount of 100.000€ not before to satisfy basic needs that other players prevent to do increaising their cost. In this game is convenient spend many earned money cause there is the risk to buy useless things or pay taxes. The fan of this game is to encrease the prices to avoid that other players can terminate the match.


Dall'autore chiry2000:

Un gioco da tavolo stile monopoli con nuove funzioni e nuovi modi di guadagnare denaro. Completa la scheda personale per poter acquistare le monete da 1000 a 20.000€. Lavora nelle 8 imprese del gioco o gestisci in esclusiva le stesse ditte che forniscono beni e servizi per completare le schede di tutti i giocatori. Attento alla casella di fine mese che potra' far fallire le tue imprese rendendole appetibili agli altri concorrenti che potranno rilevarle gia' a livello avanzato. Spendi piu' che puoi in modo da non essere costretti ad acquistare cose inutili e arricchire gli avversari. Vince il giocatore che avra' conquistato 100.000€ in gettoni.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Handicap Harness Racing
description: A game that simulates harness racing and teaches the player to handicap, or predict real harness racing results. The game starts with Race #4. The previous Races (1,2,3) have already taken place and data from these races have been recorded on the Past Performance Chart. In actual harness racing there are various sources where you can gather the information that is needed to create a Past Performance Chart for actual horses & drivers. So based on the Past Performance chart you decided how much risk that you can take and place wagers on the race. The movement of the horses is based on the Past Performance chart data with probabilities of different outcomes based on a history of actual races. These probabilities are realized in the game thru movement cards and a spinner. The movement mechanism does not take into account all of the information that is recommended to be collected for making bets at the track. However, to take everything into account would make for an overly analytical game and would present the false concept that predicting races is just a matter of math. The game instructions explain all of the common terms and concepts that are considered important when deciding what bets to place. And it presents a logical method for recording important information needed to place bets. If you ignore the educational aspects of the game it is a fun game. The pawns movement mechanism is similar to the more well known Win Place & Show. In each round the rigs have a movement for the round and then two of the pawns receive bonus movement. The races in this game are much shorter than most other race games, about 4 rounds.

name: Wummy!
description:
Wummy! is a word game that is family friendly as well as possibly educational. The ultimate goal of the game is to use all the letters (cards) in your hand to make words. Even short words count and you get extra points if you can link two short words into a larger one. For example, linking "PAN" and "CAKE" would get you "PANCAKE" for extra points.

Everything needed comes in the tin other than your own ability to create words.

The first to reach 30 points on their score card is the winner of this word game.

name: King-Pin Bowling Alley
description: A game similar to a target game but here it is shooting a ball from one end of the base to the skittles at the other end. As in a target game, the player who scores the most points in a pre-set time limit, wins.

name: Stock Car Race Game
description: A basic roll and move game but with extra rules to allow for collisions (It is a Stock Car Race after all).

name: Pips & Betsy
description:
This game is for very young children to develop powers of observation and colour recognition.

Three dice are used to play this game. One of the three colours that come up on the dice will bring the player’s mouse figure furthest ahead on the board. That’s where (s)he should put the mouse. The winner is the first mouse to reach the large larder.
You need to pay close attention and know the colours to be the first to get your mouse into the larder.

name: Mel Allen's Living Sound Baseball
description:
Unique baseball poard game as it has living sound. Played with a 33rpm record for realism, thrills and excitment of a World's Series Game.
Contents: Rules, play field (board), Score Pad, 33rpm record, Cub player's photographs and some plastic discs Game comes in its original box . It has its instruction sheet, play field, score pad, 33rpm record, Cub player photographs and a few plastic disks.
You call your play and play the record. Depending which groove the needle slots into gives you your result.
RCA were interested enough to design another, more simple game that was just an album sleeve and a record. The board was on the back of the sleeve. You had to make your own pieces.

name: Popeye Ring Toss
description:
Licenced Popeye game. Popeye and Sweet Pea are the targets. Players throw plastic rings, hoping to catch one on the target and score some points.
The target Popeye is 6 inches tall.
The one who scores the most points after a pre-determined time limit runs out, wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical

name: Grub!
description:
Grub! is game about encouraging the importance healthy eating habits, designed to entertain and challenge children with fascinating facts about foods from all over the world. The goal is to be the first to fill your plate with the right amounts of different foods. The game is based upon identifying and answering true or false statements while also avoiding other players who might want to grab your grub from you.

Box Contains:
- 4 game boards
- 20 food wedges
- Spinner
- 132 multi-level true or false cards
- 60 grub cards
- Rules leaflet

name: Spokane Trivia
description:
User Summary

This is a somewhat typical "roll & move" trivia game with a couple of interesting wrinkles... players may only move one of their pawns after they correctly answer a question, and each player gets three player pawns.

If a player is able to land on a space with another player's pawn, she may send her opponent's pawn back to its starting space.

The first player to get three pawns into the center space wins.

name: Eamonn Andrews Quiz Panel
description:
The box boasts "200 Questions" which is pretty mean by today's standards. A straightforward trivia game. Your objective is to score the highest total of points after 25 questions.
Each player has a question sheet. Players answer questions individually by inserting the wooden peg into the corresponding hole on the board. Each question has a code number. Turn the dial to the correct code to reveal the correct answer.

Keep a note of your score and continue until all questions are answered.

Eamonn Andrews (1922 - 1987) was a Irish boxing commentator who transferred to mainstream TV. He is best remembered for hosting This Is Your Life in the UK, for nearly 25 years. Bell used his name and image on three of their board games.

name: Teddy Schlabbermaul
description:
Objective: Try to protect (as a bee) your honey - cooperative game
Players are using 2 colour-dice & moving by turns
One die should be assigned to the bear, the other to the active bee/player

Big bear is watching bees and finds out, that honey is produced by these small animals.
If the bees will support each other they have a chance to protect their honey against the bear
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gangs of Transylvania
description:
I don't know why you wanted to come here out of all the places you could have taken your vacation but take heed stranger. If you thought the gangs that prowl your cities were dangerous then you obviously haven't done your homework on Transylvania. You can't go out at night for fear of running into the blood sucking Blood Leeches or the flesh eating Howlers. You even have to be careful during the day for fear of running into a member of the Stitched looking for some new body parts to create their next member. Nowhere is safe and tonight there is a full moon. The Howlers will be uncontrollable once the moon rises. If I were you I'd hop on the next train and get the hell out of here while the sun still shines.

Welcome to Gangs of Transylvania a miniatures rule set for gang warfare between supernatural creatures. With this game you will be able to create your own gang of vampires, werewolves, and a host of other horror creatures to fight for the right to rule the streets of Transylvania. These rules are available as a downloadable PDF. To play each player creates a gang (generally 5-10 models) depending on a predetermined number of points. A general game is normally around 200 pts. You'll also need at least 3 10-sided dice, a tape measure and a 3'x3' play area. Feel free to include as much 3D terrain (buildings, trees, etc) as you like.

1. MINIATURES

It is a good idea to have the miniatures of all the gang members you will be using before you create your gang. It is also a good idea for all players to have miniatures that are similar in scale.

2. CREATION POINTS

Before you can create your gang all players must decide on how many creation points will be used for gang construction. An average gang costs 200 creation points.

3. GANG MEMBERS

There are five different types of gang members for you to choose from each with its own special rule.

4. CREATURE TYPE

Creature type refers to what type of creature the gang member is. There are ten different types of creatures to choose from. Each creature has its own unique special rule.

5. WEAPONS

Once you have all of your gang members chosen you need to arm them with weapons to fight with.

6. FREAK POWERS

Freak powers only apply if one of your gang members is a freak. Freaks can be given bizarre
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: You're Sunk
description:
Abstract strategy game. Each side has six pieces - 2 Battleships, 2 Submarines, and 2 Mines. Each turn a player must add one of his pieces to the board. This piece will never be moved again.

The objective is to form a line of three pieces, a Battleship between a Submarine on one side and a Mine on the other side. This line can be horizental, vertical or diagonal, and it doesn't matter which of the three pieces are that players. He can win if, for example, he puts his Battleship between two enemy pieces. If victory is acheived the winning player must call out "You're Sunk" to end the game.

I think a lot of games might well be draws (as in Noughts and Crosses, for instance). And if there is a number of placements that will always make that player a winner (as in Nim) then that will kill the replayability.

There is no publisher name on the box or rules.

name: Belly-Ache
description:
The Belly-Ache Puzzle Maze is a great old dexterity game from Kohner. This one has an enclosed rounded bottom that keeps the ball captive so you can never lose it. The players decide the rules, whether the maze is set on a flat surface, held in the air, held with one or two elbows on the table. Get the ball as far as possible without dropping into a numbered hole.
Production code is 151 and the maze is dated 1971.
The back of the box says to get all of the games in the series such as ToothAche and HeartAche.

name: "Tatü-tata-a-a!": "die Feuerwehr ist da!"
description:
Objective: Be the first to cross the finish line (field 75)
Simple 'Roll and Move' game with 'snakes and ladders' approach
nice & cute drawings; equipped with typical 'Spika' meeples

name: Löwenzahn: Das Spiel
description:
Löwenzahn (common dandelion) is a game where the players try to plant dandelion in "Peter Lustigs" garden. The player who has first plant 3 of the flowers wins the game.

To reach the garden the players have to move the seed over the main game board. With a special dice, the figure "Peter Lustig", is used on a side board to declare what happens.

There are some mechanics that makes the game more difficult on just move the seeds over the gameboard:
A bee is used on the gameboard to dust the seeds, while a cow eats the flowers and the seeds. To get a fast move the windcards are very handy. When a seed counter is moved on a question mark the players can answer a question from some cards and if right they can move again.


Löwenzahn is a german TV show for children in which "Peter Lustig" explain ecological, technical and economic topics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Take Me To Your Leader
description: Leadership skills are indispensable for success in any career. Take Me to Your Leader is a fun way for students to learn eight specific leadership skills and the principles of ethical leadership. Players not only learn these skills in the game, but also practice them while playing. Through a series of four decks of cards, players earn money for displaying and demonstrating good leadership qualities.

name: Financial IQ
description:
Financial IQ is an educational game designed to teach financial responsibility and literacy. Players learn everything from the differences between credit cards and debit cards to the role of collateral. There is a strong emphasis on how players can learn to be prudent and sensible about investing, taking on debt, expenses, etc.

Over 200 cards cover a broad spectrum of financial literacy concepts making the game ideal to be used as a supplement in a wide range of business courses.

name: The Respectful Workplace Game
description:
Bullying, harassment, and verbal abuse are not only painful for the targets of such behavior, but also there are serious negative consequences for the organization–reduced productivity, reduced creativity, increased turnover and absenteeism. The Respectful Workplace Game™ is designed to give all employees, both supervisory and non-supervisory the skills they need to handle even the most difficult problems in an effective and respectful way. Players learn and practice six Principles of the Workplace Respect so that their actions could never be interpreted or mis-interpreted as bullying or harassment. Players also evaluate case studies and make recommendations how to prevent or end bullying and harassment. This game is not specifically about sexual harassment, but rather about learning how to deal effectively and respectfully with everyone at work. This simulation is appropriate for business courses as well as for seminars and training at the workplace.

The board represents an office complex, and players follow schedules in order to attend important meetings in various offices. Planning ahead is important as players are penalized for being late to meetings. Players pick from three decks of cards: Case Study cards present case studies of realistic workplace situations. Players identify bullying or harassment and suggest remedies. Respectful Relationships cards give examples of difficult management and other interpersonal situations. Players select the best response and suggest their own solutions. Bonus cards are true-false and multiple choice questions that give information on essential aspects of workplace respect and workplace bullying.

name: TeamPower
description:
Teams and other task-oriented groups are pervasive in the workplace as well as in everyday life. The role of teams is becoming more and more important as organizations learn the great benefits of putting the power of teams to use. The ever accelerating speed of technological change is creating an environment where teams are needed to bring the expertise of several organization members together. Learning about teams and how to function successfully in a team is no longer an option. Like understanding new technology, it is becoming indispensable for success in a career and in life.

TeamPower™ is an educational board game specifically designed to teach important skills and concepts for working in all kinds of groups and teams.

Players learn four sets of skills: Task skills (for getting the job done), Interpersonal Skills (for cooperating effectively with other team members), Self-Management Skills (for maximizing their own contributions), and Leadership Skills (for members who want play a leadership role in helping the team achieve its goals.

There are three sets of cards: The yellow All About Teams cards give information about the benefits of teams, the problems teams can face, different kinds and functions of teams, etc. The red Problem Detective cards describe behavior by fictitious team members. Players must describe the problem that the behavior is likely to create and what they would say in private to the team member to reduce problems in the future. The blue In Depth cards give the players a better and more detailed understanding of the sixteen Team-Power™ skills (four skills in each of the four sets of skills). All three decks include cards that deal with ethical issues.

The game can be played by individuals or by teams of players, who later examine the skills they used as members of a team playing the game. There are separate sets of rules for individual and team play.

name: Career Odyssey
description:
Career Odyssey is a board game specifically designed to help students explore careers that may be good matches for their talents and interests. Students develop insight into their own talents and interests and then try to match them to careers.
Players fill out a brief “Talents and Interests” card that asks then to select two talents out of six that are most descriptive of themselves. The talents are based on Howard Gardner’s theory of multiple intelligences, but the names are simplified. Players also specify work preferences, such as working mostly alone or mostly with others.

The game contains 100 career cards, divided into twelve major career areas. The cards describe talents required for success in the career and how the career relates to the same job preference dimensions described on the cards filled out by the players. Players then navigate around the board trying to collect career cards that are similar to their own card. The game is made more interesting by players’ ability to trade and sell cards to each other. Players earn play money based on the degree of match between their own card and the career cards they collect.

name: Equipped for Life
description: This game for helping youth think and act responsibly, includes over 100 situation cards for each of two levels, grades 5-8 and 9-young adult. Topic areas include: daily living, education, relationships, school, community, substance abuse, employment, and after school activities. As players move around the game board, they are asked to identify thinking errors and replace them with accurate thoughts and constructive action plans.

name: Bullies to Buddies
description:
Bullying is a complex process involving the bully, the intended victim, the bystanders, and the climate in which the bullying takes place. Bullies to Buddies is an educational game that deals with the complex nature of bullying in a way that elementary school students can understand and learn specific skills. Players learn that all students must take a stand against bullying. For example, the target (intended victim) can use assertiveness skills to discourage bullying. If bystanders are present during the bullying or know about it beforehand, they can take action to discourage it. Regardless of when they learn about it (before, during, or afterwards), all bystanders can refuse to give the bully the status, popularity, and power that he/she is looking for. Bullying then ceases to be a useful tool for the bully to achieve his/her goals. Players learn in the game that they can do a great deal to discourage bullying, even with things as simple as telling a bully to stop or refusing to laugh at a bully’s mean jokes. Students will learn skills to use when they are:

a target of bullying who wants non-violent skills for stopping bullying.
a bystander who wants to discourage bullying.
a former bully who wants to gain popularity without resorting to bullying.

Players also learn the difference between “tattling” and “telling”. Guidelines are given when it is appropriate to go to a trusted adult for help. Players earn points by giving advice to targets (intended victims), bystanders who are present during the bullying, bystanders who are not present but learn of the bullying later on or beforehand, and the bullies, themselves. Bullies to Buddies® intentionally avoids putting players in the role either the intended victim or the bully, avoiding embarrassment and defensiveness. A 24” x 17” poster is included, so that teachers can continue to reinforce the skills learned by the players.

name: Call Me Capable
description:
Call Me Capable is an educational board game that helps students understand disabilities, as well as to help them learn to respect and empathize with persons with disabilities. It stimulates players to focus on the capabilities of people living with disabilities. The game is designed primarily for educating students who are not disabled, although disabled students enjoy playing immensely. The game has two sets of cards, one for elementary students, and one for middle and high school students.

Players move around the board picking cards and discussing the questions posed on the cards. Emotion cards ask players how they would feel if they interacted with people with disabilities or had to live with a specific disability. Experience cards ask players to discuss the practical aspects of living with various disabilities. Imagination cards ask players to imagine situations in which the player has a disability or wants to help a person with a disability. Challenge cards are multiple choice questions that add to the players’ knowledge about specific disabilities, ways for disabled people to improve their lives, and famous people with disabilities.

Call Me Capable was originally developed by Carol Leish, who sustained disabilities from an auto accident when she was a young child. The game gives a unique insight into both the limitations and possibilities of living with disabilities. Most of all, the game reflects Carol’s philosophy of focusing on the capabilities of herself and other disabled people.

name: Circle of Respect
description:
Understanding the concept of respect and developing the ability to show respect in a variety of situations are vital for success in school and throughout life. Circle of Respect® is an educational game specifically designed to teach students (1) the guiding principle that showing respect is the best way to receive respect, and (2) specific ways that they can show respect in four important areas of their lives:

With Classmates

With Family

At School

In the Community

As illustrated by the large circle in the center of the board, players learn to identify the situations in which showing respect is important. Issues such as respecting differences and respecting the environment are included. The game is careful not to equate respect with obedience. The players learn that it is acceptable to disagree (including with parents and with adults at school) as long as it is done in a respectful way. Cards demonstrate respectful ways of disagreeing.

name: Bully Safe
description:
Bully Safe is an educational card game that teaches a systems approach to reducing bullying behavior. All children have been involved in bullying incidents, whether as a target, a bully, or a bystander. Players learn that everyone can play an important role in reducing bullying. The target of the bullying will become the victim if he/she cannot stop the bullying attempt. In addition, the bystander who laughs when the bully makes fun of another student is unwittingly rewarding the bully with the status he/she seeks and encouraging more bullying.

Like other behavior, bullying behavior is not random, rather it is motivated by specific goals. Most bullying is motivated by social goals, such as status, popularity, power, having fun, etc. The game emphasizes that all students in the school community have the ability to support bullying or to discourage it. Students learn concrete, non-violent skills to use in bullying situations. In addition to the game's systems approach, it differs from most other approaches to bullying in two important respects. First, it pays attention to the potentially positive role of the bystanders. Second, it gives bullies positive skills to use to achieve their goals without resorting to bullying behavior.

The game box includes rules for both cooperative play and competitive play. In each version players read Situation cards that describe typical middle school bullying behavior. Players then offer advice to the target, the bystanders, or the bully (on how the bully can achieve goals using pro-social skills instead of bullying). Players earn tokens for their sound advice. In order to facilitate learning and help the players give sound advice, the game includes a list of non-violent skills that targets and bystanders can use to reduce and stop bullying. Players also learn when it is appropriate to seek help from a trusted adult.

name: Hedronism
description:
The game is basically a simple board game printed on a 23"x25" poster. You supply your own dice, since any size and shape dice can be used with the game.

The dice themselves act as board markers. Players try and get two markers all the way to the End Space. There are strategies involved; mostly regarding how a roll will be split among your two markers, similar to what happens when you roll a "7" in the game "Sorry." In Hedronism, every number roll can be split this way.

This game was designed specially for dice collectors or for anyone who wants a really unique game that can use a variety of different-shaped dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Finders Keepers
description:
The Finders Keepers game from Schaper is described as a grade school game for two or more players.
Pick a card then hit the switch which releases the ball and the objects. Pick the object that was on the card before the ball hits the bottom of the ramp and locks the objects back into place, keep what objects you retreive.
There are two sets of objects and two sets of cards, one simple with recognizable shapes, the other much harder with abstract shapes.
If the game gets too easy you can put the ball at the lower peg which gives you even less time.

name: Skill-Roll
description: An indoor version of a game often seen in fairgrounds. The target is propped up and players take turns in rolling a ball at, and hopefully up, the target board. In the target there are holes for the ball to fall into. If it does, the player scores the points for that hole. The box image illustrates the game rather well.

name: Fancy Nancy's Double Dress Up Game
description:
Join Fancy Nancy and her dog, Frenchy in this fun-filled game

Make Fancy Nancy and her posh puppy even fancier by adding on eight fabulous accessories. The first player to use all eight on the play scene board wins.

Com join Nancy and learn how more is ALWAYS better when it comes to being fancy.

name: Cock Robin
description:
From a description of the game at ALL ABOUT GAMES

Following most of the words of the Cock Robin nursery rhyme the card game has the players answer the questions found within the rhyme. The first one being, “Who killed Cock Robin?” And the last one being, “Who will sing the psalm?”
The old card game offers a twist at the ending and differs from the nursery rhyme. The players of the game are told Cock Robin is alive and well and they have all been telling a story! This is the part of the game which truly has the players interacting with each other and reveals the fun age of the times.
The directions for the game of Cock Robin begin with choosing a person to be the dealer. After having all the cards dealt out to theplayers, the dealer is then the person who asks the questions. For example, the dealer reads the first question of “Who killed Cock Robin?” The correct animal card to specifically answer is the Sparrow card. It reads, “I, said the Sparrow, with my bow and arrow. I killed Cock Robin.” If the player has the ‘Sparrow’ card, he lays his card down on the table in front of him and the dealer asks the next question to the next player (Who saw him die?).
If the player does not have the sparrow card in his hand, he picks a card from the player to his left and reads a generic answer card (often humorous) before laying that card on the table in a separate pile. The dealer proceeds to ask the next player the same question until the correct answer card is found and played. The player who answers the question will take any of the generic cards played to the question and place them (if there are any) in his hand

Once all the questions have been read and answered the exciting part of the game begins! The dealer reads the following script,
“Oh, Mr. Bullfinch, Oh, Mr. Popinjay
Never believe what these little birds say-
Bad little birds—telling us a story-
Cock Robin is alive in all his glory!”
The dealer continues to read the next line of,
“Cock Robin is all alive—Mr. Sparrow, pay a fine for that story now, about your bow and arrow.”


The player who has the Cock Robin Sparrow Card in front of him must then ‘pay the fine’. The fine is anything the dealer wants it to be. In the directions, suggestions for the fine are, “to kiss the one loved best (which is often the looking glass), or to flatter some of the other company…”
Additional scripts are read for each of the animals and the players with these cards in front of them must do what it says. Other examples are as follows:
Cock Robin is all alive—Miss Lark, Shut your eyes and sing us a song in the dark.
To pay for the story you told—Mr. Linnet, tell us where your night cap is, and how you get in it.
Your manners are very bad, Mr. Rook, in all your reading what was your dullest book?
The last script read reveals the winner of the game of Cock Robin. It reads, “And now Mr. Thrush, Come out of your bush, and sing us a song. Or give us a riddle; and we’ll grant you the fame of winning the game.”
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: On Target
description:
The On Target game from the Milton Bradley is a big action/skill game nearly the size of the Skittle Games of the same era.
The five targets are pulled up and the wheel that holds them spun to set the value for each target. The player must then call a target (they are embossed with a Witch, a Skull & Crossbones, a Devil, a Vulture, and a Ghost) and shoot for that target using the banking corners to reach targets that aren't in front. If the target drops that score is noted and the target reset. The player may stop and take those points or may shoot for another target after they are spun again (and risk losing the points he or she just scored). First player to reach 200 wins.

name: The Rattlin' Gattlin' Shootin' Gallery
description:
A Western-themed shooting/target game.
The gun barrel turns like a real Gattling gun and shoots ball bearings just as fast as you can turn the handle. It is also the most painfully loud thing I have ever heard and I can only let my son play with it for a few minutes at a time lest my head explodes like the guy in the movie Scanners.
Each turn a player can aim at four targets, scoring a point for each one 'knocked out'. The player with the most successes, wins.

name: Slick Shooter
description:
A shooting target game. Mattel claimed it turned your home into a penny arcade.

The targets are reminiscent of fairground games when you can aim at targets and if you hit them, a door might open or some other result of your successful shot.

No batteries needed, the gun actually shoots a blast of air down one of five hoses based on where the gun is pointing. Ingenious!

As usual with shooting games, the highest number of successful shots after time has run out, wins the game.

By the way, this game is huge, 49 inches long.

name: Snap Action Bowling
description: Snap Action Bowling is a cool game by Shelcore. The bowler's arm is spring loaded and shoots a ball down the alley with great speed. The balls, brown marbles, are painted with three finger holes! Attention to detail make this a very enjoyable game.

name: Spy's-a-Poppin
description:
The game is huge, about 18 inches wide and 27 inches tall when assembled.

The idea is to use the Magi-Scope dart gun to shoot the spys who will blow up the girl hostage if you miss.
Access to the house is gained by shooting the bomb on the roof which causes the facade panel to fall down exposing the interior. There are two spys hiding behind the pictures on the wall and you can see them if you look through the red Magi-Scope atop the gun. When the upper picture is shot out it releases the master spy who comes down the stairs and will hit the TNT plunger and blow up the hostage if you don't shoot him before he reaches it. An amazing piece of design!

The first player to complete this sequence correctly, wins.

name: Wing-It
description:
The box says "It's Fun!! It's Fast! It's the family game of the year". (a little over the top, you marketing guys).

An action game that calls for some skill. Players must knock down targets with counters that are fired from, for the want of a better word, your countercannon. The box illustrates the equipment and objective very well.

name: Pairs Up
description:
An action and memory game.There are 20 pegs which fit into the board. One end of the peg indicates a shape and, when placed into the board upside down, no-one knows which shape is where. Set the timer and start drawing and looking at random pegs. You are looking to find a pair of shapes. You can only look at the pegs one at a time. Memory comes in to the game because non-matching pegs have to be placed back into the board. If you find a pair, you put both pegs at the bottom end of the board.

If the timer runs out, the pegs still in the playing area fall through their hole and inside the game, where they can be retrieved by the next player to set up his turn.

Games can be as long or short as you choose. Have one turn each or ten turns each, it is up to you. Allocate points for every pair found. When you have finished, the one with the most points, wins.

name: Ring Board
description:
Traditional Quoits game. The target has 12 hooks, worth points from 2 to 13. The rings provided are rubber.

The most points after several turns each, wins

name: Accolade: Journey to Knighthood
description:
In Accolade each player takes on the role of the Lord of a medieval household. The players must guide four Squires on their journey around the board on their quest to become Knights and garner influence for their household. During their journey, they will also be attempting to keep the rival households in check. Can you be the most influential Lord and gain the ear of the King? Only time will tell.

Inspired by classic games such as Parcheesi/Ludo and Checkers/Draughts, Accolade is an abstract game of chance and strategy, which has players maneuver their Squires around the exterior path of the board in an attempt to reach their home cathedral (similar to Parcheesi). Once the Squire makes it to the cathedral, he receives his Accolade and is knighted. This new Knight now reenters the board, now with the sole goal of interfering with your opponent's Squires and Knights.

The board is made up of a central hub and 4 spokes, which are assembled differently depending on the number of players (2-4), allowing for a scalable game that decreases the amount of dead time experienced in a 2 player game of Parcheesi/Ludo. Though the board could also be used as an alternate Parcheesi board using those standard rules (and there is a bonus draughts board on the back of the main hub as well).

The main mechanic of the game is simple dice rolling for movement in a similar style to Parcheesi, but the pieces have more options on what they can do with those rolls. Opposing pawns (Squires/Knights) interact with each other by Checking (landing on them, as in Parcheesi) or Capturing (jumping over, as in Checkers) them. Pawns can attain a degree of safety by being in Castle spaces, or forming a Castle by doubling up 2 pawns of the same color.

Points (influence) are scored for removing opposing Squire / Knights and for any of your own Knights on the board (not in your home area).

The game ends once all remaining pawns are Knights, then the player with the most points (influence) gains the ear of the King and is considered the winner.

The game was created as an entry for TGC Classic Game Mashup Contest.
publishers: Grey Cat Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Batt
description:
Taken from the Publisher's website:

it is a card game for 2, 3, 4 players. Form your Tribe and start your battle facing the attacks of wolves, buffalos and eagles that your adversaries will try to throw on you! The challenge starts!
You must do more points than your adversaries forming one or more patrols built with your own cards. The player who first arrives to 100 points wins. The points are obtained by the red ability spheres at the base of the tribe cards or of the passive defense cards (1 ability sphere = 1 point).

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 90 playing cards.

name: Calcetto
description:
Taken from the Publisher's Website

It is a boardgame for 2 players that defy each other forming their team composed of 5 elements each one with different abilities of contrast/shot, with the aiming of score more goals than the adversary. Every player puts his players onto the field according to his tactical choices and makes the actions trying to get free from marking the adversary and to shoot at goal.

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 1 game board (the football field); 20 cardboard shapes (the 2 teams); 20 little plastic bases; 6 cardboards balls; 1 ball (plastic pawn); 2 dice (1-6); 1 plus/minus dice (+/-).

name: KARMOX caccia al tesoro
description:
From the publisher's website:

8 brave heroes fight for the treasure of Karmox fortress. Only one will be the winner! Choose your character or your team to start your treasure hunting; the characters increase their level during the game defeating the adversaries; from the life points of the adversaries one gets the level points that will then be transformed into ability points used to increase the player's attack or defense or movement. Exploit the "event" chart that will allow you also to call for the "warrior spirit" that will help you during the most critical moments.

Content:
1 handbook with rules; 1 modular game board; 60 pawns to score points; 1 red pawn; 1 blue pawn; 2 6-sided dice; 8 "warrior spirit" cards; 1 "event" mini game board; 8 character charts; 8 characters (cardboard shapes); 8 coffers (cardboard shapes); 16 little plastic bases (to keep the cardboard shapes)

name: 5star
description:
5star is a racing game for 2 players in which the number 5 on the dice serves to allow new stars onto the board. After this it's a race to the finish. The first player to get 5 stars over the finish line is the winner. Stars can be captured by both your own stars as well as by opponent stars. Whenever a star is on the fifth or tenth position on the track, it's prone to capture the oppenent if he/she moves a star to the same rank.

Multiple games can be combined to allow for more than 2 players.

5star is designed by the mother-and-daughters trio Linda, Isis and Nova.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Young & Fashion
description:
Objective:
Replay of the economical stuff learned on middle school
game ends after 90 min ==> winner: most points/money

Economic & educational game (simulation of a company producing
teenage furniture)
Check - if pupils have learned economic stuff successfully
- moving/acting by turn -

players roll the die, move their meeples; if you land on a marked area draw a card:
cards have questions coming out from
a. calculation (cash discount, credits, stocks...)
b. accounting (different business cases)
c. cost-benefit analysis
d. economic analysis / spreadsheets
solving these questions takes time, because most often you have
to find a problem-solving approach, subsequently to calculate getting correct result
collecting bonus points/money to get awarded
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Mont-Royal
description:
It's a race up the mountain! Beat the other players to various Mont-Royal landmarks.
After rolling 4 dice, a player will choose two dice pairs and advance his coloured tokens along the paths available of the appropriate sums of the pairs. As soon as one player has advanced their token to the last position along a path, they can claim that landmark and no other player may advance along that path.

This game was designed and printed to be a give-away for all attendants to the 2011 Montreal 60 second film festival, M60, registration party.

name: Solar Empire
description: Solar Empire:CCG is a new card game, its a space warfare game based on solar system conflict and space combat. Its made for 2 players, 8 years and older, the game itself uses cards to represent spaceships, planets and special effects. Its basically a deck dueling game, where players build their own decks and play against another player across a table. The cards are high quality, the rules are easy to understand, and it has replay value due to the variety of cards and player strategies. The object of this game is to capture all the opponent's planets before your card deck is exhausted. All cards are played face down, the planets are setup at the start of play, face up, as the game progresses ship and special effects cards are revealed, players tally their victory points and the winner is decided. The game play time is from 30 minutes to 1 hour depending on the number of planets in play. Its a portable game using only cards, there are no dice, charts, or tokens involved, all a player needs is their own deck and they are ready to play.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Filmclub Movie Trivia
description:
From the back of the box (translated from dutch):

Roll the die and answer the question of the colour you rolled. A right answer gives you a token of the same colour. The moment you earn a token your turn is over. Collect all 6 tokens and answer the six questions of the next question card you draw. If you correctly answer 3 questions, you're the winner of the game.

The six categories are: actors and actresses (blue), directors and movie music (pink), classics (yellow), general knowledge (red), movie titels (green), childrens movies and animation (orange).

name: Skittle-Tennis
description:
Contents
2 Clamps.
2 Wooden Poles.
1 Ball.
7 Wood Skittles

Indoor game that lends itself to skittle games where you swing round a ball on a string, trying to knock down the skittles as it sweeps by. In England this type of game was always known as Bar Skittles.

Skittle-Tennis has a ball on a string but the string is longer and must be hit with a bat rather than out of the hand.

The skittles are rated for different point values. Obviously, you should try to knock over the higher scoring ones. The first player to score 100 points is the winner.

From the rules "An interesting game that can produce an excellent method of training the eye for both Table Tennis and Tennis.

There are some game variants in the rules.
publishers: KUM-BAK Sports, Toys, & Games, MFG Co. Ltd

name: Sag Die Antwort
description:
Religious trivia game. "A religious game for catholic children" from Leipzig in East Germany at the time.

Up to 14 players get a card with room on it to place six cards. A question is asked about the Bible and if someone recognises the passage, and correctly, they get the card to put on their board. First to get all six spaces filled, wins the game.

name: The Magic Roundabout Game
description:
Contents
1 Playing Board.
6 Dougal Playing Pieces.
1 Dice.
Instructions Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.
Game based on characters from the BBC children's series, in particular, Dougal the dog.

Each player chooses a Dougal figure. The game is the story of Dougal looking for his sugar. The story starts at space Number 1 on the board and finishes at Number 63. The first player to reach the centre of the board at space Number 63 is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pipofax
description:
The players draw cards, stand one behind the other and put one hand on the person in front as shown in the cards they drew. The first player picks up the wooden baton and ball standing in front of him/her and carefully passes it on to the next player. If the baton and ball arrive at the last player everyone has won that round of the game.

Fun and skill are the most important here. Pipifax develops body awareness, balance and team spirit and trains the recognition of different positions.

name: Monkey Tricks
description:
Contents
1 Wooden Base.
2 Tree Trunk Sections.
1 Palm Leaf Connector Unit.
4 Green Palm Leaves.
1 Chimpanzee.
12 Monkeys (3 of each in 4 colours).
2 Dice.
Rules (printed inside the box lid).

A race game where you are racing up the plastic palm tree instead of around a board. Each player has an equal share of the monkeys. Dice are thrown to climb (each notch is four spaces apart).

The monkeys want to get to the fruit at the top of the tree - therefore the objective is to climb the tree as quickly as possible. The winner is the first player to get all their monkeys onto one of the palm leaves.

Beware the black chimpanzee as he wants all the fruit and will chase the monkeys down when he catches them. The chimpanzee moves when a double is thrown and tries to catch the monkeys.

name: Comic Action Heroes Game
description:
Boardgame released by Denys Fisher in the seventies as part of the Comic Action Heroes line of toys.
It's an official DC licensed version, and includes the heroes Superman, Batman, Robin and Shazam against the villains Joker, Riddler, Mr Freeze and the Penguin.
It's a fairly basic roll and move game, where the object is to reach the top of the 3-d cityscape that clips onto the board, but the playes also control the movement of the villains to hinder your opponents progress.

name: Home Golf
description:
Contents
1 Playing Surface.
4 Picture Cards(9 Holes).
1 Golf Figure and Base.
2 Balls.
4 Markers.
1 Flag and Base.
1 Direction Indicator.
Scorecards.
1 Set of Rules.

From the box "Enjoy playing at many famous courses including St Andrews, Carnoustie and Hoylake. Pitch, Putt, Hook, Slice - Play the outdoor game the indoor way!"

The game is supplied in 2 Parts;
1.A soft playing surface where all strokes are taken.
2.Picture Cards of the course, hole by hole, on which results are recorded, (by placing markers), the distance and position of each stroke. There is a heavy ball which is used for all strokes until the green is reached, and a lighter ball for putting.

Select a hole to play and decide how far you would like to hit the ball. Then, using the golfer figure, you whack the ball, trying to limit the distance you need to ball to end up. Then you advance the marker on the hole card and note any penalties that might occur - Hook,Slice Etc. When the green is reached, use the lighter ball to putt.

name: Nürburg-Rennen
description:
Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Dice.
1 Playing Piece Car.
3 Playing Piece Motorcycles.
1 Rules Sheet.

Simple die rolling game. From the start, you move round the track, obeying instructions on special squares. The first player to cross the finish line, wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of the Red Pig
description:
Game circa 1930's from Parker Brothers.

This is sort of a spin and move game where depending on what number you get from the spinner you move forward that number of places on the board. There are certain places on the board with special letters on them. Those spaces allow you to move forward extra spaces. Landing on places with Black dots make you move back some number of spaces. First to finish wins!

name: The Great City Game: Paris
description:
Box says: Explore the great city of Paris from the comfort of your home. A strategy-travel game, for 2-6 players. #7471, 1974 Gameophiles Unlimited, Inc. 16 Pine St., Morristown, NJ 07960. Patent Pending.

Roll the die and move. Land on special squares and pick cards that move you to different places like the Louvres Museum or the Eiffel Tower, Arch of Triumph, Church of Sacre Couer etc. Enter the city from Orly Airport, The Palace at Versailles, Longchamps or Colombey. See the needed number of places in the city to win the game.

name: GolFUNator
description:
GolFUNator is a strategic golf board game.Each player begins with the ability of an average Pro Golfer (stats taken from the 2010 PGA Tour Season). The course, Highland Peaks is a ficticional par 72 course.

Players choose the type of shot they will take. Choices range from safe, normal, or all-out from the tee, and safe, middle (of the green) or Go (for the pin) on approach shots. There are also other choices during play. On putts from the fringe and distances over 25', the player may choose 'GO' or 'LAG'. Almost anything that can happen in real golf, can happen in GolFUNator. 6 times per round, if the player hits an errant shot (trouble) he may choose to use one of his/her 6 'LUCK' cards. The results will be either good, bad, or no luck at all.
A player can get HOT by getting 2 birdies in a row. He/she may also become COLD with 2 bogeys in a row.

The game comes with a 14x14" HD laminated cardstock 2-sided board, 2 10-sided dice, 5 decks of cards, markers, scoresheets and instructions.

name: The St. Franks Football Game
description:
An extraordinary game.
The game is played on any reasonable sized table. 2, 4 or 6 players can play.

This must be a forerunner of football games like Subbuteo. But, instead of little footballers that you flick, in this game you where the football boots. The diagram illustrates this rather well. You kick the ball literally with your boot-encased finger.

The rules allow for free kicks, throw-ins and penalties.

There is a warning that your boot fingers must be on the table at all times, so that should be very friendly with six players, three a side!

name: 3 mit Kopf & Pfote: Fit, pfiffig, schlau
description: In Play with the coloured balls a lot of disorder has been created, the winner is the first to gather his balls back together, but to be able to do that one must answer questions, do gymnastics with the dog and solve puzzles. Each player has a collecting table and in his turn rolls the die and moves. Depending on the colour of the animal track a ball chip is turned over and one takes a card from the thus determined card stack. The rabbit poses a riddle, fun or logic question, the parrot a knowledge question and the dog sets a movement or a pantomime task. For a correct solution the player receives the chip for his table.

name: Flicking through the Ages
description:
'Flicking through the Ages' is a 2-player dexterity civilization game created as part of the NaGaDeMon contest during the month of November 2011. Aside from the obvious Through the Ages nod, FttA claims Flicochet, Tumblin Dice, Breakout and the classic carnival game of knocking over milk bottles as its primary pedigree.

FttA aims to deliver the civilization 'feel' to a dexterity game playable in under 30 minutes and assembled from easy to find materials. It combines five completely different minigames into a timeless struggle for cultural supremacy! Players balance their actions by using population discs in the following ways:

1. Gather resources by flicking your disc down a platform decreasing in size with increased return for increased risk.
2. Research new technologies by flicking your disc at one of four stacks of available technologies arranged like a breakout game and taking the block you strike. Once obtained, players need to choose whether or not to add the technology to their list of abilities or to trade in the block to increase their population
3. Declare war on the other player's civilization by flicking your disc at their researched technologies stacked in a pyramid. Knock your opponent's blocks down to steal population, technology or colonies
4. Vie for colonies by flicking your disc closer to the colony disc than your opponents
5. Construct Wonders of the World by stacking resource cubes on a disc and sliding it along a path symbolizing the shape of the building without letting one fall

NOTES:

Construction of 'Flicking Through the Ages' requires:
1 set of Jenga-style blocks
1 set (2 colors) of 'bakelite'-style backgammon discs or other discs of roughly 1.25" diameter that flick reasonably well and are heavy enough to impact a tower of Jenga blocks enough to fall over
1 set of the rules including the 'colony' and 'technology' sticker sets to be applied (or taped) to the above components
mechanics: Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Krötenhopsen
description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Krötenhopsen again tests dexterity. You have one try per toad to snip it into the pond with yor finger. Each toad ending up in the pond, totally or in part, scores 1 point. If the toad touches the water lily, the score is 2 points. The player with the majority of points after 3 rounds wins the game.

name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Spinnentanz
description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Spinnentanz is also a test on dexterity. Two players stand opposite to each other and have a spider fastened to their waistband in the back. Both try simultaneously to place their spider on the card. The first player to do so scores 1 point. When everyone has player has played against everybody else, the player with the highest score wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Bibi Blocksberg Hexenprüfung Hexwissen
description:
The young witches Bibi, Schubia, Flauipaui and Arkadia need to pass their exams at the end of the year.

Hexwissen tests knowledge. The referee poses the questions and gives three answers - the first player to call out the correct answer receives the card. The first player who collects four cards wins the game.

name: Die Koala Brüder: Tempo, Tempo, Freunde!
description: Frank and Buster give a party so big, that no one can really keep an eye on all the guests. Who can find the combinations of guests first? One player rolls the dice and all players simultaneously look for the characters rolled. They can be on one or more cards, but must be adjacent do each other, diagonal combinations do not count. For a correct combination a player receives all tiles in the combination, for an error one looses a card. When the draw pile is finished the player with the most cards wins.

name: Minions
description:
Minions brings the classic web-based style game called 'Tower Defense' to your table top. Two criminal masterminds send waves of minions to destroy the enemy HQ. To keep the minions away, each player deploys a variety of towers to eliminate those pesky minions. The first player to sneak three minions through their enemy's defensive perimeter succeeds in destroying the enemy HQ and winning the game.

Minions uses a variable map system allowing different paths each time you play. Machine Guns, Cannons, Missiles, and Death Rays abound to frustrate the Minions' attempts at destruction.

name: Viva la ResistANTS!
description:
Viva la ResistANTS! is an abstract boardgame. Main game mechanics includes area controll, set collection and 'press your luck'. It combines American and European styles of boardgaming design. The game has a unique setting. The forces of Resistance of Ants led by the mysterious Serg Ant try to help the civilians survive under the occupation of enemy forces, who perfidiously attacked the peaceful republic of ants. Now you must fight for your freedom. Let's say together: Viva la ResistANTS!

Each player has a detachment of 10 ants. Each turn the player can send 2 of them to the field to participate in a special mission or withdraw 1-3 of them. At the start of the game the playfield is generated randomly. If 1 or more ants get status missing in action, players should shuffle the tiles of the playfield and generate it randomly again. Other ants return to players. The ants get status missing in action if a card from alert deck with the appropriate colour is revealed for the second time. One card from alert deck is revealed every time each player takes a turn. If the same colour is revealed for the third time the alert deck must be shuffled. If it must be shuffled for the second time, the game is over. The player who gets more victory points becomes a winner. In case of a tie, the winner is the player who retained more ants.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Trasformat
description:
Based on a TV Quiz Show aired in Italy.

There are more than 300 different cards with a transformed or masked image that represents a famous person, an animal, an object, a monument, a painting or a sculpture.

The active player must to recognize the subject of the pic and gain points.

Fun little game, with 4 different variants, based on good observation and quick thinking.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Turbo-Wörter-Quiz
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the finish line
- moving by turns -
1. place the meeples on the starting position
2. turn the spinner and draw a question card
3. there is one minute left to find an appropriate answer - starting with the letter the spinner is pointing on
4. if you fail roll the die - if the number matches with correspondent letter number you may move, too
5. if spinner points at a symbol act as described

name: Fermat Math Game
description: A mathematical game for 2 to 4 players. Each player has 9 balls in his game colour. The playing field is 6x6 and numbered from 1 to 36. If it is your turn, you have one minute (egg timer) to roll 3 regular dice and arrange them in a formula with the four basic mathematical operations. The result is where you put your ball. The target space must be unoccupied. If you can not create a formula in one minute for a free space your turn ends. If you achieve 3 or more own balls in a row you get VP. If you get five own balls in a row the game ends. The first to have no more balls ends the game also. Player with the most points wins.

name: Good-Bye Bully Machine Card Game
description:
Help stop bullying and reinforce positive behaviors with this card game that encourages young people to think and talk about bullying, its implications, and ways to stop it.

Based on the lively book Good-Bye Bully Machine, this anti-bullying game allows players to take turns breaking down the Bully Machine, piece by piece. As players draw cards, they discuss what they’d do in bullying situations, are asked to talk about conflict resolution skills, compliment other players, and practice empathy. Each time a player gives a response, he or she gets to take away one piece of the Bully Machine from the game board. Watch out, though: someone might draw a Mean Moment card, which will suggest that a player has done something mean to help build up the Bully Machine. Then the player has to replace one Machine Card. When the machine is totally dismantled, everyone wins.

name: What Do You Stand For? Character Building Card Game
description:
Turn learning into a game and kids will want to play. Based on What Do You Stand For? For Kids by Barbara A. Lewis.

To win, players collect cards of each trait. Each card features a "What If" scenario or question about character that gets kids thinking about what they would do-and what they stand for. Meant to be played with adult supervision (a teacher, counselor, or youth worker familiar with character education themes), the game includes an insert with rules and basic character education concepts.

name: Dr. PlayWell's Don't Pick on Me Game
description: Each player is assigned an area of the board—the classroom, the school bus, the cafeteria, or the hallway. Players must get rid of the bullies and protect the victims in their area of the school by answering true/false questions about the nature of bullying. There are two levels of play: for younger kids, and older kids, and a Bullying Quiz to assess how much children learn.

name: Hidden Rules
description:
Hidden Rules (or Hidden Curriculum) is a term used to describe the unwritten social rules and behaviors that most of us seem to know without ever being taught, such as respecting those in a position of authority, acknowledging others' personal space, speaking at an appropriate volume, paying attention to body language, and more. This fun card game will help children learn and practice 40 hidden rules for everyday life. The object of play is to be the first player to get rid of all their cards.

Contents:
10 blue Hidden Rules Cards
10 red Hidden Rules Cards
10 green Hidden Rules Cards
10 yellow Hidden Rules Cards
10 blue number cards
10 red number cards
10 green number cards
10 yellow number cards
5 Wild cards
5 Skip-a-Turn Wild Cards
8 blank cards (2 of each color)
Instructions

name: Dr. PlayWell's Game of Self-Control Board Game
description:
Learning self-control is not easy, but this game will make kids want to try. Teach children to control their impulses in all kinds of interpersonal situations at home, in school, and in the community. As children learn about the importance of self-control they are challenged to perform various stunts, using the Self-Control magic color circles included with the game. Includes reproducible assessment form.

Includes:
Game board
2 dice
4 pawns
12 At School cards
12 At Home cards
12 In the Community cards
12 About Myself cards
4 Self-Control circles
100 chips
Self-Control assessment form

name: Sports Electric Quiz Game
description: Sports trivia game. When you answer a question correctly, the board lights up. Whoewver gets the most questions right is the winner

name: Electromatic Dial Quiz
description:
Electronic quiz game. When you answer a question, you touch the connection and a light will come on if you are right.

275 questions sounds like it won't have much replayability.

name: Fringe The Apocalypse
description:
Fringe The Apocalypse is an unique science, standards based board game, three years in the making that helps kids gain a critical thinking advantage in the sciences. The game academics with game playing fun. 2 - 8 players must balance strategic goals with game playing challenges in an attempt to successfully navigate two worlds, fighting and collaborating with aliens while acquiring necessary gear, keys and dropa stones. Become strong enough to defeat Boss Zygos and enter the wormhole to save earth from an impending apocalypse.

Choose between the Family or School Editions. Each edition focuses on learning in an all new, fun and exciting way. You must be smart, aggressive and cooperative as your aliens race, battle, negotiate and outsmart your opponents. Enter Maze and Portal Challenges and gain advantage over your opponents. Beware! you must acquire and use the Arc of light to save earth before the end of days apocalypse where all players lose - game over!

Dark Matter, Black Holes, White Holes, Wormholes, The Fourth Dimension, anti-gravity and various barriers await you. Time machines, Teleport Tunnels, Maze of the Ancients, Tower of Power and Portal challenges can be used to your advantage. Answer Mystery and grade level Science questions at each stage of the game. Play your Alien Power cards and Gear cards wisely to win the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Educational, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Lern-Spiel-Sammlung
description:
Using motives from the TV show "Die Maus" this collection of learning games offers three different games for children from age 3.

Lerne Zählen teaches them the numbers from 1-12 and helps to find them in day-to-day situations.

Mein Zuhause concentrates on daily things and situations in the nursery and all over the house.

Lerne die Uhr teaches them a feeling for time and shows in play how the clock can help to manage the day better.

name: CLIQUE
description:
CLIQUE : The Card Game

Welcome to CLIQUE, the game of ruthless popularity. You play as that most terrifying of creatures, the pretty, popular, teenage girl. The goal is simple, to accumulate enough popularity to take over the Clique and rule the school. You accomplish this by gaining the things all girls need for societal domination, The Car, The Look, The Gear and the ultimate accessory: The Guy. But your opponents, the other girls in the Clique are out to stop you with that most powerful and destructive of weapons: Gossip. Is that Look So Last Season? Is your new Car actually Used? Is your new Guy Secretly Gay? Get all four Acquisitions, free yourself from the vicious Gossip, and you can take over the Clique.

Mechanics

The deck breaks down like this:

6 Avatars - These are the girls, each with a unique look and style.
6 Looks - From Goth to Ghetto Fabulous.
6 Cars - Will you go for Classic or Import?
6 Guys - If Jock is not to your liking, how about Vampire Chic?
6 Gears - Do I go for the Jewelry or take the Dog?
24 Gossip - Hand Me Down? Late Bloomer? Cruelty in card form.
30 Specials - Remove Gossip or dramatically alter the game.
50 Status - 10, 20, or 50 point cards to measure your popularity.
And so we come to gameplay. I'll try to keep this simple. The players set what level of popularity they need to reach in order to win. Each turn you play from your hand to try to get Acquisitions (The Gear, The Guy, etc.) for yourself. Each one gives you 10 points each round toward that goal. But the other players can put Gossip on them. While an Acquisition has a Gossip card on it, it earns you nothing. Of course, turnabout is fair play, so you'll be attacking them with the same vicious rumors. The first to earn enough popularity while having all four Acquisitions in play with no Gossip on them takes over the Clique and rules the school.

Along the way, there are also unique cards to, for instance, prevent Gossip being played on your Car (My Daddy Owns A Dealership). It possible that everyone might lose their Guys in one fell swoop if someone should play Smoking In The Boys Room. The game can change dramatically from turn to turn. But isn't that the way with high school popularity? One day you are the queen, the next you are the outcast. Same goes for CLIQUE.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Hench: The Game
description:
There Must Be No Competition, Before World Domination

In Hench: The Game, you take on the role of an evil mad scientist that has the means to rule the world, but so do a few others just like you! Before you can take over the world, you need to eliminate the competition.

Hench: The Game will be a simple card and dice game (recommended for 2-4 players). From your hand of 6 cards, you build your army of henchmen to protect you using Recruit Cards, and who will also do all your dirty work for you. You can strengthen your henchmen army by building enhancements to your secret hideout or equipping them with weapons. You can also attack, sabotage, defend yourself and many other things using Event Cards from your hand.

Basic gameplay will go like this:

1.As your turn begins, you may play a Recruit Card to play henchmen from your hand (but keeping some hidden in your hand may be beneficial to you later)
2.You then can play one Enhancement, Weapon or Event card from your hand (see FAQ for card type explanation)
3.If an Event card is played, instead of a Weapon or Enhancement card, then all effects from the card are resolved
4.Draw back up to 6 cards.
5.Next player's turn

If an Event card, such as Direct Attack or Provoked Attack, are played, then combat starts. How combat works is your opponent and yourself add up your "Hench Power", which is +1 for each henchman you have in play, and any modifiers from Weapon or Enhancements in play. Each battling player then rolls one D6 and adds it to their "Hench Power". Higher number wins, and the loser can either lose a location enhancement or half the difference between the "Hench Power" numbers (round up) in henchmen they have in play.

Some other Event cards would allow you to avoid a battle (but you end up losing a turn), forcing a battle between two other players, performing suicide attacks, etc.You lose when all of your henchmen are destroyed, and the last player standing wins the game, and the world!

name: All meine Früchtchen
description: The players want to cook marmalade with the mouse and collect the fruits in the garden to exchange them for marmalade. Each player draws a secret mouse card, his aim is to reach a corner square with the mouse of that colour and as many fruits as possible. The active player rolls the die and moves any mouse accordingly in any direction, jumping over other mice is possible, only one mouse per square is allowed. Who reaches a corner, discards the mouse card and draws a new one, the fruit chips he keeps. Three fruit chips are exchanged for a marmalade jar. When all the mouse cards have been discarded, the player with the most marmalade jars wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming

name: Erzähl doch was!
description:
Four simple games teach how to remember stories and facts and how to retell them properly. This trains fantasy and verbal development.
"Unterwegs mit der Maus" is a combination game, cards must be put on the boards, the situations have a time sequence.
"Schnell geschaut" is a reaction game, a game master combines 3 fitting and one non-fitting card, players score a point for finding the misfit.
"Was könnte das sein" is a description game, players must name the words describes.
"Quatschgeschichten" is a repetition game, the first player tells a story containing the three words on his card, the next players repeat the story and add their own things, a mistake scores a minus.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Hau Ruck!
description:
The mouse is clever and the elephant is strong and they play tug-of-war, but they need both muscles and brain to pull each other over the finish line.

The terrain cards are laid out, the tug-of-war card is placed under the middle card, flag just beneath the starting post. One player has the mouse cards, the other the elephant cards. Duck cards win against 8, 9, and 10 and lose against all others. Each player chooses a card and places it face down and are revealed at the same time. The higher card wins and the player may move the tug-of-card along one terrain card. Whoever can move the tug-of-war card over the finish line wins.

name: Ich hab's
