description: Where is the tiger hiding? To fulfil the demand cards players must remember exactly where which picture lies and especially what is shown on the other side of the pictures. The picture cards are spread out on the table, each player receives a demand card, the other demand cards form a draw pile. The active player turns over three picture cards to fulfil his demand card. If at the end of his move there are only those pictures face up on the table that are shown on his demand card, he lays down his demand card and draws a new one. If he could not fulfil his card, his move ends. If a player wants he can discard his demand card and draw a new one instead of turning over three picture cards. When the draw pile is finished, the player with the most points from his fulfilled demand cards wins the game.

name: NONSENSE
description:
Altercation - The Card Slinging Action Game

Object of the game:
Players win the game by either Knocking Out all other players
OR
By being the player with a Vigor Point Total(VPT) Closest to the Target Number (TN) (in either direction) when all cards have been played from the deck and all players hands. *If two players are tied for Closest to TN, The Throwaway Pile gets shuffled and play continues*

How to Play:
1. Calculate Vigor Point Total (VPT): Roll the 4 dice add the total together: That is each players starting VPT. Write each players name and VPT on the score sheet.
2. Calculate Target Number (TN): Roll 3 dice and add the total. This is the number everyone is trying to get closest to by the end of the game.
3. Decide who plays first. Roll a dice, Flip a coin, etc.
4. Shuffle the Deck and Deal each Player 5 cards.
5. Place the deck face down in the middle of the table.
6. The first player takes their Turn and play continues to the next player on the left.

Turn:
Step 1: Draw cards until you have 5 in you hand (skip this step on the first turn)
Step 2: Do 1 of the following 2 options:
A. Play a card. Choose a player and play a Lose, Gain, (put this
card in the Throw Away pile next to the deck after addition or
subtraction takes place) or Defender Card (play this card in
front of you)
B. Throw Away 1 Card and Draw 1 new Card
Step 3: End of Turn
publishers: General Nonsense Games, Off The Wall Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: GAME ON
description:
GAME ON is the very first live card game.
The Game is played while watching a sports event.

There is a special deck made for each sport:

Baseball
Football
Hockey
Basketball
Soccer
Golf
Tennis


The two most popular ways of playing GAME ON….

Each player (2-5 players) are dealt 7 random cards. Leave the leftover cards in a pile, they will be used soon. Now.....

1. Let the sports event decide what cards to play by what is actually happening in the game. The goal is to dump all of your cards first. If the next play is running back running for 15+ yards and you have that card then you can play it. That is once less card you have to dump AND if that card you use is a + or - card then you get to dump more of your cards or have a player (or two) pick more cards up from the leftover pile. Its that simple.....AND FUN!!

2. Play your cards by predicting what will happen next in the game. The goal is to collect as many cards as possible. Before the next chance (inning, possession, break, etc...) each player chooses a play from the hand they are dealt. Place it face up so everyone knows whos playing what. When the first person who chose correctly wins then he/she gets to collect all the cards that were played. Plus if his/her card was a +/- card then she could get more cards from the leftover pile or they can choose the cards that other players have to dump. Trade cards are used as well and when you win with that card you get to pick a players card (blindly) to trade with your worst card. Its that simple....AND FUN!

***There are many other ways of playing GAME ON. Other luck games or harder games involving more skills and knowledge.***

Each sport has between 8-13 different plays in the deck. Some are rare but most are common plays.

name: Seepferdchen-Wettlauf
description: If the wind likes you he plays a lovely bell tune into your ear. When you hear that, the sea horses hold a race round a sunken castle, dance in the fallen walls and the sea horse who is the first to be all around the castle, may ring the bell. A nice castle is put together and the bell is fastened to the bell tower. The players in turn roll the die, with a dark blue dot one may put a sea horse to the start and then in one’s turn again roll the die and move the horse. In case of a dot the sea horse moves to the next wall of that colour, for a ring to the next but one, and for an arrow it moves back one wall. If a sea horse is rolled, the player may move his horse through the next opening in the wall. Who reaches the bell tower first has won the game.

name: Englisch für den Urlaub
description: The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empty spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. If the translation is correct he/she receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.

name: Quizfächer Pocketquiz für schlaue Kids
description: A quiz in the form of a fan, on the subject of general knowledge - 'primary school level' -, 1000 questions and answers sequenced by time periods. The cards are held by a screw and can be ideally taken on travels, the answers are always on the next page. The quiz can be played alone or by several players.

name: Gotham G-200 Ice Hockey Game
description:
This appears to be the first hockey game made by Gotham.
Game says that patent applied for GOTHAM'S G-200 TOY, ICE HOCKEY GAME
Manufactured by GOTHAM PRESSED STEEL CORP from NY USA.
MADE IN UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
Game measures 24" long x 11" wide.

This is the same game as GOTHAM G-800 Ice Hockey game already in the DB. This game of course is different because it is not electric. You have to hand hold the goalies who resemble the look of the Electric G-800 goalies.

name: Game of Golf
description: This game from McLoughlin Brothers was a game that featured a mechanical man who was controlled by the player. The scorecard that came with the game showed how long each hole was and a conversion into inches was then made by the players. There was an out-of bounds marker and a sand trap and movable green to navigate to and then with a deft touch the ball could be putted into the hole.

name: Mukden 1905
description:
This game covers the battle of Mukden in 1905 during the Russo-Japanese war.

Though the title doesn' contain the word and the game is not designed by Mr. Nakamura, this is the latest addition of "Storm over" series game.

This game uses an area map and uses a card-driven system. The additional twist is Russian initiative. The initiative is decreased by losing territory, and can be recovered by sacrificing the card play. Also, this initiative is used for combat modifier.

The rules are easy and the game can be played within 2 hours.

Contents: 126 counters, 32 cards, 1 game map, 4 pages rulebook
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Das Kasperlspiel
description: Harlequin cannot sit still, he jumps up and down, all limbs in different directions. Children try to immitate him with their harlequins. Each player receives a harlequin card and starts with arms and legs of the harlequin in a randomly chosen position. The cards are shuffled and seperated into three piles with 12 cards each. One player after the other moves an arm or leg of his harlequin exactly on step away from the previous position. If the new positions corresponds with the position of the harlequin on one of the three top cards in the stack, the player takes this card. When all cards are gone, the player with the most cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Das Niederösterreich-Spiel Land-und-Leute-Edition
description:
Das Niederösterreich-Spiel Land-und-Leute-Edition is a quiz game on the 573 communities of Lower Austria, the active player rolls a die for the number of the question to read out, all other players answer as a team with a number. The active player then guesses if the actual answer will be higher or lower than the answer given by the others. Depending on the result, the active player receives a chip. At the end of the game, the player with the most chips wins.

Contains 300 new questions on 55 new cards for 'Das Niederösterreich-Spiel' and a small rulebook, and can be played without the base game (however, a die and 21 coins or something similar are needed).

Expansion for the Member’s gift 2004 of the Volkspartei Niederösterreich
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Im Reich der Käfer und Schmetterlinge
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 75)
simple 'Roll and Move' game
remarks:
very cute drawings
humanized animals
2 educational inserts about bugs & butterflies by manufacturer
6 very nice coloured pewter figures
should had been published between 1910-15
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing

name: Reingefallen
description:
Objective: move as many as possible of your meeples into the middle of the board (safe)
- moving by turns - surviving seems to be very tough
1 each player starts with (only) one meeple at his (coloured) base
2 roll the die and move a. your meeple b. turn the wheel according the die
3a if your meeple falls into a hole - bad luck
3b if your meeple is still 'on board' ==> next player
3c if your meeple reaches the middle - safe; put a new one onto the board if you have remaining moves
4 thrown out meeples (not dropped) may start again (home base)
5 game ends if all meeples dropped/are safe

There are 2 different editions: small ==> max 4 player 245/I
large: max 6 player 245/H; if you play with more than 4 players you should fix/tape one hole
game was published during 1930's

name: Wir reisen mit Karl May -Vom Sinai zum Tigris-
description:
Object of the game:
Be the first to reach field no 100

Simple 'Roll and Move' game
based on the book/story of 'Karl May',
well known German novelist;
Schmidt aquired rights to publish Game
edition is equipped with 6 cute pewter figures.
categories: Adventure, Arabian, Children's Game, Novel-based, Travel
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Over and Under
description:
Over and Under is a child's "First Game of Fractions".

From Publisher Page:
Players place one die over or under another die to create a proper or improper fraction in this multi-leveled game of beginning fractions. Then place a marble over or under that fraction on the game board to knock their opponents out or capture the fraction for themselves. For the biggest challenge, be the first player to capture a combination of proper fractions that will make a whole number.

The game is available in a wooden board version and a Masonite board wipe-off version, for use with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wooden Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite board
- Dice
- Directions

name: Down and Around
description:
Down and Around is a game that teaches "The FUN-da-Mentals of Fractions".

From Publisher Website:
Players use our original Fraction Ladder to easily find the Greatest Common Factor (GCF) and Least Common Multiple (LCM) of 2 numbers rolled on the 6- and 12-sided dice. Then players use their answers to be the first to fill-in 9 of their 12 spaces. For a more challenging level players compete to get 3 in a row on either side of the board using both offensive and defensive strategy.

This game comes in a wooden board version and a Masonite board version, for use with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wood Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite board
- Dice
- Directions

name: Pirates 'n Plunder
description:
Pirates 'n Plunder is a game of "Adding/Subtracting Fractions for Fun!"

From Publisher Site:
Using our original Fraction Ladder, players quickly solve fraction problems with addition and subtraction. Then using these answers, they try to build runs of their marbles for bonus points or to block their opponents' runs. If they plunder (surround) an opponent's treasure chest or include a treasure chest in a run, they score extra points. A fun way to practice adding and subtracting fractions with lots of strategy!

There is a wood board version, and a Masonite board version that be used with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wooden Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite Board
- Dice
- Directions

name: Sink the Ship
description:
Sink the Ship is a game of "Multiplying & Dividing Fractions for Fun!"

From Publisher Website:
Multiply or divide two fractions created from the roll of four dice to produce an answer that will help you build runs of your marbles for bonus points or block your opponents' runs. Include a safe port in a run and double your points. Sink the Ship of your opponent in its home port and score even more points. Lots of strategy in this fun game of multiplying and dividing fractions!

There is a wooden board version, and a Masonite wipe-off board version that can be used with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wooden Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite Board
- Dice
- Directions

name: Wir wollen das Sportleistungsabzeichen erwerben!
description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
if you land on an area called 'Gefahrenpunkt' = danger point
you made a bad move
introduction is used to motivate children practising sports

name: Der Satzbaumeister
description: There are groups of words On the 48 cards from which players can make sentences. Depending on the difficulty there is one, two or three points to use. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Wizard's Tournament
description:
Wizard's Tournament

Every year, wizards from all over the realm come together to fight over the title of Archmage to become the most powerful wizard in the world. Wizard's Tournament is a fantasy deck building game of magic combat where two players attempt to defeat each other using spells, monsters, and relics. The game comes with thirty-five different sets of cards but only twelve of these card sets are picked at random to be used during a game. These cards are added to a player's deck during a game so every time you play, it will feel like a new and exciting game.

Spell Cards
Spell cards allow a player to perform special actions including dealing damage, drawing cards, healing, and causing an opponent to discard cards. When cast, the ability of a Spell card occurs once and then it is discarded. Fast spells can be played at any time but regular spells can only be cast on the owner's turn. Spell cards can also be discarded to add Spirit to your Spirit Pool.

Monster Cards
Monsters are permanent creatures used to attack your opponent and defend you from enemy monsters. Every monster has a special ability that makes them more dangerous and difficult to defeat.

Relic Cards
These permanent artifacts give a player special abilities that allow them to perform an action every turn until they are destroyed or stolen.

Game Play
Each player starts with thirty Life. If a player reduced his opponent's Life to zero, he wins the game. A player can also win by having thirty or more Spirit in his Spirit Pool or by having one hundred or more Life.

Each player starts the game with ten Spirit cards. Twelve cards are drawn from the Selection deck and these twelve card sets are placed on the table. The starting player is determined randomly. Before play begins, the player that is going first draws one card and the player going second draws three cards.

There are three possible icons on the each card: Green, Blue, and Red.

Green Icons: This is the Cast cost to activate a Spell, Monster, or Relic card. This is also the purchase price in Spirit to add this card to a player's discard pile.

Blue Icons: This is the amount of Spirit added to a player's Spirit Pool when a card with a blue icon is discarded without activating it.

Red Icons: Monster cards have red icons equal to its Power. A monster's Power is equal to a monster's Life and the amount of damage it can deal to a player or another monster.

Turn Sequence - 5 Phases

Draw Phase

A player draws five cards from her deck. A player may never have more than ten cards in her hand at any time. If a player cannot draw a card because her deck has run out of cards, the player must shuffle her discard pile into a new deck.

Purchase Phase

During any phase, Spirit cards or Spell cards can be discarded to add Spirit to a player's Spirit Pool equal to the number in the blue icon on the card. This Spirit can be spent to purchase any of the twelve cards in the center of the table. To add a card to your discard pile, you must pay the value in the card's green icon in Spirit. Only one copy of each card can be purchased each turn.

Magic Phase

Players can spend Spirit to cast Spell, Monster, and Relic cards. When Spell cards are cast, their ability is performed once and then they are discarded. When Monster and Relic cards are cast, they are placed in play with an Activation token. Relics and monsters can use their abilities during the Magic and Combat phases. An Activation token is placed on a relic when it is activated. Relics and monsters with an Activation token cannot be activated.

Combat Phase

A Monster card can be used to attack another player or defend you from an attacking monster. Monsters with an Activation token on them cannot attack, defend, or use their ability. To attack, select all the monsters under your control that you want to attack. Your opponent then decides which of his monsters will defend against each of the attacking monsters. More than one monster can be used to block a single attacking monster. After the attack, place an Activation token on each of the attacking monsters.

If a monster attacks and is not blocked, the defending player’s Life is reduced by the Power of that monster. If a monster is blocked by a defending monster, both monsters deal damage equal to their Power to his opponent. If a monster's damage is ever equal to or greater than its Power, it is destroyed and placed in its owner’s discard pile. If a defending monster cannot absorb all this damage, the excess damage is applied to the defending player. Excess damage applied to an attacking monster is ignored.

If more than one monster is used to block a single attacking monster, the attacking player may apply damage equal to the Power of the attacking monster divided amongst any the defending monsters in any way. Any of these defending monsters that receive enough damage to be destroyed are placed in his owner’s discard pile. If a group of blocking monsters cannot absorb all the damage, the player that controls them has his Life reduced by the excess damage. All the Power of the blocking monsters are combined and applied to the attacking monster. If the damage dealt is equal to or greater than the Power of the attacking monster’s Power, the attacking monster is destroyed and placed in its owner’s discard pile and the excess damage is ignored.

End Phase

All Activation tokens are removed from play, all monster damage is discarded, and all Spirit Pools are emptied.

3 or 4 Player Optional Rules

The game can also be played with optional rules for three or four players when you use the extra Spirit cards included in the game.

Players: 2

Time: 30 Minutes

Ages: 12+

Contents: 292 Cards, Tokens, and a Rule Book

name: Latrotabuli
description:
This game was created by Jennifer Diane Reitz to make part of her fictional universe of Pastel Defender Heliotrope.

It is based on the ancient game of latrunculi or latrunculorum, where players try to eliminate all the opponent's pieces using a "flanking movement" (i.e. pieces surrounding the captured piece in opposite sides). There's little information about movement of pieces, being suggested different ways.

Latrotabuli is a variant played in 12 x 6 retangular board and players have 12 latros and 1 centurion (acts as king). Latros can move any number of spaces in one of the cardinal directions whilst the Centurion can only move one space.

One particular feature of the game is the possibility of creating several formations to best deployment of pieces: the Testudo and the Phalanx. The testudo is a 4-piece square formation and phalanx is a 4-piece linear formation, in which pieces move as one.

The method of capture depends of the capturing formation (or lack of) and of the captured piece/pieces, and can be by approach, by flanking or by moving and replacing.

There's 3 victory conditions:

capture all opponent latros (pieces)
capture the opponent centurion or,
when a player in the beginning of his turn can't move his centurion, he loses.

name: Handelsschiffe auf den Weltmeeren
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible by transporting goods by boat
- moving by turns -
each players chooses a coloured meeple and draws 4 cards
the 4 cards represent goods he has to deliver to the listed port
due to his meeple each player follows his coloured route
by rolling the dice
delivering goods the player draws a new cargo card (only the first player entering same port may draw a cargo card)
game ends if alls player have reached their final destination port (first one gets special bonus)
player with highest bonus points wins
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Deutschlands Klügste
description:
Quiz based on TV Show.
In Round 1 will be asked 12 questions and 4 possible answers given to each player for his answers.
In Round 2, each player chooses a category and then try to answer within the specified time as many questions as he can. The results obtained in Round 1 and 2 points determine the participants for the final. Who has the most points after that is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: The 7 Dwarfs
description:
"The 7 Dwarfs" in english.
The dwarves are numbered and must be combined to form families, which may be the sum not higher than 7. Players score points for entire families. The player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Number

name: Nuzoo
description: Party game. Twelve pictures of composite animals are placed around the room. During the party, guests look at the pictures and write down the animals that make up each image. The one who gets the most right answers, wins.

name: Dr. Kinkin Bacteriapanic
description: Japanese card game that has numbered sickness cards and numbered medicine cards. When you get sickness and medicine card with same number, you can throw them away. First player to get rid of all hand cards wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Medical, Party Game

name: Risu-Game-On Plus
description:
User Summary:

A Japanese amateur Dominion-esque card game. Each player starts with a small deck of cards containing money and some VP and during the course of the game buys more cards from a common card pool.

Expands Risu-Game-On.

name: Risu-Game-On 3 Deadly Strike
description:
User Summary:

A Japanese amateur Dominion-esque card game. Players start with a small deck of cards containing money and some few victory points, and may each turn buy more cards from a common card pool, gradually increasing their decks.

The player with the most victory points in their decks once the game ends wins.

Expands Risu-Game-On and Risu-Game-On Plus

name: DungeonMania
description:
User summary:

A home-made "Hero Quest" type game. The game is played on a square-gridded board representing a dungeon. One player takes the role of the Dungeon Master, the other players are heroes trying to defeat and clear each scenarion.

The game contains a game board, rulebook with 10 scenarios and cut-out markers for all enemies and items.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Anger Solution Card Game
description:
This game was designed to teach children constructive and effective ways to resolve their anger. The cards allow them the opportunity to choose alternatives that can turn anger-inciting situations into more positive encounters. Through repetitive game play, they will learn how to use the new solutions in real life to avoid negative reactions. The object of the the game is for players to resolve as many anger-inciting situations as they can within a 20-30-minute periods. Players get chips for resolving anger situations, and the player with the most chips wins the game.

Contents:
20 People cards
40 Situation cards
40 Solution cards (four sets of 10)
100 Chips
Instructions

name: Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files
description:
Note from designer: This was planned but never got published.

Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files provides new exciting stories for clever investigators and is a part of the Crime & Mystery family. They have to solve the mysteries of these stories, which the police could not solve.

The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence" cards. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files is the sequal to the uncommon und innovative criminal game Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files. The players have to listen closely and remember and combine the facts in the right way to find the murder and win the game.


Neue Fälle der ganz anderen Art erwarten die Ermittler. Es gilt, Fälle zu lösen, welche die Polizei selbst nicht lösen konnte und nun zu den Akten legen will. Doch nicht, wenn es nach dem Willen des scharfsin nigsten Ermittlerteams von ganz London geht.

In Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files, der Fortsetzung des ungewöhnlichen Kriminal-Spiels Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files muss man genau zuhören können, messerscharf kombinieren und braucht ein erstklassiges Gedächtnis, um anhand der Indizien und Hinweise, den oder die tatsächlichen Täter zu überführen. Lost Bakerstreet Files kann separat oder zusammen mit den Bakerstreet Files gespielt werden.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Crime & Mystery: Modern Investigation
description:
Note from designer: This was planned but never got published.

A new murder at East Highway. There is no time to lose before the hints are lost. Due to new methods there are new ways to discover the murder for the investigators. Find root of hairs, fingerprints and autopsy dead bodies.

The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence" cards. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

Crime & Mystery: Modern Investigation is a deductive game for 3 to 6 investigators. It is a part of the Crime & Mystery family and is based on the mechanism of Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files. It puts the investigation into the setting of CSI in the USA.


Schon wieder ein Mord am East Highway. Wie immer gilt es, keine Zeit zu verlieren. Die Spuren müssen gesichert werden, bevor sie verloren gehen. Dank den neuesten Methoden der Wissenschaft, hat sich das Gesicht der Ermittlungen in solchen Fällen geändert. Haarwurzeln, Fingerabdrücke, Blutproben, Insektenlarven und präzise Autopsien ermöglichen eine ganz neue Form der Verbrechensbekämpfung. Und auch eine neue Art von Ermittlern.

Crime & Mystery: Modern Investigation ist ein deduktives Spiel für 3-6 Ermittler, das auf dem Spielmechanismus von Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files beruht und die Ermittlungen in das Setting der Crime Scene Investigation der USA führt.

name: Dick Tracy ...jagt "Big Boy"
description:
Objective: 2 players or two teams are attempting
A capture Big Boy or (Dick Tracy)
B get into head quarter (Big Boy)
- moving by turn -
player rolls the die & moves; if you meet an opponent you are going to fight (by die); loser is placed into the hospital, winner moves on.
Story is based upon the movie published 1990, where the cop Dick Tracy is trying to capture his arch enemy Big Boy Caprice
categories: Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spin & Rescue Game
description:
The aim of the game is to collect all 5 of your rescue cards by remembering where they are.

There is a big spinner in the middle of the table and players spin Fireman Sam as hard as they can!
If he stops by your marker, listen carefully to what is said.

Depending what Fireman Sam said player draws one or two rescue cards and if it is his hero on that card he takes it on his hand or if it's not puts it back in the circle around spinner.
But sometimes Norman is in trouble! Now player have to give back randomly one of his rescue card.

The first player to collect all their 5 hero cards wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: CityProGame Mainz Wiesbaden
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Mainz & Wiesbaden each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: CityProGame Duisburg
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Duisburg each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: CityProGame Frankfurt
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Frankfurt each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

name: Lauf, Löwe, Lauf!
description: This is a childrens variant of Pachisi. Each player has just three pawns (characters from the movie Lion King). The track fields have five different colours. So does the die. If you roll RED you can move to the next red field. If you roll the blank side you can choose a colour.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Weltraumfahrt
description:
WELTRAUMFAHRT is a roll-and-move dice game which was published around 1960.
What makes it special is the highly attractive artwork and the beautiful playing pieces shaped as small astronauts, which glow in the dark...

name: Biribi
description:
The game board depicts a rug with three connected, diamond-shaped areas of 3 x 3 fields each. The goal is to get as many of one's own playing pieces to the far end of the board.
Each player has five coins. In each turn, a player can move a coin one field forward. When a coin can reach one of the opponent's coins, it climbs on top of that. This is called a Biri, it can move two fields, but not eliminate further coins. It can be caught by a single coin of the opponent. The resulting "Biribi" can move three fields and can't be eliminated.
When a Biri or Biribi reaches the far end of the board, opponent's coins are discarded, one's own coins are scored. Whoever managed to get most coins across is the winner.
publishers: Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., White Castle, WIN: Das Spielejournal

name: Zombies Ate My Brains
description:
In Zombies ate my Brains (ZAMB) you are a newly created Zombie just trying to get some fresh human brains to keep you in peek undead form. Those pesky living ones however seem to want you dead, for real this time. Can you eat their brains before they destroy your rotting body? Find out if you have the right stuff come the Zombie Apocalypse.

ZAMB is a solo card game in which you have 2 decks, one is your play deck and the other is the Humans. You also have a set of cards to represent you the Zombie- which as you take damage changes your ability to draw cards and also effects your defence and offensive capabilities. Gameplay involves managing whatever the humans throw at you and using your hand/deck you try to defeat the game as more and more threats come into play. Picking the wrong option is deadly to the undead.

The Zombies over run the world and win if there are no more human cards left to play and yet your undead minion is still in (at least) one piece.

The game is a fast playing light card game which can also be played as a 2 player format with one player taking control of the Humans. In solo play the game rarely goes over 10 minutes play time.

name: The Hatter's Table
description:
The Hatter’s Table is board game about discovering the hidden and wonderfully strange rules that govern an apparently irrational situation. Set around the Mad Hatter’s table, players must dash around the Wonderland tea party while trying to figure out what secret rules govern the other players' movement. The Mad Hatter character serves as both an audio guide and aid to chaos.

How do you play?

Each player has a secret rule. When play begins, the Mad Hatter shouts out instructions about where to move around the table: "Go sit at a tea cup," "Take a seat next to the March Hare," "Move one place counter-clockwise." Players move their tokens accordingly, unless they find themselves in a situation where they must follow their secret rule instead.

Your goal is to guess what secret rules the other players are following. If you can do so successfully, you are rewarded with buttons, and the first player to get fifteen buttons wins the game!

At first, the game might seem like madness, but once you get the hang of it you'll learn to use some strategy. Watch the other players carefully and take note whenever they disobey the Hatter's direction - that's when you know they must be following their rule. Each place around the table has two different states, and every state has two positions around the table. When the Hatter tells you to sit next to the March Hare, a clever player will pick the spot next to the Hare that will best hide their secret rule.

name: Puff Ball
description:
Spears action game.

THe board has 8 sections, with a goal at the appropriate at every alternate side. If two play, opposite sections are played. If four play, then all goal-sections are used.

Each player has a 'puffer', a miniature bellows that, when pressed, ejects a stream of air. The object is to 'blow' the ball around the board, trying to get it into an opponent's goal.

The first to score 6 goals is the winner.

name: Öko-Detektiv
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible

- roll & move game with action cards; moving by turn -
Each player tries to roll & move, picking up cards, helping enviroment and moving his/her stone along the scoring board/row
for more involved detectives (age 10..) a 'tracing set' can be added

Content:
1 board
5 wooden meeples (= 'Öko-detectives')
5 wooden stones (scoring)
1 special 6-sided wooden die
30 wooden chips
26 event cards
12 cards for environmental sins
8 action slides
5 tracing-set-cards
1 rules
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Environmental, Racing

name: Zombie Roller Derby
description:
The war is over. Humanity has regained control. The zombies have been rounded up and contained. Time for people to get on with their lives. But there's no TV; no internet; society needs time to rebuild. What will the masses do for entertainment?

Zombie Roller Derby. In this game, you take the role of a roller derby team manager. Your team consists of "trained" zombies; your goal is to win the race, and maybe kill a few zombies along the way.

Race your zombies along the derby track. Play cards to urge them forward or to fight other zombies. Avoid the ire of the crowd, or stir them up on purpose. Play to win; to kill zombies; or to incite a riot. Just don't let the zombies get out of their cages...
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Wall of the Dead
description:
"They are hungry!
The only way to safety is to climb up. . . or is it?"

Dexterity based game in which your zombies are trying to reach the human of the other player. Be careful, or your zombies will tumble down and they'll have to make their way up again.

Game is simple: On the player's turn he or she gets a randomised zombie which must be placed against the opponent's wall. The goal is to get the pile high enough to touch the human. Players place one zombie at the time and try to catch the opponent's human before their own human is zombie food.

name: Straddle
description:
Straddle is a skill-action party game played on a giant planisphere (5 ft x 6 ft plastic playing mat) and combines a fun mix of practical and observational astronomy. Playing like Hasbro’s classic Twister game, the object is to touch a star or constellation using only your feet or hands and be the last player not to touch any other body part to the mat.

Each player stands at a corner of the mat in socks or bare feet. The umpire spins the spinner and calls out the body part and the star or constellation, for example, left hand Orion. The first player puts his or her left hand on the constellation Orion. Using the supplied star charts, the umpire can help a player determine what stars are in the constellation. Play continues to the next player.

If a player touches the mat with any body part except a hand or a foot, that player is eliminated. Be the last player not to touch any other body part to the Straddle mat to win the game.

name: Juegos olimpicos
description: "Juegos olimpicos" (Olympic Games) is a game for the whole family, consisting of different Olympic events (marathon, long and high jump, hammer throw, sprint race...) wich take place in different boardgames, each with it's own rules and mechanics. After each event, the winners receive individual medals (gold, silver and bronze) and at the end of the Olympics, after having competed in all events (having played in all the boardgames), the one who has amassed the largest number of medals, taking into account its value (a gold medal is worth more than two bronze), is declared the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Empires And Generals
description:
Empires and Generals is a Print and Play Collectible Card Game with free content available from EmpiresandGenerals.com.

You play as a famous Empire from real history against other Empires from real history using Generals, Soldiers, Ideals, Strategies, Tactics and Resources from their own unique Empire.

The object of Empires and Generals is to become the greatest and most powerful Empire. You can do this by gaining Cultural Health or by causing others to lose theirs.

To date the "Family Edition" is free to print and that includes:

The Huns
Roman Republic
Egyptian Kingdom
Ancient China

The Expanded Edition includes:

Ancient Greece
Achaemenid Persia
and more

And other expansions include:

Act of God Thematic Expansion
The Prince Thematic Expansion
The Great Plague

Using Playing Cards and Resource Cards you build your Empire. Build your Kingdom with Civilization-specific cards. Send your Soldiers out to the Battlefield with the General in the lead. Utilize Strategies and Tactics to suit your personal playing system.

Pick an Empire to represent.

After determining the length of game-play, dominate your opponent by destroying their army or hide behind your walls and win by cunning.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Going to the Cinema
description:
A simple game, rather like Snakes and Ladders but without snakes or ladders.

The board has 100 squares and the object is to be the first to reach square 100.

This must have been a free game sent by post because the board is paper and the teetotum needs to be cut out to act as the die. And you can cut out 'figures' for playing pieces.

name: Arithmetic Rummy
description:
Game designed to help children with their maths. A set in this version are a number of cards that form a correct equation. For example; a three card set could be 4 divided by 2 = 2.

A promotional game, by Kellogg's

name: Tiz-Golf
description:
Indoor golf game. Nine metal 'holes' are included. They are odd shapes so that each hole will play differently, rather like an indoor version of Crazy Golf.

No publisher credited or a date of release. The illustration on the box looks like it is from the 20's or 30's.

name: Dual Deck
description: The Dual Deck has 96 cards that are similar to Poker cards, except that each card is actually 2 cards combined into 1. There are 2 sets of rank and suit on each card. Players can choose which set they want to use. The Dual Deck puts a new twist on the traditional card games! It is also a cardgame system that is waiting for new games to be designed just for it!
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Rainbow Tiles
description:
Rainbow tiles is a deck that consists of cards each with 4 rectangles of different colours. There are also white lines that resemble roads or paths. The Rainbow Tiles is a game system can be used for tile-laying games.

If you have any suggestions or comments, please join in the discussion at this forum:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/744252/rainbow-tiles-a-t...
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Der GourmetGuru
description:
Objective: be the first who collected 5 stars answering question cards correctly
- moving/acting by turn -
luxuriant equipped game
roll the dice, draw a card, answer question (out of world of dinner & drinks, recipes ..) correctly - multiple choice/possible multiple answers
selection/samples of questions:
what is tartar?
A stone growing on grapes
B small crystalline residues
C stone needed to press grapes
categories: Card Game, Dice, Mature / Adult, Trivia

name: DKT Das Kartenspiel
description:
Cardgame based on popular DKT board game but it's not neither expansion or transformations.

The game uses the fields of Austria-expenditure of DKT as images for the cards and offers three different game ideas: quartet, DKT Schwarzer Peter and DKT land poker.
There is a play money included for poker variant but in the poker game there are only pairs and triplets of action which very limits the possibilities.

Contents:

36 cards,
play money,
1 set of rules

name: DKT Das korrupte Talent
description: Variation of DKT with a satirical theme. Money is transferred to the Bahamas and Liechtenstein, in the end all Tickets are sold to the state and the rest of the money in the bank - that still exist - all players divided, whoever has the most money wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Gravestalker
description:
Part of the Tiger Klix line.

A portable, magnetic roll-and-move maze game for two players. The object of the game is to escape the graveyard. To do this, you'll have to navigate the graveyard maze and reach the Gravestalker's house in the center of the board. Once there, you may claim the key that will let you escape. But players will also have a chance to move the Gravestalker, in an effort to block their opponent's path. Also watch out for skull spaces on the board, which can send you further away from your goal.

Once you have the key, it's a mad dash to the finish. The first player out wins.

name: Slasher Movie
description: Slasher Movie is a game of Survival Horror, Detection, and Betrayal for 2-6 Players. In Slasher Movie, you play as a character in your very own horror movie. You can play the game trying to save Victims from the various Slashers in your town. Or, you may try to discover who’s responsible for the latest killing. But beware, one of your fellow players may also be a Slasher, ready to strike when you least expect it. What’s more, You may be a Slasher yourself, plotting the demise of everyone else.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wildstyle: O Jogo das Tribos
description:
Players are gangster that must keep their territories safe from others. Move your pawns in New York, trying to reach a secret objectives to win the game.

In your struggle, you will have help of warriors that will fight with punches, kicks and other martial arts skills, but be aware, if you loose a battle, your will loose your warrior and will be an easy target.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Weinspiel
description:
objective:
become wine Queen (or king) by collecting appropriate cards
- moving/acting by turn -
moving around the board, solving questions, collecting cards, barrels, increase knowledge about ampelography and - steal what you need from your teammates - to get the crown
doing so you are going to learn - apropos of nothing -
quite a lot about the stuff (ehem.. world of wine) you are dealing with:
cultivation all over the world, history, different grapes, manufacturing methods, flavours, ..

name: Chain Rule
description: The primary goal of the player is to make a chain of gems from the outside of the board to the center.

name: A Few Rare Men
description:
This is a specialty ASL product that purportedly is available free from Critical Hit as a special thanks only to those who ordered the "Many Bundle" (which was a bulk order including the following CH products: GENESIS II + THE STONNE HEIGHTS + BdF II + GEMBLOUX II + FACING THE BLITZ).

A Few Rare Men features six France/Belgium 1940 ASL scenarios, and comes with a new geomorphic map board, a large overlay, and two small counter sheets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Ammo Domini: Fight for Europe to the Last Bullet
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Vorwärts, kleine Raupe!
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line and became a butterfly
- moving by turn -
throw 2 dice - the coloured one shows, which caterpillar should be moved, the other die the corresponding number (1-3) of moves.
But because a caterpillar exists out of 3 parts - head, belly and duff, you must move them sequencing

name: Calcul
description:
CALCUL is the 1st boardgame credited to Rudi Hoffmann.

It's like most of his games one with easy to understand and to learn rules but including the special "Kick": Every player starts with two parts of a pyramid cut in half, and following a certain pattern on the gameboard tilting their pieces, they have to reunite these halves to form a complete pyramid on one the the square board fields.
The more players the more challenge, as the space to tilt your pyramid is limited...

The game was a special promotional item for a company doing promotion itself, and it was of immensly high production quality: The game box was a wooden one, the gameboard was printed on top of it and the the pyramid halves were made of wood covered with lacquered cardboard.

name: Der Einkaufsbummel
description:
Promotional game for the Mariahilferstrasse.

Each player has three shopping cards, the player turns around one of his dice in his turn and moves his figure further accordingly. If a figure stops in front of a store, player can take goods chips required for his shopping card. Completed cards should be discarded and new cards are drawn.
If any player plays the last card, the game ends and who has completed most of purchase cards is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Wir spielen Regierung !
description:
Title means in English: "We play government!", game was released in 1952.
It was far ahead of its time and with an outstanding equipment.
It was a two-part-game played on both sides of the gameboard:
The first part was a roll-and-move game, but it had many twists to change the later part of the game.
This second part was played on the backside of the board, on a chess-like pattern, divided in 3 color-coded zones.
Not only that the first part decided which chess-figures you had to play with, no, the figures could be equipped with different heads, depending on which party-side you participated.
Winner was the first party to fill 3 squares at the end of the board.
As you would believe, the color-coded zones played a prominent role in moving and capturing, the rules were really interesting, but an awful lot to learn.
Fascinating stuff from the early German post-war era...
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mutations: Book for Killpower Ball
description:
A book of 1000 mutations in french version. 88 pages.
A extension for the game borad Killpower Ball

Here came the second extension Killpower Ball! It comes down to this book consisting of 1000 mutations.

If it is possible to play with mutations in a championship mode with or without money, tournament mode does not the use of this extension.

Mutations, drawn randomly can be positive, neutral or negative.
So take one or two Gladiator is a crucial choice, which will require careful thought as it may to change the future of your team.

It is also possible to use this book to make changes any character your favorite roleboard. However, adaptation will probably be necessary depending on the RPG.

name: Move Out
description: Move Out (1971, ADA, $1.50), by Tom Kaeter, simulates man-to-man combat in Western Europe in 1944. It pits all or part of an American infantry platoon (31 men, 31 counters) against a German platoon (32 men, 32 counters). Each side has one of five possible missions as they enter the board from opposite sides. Upside down placement and blank counters are used to add the fog of war. The terrain includes brush, hills, woods, a creek, a pond and two small buildings, one with several rooms. The men have their separate weapons and also a number of individual differences. Some can see better, some run faster, some are sharp-shooters, and others experts at hand to hand combat. Unfortunately, it is a very unfinished game. The rules are hard to figure out and some are almost impossible to carry out. Things are particularly difficult when fighting develops around the buildings. The game is an offshoot of Terry Griner's Patrol, published as a set of rules in Strategy & Tactics Nr. 7, and reading the rules in that source does help to figure out Move Out. Furthermore, the reproduction of the rules and map is quite poor. There are no counters, only pictures of counters and the pictures are hard to decipher. In spite of its faults however, Move Out offers something unusual and worthwhile for anyone who wants to investigate small unit tactics through a game. (Moves Magazine description)

name: Sieger-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first collecting 50 bonus points within 3 categories ==> status, wealth and adventure
- moving by turn -
roll the dice, move your meeple and follow instructions of the area you land on - that's it - sorry
add on bonus points to 3 different areas - don't forget, that minimum amount of points for status is '21'

inspired by novelist Heinz G. Konsalik
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Elektro Test: Variabel Programmiert
description:
Trivia game with over 500 questions.

This quiz is based on electrical contact - touching the contact surfaces in addition to question and correct answer, the correct answer will light the lamp. Included are 26 tables each with 20 questions, with different topics (many themes from nature, mathematics, history, fairy tales including images).

name: Berti Baggerfahrer
description: All excavator drivers try with their equipment to drive around the site, but they have to be careful on the things what is under the earth. A nice run play with a memory factor, certainly most interesting for preschool children, the topic is pretty and the kids can play safely after the declaration alone.

name: ABC + Phantasie
description:
Objective: collect letters (= bonus points) by forming cards to sentences
- acting by turn -
each player may place cards (= words) by turn, creating a sentence in a crossword puzzle 'frame'.
If successful player gets a letter corresponding to the letter on (just) placed card. later on these letters can also be used forming words;
end can be determined (time) or if all cards/letters are used
player collected most letters wins
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Toyland Surprise Game
description:
Objective: collect the most toys
- moving by turn -
player rolls the die and moves according rolled colour
if die shows own colour move twice
if die shows black don't move
if you land on an aera with a case - open the case and take out a toy
if you land on another player's position take a toy from him/her
if you are the first to pass finish line get all remaining toys out of the cases

name: Robofactory
description:
In this game you will:

- Bid in the markets, against the other players for those crucial contracts.
- Develop different technologies to produce more valuable robots.
- Upgrade or add to your production, increasing production capacity.
- Make the tricky decision to invest in new offices to exploit new markets around the world.
- Hire Sales Representatives to enter and hopefully win more auctions.
- Make and deliver the goods within the contract deadlines or pay the missed delivery damages.

You will also probably need to take a few loans, but be careful with the hefty interest!

Will you make the most profit or descend into bankruptcy ?


Robofactory is a zero-luck business simulation economic game about manufacturing robots around the world.

The game is modular and based on a large number of different and unique contract cards with different types of order.

The rules come with many different scenarios for players to decide on the length of the game that ranges from introductory games (60 minutes), quick games (90 minutes), normal games (120 minutes) and long games (180 minutes). Players are also encouraged to set up their own scenarios by combining the many contract cards available (please note that playing with ALL available contract cards will turn the game into epic and last a weekend).

name: 1001 Karawane: Sonderchips
description:
This is a small expansion for the game 1001 Karawane, which adds 4 cards and 4 tiles to the base game.
The rules come with the expansion.

name: minishuffle und minicurling
description:
In Table Shuffleboard, players push wooden pucks
down a long and smooth(!) wooden table into a scoring area at the opposite end of the table.

Shooting is performed with 'hammer' construction directly,
After both players (or teams) are finished shooting, then add up the score based on where the pucks finally landed on the Table Shuffleboard. It is not allowed that puck touches side band
scoring: puck scores depending (numbered) area it lands on
variants: quite a lot, like curling (similar to sport game)

name: Keep Away!
description: A memory-matching card game used to teach children about fire, fire hazards and fire safety. The 30 cards are laid out face down and players turn cards over to make matches. When a correct pair is found, it is removed from the board and the player scores a point. If a match card or lighter card is turned over, it is removed from the game along with the other overturned card. The player with the most points wins.

name: One of a Kind
description:
Based on the popular game Crazy Eights, this lively card game delivers fast-paced fun while helping kids become aware of their unique and special qualities. Players draw, match, and shed cards, answering questions as they go. (For example: "Would you choose yourself as a friend? Why or why not?")

Because only half of the cards include questions, the game moves along at a brisk pace. Special cards--Switch Direction, Leap, and Wild Cards--introduce an element of surprise. Players race to get rid of their cards and be first to proclaim "One of a Kind." For added excitement, the rules provide a way for quick-thinking players to jump in at the last minute and keep the game alive.

After each round of play, smiles abound--because kids are not only having fun but also feeling better about themselves.

name: Donald Duck's Party Game for Young Folks
description:
Donald Duck's Party Game for Young Folks is a "spin" and move game for young children.

The object of the game is to collect three prize tokens. The first player to do this is the winner.

The prizes are collected by moving the player pawns (four versions of Donald Duck) around the board by spinning a movement spinner until one player has landed on three "prize" spaces. The spinner is divided in to 4 quadrants numbered 1 to 4 with each one containing one square for each colored pawn that will determine the color of pawn to be moved and the number of spaces to move. While moving the player must read aloud what is written on the spaces as they pass them and perform any action that is in the space. For example "Stand up and take a bow" Once a player has landed on three prize spaces they are the winner. The winner must then do what the three prize tokens say.

name: Ein Tag wie kein anderer
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible finding correct answers
- geographic quiz, split into 3 phases, acting by turn -
phase 1
each player draws (randomly) a country card, memorizes data (as much as possible), localisates country and asks / answers questions
phase 2
each player rolls the die finding answers to selected questions regarding 'his country'
phase 3
each player determines by die a question card (world history) and faces the neighbour with a true/untrue questions
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political, Travel, Trivia

name: Die Farben Biene
description:
Objective: collect as many flowers as possible
- acting by turn -
roll the coloured die, choose one of those bees which where place previously onto flowers of the board,
if the flower shows the same colour take it and put the bee on another flower

name: Kombi-Fix
description:
Objective: be the first to get rid of all your chips
- acting simultaniously -
three dice with symbols . colour, circles and figures - are thrown
combine all of them and find correspondend picture on one of the boards
being the first you get rid of one of your chips to be placed upon that picture
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Real-time

name: Die Fußball Fibel
description:
Objective: be the first to move each of your three tiles across finish line (centre of the board)
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die and move - depending on area you land on you must draw a correspondent card (different topics)
if answer is correct move your tile one step into directon of the middle of the board (inner circles)
if you step on already occupied area opponent's tile is going to be moved back to start position if you win the fight (faster reply on question); the winning tile moves on into direction of the middle of the board

name: Fußballquiz
description:
Every card has three questions about football in categories like players, clubs and matches on its frontside and answers on the backside. The Reader reads the questions and player who answers correctly first gets the card. If nobody answers correctly the card goes out of play. If all cards have played out, the player with the most cards is the winner

Contetns:
55 cards

name: Druggies
description:
It was only supposed to be a onetime deal to make a little extra cash. That was several years, countless deals, and a few arrests ago. Now you can't even imagine a life doing anything else. The money is too good to give it up. At least it was until someone started moving in on your territory.

Druggies is a flip toss game where each player takes the role of a drug dealer trying to get and sell drugs in an effort to be the first seller to reach the sales goal.

WHAT IS A FLIP TOSS GAME?

A flip toss game is a boardgame that uses a coin of some sort, instead of dice or cards, to determine different results during the course of the game. This is achieved by flipping a coin and trying to get it to land in a desired location on the game board.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Klaar Kiming
description:
Objective:
get rid of your cards (places to visit) and reach Bredstedt at the end
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
choose the best route to discard your cards
if you land on a 'chance' field follow instructions
if you land on a place you possess a card of ==> answer a question drawn by another player - if you succeed, discard it
if not - discard the previous card but draw a new, additional card;
in this way you learn more about 'Frisia', a northern part of Germany
rules, cards and map are printed in German and Friesian
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ein unbegabter Liebhaber
description:
Objective: get on your (male) feet, find a proper lady and be the first taking her home (doesn't matter if it is her or your home)
- moving by turn - 'Roll and Move'
4 ladies are waiting to be caught (sorry: married) but board and rules are made to create a bit confusion and trouble
the way to find a lady can be easy - roll and move but
taking her home (depending on colours) is difficult because
appropriate cards must be drawn & instructions followed;
opponents are waiting to pinch your lady - much easier than
choosing detours - or to change ladies, if the their way home seems be faster/shorter
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Manx TT Race Game
description:
The Isle of Man TT races are held every year. The TT stands for Tourist Trophy. Bikers get to ride very fast around the lanes and roads on the island.

This game relates to their popularity. It is a relatively simple dice and move game, with certain spaces around the track giving instructions if you land on them. In addition, if two pieces end up on the same space, they are said to have crashed and must miss a turn. Also, if you roll too high a number when going round certain bends, you crash and must miss a turn.

First to the finish line, wins. If you want a longer game you can play on for whatever number of laps you choose.

name: Mit dem Euro unterwegs
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (and learn more about the Euro-currency countries)
- 'Roll, Move, draw card, answer question & do what's requested' game -
game leads you through the 12 EC-countries with Euro currency
in a given order
Dice ==> moving through all the countries, drawing cards, answering questions, confronted by barriers ...
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel, Trivia

name: Was lebt da in der Stadt?
description:
Objective: be the first to find all requested (cards) stuff (animals & plants) - learn more about your surrounding enviroment
roll the die, move around the board, draw cards fulfilling/finding the things on your to-do-list
proper method to learn, that there are more animals like cats, dogs, doves ... nice images

1 board
1 rules
4 meeples
1 die
5 replacement cards
6 'disorder' cards
40 animal cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing

name: Hoppla Hexenbrücke
description:
Objective: be the first to move all of your 4 meeples home
- simple 'Roll & Move' game, similar to Pachisi -
- moving by turn -
the game differs from Pachisi that the circle you are moving on is bridged (4x2 holes); if your die shows only small numbers or you choose the wrong meeple - it is going to fall into the river

name: Eisbär Flocke  Mein erstes Abenteuer
description:
Objective; move Flocke, the little ice bear, onto your side reaching one of the marked corners
- 'Roll and Move' game, 2 players or teams, moving by turn -
each team receives 5 'action' cards;
icebear is placed into centre of the board, barriers elsewhere

roll the die and move the ice bear into direction of your (marked) base line or move bariers or split number and move both
only vertical or horizontal moves are allowed
a '6' gives you the possibility to fly with the bear (blue fields only)
an 'action' card may be added to the number, but must be discarded afterwards
fields marked with a feeding bottle - if bear lands on it - give you an additional turn

name: Fish Tales: A Flip Toss Game
description:
It's time for the annual fishing derby and you and your buddies have decided to make it a little more interesting this year by making a wager. Whoever catches the most fish doesn't have to buy his own drinks for the next year and there is only one thing better than fishing and that's fishing with free drinks.

Fish Tales is a flip toss game where each player takes the role of an angler trying to be the first one to catch 10 pounds worth of fish.

WHAT IS A FLIP TOSS GAME?

A flip toss game is a boardgame that uses a coin of some sort, instead of dice or cards, to determine different results during the course of the game. This is achieved by flipping a coin and trying to get it to land in a desired location on the game board.

name: Eine Reise durch Sachsen- und Sudetengau
description:
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point
learn more about folks and country
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -

rolling the die each player starts in Dresden
you can't kick opponents ==> your can't move if you would meet another meeple
follow instructions of field you land on - description/characterization of the place you reached is told
to all participants

remarks:
due to later occupation of 'Sudetengau' 1938 by Nazi Germany this game touches sensitive contents in the circumstances obtaining at the time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Biblical Quest
description:
The board is in the shape of a "Star of David". A path goes around the star and through the center. In the center of the star is a space marked "Heaven". Each point on the star is the start position for a player and is marked with a biblical person whose name starts with one of the letters in ISRAEL. Each player has a block that spells out ISRAEL.

Players roll a die to advance around the board. The spaces on the board determine what question based on the bible the player has to answer. A correct answer allows the player to roll again. If the player lands on a space marked with the name of a biblical person and answers a question correctly they get a chip to place on their block. There are spaces that give players the ability to remove a chip from other players or get a free chip. When a player has their block completely covered they must enter the Heaven space by an exact roll and answer a question correctly. If the player answers the question correctly they win the game. If the answer is incorrect the player must leave Heaven on the next turn and try again.

Essentially this is a rip-off of Trivial Pursuit.

name: Das Hamburg-Spiel  300 Ergänzungsfragen
description:
Objective: see base-game

'Das Hamburg-Spiel 300 Ergänzungsfragen' is an expansion and can't be played by itself; to play with it, you need 'Das Hamburg-Spiel' as well as the full rules for setup and gameplay.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Travel, Trivia

name: Hör genau
description:
An educational game to promote the acoustic sound insulation. Ideally suited to school in preparation for kindergarten age amd is especially recommended for dyslexic students in early education..
Game is based on initial sounds. There are 72 cards and 4 cards per initial sound in this game.
Ways to Play: Collect all four cards with the same initial sound or looking for pairs. Player who has most sets or pairs at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Farming

name: G.I. World War II Tactical Combat
description:
Rules for skirmish combat during the Second World War.

Game Scale:
1 turn = 1 minute in terms of movement
1 figure = 1 vehicle or soldier (in general)
1 inch = 15 meters

Opposing forces are divided into two to four tactical groups (units) either by the players or based on scenario rules. Units are activated one at a time during the random activation process. Units are composed of one or more formations (squads, weapons sections or vehicles) and formations are composed of one or more figures. Recommendation is no more than four units per side to control the size and pace of the game. Each unit will be represented by a marker (a playing card, marked poker chip, or specially prepared index card) during the activation process.

A turn is comprised of 4 phases:
1. Artillery
2. Mark figures conducting supressive fire
3. Activation phase
4. Remove markers

name: Affenzirkus
description:
Affenzirkus is a dexterity card game for children.
The game contains 49 cards with animals.
All the cards are placed face down on the table. By turns, players draw cards. Thank, depending on the animal drawn, players have to do dexterity tasks. For example if you draw a penguin, you have to place the card on your feet and walk 5 steps without dropping the card.
If you succeed, you get the card.
The first player to have 5 different cards is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Ran Sat1 Fussball Quiz Super Q
description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line finding correct answers to question cards
- moving by turn -
each player rools with 2 dice
die 1 selects question card (difficulty level)
die 2 shows no of spaces to move if successful
special areas allow to move faster (yellow, red and penalty cards)
answering questions for other players or combined activities are possible
remark:
'Ran Sat1' - this title was used for several games (Schmidt, Klee..) which can create some confusion
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Sports, Trivia

name: Imprints
description:
The Game of Photographic Memory...

Imprints is a trivia/picture identification game. Players try to earn a card from each of four categories, which is done by drawing from the deck, correctly identifying the picture on the front, then answering a trivia question related to the picture.

name: Worzle
description:
Worzle. The strategic word puzzle game. It’s cute and creative, fast paced and fun, and you might even learn a thing or two along the way. Two to eight players evenly distribute a total of 100 puzzle pieces. Each has a printed letter along with four wild pieces. Begin by placing a puzzle piece on the table. Start the timer. Taking turns, each player adds a piece to the puzzle. How the puzzle expands is up to you. Once every piece has been placed or time runs out, players pick up their pencils. Start the timer again and find as many words as you can. As long as the puzzle pieces are next to each other, any direction goes, however a player may not skip over a void in the puzzle to complete a word. When time runs out, using the Worzle Scoring System, the points are tallied and the player with the most wins!

Worzle is the next progression in word games. It combines the strategic component of building hidden words with the fast paced nature of finding as many as you can. It is not as simple as you might imagine. As the puzzle expands, pieces are placed in multiple directions leaving them upside down and sideways. Each player around the puzzle has a unique perspective of the game. The “building the puzzle” dynamic adds huge interest to the game.

Worzle will be packaged in a printed drawstring cotton bag complete with a timer, several custom pads and pencils all in a full color box.

name: The Ancient Americas: Cities of Promise
description:
From South America to Central America to North America there are remnants of large civilizations that have disappeared leaving behind only the ruins of temples, city structures and fragmented settlements. The Ancient Americas are shrouded in mystery and intrigue. The people were religious with a fashionable culture. Their cities were the central hub to life and these civilizations enjoyed much abundance and prosperity all while in the midst of conflicts that were trying to destroy them.

General Rules

This game is for 2 to 4 players ages eight to adult. Players build a 'city of promise' by building their civilization with important structures and with valuable characters that then defend the city from corruption's power.

Building Cards - Throughout the deck are Building Cards. To build structures for the 'cities of promise' and to use important historical figures within the cities, a player must try to collect specific cards and in the right amounts. Some cards cost more than others and the value of the cards vary in power. Players who gain the right building cards pay the cost of the card and a new part of the city is then added.

Game Timer - Corruption Cards play as timing cards and determine when the game ends. When the 18th Corruption Card is placed down the game ends for all players.

Each player add up their cities power points. If the total is greater than the total points of Corruption Power Points then they have WON! Yes, that's right, there can be more than one winner in this game making it more rewarding for the whole family. And if the friendly competition is that HIGH you can find out who's city had the most strength and they can be the Grand Winner!

Types of Cards

Corruption Cards - New cards are drawn at the beginning of every turn. Any time a Corruption Card is drawn it must be played during the player's turn and added to the Corruption Card area (typically the middle between all players).

Building a City - Players that purchase City Cards with the Build Cards will be able to piece the city together in any combination left to right or right to left. As players strive to get the better City Cards it may be necessary to discard unwanted or undesirable City Cards in the hopes of gaining a better one on the next draw.

Specialty Characters - Character Cards can be added to your city by purchasing them with the Build Cards and then placing them under the correct City Card they belong to. These cards also have a power point value so players can seek to add the best characters to their city to give it the best advantage.

Bonus Power Points - Saints Cards, Resources Cards, and Faith & Works Cards can be stored under Character Cards for later purchases of City Cards and Character Cards. Unused Build Cards can add additional power points at the end of the game.

name: Necropoly
description:
Necropoly (Game of the Dead) is a spin on Monopoly but the differences are a dead giveaway. Two to six players make their way around the board beginning at Death and navigating through cemeteries and pitfalls trying to build up their stash of personal burial plots and even adding tombstones and mausoleums so they can charge more for other players standing on their grave. The “Fate” and “Communal Coffin” cards are hysterical. But beware the devil in one corner; he will send you straight to the fire.
Players advance with the roll of the black dice, paying bones to the bone collector or taking in bones for fees, and the game ends when one player is the last to have bones.

A lot of cultures celebrate the dead with holidays like Halloween, Day of the Dead, and All Souls Day. This game is great for all ages and takes perhaps the scariest thing in life and makes it a fun and competitive adventure. The entire family will get into the spirit and will be laughing out loud.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Royal Purple: The Game of Kings
description:
The unusual features of this game are the moves of the Prince and his acquisition of the territory upon which he sets foot. A Prince moves up or down on a dice throw of 1 or 4. Moves right or left on a throw of 2 or 5, and diagonally on a throw of 3 or 6. A player places a Dominion Marker on all squares stopped on by his Prince, and no other player may trespass on that territory when so marked. This limits the squares a Prince may move to making and unusual situation, and calling for increasing skill as the game progresses.

The person starting is determined by high roll. Turn moves to the left. Each player starts from his Corner Castle and is given a Prince, 30 Dominion Markers, and a die. Each player in turn rolls and places a Dominion Marker where the Prince lands. The first objective is to move to and place Dominion Markers on five Noble Squares (indicated by a purple board square with a white center). Then with the support of these five Nobles the Prince moves toward the Throne Space at the other side of the board. The first Prince to enter a Throne Space earns the right to wear the Royal Purple (wins).

The game plays like a cross between popular games of the day Chess and Halma with a roll and move mechanic added. A number of "Go To" squares on the board jumping players ahead to another square are an added twist.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Operation Matador
description:
The Sortie of the Prince of Wales and Repulse December 1941

Operation Matador is a historical simulation game recreating the Allied attempt to intercept the Japanese transports heading for the Malay peninsula during the opening hours of the Pacific half of the Second World War.

This game as two components a strategic move using a map of the pacific covering the Gulf of Siam and South China Sea, specifically covering Indochina with city of Saigon and Malaya with the city of Singapore. The ship to ship combats are conducted on a small hex map.

Victory points are assigned for the number of destroyed enemy air units, submarines, transports destroyers units destroyed. In addition points are allocated for shore bombardment and any damage to enemy carrier or battlecruisers. If the Repulse or Prince of Wales are able to leave the south or south west map edge.

name: You're the Banker
description: You're the Banker is an educational game, designed to be played by large groups of students (up to 30 in 5 groups of 6). The game aims to teach the purpose and practices of the Federal Reserve Bank, by having teams of players run banks.
