Many of the consequences in the game are automated, but the teacher/moderator of the game is required to decide whether loans are sufficiently sound to accept as collateral for borrowing from the Federal Reserve.

name: KaPOW!
description: This game was ultimately published by Goldbrick Games as "Rumble Pie"

name: Oil Quest: The Game of Energy and Excitement
description:
A game designed for group involvement. The object of the game is to get your drilling rig on the board, drill for oil and if oil is struck, replace the rig with a pump jack. Each time you go around the board you get revenue from each pump jack you own. When all the lease sites are allocated the game ends and the player with the most pump jacks is the winner.

Extra wealth can be gaining control of a whole section of the board. If you land on a square called "Option to Auction" you can place sites up for auction and get a commission for each site auctioned.

If a player lands on a Seismic Report he can drill for oil.

Only a thousand games have been produced with hand made wooden pieces.

name: Clownereien
description:
The game has 36 cards showing combinations of clowns in different colors. Move the cards always color on color in a row. Who has so placed as the first all his cards wins the game.

Simple observation and logical deduction game, better with more players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition

name: 1, 2 oder 3 Kinder-Quiz
description: With this game the german quiz show "1, 2 oder 3" is coming to the nursery. Everyone has the opportunity to slip in the role of the quizmaster or the candidates and can hop around on the fields to collect points. Who is clever and the first player to eight questions answered correctly, wins the game.

name: Lovely Agents
description:
Mysterious spy organizations work toward world domination. It's up to "Lovely Agents", gorgeous news reporters and undercover police officers work with clever disguises to uncover corrupt plots and steal secret information.

Secret "Target" cards show the toughness and worth of an object. Players as spies try to take or keep these targets from each other. Players (all hot anime chicks of course) have protection cards (weapons, disguises, skills and events).

3 to 6 players with optional variant for 7 players who will target each other rather than an object.

name: The Grain Drain
description:
The Grain Drain is a game intended to improve understanding of world hunger. At the beginning of the game, some players are randomly chosen to be rich countries, the rest are poor countries. Depending on this choice, players roll and move around either the "rich" loop track or the "poor" loop track for the rest of the game.

The object of the game is to avoid starvation: all players must be able to afford to feed their people once per lap of the gameboard, but because event squares on the "rich" track typically award greater amounts of money, "rich" players are less likely to suffer.

Part of the educational package Food For Thought (1976), produced by Christian Aid jointly with Oxfam and the Catholic Fund for Overseas Development.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: The Ark
description:
This is a game for young children based on the story of Noah's Ark.

There are four identical boards representing Noah's Ark. The interior of each Ark is divided into 20 squares and each square contains the picture of an animal. Each player is given one of these boards.

There is a bag full of animal picture tokens. During a player's turn the child will remove one token from the bag at random. If the token matches an image on the kid's Ark, the player places it in position. If it doesn't match, the child loses a turn and puts the token back in the bag.

The first child to fill an Ark wins the game.

Designed for children 3 to 6 years old with no reading required.

name: Scoop
description:
Promotional game made by Black Cat cigarettes. It consists of 28 cards, but only 14 cards are used in any one game. Several games should be played to find a winner.

One player is elected Banker. He starts the Pool by placing 6 counters into it. He then shuffles and deals 14 cards face down. All the other players now place a bet (counters, not real money) on any card they wish. No more than one can bet on any one card. When all bets are placed, the first card is drawn. The player who bet on it must follow the instructions.

If the Banker role changes hands, a new deal shall be started. But Note: Sometimes a player's call against the Bank cannot be met. The deficiency is made up as far as possible from the Reserve. Then the Bank is 'broken' and the Bank role is transferred to the player on the Banker's left. This player starts a new Bank by putting in the 6 counters that are required.

Cards are:
One In, Two In, etc. = Player puts counters into the Pool
One Out, Two Out, etc. = Player takes out counters from the Pool
Reserve = Every player puts 1 counter into the Bank Reserve. This Reserve is set aside in a special pool, for use on special occasions. It transfers when the Bank is transferred, and only withdraws when Bank Holiday is turned.
Official Receiver = When turned, the Bank and Reserve (if any) transfers to the player who has backed the card, but that player pays over to the retiring Banker counters equal to the number then in the Pool (but not counting in the Reserve). The Banker taking over shall not scoop the Pool, which stays untouched and the game proceeds.
Distribution = When revealed, every player, including the Banker, receives a counter from the Pool.
Contribution = Every player, including Banker, puts a counter into the Pool.
Scoop = The player backing this card scoops the entire Bank, which now transfers to him. The Reserve remains untouched. He starts a new Bank with 6 counters.
Stake = This gives an advantage to the last player to have put down a stake of 6 counters to start a Bank. He claims 6 counters from the player who backed this card. The current Banker usually will be the one who staked the 6 counters into the Pool, but if a new Banker takes over because of the Official Receiver card or the Transfer Bank card (neither of which do not require 6 counters being paid into the Pool, so the player who benefits by this card will be the previous Banker perhaps).
Transfer Bank = The Bank transfers to the player who backed this card, but its capital cannot be increased or the Reserve interfered with.
Bank Holiday = The Bank's Scoop card. When revealed, the Bank scoops both Bank and Reserve, and starts a new Bank with a stake of 6 counters.

name: Globolog
description:
The game is a promotional game for BMW.

Objective:
Be the first to gain "required experience chips" listed on the 'task-card' you draw in the beginning.
Chips are handed out as a reward for correct answers on coloured areas. Questions are related to nature, BMW, environment, history of automobiles

name: Rauch Monster
description:
Objective: throw out all smoking monsters which have invaded (y)our home (cave) - or - enter the cigarette slot machine before all monster puzzles (20) are gone
- moving by turn -
decide which die to use (3 red spaces = tough one)
roll the die and - let the monster puzzle grow (if red) or -
move as fast as you can from your cave to the slot machine;
on your way (different possibilities) you have to manage different obstacles like being caught (magic ring), releasing your partner(s), speeding (combining cones), answering questions (cards) ...
content:
1 board
1 cigarette slot machine
1 cave
8 coloured little cones
26 yellow event cards
24 red community cards
20 smoking monster - puzzle pieces
1 "magical ring"
1 die with 3 red spaces
1 die with 2 red spaces
1 rules (cover inside)
remark: promotional edition manufactured by Ravensburger
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gordian Knot Ancient Wargame Rules
description: This is a set of rules for large (i.e., not skirmish) pre-gunpowder battles. Basing is given for 6mm, 15/20/28mm; 6mm uses 1/2 the distance of other scales. No army lists are included. No figure or stand removal is required when casualties are suffered; units become disordered, wavering, fleeing, and finally dispersed. Units may improve their state by spending one turn immobile and not involved in combat.

name: Neues vom Räuber Hotzenplotz
description:
Objective: get as many coins as possible from the treasure of the bandit Hotzenplotz; game ends if all coins are gone
- moving by turn, hide & seek -
game is split into different stages
each stage runs like:
1 one player hides the Hotzenplotz-tiles (traps, footmarks & treasure) on the board
2 other players roll 2 dice ==> subtract: difference to move;
choose, which of your meeples may walk; if you land on a symbol
3 flip a tile: trap ==> remove meeple; footmarks ==> all players know the symbol the must search behind; treasure; take two coins & and hide tiles for a new stage

name: Glück in der Liebe
description:
Objective:
be the first passing the finish line (field 50) together with a partner
- moving by turn (with exceptions) -
each player starts as a 'single', handicapped moving forward
depending on the colour of the field you land on ==>
- being coppled (married) - now moving becomes easier
- being divorced
- being frustrated
- moving for- or backwards
- being safe
- being blocked

remarks:
title ('lucky in love') could lead to some misunderstandings because it's more or less a 'Rool & Move' game with a
certain chance of getting trouble (missing luck)

name: Deceive and Decide
description:
From the back of the box...

"Deceive and Decide is a hilarious word-bluff game: the players deceive each other with made-up definitions to words you probably never heard. Then they decide which outrageous definition is correct.

Deceive and Decide contains 1000 obscure words complete with pronunciations which are known only to the poker-faced Word Master. Each player concocts his own whacky definition and the Word master reads them all allowed, including the real one. The players vote on the definition that seems most plausable - and everyone wins.

The game goes 'round the table at a razzle-dazzle pace as each player yakes his turn at Word Master. The definitions range from ludicrous to bizarre - if you can stop laughing long enough, you may even want to add up the score.

Imagine creating defintiions for words such as:

Beccabunga
Gardyloo
Dorking
Xylophonist"

This game sounds similar to Balderdash, but there is no board and the card layout and playing equipment is quite different.

name: Die lustigen Skihäschen
description:
Objective: be the first passing finish line (= one full circle into middle of the board) with all your (4) meeples
- simple 'Roll & Move' game, similar to Pachisi -
- moving by turn -
roll the die, step out if you throw a '1'
rules different to Pachisi:
your meeple is safe (can't be thrown out) if placed on a red field (12x)
putting two meeples of the same colour onto same field = barrier, can't be passed by anyone

name: Jeu du bêtisier
description:
The Game of famous situations and sentences.
Player move their pawns around the board back to their starting square answering questions and guessing the authors of famous situations/sentences. Player who finish first is the winner.

There are 110 cards and 1100 situations often known, you need to attribute to the author. Dou You know what did or said Audiard, Guitry, Santini or Van Damme?
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Love Party
description:
Love Party is funny trivia games about Love.
The goal is finish first together with Your parner.

To score points, players must go through the game with partners found on the game's three phases in order: romance, love and sex and answer the questions of these categories.

With your card, you build adventures that go in the order of the dredge to love and sex. Of course, your opponents do not give up the pants! Surprises, dirty tricks, breaks and exchanges, anything goes.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Nesthäkchen
description:
Objective: you are a mother animal - your very young child is hidden in the wood: go out, find your child (puppy/baby lamb/baby foal/baby calf) and be the first returning to your home
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game using a die with symbols
remark:
cute wooden figures

name: Whose Shoes?
description:
Whose Shoes? is a boardgame to facilitate discussion on topics related to personalization in health and social services.

Players roll and move around a perimeter track of colored "footprint" spaces, taking a card of the color of the space they land on. The card contains discussion text and may award a colored square in red, yellow, green or blue. The object of the game is to collect sets of four differently colored squares in the center area of the board, forming a "path to personalization".
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Aussie Battler Pack
description:
From review at DesperationMorale.com:

Add-on scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader featuring Australian troops, with a few other surprises.

In early 2011, Break Contact emerged from a period of relative inactivity to release two new items, one of which is this product, The Aussie Battler Pack (ABP), a scenario pack very much in the mold of Break Contact! and The Armoured Aussie Pack. It has an emphasis on actions involving Australian troops, with a few trips further afield.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Calcul Genius
description:
The object of the game is to get rid of Your cards first.

Each card has a large number in the middle and, below, an operation. From these data, we deduce the number of the next card what next player have to play. Some cards have special moves, sometimes using dice for calculating sum.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: Meine fünf Sinne
description:
Objective:
be the first to collect all the slides (10) which match with the drawings on your own board
- acting by turn -
roll the six-sided (5 symbols + joker)
if you see e.g. the symbol "smell" you have to choose a slide
1. which is printed on your board
2. which refers to 'smell'
before you place it on the board - turn it, because on the back you see if you were wrong or right

name: Gott sorgt für uns
description:
Objective:
be the first to deliver Elia 6 x with food (bread and meat)
win the impression that God is taking care for us
acting by turn
you are a smart raven who tries to find bread/meat
after you got it choose a fast route to fly to Elia
don't loose food - otherwise you must return
each time you deliver food successfully you win a card which explains how God is taking care for us
game ends if someone has collected 6 slides

produced by Ravensburger

name: Dark Galaxies
description:
Dark Galaxies is a tactical dexterity game of spaceship combat. Players maneuver their ships and fire lasers and drone missiles by flicking discs across the play surface. Unlike many other flicking games, Dark Galaxies emphasizes the importance of ship orientation; how you position your ships will determine which weapons you fire, where you take damage, and what your movement potential is going forward. It takes only minutes to learn but offers a deep combat experience.

Dark Galaxies is currently in prototype and is slated for publication in 2012.

name: Space Flick
description:
Space Flick is the placeholder name for a tactical space combat game. In Space Flick, up to five players represent the elite captains of small star nations. Those nations have just learned that the evil empire that dominates their area of the galaxy is engaged in a major conquest, leaving behind only a fraction of their fleet for defense. The captains decide to launch a daring raid on the heart of the enemy, hoping to destroy a key space station integral to its military efforts. If they succeed, their worlds may be free; failure would be bad.

Bad, unless you're the person playing the evil empire.

Space Flick plays through a series of encounters as the captains move closer to their goal, culminating in a final battle. Game play is fast-paced and easy to learn. Movement and combat is resolved by flicking discs across the playing surface.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: Junior Quiz
description: Cards are shuffled, the quizmaster reads the question from the card and the current player answers. If he answers correctly, he gets the number of points credited. If the answer is wrong, the number of points will be deducted. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Junior Quiz
description:
There are 55 cards in this game each with 5 questions and answers.

Player roll the die in his turn and asks the question according the die, if "6" is rolled he can choose the question.
Player who answer correctly first gets the card. Player who has collected five cards first wins

name: Wer will mit ins Märchenland
description:
Objective:
be the first to step on field 60
- 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -
players roll the die and follow instruction if they land on a marked field
remarks:
one of the very few publications short after WWII
surprisingly 1946 under US occupation authorities

name: Crazy Chance
description:
Children memory game.
Every player has a player board with goal with 8 balls and object of the game is to fill the opponents's balls from the board with as many balls-tiles from the table as possible.

In his turn player takes a ball from the table and look if it match with any ball from opponent's board to place, if not it goes back to table.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Sports

name: Funny Circus
description:
Funny Circus is a memory game for young children, not as simple as it sounds. Every player has 6 cards in front of him.
They look at them and turn face-down.
Every turn players reverse the position of two cards of their opponents.

Then they start to drawing a cards from the middle of the table and if the right card is drawn player must find it among his cards. If he finds correct card he may discard it. If he finds incorrect card he gets one penalty-card with elephant's dung.

Player who discards all of his cards is the winner

name: Kombino
description:
From the back of the box:

A new exciting strategy game promoting color and shape recognition. Vivid and shining tiles, painted with water colors, to be placed on a natural bamboo mat for great fun and a learning experience.

For 1-4 players, from 4 years of age.

Contents: 16 orange squares, 16 blue circles, 16 green hexagons, 16 yellow triangles, 4 bamboo mats

From a slight paraphrasing of the inside rules:

There are three versions of how to play.

Version 1: Each player takes one bamboo mat and places it in front of him. Each player takes 4 tiles of each color / shape and places them next to the bamboo mat. Place all tiles in such a way that each color / shape appears just once horizontally and vertically. The fastest player wins.

Version 2: Each player takes one bamboo mat and places it in front of him. Choose one of the given patterns (different levels of difficulty) and place the tiles on your mats as given in the pattern. Try to place the missing tiles as fast as possible, Pay attention that each shape / color appears just once horizontally and vertically. The fastest player wins.

Version 3: Put the four bamboo mats together to form one big mat. For alone or team play, choose one of the given patterns (different levels of difficulty) and place the tiles on the mat as given in the pattern. Try to place the missing tiles correctly. Pay attention that each shape / color just appears twice horizontally and vertically. The same colors are not allowed to lie next to each other. The winner(s) successfully place their pieces first.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Segelflugspiel
description:
Objective: be the first to gain 60 winning points
- 'Roll & Move' game, moving by turn -
each player must roll a '6' before lifting off
- each time you pass an 'arrow' you gain a point
- there are different routes you may choose (more points - more difficulties = fining or delay)

remarks:
rules are written in 'forced rhymes'

name: 851 Baseball
description:
851 Baseball uses pitching and batting statistics in tandem to simulate the game of baseball on a well-crafted gameboard that depicts a baseball field laid out in a grid pattern. The game comes with 10 fictional teams, each consisting of 20 fictional players (13 position players and 7 pitchers). Each position player is rated for batting average and power versus both left-handed and right-handed pitchers, plus speed, arm strength, and fielding ability. Each pitcher is rated for opponents' batting average, along with strikeouts and walks against both left-handed and right-handed batters.

The outcome of an at bat is determined by rolling dice and consulting the pitching card. If the pitching card indicates that the batter made contact (fly ball, line drive, or ground ball), the batting card is then checked against the result of another dice roll to determine where and how far the ball is hit.

The batted ball is plotted on the gameboard with the built-in batting stick. Defensive players, who were positioned on the playing field grid, attempt to make a play on the batted ball. Depending upon their initial positioning, their speed, their fielding ability, and in some cases their arm strength, the result may be a base hit, an out, or an error.

The appeal of 851 Baseball is that it depicts the movement of the ball, defensive players, and baserunners as each play unfolds. For example, a line drive might be caught by an outfielder or it might find the gap and roll to the wall. Baserunners advance according to their speed and can be instructed to try to take an extra base.

Multiple dice rolls can be required to fully resolve the outcome of an at bat, but play moves relatively quickly and the visual element sets this game apart from most other baseball boardgames.

The game comes with gameboard and batting stick, 5 dice (4 six-sided and 1 twenty-sided), color-coded playing pieces, rule book, 10 batting cards, 10 pitching cards, a pad of scoresheets, all attractively packaged in a game box.

name: The Brains Trust
description:
1950's game named after a very popular radio and television show at that time. The programme consisted of questions (by post and by an audience watching the recording) and a panel of four academics would answer them. Not a quiz show, it was just deemed by the BBC that it would educate the country (which, in the BBC's mind, needed educating).

The game is an electronic trivia type where players are asked questions and then plug the sensor into a hole in the question sheet. If they are wrong, nothing happens, but if they are right a bulb lights up.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Speed Splash Splootch
description:
The goal is to get rid of its best spots of paint, in accordance with the neighborhoods. There are 5 compartments in this game where the cards can be played - the central compartment is adjacent to four other compartments, whereas compartments at the periphery in three adjacent: the central and both right and left, as indicated by large arrows.

Everyone plays cards simultaneously. When we find a playable card, that is to say, having at least two spots in common with the neighbors, we scream "Splash" and then place it. The interest is to place cards with three or four fitting spots, making the opponents draw cards.

A dog that is on hand at the end of the game scores five points to the winner, just one point against the son or daughter.

name: The Nipper Finger Football
description:
Australian action game. The pitch is enclosed (so you don't have to keep picking the ball up from the floor). There are three indentations on the play area and each player has three levers behind their goal.
During play, the ball will always settle into one of these indentations. Then both players try to be first to press the correct lever and thus propel the ball out of its resting place.
After a pre-set time, the player who scores the most goals wins.

name: Achtung: Durchfahrt frei!
description:
Objective:
be the first entering opponent's garage with your car
- acting/moving by turn -
moving your car out from your garage into opponent's one is restricted by:
- you may move your car 1 space only (transversal,horizontal, vertical) - last move horizontal/vertical only
- policemen (2 for each player) (bishop/Chess) are blocking controlled fields
- NITAG gas station range allows jumping
- detour (2 - one for each player) blocks surrounding areas; may be moved 1 space only

content
board
1 gas station
2 x 2 policemen (motorbikes - yellow & blue)
2 cars (yellow & blue)
2 detours (yellow & blue)
rules - cover inside

name: Komm mit!
description: Children can learn languages, the names of colours, the names of animals, etc. In his turn a player rolls the die and moves, if he has a card for the spot he landed on, he names the country and pronounces the word correctly and may move his counting stone 3 spots. If he has no card and names the country correct, he may move 1 spot. The first player to reach the end of the counting scale wins. The came comes with a CD with 12 different children songs, sung by Timna Brauer.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Peter Pan In Never Never Land With Tinker Bell
description:
Players begin the game in the Nursery of their home as one of 4 characters. Peter Pan, Wendy, John or Richard. Peter Pan takes the players into Never Never Land where Captain Hook and his pirates are located.

Peter Pan begins by shaking a little box that represents Tinkerbelle. When a bell rings Tinker has landed on a movement circle. That movement number determines how far Peter can move trying to get back home. After Peter moves the other players also try and get numbers that will help them get home. There are places to stay away from. Landing on a Double Circle means that the player must take a longer route home.

While all of this is happening Mom & Dad at home become aware that the kids are gone. The are very worried and remain so until one child gets back to the nursery thereby winning the game

name: In The Chips; NEW YORK
description: Welcome to New York! You'll soon be traveling on the streets of New York, earning an income, buying a car, buying a home, and making investment decisions. You'll also have the choice of getting an advanced degree (as well as salary increases) by getting an education Naturally, you can succeed or fail; just like reality, some of the decisions are up to you! The object of the game is to negotiate your way through the city and make your wealth through proper management of your income in home purchases and business investments. The game ends when every player completes the trip and all cash and investments are totaled. The player with the most money is the winner. - 2 to 6 Players - Ages 10 to Adult

name: Pop-In Scoring Game
description:
Action game of skill.
The board comprises of a three dimensional area with holes in it. The object is to get your marble-like balls into those holes. The balls are launched by a catapult-like device. You put a ball into this device and press down. When you let go, the ball is thrown into the air and, hopefully, into one of the holes. If it does, it rolls down into the scoring area at the bottom of the board.

You can play for a set number of turns each or for a pre-determined time. The one with the most points, wins.

name: Cart' Ouf
description:
There are 56 cards in the game which have number and color on their back-side and only 36 cards with indentical front-side, other cards has monster or remedy against monsters on their frontside.

Player draws in his turn card from his neighbor looking the back-side but sometimes the monster can hide on the front-side.

The object of the game is to collect 10 non-monster card in his hand.

name: Star Cruiser Command
description: In Star Cruiser Command, 2-6 players their own deck of cards to attack and defend against each other. There are 2 types of cards; System cards and Playing cards. The System cards represent the state of the ship systems. The Playing cards utilize the System cards to perform various actions. In each round, the players will have 2 actions; Attack, Repair, Charge, Draw or Shuffle. Once attacked, the player can react and try to protect themselves with Defense cards. If an attack is undefended, damage is done to the ship’s Shields or to the Hull and/or Systems if the Shields are down. Play will continue until the other players are defeated by either removing the last point of Hull or by destroying the Engineering and Bridge Systems. For a 3-6 player game, Target and Event cards are used to form a Target deck, which is used to determine which ship is targetable each turn.

name: Last Knitter Standing
description:
Last Knitter Standing is a game with trivia and challenge cards in order to find the best knitter.

Game includes a spinner to select which type of cards to draw, a sand timer, and four different types of cards. Players must supply their own needles and yarn which serves as each player's scoreboard, as well as being used for certain types of challenges.

The player will spin the spinner, and one of the opponents will read the card of the type indicated. Trivia questions will have the player knit rows for correct answers, and rip out stitched rows (frogging, for knitters out there) for wrong answers. Some cards require challenges to add rows, such as knitting with eyes closed. Other cards involve words, such as scrambled words, or listing knitting terms, where the amount answered adds rows. Lastly, there are cards that mess with the other players, such as having to swap knitting with another player (remember that the knitting is the scoreboard), or to force another player to remove rows.

Player with the most knitted rows at the end of the game wins.

name: Quarterback Option
description:
Card game intended to played while an American football game is in progress. Each player is given a deck of cards. Between plays, each player selects a card indicating his or her guess as to which play is about to happen and its sucess or failure.

The game includes four variations of play:
The Poker Game - Players will have to provide one deck of playing cards for each player. This game is played for money or chips. Players win cards everytime they are correct and try to form winning poker hands.
The Fun Game - Players score a point everytime they are correct. Most points wins.
The Party Game - Players decide before play begins whether taking a drink is the reward or penalty.
The Prize Game - Someone provides prizes which are auctioned at the end of the game. The players bid chips which were won during the game for their correct predictions.

name: Wir gehen nicht unter
description:
Objective:
Create the terrestrial globe collecting/gaining puzzle pieces
- acting/moving by turn, cooperative game -
1. Determine level of difficulty
2. Each player moves his/her meeple through South Sea Islands by rolling the die
3. Draw a card landing on appropiate space
4. Solve the question - requires creativity, good communication, joined-up thinking
5. Gain/trade puzzle piece(s) if successful
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Ninja Family Picnic
description:
A simultaneous action board game for 2 to 4 Ninja. Quick to learn but hiding ancient ninja secrets.

As 4 visitors walk and look around the park, you must enjoy your picnic meal, spend time with your ninja family, and take part in various fun activities -all without being seen!

Each ninja plays 3 cards face down each round, then simultaneously resolves them one at a time. Among them; Dash Forward, Zig Left, Zag Right, Sneak, Family-time, Distract, Push, Hide, and your own Ninja's special ability. When a Yin-Yang card is played, your action is determined by the face of your Salt & Pepper Marker (which then switches).

When the 7th Visitor leaves the park, it is time to go, and the Ninja who has had the most fun (collected the most tokens) wins!
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Lustige Fulda-Spiel
description:
Promotional game published in Germany by Fulda, a tyre manufacturer.

A simple roll and move game. The board has 96 squares which have to be traversed. If you land on the special squares (listed at the side of the board), you must obey the instructions. First to get to square 96, wins.

name: Let's build a house
description: Deck of 96 cards, each card shows a portion of a building facade and a number, depending on the number of players to build their own house or a house together. Each player has five cards in hands. The house is built from the bottom up, holes in the ground floor or the wall are not permits, and house façade must be built reasonable, for example, window must be on the ground floor. If a house is finished, the cards are added together in the house, a house may only be completed if it is worth at least 40 points.

name: Computer Trivia
description:
Computer Trivia is a standard trivia game where the object is to be the first player or team to reach the WINNER key. Along the way players will encounter category, choice, opponents choice, P.C. glitch, and category headquarters keys.

On your turn you roll the die, move, try your luck on a trivia question and if you somehow answer the question correctly you get to roll again. There is a special star-dot-star side on the die, and if rolled the player gets to ask a question (of their choice of categories) to the "opposing" players. If the players answer correctly they stay on their current location; if they answer the question incorrectly, they each roll the die and move back the indicated number of spaces.

The Category Headquarter keys must be landed on with an exact roll and cannot be passed until you answer the question correctly. The Winner space must also be landed on with an exact roll.

The trivia categories are Hardware, Software, People & Companies, History, and Potpourri (miscellaneous).

Contents:

1 - Computer Trivia fold out playing board
2 - Volumes of trivia questions & answers
2 - Computer Trivia book marks
4 - Playing pieces
1 - Computer Trivia die

name: Dein KDF-Wagen
description:
A simple roll and move game, presumably encouraged by Hitler, to further his prestige as it features the then new Volkswagen Beetle motor car.

Players roll a die to move round the track. If you land on red numbered squares, you must obey instructions. Whilst you play, you also get to learn facts about cities in the Third Reich. First to reach the end of the track, wins.

name: Pile 'em High
description:
First you look at the packaging (a tube) and you think 'Pick Up Sticks'. Then you see the sticks and you more definite that it is a Pick Up Sticks version. But there the similarity ends.

The tube contains the stcks, but also a bottle that fits into the frame. Once fitted, the bottle will swing freely. The game is to balance sticks on to this bottle without allowing a stick to fall off, so it is the opposite to Pick Up Sticks.

name: Weisses Gold
description:
Objective: get as many treasures as possible
- moving/acting by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game, promotional edition for Commerzbank AG -

each player moves her/his meeple/boat according die & speed
landing on a 'diving' space ==> search for treasures
landing on 'caution' space ==> draw event card
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wir erwerben das Touristenabzeichen
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 85)
- moving by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
each players is moving according the die roll
if you land on marked spaces follow instructions printed on cover inside

name: Lustige Kletterei
description:
Objective: be the first climbing up to the top of the ladder and returning to the ground
- moving by turn -
each player moves according the die roll; if you step on marked spaces follow instructions printed on cover inside

name: Das Spielemännlein im Märchenland
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 150)
- moving by turn -
each player moves according die roll; if you land on a marked space follow instructions cover inside

name: Beharrlichkeit führt zum Ziel
description:
Objective: be the first to move all your (3) meeples into centre of the board
- moving by turn/elements of Pachisi -
each player rolls the die:
1. 3 x if you don't throw '1'
2. if you throw '1' during game step out with another meeple
3. if you land on a marked space follow instructions cover inside
4. if you land on an occupied space place affected meeple on start position
5. some positions require appropriate die numbers

name: Five Golden Rings
description:
"Five Golden Rings" is a "12 Days of Christmas"-themed game in which players select cards from a layout in sets (same rank, "marriages," etc.) with an eye to score the most points. Players must select cards carefully, however, as end-game bonuses are awarded for holding certain cards and each card selected opens up new plays for opposing players: in some cases, marrying a Lord a-Leaping to a Maid a-Milking may be the best play; in others, capturing the Partridge in a Pear Tree may be best.

The artwork for this game comes from the "12 Days of Christmas" stamps issued by Christmas Island in 1977. These lovely stamps have been a favorite of philatelists and graphic artists since their issue and add to the theme and flavor of this game.
publishers: Jason Stone Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Nik Nak Numbers
description:
Nik-Nak Numbers is different enough to challenge the most inquisitive game enthusiast, yet simple enough for a child to play.

The ingenious game board is supplied in sections that are easily assembled in literally thousands of combinations, each accomplished in a matter of seconds.

Careful strategy lowers scores and the low score wins, as players progress across the board, struggling to block opponent's moves.
Unique tally cards permit easy score keeping and eliminate unnecessary writing materials. Simple addition is used for exciting play!!
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Down on the Farm
description:
Game is designed for 2-4 players. Recommended for Ages 4 to 8.

The object of the game is the first player to reach home after going completely around the farmyard, wins the game.

Game Board is colorful featuring pictures of farm animals along a path with some obstacles to overcome before reaching the finish line/end.

The game comes with (4) different colored (blue, red, purple, & yellow) cardboard Tractor themed markers and a
Spinner which is numbered from 1-6. This is used to determine the number spaces each player will move around the game board.
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

name: Fallen Order
description:
The apocalyptic battle of Good versus Evil! Will you fight for Good and save the universe? Will you battle for Evil and destroy existence?

It is the end of the world. The prophesied apocalypse is happening and the final battle between Good and Evil will decide the fate of the universe. Governments and social order have all fallen apart and the barriers of reality are broken. Great fissures have opened up across the earth, opening up gateways to Hell. Demons have come forth to destroy humanity. The weak ones inhabit corpses creating flesh eating zombies while the more powerful ones create destructive nightmarish forms. A small group of people find themselves up against this unearthly evil and must find a way to band together despite their conflicting personalities. Fortunately for them, the skies have opened up, revealing the Gates to Heaven. Warrior Angels descend to provide assistance but the battle is to be decided by the people. If Good wins, Hell can be closed forever and everlasting peace will reign. The Demons refuse to be trapped in Hell for eternity and prefer to destroy existence. If they can devour enough souls, Good, and the universe along with it, will be eradicated.

Choose a side and battle it out in this action packed, dice and card game!

As Evil, you will command an unrelenting stream of zombies while bringing forth powerful demons to wage total destruction.

As Good, you must put together a motley crew of bickering humans and equip them with weapons to battle the evil demons. Call upon Angelic warriors to help turn the tide of battle!

Finalist in the IcePack Games Challenge Contest!

name: Coup d'Etat
description:
Early wargame on the conduct of a coup d'etat in an unnamed city.

From ad copy: "Brian Shieldhouse has made a special study of insurrection in Latin America, the Middle East and Europe. over a number of years and Coup d'Etat is the result of extensive researches.

The takeover of a city involves much more than its capture, block by block, and Coup d'Etat faithfully reproduces lhe fascinating interplay of tactical considerations which arise. Is the loyalty of the Police suspect? Will the locally based army units defect? Can control of the broadcasting station be neutralised bv seizure of the newspaper offices? Is the underground railway in reliable hands? Can the deadly power of the air force be rendered ineffective by jamming its operational wavelength? Should all electric power be cut off, and if so for how long? etc. etc.

The fascination of Coup d'Etat is the way in which these and many other questions are resolved; each solution itself has an immediate effect on the course of the battle and produces the next tactico- militarv problem."

name: Indo Persian chess
description:
This is actually the missing chain-link between Chaturanga and Standard chess.
The game provides the players with feeling of REAL Chaturanga(Shatranj), However it contains enhancements for the XXl Century and beyond.
The Bishop(formerly elephant)has been newly refurbished by inherited motion and enhanced influence,
The game sees the intro of two new pieces at promotion and in the opening stage:
The Hawk with never before seen movements due to its Chaturanga enhancements which takes care of jumping spots.
The intro of the Elephant from Capablanca with promotion requirement to provide maximum compatibility.
The object of the game is to trap and checkmate the enemy king.

name: Safetiroad
description:
Promotional game published by an Australian company in the oil and petrol business called Golden Fleece.

An old-fashioned race game. Roll the die, move along the track (which is around 100 spaces long). The track weaves around a back design of Australia so you get to visit cities and learn a little about Australian geography.

Traditional rules apply. Obey instructions when you land on them, you can't start until you throw a 6, and you need the exact number to cross the finish line.

name: Horse Race Game
description:
Rare game. The board has different coloured lanes, one for each horse. In your turn, you throw the three dice. Move a horse that matches a number, e.g. you roll a 3, 4 and 5. Horse numbered 3, 4 and 5 move one space. If a number is rolled twice, that horse moves 2 spaces. If a number is rolled thrice, that horse moves 3 spaces. If a horse gets to the space before the finish line, it must roll a double to cross the line. That is it. Not the most skilful game I have ever seen!!

The rules allow for three variants, the Regular Race (as described above), the Slow Race (the horse that is last to finish, wins the race, and a hurdle race which is played just like the Regular Game except that when you reach a fence, you have to roll a double to get over it.

The publishers suggest that you may use the contents and create your own variants. I suggest, for a start, have some betting before the race. At least that would make the game a little more exciting.

name: Nip-It-In
description:
A British variation of Tiddley Winks but with a novel twist. The board consists of 10 different target-pots. Each pot has a value in points. You flick your counters (as in Tiddley Winks) with the hope of getting the counter into a high scoring pot.

The player with the most points after a pre-decided time limit is up, or a certain number of turns each, is the winner

name: Lunch Box
description:
Lunch Box is a patent pending, educator recommended children's health and fitness board game that has been in development since 2007! Lunch Box reaches out to our children through a fun and educational board game, bringing health and fitness back to the forefront of their daily lives. It teaches through the best way children learn…playing a game!

Lunch Box is for ages 6+. Players 2-8. Average game time is 30-45 minutes to earn 5 Healthy Golden Lunch Tickets! Or choose to only play for 2 Healthy Golden Lunch Tickets for a 15-20 minute game play! For a school environment you can have up to 12 players per game board (3 players per house).

Playing the Game:
Move around the board with your lunch box pawn. Answer Pop Quiz questions from Cafeteria, Science Lab, Library, and Cool Facts. Answer correctly and earn a Healthy Golden Lunch Ticket! Get 5 Healthy Golden Lunch Tickets and be the first player to make it back to your Front Yard Space to win the game!

But don’t get caught sleeping in class from a sugar crash or you go to the Principal’s Office and lose your Healthy Golden Lunch Tickets. Be careful not to land on Couch Potato, as you must roll a lemon/s or jog in place to get out! You can try your luck pulling a Snack Card but if it is an unhealthy snack then you go to the Nurse and must roll apple/s or stand up and touch your toes to get out! Maybe you will land on P.E. where you will earn a FREE Healthy Golden Lunch Ticket for all your efforts and improve strength, flexibility, and confidence!

Watch out for spaces like “Roofus ate your homework”, or “Late for school” as you will lose your turn! Hopefully you will make the honor roll and earn a FREE Hall Pass, which will get you out of losing your turn.

With so much fun and action you will almost laugh yourself silly when your opponent lands on your Front Yard Space and must stand up to do your yard’s Exercise Challenge; Frog Jumps, Push Ups, Jumping Jacks, or Abdominal Crunches! This game is so much FUN you will not even realize that you just learned what a "Whole Food" is and which foods are the best choices for you to live a Healthy Lunch Box Lifestyle!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Corporate Mayhem
description:
From the publisher:

"Corporate Mayhem is a fast and raucous board game about ambition, opportunity, betrayal, amoral excesses, premeditated criminal behavior, and runaway greed in the corporate world!"

"The object of the game of Corporate Mayhem is simple - to gain a million dollars and then cash out to a life of easy living, ahead of everyone else.

In principle you could achieve this by a long, methodical process of honest hard work and diligent saving. This might enable you to enjoy the fruits of your labor - from your wheelchair at age 90. But instead, you could more quickly amass your personal fortune by being an opportunistic, devious self-promoter who is adept at finding shortcuts, loopholes, and weaknesses in the system and in other players!

But beware! Your path to the easy life can be blocked or destroyed by poor judgement, bad luck, or deliberate backstabbing by a jealous rival. And even if you manage to elude pitfalls and cleverly claw your way to the top, you can in the end (as in real life) be undone by fate itself."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Trading

name: Spuds
description:
Spuds is a simple game for 2 players that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. .

The board (4×4) starts with 8 White and 8 Black balls in an alternating pattern.

Players take turns doing two things:

First, the player must remove a ball of her colour from the bottom layer, if possible.
It is only possible to remove a ball from the bottom layer if it has exactly one red ball resting on top of it.

Second, the player must place a red ball on any 2x2 platform. If there are no red balls available, players skip this step.

When it is not possible to remove any more balls from the bottom layer, the game is over. The player who removed more balls of her colour is the winner.

In the event of a tie, the starting player wins.

Spuds was designed in response to The Shibumi Challenge geeklist.

name: Spetris
description:
Played in a Shibumi board,the game tries to emulate the Tetris experience, combining it the elegance and aesthetics of Shibumi.

On a given player's turn, he must put one of his pre-set groups of marbles (every group has a specific shape/pattern) respecting the following conditions below:

1 – The original form of the group must be preserved
2 – Each ball of the group must occupy (and fit) a single space, being in the first floor, or stacked.
3 – All balls of a group must be entirely supported.
4 – The player can’t use the same group pattern that his opponent used in his last move.

The goal is to be the player with the least number of groups in hand or, given a tie in the first condition, the least number or marbles in hand.

Haikai

A Falling leaf
dances under the full moon.
search for a place to rest.

name: Daniela Katzenberger Show-Time Das Partyspiel
description:
Objective:
be the first to reach top of the racing board
- moving/acting by turn -
Active player draws a card, determines question (by die), turns the sand glass and starts to explain the term to be guessed;
==> due to the focus of the game: all things what a vamp, artificial & excentrical star (Daniela Katzenberger) needs like mascara, high heels, mini skirt, lipstick ... have to be explained, in the beginning with words, mimic, hands & feet, paper & pencil ... ,later on - especially positioned on marked spaces - with limited degrees of freedom
both - active player and first guesser - may move foreward
2 different racing boards give some variety
content:

1 board /2 different racing charts
6 meeples
1 die
104 cards with 620 terms
6 answering cards
1 sand glass
1 rules
Daniela Katztenberger is used as figurehead, but shouldn't be the designer
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Voxtours
description:
Objective: be the first travelling through 6 continents & becoming the 'Voxtours-Champion'
- acting by turn -
each player picks up his passport jetting through a continents;
3 questions must be asked properly before getting a new visa;
questions to be solved may challenge your knowledge about language, sight seeings, local delicacies, flora & fauna, currencies, airports....
Only a new visa will allow you to travel to the next continent.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Travel, Trivia

name: Pace
description: This is a card driven horse racing game. The majority of the included cards have one of the horse's number. First, the cards are shuffled and a number of them are dealt to the "Odds" area of the board and are used with a set of dials to determine the odds for each horse. The players then place their bets. Then the cards are dealt to the race part of the board that has very nice pictures of happy looking horses ready to run. The first horse to have 5 of its cards dealt from the deck for a 5 furlong race is the winner. The horses need one card per furlong to win a race. Cards can be added to the deck that cause horses to run slow for a race, thus requiring an addition card. Cards can be added to the deck that represent a horse not clearing a hedge row in a steeple chase race. There is an alternate way of running a race included. Running times for each horse are assigned via a chart that uses the quantity of the horse's cards that are turned up to determine that running time. In this race the lowest time is the winner. Each game consists of a set of three races and during the set one player represent the Racing Committee or "The House". Under certain circumstances this player receives the purse and in others he must add to the purse from his own money. The similarities between Pace and And They're Off leads one to believe that Pace was used as the bases for http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/3112/and-theyre-off

name: Hollywood Hookups
description:
The Concept

Hollywood Hookups is the first trivia game that links celebrities through biographical facts. The connections are real. And so are the celebrities. The concept of the game is very simple - you are given the names of two individuals that both dated or were married to the same person. You will have to come up with the name of the middle person. Hollywood Hookups links all kinds of celebrities - actors and actresses, musicians, athletes, and royalty. The trivia questions are in 3 different categories, and span the contemporary era to early 20th century.

The Game

The actual board game consists of a board, more than 500 question cards, 50 tokens, 1 die and 6 colored game pieces (red, yellow, blue, green, pink and orange). This is a family-friendly game for 2 to 6 players, ages 13 and up. The object of the game is to collect tokens by answering trivia questions correctly. The first player to get 8 tokens wins the game. This game can either be a single-player game, or it can be played in teams of 2 or 3. We really like the design of the board - the maroon color of the board contrasts nicely with the gold accents. The outside of the box has a white background, with more than 30 different celebrity names on the box - Marilyn Monroe, Tom Cruise, Britney Spears, to name a few.

The Question Cards

The questions come in 3 different categories - Modern, Classic and Connect 3. The Modern cards have questions about contemporary celebrities; the Classic cards have questions about classic (old Hollywood) celebrities. Both of those types of cards only have one celebrity as the answer. The Connect 3 cards have contemporary celebrities, but the connection involves 3 different celebrities. These questions are much harder, but we're sure you're up to the challenge! Please see the designs below.

name: MAX
description:
On a star-shaped board divided into a grid of 300 equilateral triangles, players take turns to place irregularly-shaped pieces (pentiamonds) of their color. When no more pieces can be placed, players score points for each chain of pieces of their color which connects two or more vertices of the star. (Adjacent pieces in a chain need not share an edge: touching at a corner suffices.)

MAX also comes with a set of 44 tangram-style puzzles, consisting of outline shapes which the solver must reproduce by assembling the game pieces.

name: Playmobil: Zoo Game
description:
Attention: baby animals have run away!

The baby animal cards are shuffled and put face down in the middle of the playing board. Each player chooses one koala and puts it on the first playing field.
When a player lands on a koala space, the player has to draw a baby animal card. If the player doesn't have that baby card already, it is put on the corresponding playing field on the board. Otherwise put the card back under the deck.
If a player lands on the clock, the player misses one turn. When the player lands on the 'vet', the player takes the vet and may roll again.

The player that finds 4 different baby animals first and holds the vet, wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Meesters in de Rechten
description:
Meesters in de Rechten is a game about the Dutch criminal law. Players roll the die and move their pawn.
If a player lands on a blue space thta player has to answer a multiple choice question about the Dutch criminal law. When the player answers the question wrong, that player has to skip a turn. otherwise the player thows again.
When a player lands on the yellow space, the player gets a Lik-op-stuk card. These cards are like chance cards. You can gain benefit or a disadvantage of the card.

When a player lands on the 56 space. That player becomes the suspect. The other players vote guilty or not guilty. If a player is found guilty, that player has to start over again. otherwise the player remains on its space.

The first player that arrives on the 60 space and answered the question correctly wins the game.

name: Lass dir Zeit!
description:
Game of arithmetic operations.
Every round card is drawn and players have to calculate the score of the round with possible arithmetic operations of addition and multiplication. Calculation errors are penalized and who discover errors score points. Whoever wins the round, gets the card of the round. Whoever has most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Fit for Fun  Triathlon
description:
Objective:
Be the first to pass finish line
- acting/moving by turn -
very rare combination out from sports and board gaming;
each player throws the die - the space you land on often forces you drawing a card / spending movement (power) points
lucky, if you have any/enough
how to get those points? ==> (heavy) exercising, fitness activities (don't forget applying deodorant turning back to the board); a beach/swimming pool close to gaming area could be useful
of course, if you are going to bunker points you could avoid
to start again, especially if nasty companions play action (event) cards against you;
the 'trivia' part (out of sports/training/nutrition...) even makes it more difficult to score;
a leading position often creates a perfect enemy image
which is going to be supported by anyone
content:
1 die, board, 6 meeples, 1 pack trivia cards, 3 packs event cards (1 per each exercise area) red (power) chips, rules

name: Spinca
description:
Spinca is a game that embraces the Shibumi ideal that less is more. It is a 2 or 3-player game and can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. The winning conditions vary slightly for the 2 and 3-player games; however, the game play is the same for both versions. Naturally, team play is also possible.

At game’s end, a pyramid of 29 marbles is created, which resembles an Inca temple. The peak level is not used.

The board starts empty. Players choose a color and take the corresponding marbles. Player turns proceed clockwise. Herein, the order is assumed to be White, Black, and possibly Red.

Starting with White, using the phase order below:
1. A player may move any free marble on the board to any adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) hole or 2x2 platform which is on the same level as the marble.

A free marble is any marble that does not support two or more marbles in the level above it, and will not cause to move any marble that was moved or placed on the previous player’s turn. This includes tumble-downs. And,

2. A player must place one of his or her marbles on any empty space or 2x2 platform on the board. This completes the player’s turn.
Any marble that was relocated, tumbled down or was placed is temporarily locked for the following player’s turn. The virtual Shibumi Sandbox implementation at igGameCenter at http://www.iggamecenter.com/, has moved marbles marked with a plus sign. Nice and convenient. For physical game board play, players will have to keep tract of their last moves by recording them.

When the Inca temple is completed, each player sums the sizes of the smallest of his or her connected groups on each of the four faces of the pyramid. Each of the four faces will yield only one number. For example, if on one face of the temple, a player had group sizes of 1, 1 and 3, the player would only score 1 for that face. The marbles on the pyramid’s rising edges are considered part of both of the adjacent faces making them strategically important because they are potentially counted twice!. However, an isolated edge marble can ruin a player’s score.

For a 2-player or 4-player game, the player or team with the highest sum wins. If there is a tie, remove the outer faces to reveal the inner pyramid. The player or team with the most marbles in the inner pyramid wins the game.
For a 3-player game, the player with the highest sum wins. If there is a two-way tie, the player with the lowest sum wins. If there is a three way tie, remove the outer faces to reveal the inner pyramid. Players score the inner pyramid by counting all their visible marbles once each. The player with the highest inner total wins. If there is a two-way tie for the inner totals, the player with the lowest total wins.

name: Polish Legions
description:
Polish Legions is a PanzerBlitz variant with 10 scenarios from the 1939 German invasion. It includes 240 mounted, pre-cut counters, a small, mounted map, and plastic overlays portraying railroad lines. A copy of PanzerBlitz is required in order to play.

Six of the scenarios are based on historical actions, all of them Polish successes(!), including a couple of cavalry victories (but no charges into the barrels of tanks). Two of the four hypothetical scenarios are designed to show the superiority of combined arms tactics over uncoordinated assaults. One interestingly pits panzers against an armored train. The last features a German spearhead operating deep in Polish territory.

The game was published in Issue #1 of VAIPA Quarterly, an undated periodical apparently sold only through eBay. The issue includes other articles about Poland in World War II.

name: Operation Dragoon
description:
During the years of preparation for the invasion of Europe, the Allies established an initial landing in southern France to support the main assault on Normandy. This plan was then called "Operation Anvil" ("Anvil"). However, it was not possible to divert naval resources for the Mediterranean and Operation Anvil, now renamed "Dragoon," was postponed to August.
The 15/08/44, "Operation Dragoon" was triggered. The success was total.
There is an hexagonal map of south of France with Marseille and not Marseilles (this city is unique!). The counters represent the german, US and Free French Forces with Colonial units. The rule book is in portuguese, but rapidly translated in english.

name: Fluke
description:
Fluke - The Wealth Building Game of Accidental Inventions

Fluke simulates Corporate America - the wild, wild world of intellectual property that is grounded in inventions and entrepreneurship. Players will experience thrilling scientific research, wacky inventions, stock explosions, gigantic wealth and legal duels. Many world changing, highly profitable inventions were created by accident while in the midst of scientific research to discover something else. These inventions would have never been created if someone was not creatively seeking to solve a problem.

Everyone is memorializing Steve Jobs as he dominated Corporate America setting an even faster pace for the wild, wild world of Intellectual Property. Here’s your chance to see if you can dominate Corporate America like he did. Show your corporate executive skills by building the largest portfolio of cash, patents and research corporations.

Players will maneuver through the Risk and Rewards of the wild, wild world of intellectual property acquiring patents, research corporations and of course, cash. The game ends when the first person loses all of their cash. Each game participant will tally their portfolio. The game participant with the largest portfolio wins.

GAME PLAY

At the beginning of the Fluke game, a player is selected to be the manager of the Venture Fund. The Venture Fund holds 2.4 billion dollars, the patents, and research corporations. Each player receives 200 million dollars from the Venture Fund. They will roll the die and land on a game space. They have the option of:

1. Paying a licensing fee to the owner of the patent / research corporation

2. Purchasing the patent/ research corporation indicated on the game space from the Venture Fund if no player owns it.

3. “Wheel and deal” with another player for purchase of their patent/ research corporation. Resale prices are indicated on the back of cards. If it reads “negotiable”, Name your best price and wait to see if another player accepts your price.

If a player lands on the stock explosion space, they can explode any patent or research corporation they own. They will receive the stock explosion marker and the cash from the Venture Fund.

GAME ENDS

First person to run out of cash the game ends. Each player will count their cash, tally up the resale prices of their patents and research corporations. The person with the largest portfolio values win. Players can continue to play after portfolio tally is complete.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: The Lichten Spell
description:
A dark and mysterious blight has come to the Great Kingdom of the Mystic World. There has been no hint of sun for 500 days. With the people starving, the king turns to his four court magicians to cast an ancient spell known as the “Lichten Spell” which will again turn their kingdom to light. The first magician to cast the spell correctly will become the Great Court Magician and a hero of the Kingdom.

In order to cast the spell a magician must follow the recipe. The balance of Elements needed to cast the spell changes with the wind and from moment to moment. The four magicians now race to determine the precise mixture of elements and be the first to cast the spell correctly.

The game begins with an auction for each of the Elements. As play begins, each player makes three moves per turn, spending their Elements to both learn and change the requirements for victory.

The Lichten Spell requires many skills to win. It is one part bidding game to obtain precious Elements. It is one part mystery as players race to identify face-down cards. It is one part strategic thinking as players try to figure out three moves which will leave them with the proper amounts of Elements to win the game. Most of all, The Lichten Spell is a thought-provoking battle where no two games are the same!

name: Stop and Go
description:
Promotional game published by Shell, the petrol and oil supplier.

Essentially, this is a roll and move game but the winner is not the first player to reach home. In fact, the game does not end until all players have reached home. Then the winner is the player with the most petrol (gas) still in their car.

Cards are drawn when you arrive on certain squares and these often give you more petrol ar make you use up petrol.

name: Mickey Mouse's Tree House Game
description:
Each player is given ten pieces in their chosen colour. In a turn, the player spins the spinner. If he spins a ladder then he can place one of his pieces on the next rung of the ladder. If he spins a number, he can move his character piece up the completed rungs. If he spins a broken ladder, then he must take away a ladder piece.
The first player to complete his ladder with his ten playing pieces and move up to the tree house, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Activity for English I/II
description: Expansion for the Activity but this time the game is played using English vocabulary for I/II grade.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: OPFOR Tactical OPs
description:
This solitaire game is inspired by the work of the World Class OPFOR of the U.S. Army. In the game, you are a Colonel of a Brigade Combat Team trying to drive through OPFOR forces into the enemy rear. If you are sufficiently successful, you may be promoted to General. If not, you could lose your command.
To play, 9 OPFOR defense cards are played facedown in a 3X3 pattern. The player then selects from a variety of FRAGO cards which offensive operation he wants to use to find a path thru the defensive lines. Each FRAGO lists the type of operation, combat strength, and the number of game-hours to complete the operation. The player has to find, or fight, his way thru the defense in less than 20 game-hours.
If the player completes the breakthrough in less than 20 game-hours, he retains his command. If he can do it in 16 or less game-hours, he is promoted. If it takes longer than the alloted time, the player loses command.

name: Activity Zusatzkarten
description: Expansion for the Activity. 110 new cards for the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Celebrations Activity Mini Edition
description: Activity advertising mini-version produced for Masterfoods who is known many confectionery products.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Shuffle Penny Plus
description: Each player shuffles five pennies from the base line. Each penny scores the highest scoring ring it touches. Total score doubles if penny goes into the center hole. Maximum score is 250.

name: The Word Game
description:
The Word Game is played by placing pennies on the board as each player spells words until one player wins. 24 pennies are needed to play. One player plays heads, the other plays tails.

Players flip a penny to start. Players spell words by covering each letter in the word being spelled. A consonant may only be played once unless it appears more than once in the word being played. Vowels may be played more than once, but only if your opponent's coin is showing. If playing a vowel previously played by your opponent, simply flip the coin over.

The last player to make a word of two or more letters wins. Or, when all possible letters are played, the player with the most pennies wins.

name: I Can Spy
description:
Game intended to keep the kids quiet on a long car journey.

Each child gets a different card which has various images on it. The players must observe each item on their card. As they are seen, they are ticked off using the special crayons in the box. The boards are laminated so that any marks can be rubbed off, making sure that the game can be played again on the next journey.

There are 9 images on each board, so the first to spot all 9 on their particular board, wins. I guess, if the journey finishes before the game, the one with the most successful observations up to that point, wins.

name: Jonas On Tour CD Board Game
description:
This is a game about the Jonas Brothers singing group.

The object of the game is to gather autographed pictures of the boys. Players representing fans move around a star-shaped pathway while tokens representing the Jonas kids jump across the interior spaces.

Includes a colorful board, the CD tokens, cards, rules, and a storage insert.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players ages 8 or older.

name: Play-Poker
description:
User review: This is to seven-card stud poker as Autobridge is to bridge.

This game simulates playing seven-card stud with six players. Slide one of the game sheets into the game board. Slide the first tab of all the players to see what each player was dealt and how each decided to bet. The player decides what to do without risking real money.

The game cones with fifteen sheets for a total of thirty games.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Dogsled Racing
description:
A game of dogsled racing in the artic. Players compete to reach the goal first. In the race you will find perils and other sort of problems in the artic you will have to overcome. Players will try to stop you with action cards during the race.

It is a ruleset for 15mm or 28mm miniatures to race dogsled across snowed paths.

The ruleset comes with everything needed to play from the rules to the action cards, rulers and some merchandising banners.
categories: Animals, Dice, Miniatures, Print & Play, Racing

name: Frohe Rheinfahrt
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (140)
- moving by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
each player throws the die, moves according rolled number, follows instructions (cover inside) landing on a marked space

name: Spread
description:
This game is part of the Series: Shibumi family.

Starting with a given position, each player takes turns as follows:

1. The player rearranges the free marbles corresponding to his colour in a new position on the board. In such way that every marble of his colour is connected and at least one of his balls maintains its previous position.

2. If a 2x2 square is formed with three marbles of the player's colour and
- one red ball, then the red ball is replaced by one of the player's colour.
- one of the other player's balls, then this ball is retired from the board.

3. A new red marble appears randomly on the board

Now the next player's turn begins.

The game ends when the pyramid is completed. The player with most marbles of his colour on the board is declared the winner.

name: Quadracarta
description:
Game made of 48 tiles. Each tile tile is made of 4 squares with all the manners to combine three colors.
Many rules are possible.

The first rules are :

Quadracarta MiniSurf
Quadracarta MaxiSurf
publishers: (Self-Published), (Web published), Comité de jumelage de Pierre-Bénite

name: Blue Peter Explorer
description:
This is a great game for all ages but especially for children who are fans of the BBC programme Blue Peter, which has been on for so many years, it is now an institution. In true Blue Peter style, it is fun and educational,
When you answer a question correctly you are given a piece of your jigsaw and the aim is to complete your jigsaw of the world first. The questions are on the people and places that Blue Peter has explored during the programme's history.
The questions range from quite easy to challenging but children are guarranteed to learn some facts while they play.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Trivia

name: Palamuse loodus- ja kultuurilugu
description:
From the publisher:
This is a local Estonian game made by a Palamuse museum. This is a simple roll and move game where players race to finish the nature walk and learn most about the nature around Palamuse.
Track is filled with various helping and blocking tasks.

Be first to finish and own at least 2 pawns to win the game.

Game is promotional game for Palamuse museum with a print run of 25.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Straw, Sticks and Bricks
description:
In Straw, Sticks and Bricks players take on the roles of Pigentrepreneurs looking to be the first to finish their new housing development and start attracting buyers. But, in their rush, will they cut corners and use the more readily available straw? Or hold out and build quality brick homes? Worse yet, you will never guess who the housing inspector is.. You guessed it, it’s B.B. Wolfe, and with his inspection badge, he can even knock down brick houses. What is a pig to do….


Straw, Sticks and Bricks (SSB) is a resource management game geared toward children, but still providing a challenge for adults. It uses familiar characters and simple mechanics to engage your children. Honing skills of matching, set collecting, turn taking, negotiating and counting – it is a perfect introductory challenge for children, and great for family game night.

The game is broken into three phases, in which all players take actions, so as to minimize the down time for players, keeping everyone engaged throughout.

In the first phase players take turns spinning the resource wheel and collecting building supplies (Straw, Sticks or Bricks) – or encountering the housing inspector (Mr Wolf), who may condemn one of the recently built homes.

The next phase allows the players to trade the recently acquired building supplies with each other, hopefully to their mutual advantage.

For the final phase, players use their hard won resources to build homes in their housing developments – and once a development is full and ready to open, points are totaled and a winner (or winners) is determined.


The game was created as an entry for TGC Resource Contest.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Grey Cat Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Sleeping Beauty Game
description:
This is a Parker game, released in 1958 and linked to the animated Disney film.

Each player is the Prince, who must travel along the dangerous paths in order to kiss Sleeping Beauty and awake her from her sleep.
Along the way you must obtain three pictures as without these the Prince must continue along the Deep Sleep path, never reaching Sleeping Beauty.
Magic Wands will help you but Maleficent the evil Fairy will do all she can to stop you and keep Sleeping Beauty forever from awakening.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 3-2-1 Dusty Bin Game
description:
"Dusty Bin is in a Spin,He's Really Flipped His Lid.
If You Can Fire Your Counters in,You'll Be the Dusty Kid"
Dusty Bin was a character in the 1980's game show called 3-2-1.
The board has the Dusty Bin character sitting in the middle. Extending from the centre are 4 'hands', one for each player. The game operates with a pull-string mechanism - needs no batteries.

Each player has 10 chips. These are placed one at a time on one of the hands. You then press down on the lever and let go. The chip then flips toward's Dusty. Dusty spins around and the lid opens and closes, so it is not easy to get a chip into the bin.
Try to be the first player to flip all ten chips into the bin!

List of Contents
1 Turntable Unit.
4 Hand Launcher's.
1 Dusty Bin With Lid.
40 Chips in Four Colour's.
1 Set of Rules.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Madame Tussaud's
description:
A trip to Madame Tussauds - without leaving your living room.
The aim of the Game is to tour the Musuem trying to match up your six celebrities that you are given, The Celebrities are all on their Plinths awaiting your visit but, frustratingly, they are constantly changing their plinth - either by someone getting thier first or your competitors changing them around.
There are also Jack the Ripper cards which can not be matched in the Musuem so you must try and swap these cards with your fellow players to stop them winning.

Celebrities on the box include Luciano Pavarotti, Benny Hill, Henry VIII and Michael Jackson.

name: Desert Island Discs
description:
This game is based on the famous BBC radio show (the longest running radio show in the world and still on today), where guest are invited to choose 8 pieces of music they would like to have if they were stranded on a desert island.

The objective is to reach the centre of the island and identify who is on the desert island.

Like lots of trivia games, the space (here it is an area of the island) you are on dictates which category you must answer a question on that turn.

name: Supremo
description:
Monopoly-style game in which playing pieces move around a track and purchase business and pay when landing on a business owned by another player.
Includes bonuses for getting several like coloured properties, mortgages and event cards.
What may make this of interest is that all the businesses are real business in the Birmingham (England) area, and they have all clearly paid to have their adverts put on the board!

name: Fuchsjagd am Kahleberg
description:
Objective: be the first catching the fox before fox has finished
the circuit
- moving by turn/'Roll & Move' game -
