each player starts from the alpine hut, fox (red meeple) with 5-10 spaces ahead; fox must reach top of the mountain (Kahleberg) and return successfully to alpine hut;
players should arrange themselves which route is followed by whom;
fox can't run past a hunter (but turn) and is caught if hunter's roll ends on the same space

name: Ghost Pirates: Promotional Captain Cards
description:
This is a set of extra Captain Cards for the Ghost Pirates card game that can be added to the card deck and played like any standard Captain card during the course of the game.

Captain Keeshan - Immune to being hit directly by cannon fire.

Captain Sharkey - When Rum sends opponent's crew overboard, one is eaten by a shark and returns below decks.

Captain Sea Swindler - May discard one card to switch the direction of a an Ocean Current card.

Captain Jack - Draw 3 cards instead of two when using Rum to draw cards.

Captain Strongarms - Rolls 3 dice instead of two in a fight

Captain Sid - If any hits are scored by his side in a battle he is participating in, score one additional hit.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Wargame

name: Ghost Pirates: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
description:
This is a set of additional promotional cards for Ghost Pirates that was made available exclusively to those who supported the Kickstarter project at a certain level.

The Sea Wolf (captain) - When your captain would be forced to walk the plank, return him to the poop deck under control of your opponent (treat as an additional mate who returns to opponent’s Poop Deck, not your own). Your Mate now runs the ship, and must behave as the captain if he is on your ship (or once he returns to your ship).

Rats (treasure) - Play on a cargo hold. This cargo hold enters play with 0 crew and may not be replaced. Any fights taking place here score one additional automatic hit per side.

East India Trading Co. Representative (captain) - On your turn, when EITC rep is in a fight, kill one opposing crew before normal fight dice are rolled.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Wargame

name: Utara
description:
Utara is a dice game that makes a game board from any surface on earth. The game's theme calls to mind constellations and stellar navigation.

Utara makes use of several dice that in each face says either North, East, South, or West. The fifth face has a Sun and the sixth face is Moon. You can use any number of dice to play, with a minimum of ten dice per player. More dice will allow higher scores, possibly longer games and require more space to play.

Give the playing surface directions, meaning north, south, east and west. Players roll their dice on the playing surface at the same time. Pick one player to start randomly. The player chooses a die with a cardinal direction in it, and moves it in the direction of its face up. When meeting another dice, collect it and change directions to match the new dice face. Continue in this manner until you go out of bounds. Then the next player does the same thing and so on.

The game ends when no more North, East, South or West dice remain. Each player scores one point for every die in their collection.

It is best to play a few rounds of Utara, once for each participating player. The player who had the fewest points in the previous round should take the first turn in the next round, so they have an opportunity to catch up. Points are tallied over a series of rounds to determine the winner.

name: Kordonia
description:
Confrontation between two players in a fantasy world.
Players assume the role of military leaders.
The playing field consists of hexes. Each player has his army, which enters the game for the resources obtained at the beginning and during the game. Resources received from special hexes. Army players can be activated with dices. Victory depends on the scenario. This is usually certain conditions or set points.

name: Zombie Rush
description:
You didn't have time to get ready, didn't have time to make sure everyone could get out of the house. How were you supposed to know the evil walking dead were going to be knocking at the door? You couldn't have known, you couldn't be ready, and now it's time to rush out the door, and into any car that works.

Zombie Rush is a Print and Play real-time speed game, where you're trying to get all of your family members (cards) out of the house before anyone else does. You score two points for each family member that escaped (each card in the central, shared, scoring area). Each family member left in the house, or dead is worth -1 point.

Players can use their escape routes to get people out of the house before they finally make their escape into the central scoring area. Players place vehicle cards in the center to start piles of escaping family members (the number on the card must go up one each time you place a new family member on the pile).

When zombies appear, they eat whoever is next to them in the deck, but if you've equipped one of the members of your family with a shotgun, you can put the zombie in the dead pile (with any already-dead family members) and save a life.

Plays from 2-6 players, plays best with 3-6. Each round takes about 5-10 minutes, with a full game (to 60 points) playing in about 30 minutes.

Expands, Re-themes, Re-implements:

Ligretto


Zombie Rush is nearly language independent. If you know the word 'shotgun', you're in good shape. Rules in English only, as of now.

name: Explore
description:
Explore is designed to provide a fast-paced and fun gaming experience with materials that can be found around the house; all that's needed is a deck of cards and some six-sided dice. No need for anthologies of rules either. Explore is simple enough that many of the test-players have the mechanics memorized by the second game.

The Explore Engine uses the card deck to generate random game areas for characters to explore in a variety of different settings.

Open Beta Testing

Currently, Explore is free to download and comes with the setting, "Nightmaze." In "Nightmaze," children gather candy on a creepy Halloween night. The object of the game is have the most candy at the end of game by visiting more houses, impressing the adults with your cool costume, and avoiding bullies and the scarier parts of the neighborhood.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Maze

name: Shoot Out!
description:
Target shooting game for 2 players, linked to the popular TV series The Man From U.N.C.L.E., starring Robert Vaughan and David McCallum (both illustrated on the cover).

The object of the game is to be the first to shoot out all five targets spelling U-N-C-L-E.

Contents include platform with spring action trigger, targets, score pegs and marbles.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Nag!
description:
Winner! Most Creative Game! + 2nd Place Overall in the 2011 TGC Vehicle Game Design Contest

Nag! is a backseat driving board game where all the players cram into the back seat of one car and try to control it by yelling at the driver. It's a unique trick-taking hand-management game, where you don't necessarily need to win any hands to win the game.

Poor Harold. He stupidly volunteered to drive everyone to Aunty Josephine's birthday party, but he doesn't know where to go. Each of you has a vague idea of what her house looks like, so you all cram into the backseat and start yelling and screaming at him.

You must get Harold to drive by the house you're absolutely sure must be Aunty Josephine's. Why doesn't that blockhead ever listen! Use your Nag! cards to shout the loudest. Tap Harold on the shoulder to get him to pay attention. Use the GPS to plot your route. If all that fails, call the Cops on him.

So get Nag! today, and drive your whole family crazy!

name: Scorched Earth: Not Just a Bunch of Hot Air
description: Scorched Earth: Not Just a Bunch of Hot Air is a "board-less board game." The game board has been replaced by a color-changing dome, patterned to look like the Northern Hemisphere with a digital display floating in the Pacific Ocean. Players work to change the color of the globe from red to green by correctly answering questions about various environmental topics, learning which technologies are more “green” in order to invest in them and reacting to natural events. Beyond just teaching facts about the environment and global climate change, the game is set up to encourage thinking about how your actions affect the whole world and how what we do now will affect our future. Game-play also requires players to work together to improve the globe’s color, demonstrating how we must all work together to help slow the effects of global climate change.

name: Nyms
description:
From Publisher Webpage:

The game of words with many meanings. Did you mean "right"? Did you mean correct? 90 Degrees? The opposite of left? Like the Bill of Rights? Or did you mean write? Or rite? Or the Wright Brothers?

A fun party game, groups can team up and work on one of six different challenges for over 300 words.

Depending on the challenge and the roll of the die, players may be trying to find the most common meaning of "run", or the opposite of the word "ate". You might have to find out if you're searching for a unique definition, a list of synonyms, or if everyone has to guess what you're going to say.
publishers: GlowFly Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Jason's Crappy Race Game
description:
This is a simple print-and-play, roll-and-move used in a MDA Workshop that is part of the game design class at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

The game is played by two players. Each player has a single track consisting of 12 spaces. Players start on their respective starting spaces, and the first to reach their 12th space wins.

On his or her turn, a player has two choices: roll a d3* and move that many spaces, or get a bonus token. Bonuses tokens can be cashed-in on a player's turn, before rolling, to automatically move two spaces; a maximum of three tokens is allowed.

Thus players can either take a chance and move 1 - 3 spaces, or play it safe and guarantee themselves 2 spaces later.


d3 is a d6, which translates as follows:



d6 roll d3 result
1, 2 1
3, 4 2
5, 6 3

name: HeXeD HeX
description:
Hexed: Bewitched
Hex: Hexagon

A tile laying, race game for 2 to 6 players. Players must move from Start to Finish while avoiding their own Hex symbol. Players move their tokens across the tiles laid out by players during the game. Special ability tiles allow the course to change during the game. Players attempt to give themselves the advantage while giving a disadvantage to their opponents when placing tiles.

Game includes 96 Hex Tiles (with optional backs), Game Board, 6 Tokens, 6 Cards (with optional backs) and a PocketMod Rule Booklet.

All material needed to play is included in PDF format designed to be printed on either Letter or A4 paper or card stock.

name: Silenzio
description: Silenzio is a recation game in which a play mode is determined, then the players flip open round animal cards. Depending on the mode, either everyone has to either make the sound of the animal in the picture, or a movement, or it depends on the color of the animal card in question. The last player to do the correct action or the first player to do something wrong has to take the card. The player who gets rid of his/her cards first wins the game.

name: Bottle Barrel Brick
description:
Bottle, Barrel, Brick is a fast paced game of resource collection. Each player is a dwarf trying to make the most ale, or dig up the most gold. Players take turns deciding if they will try to gather new resources by rolling the die, or combine the resources they have into finished goods for more points. If they choose to gather resources a die is rolled to determine how much they gain. It is easier to make ale than it is to dig for gold, but at the end of the game gold is worth more.

During his turn a player can pass a bottle of ale to another player to decrease his chances of gathering resources on his turn, or pay another player gold nuggets to buy bottles of ale before they can be combined.

Once all of the barrels of ale, or gold bricks are claimed by successfully combining bottles and nuggets the game is over and the player with the most valuable stash wins. This game includes a 6-sided die and all the resource tokens needed to play.

name: Champions of Indines
description:
From the official website:
"Champions of Indines delivers the complete Strategy Tabletop experience in a single play session--from character creation, to backstory, to climactic battle--in just one to two hours!

Champions of Indines is a Cooperative-Competitive Constructed Tactical Tabletop Game to be played by 2 to 6 players. In the game, players take on the roles of a mercenary organization, the Champions of Indines, that travel around their world searching for powerful enemies to fight and people in need to protect. Each game is called an encounter, and takes around two hours to play from start to finish (though some encounters might be longer or shorter). The larger team of players form the Heroes--individual characters who work together to fight as a group. The other team is comprised of a Boss--a single player who controls one exceptionally powerful character or a number of minions (or some combination in between)."

The game is available now as a print-and-play from the official website. Players are encouraged to print the game, play it, and give feedback.

Many of the characters from Champions of Indines also appear in BattleCON. Though the two games are not related in terms of gameplay, they do take place in the same world and follow similar storylines.

name: OPFOR Full Spectrum War
description:
Warfare is no longer just guns and bombs. It incorporates all types of Political Power. The army calls this PMESII (Political, Military, Economic, Social, Infrastructure, and Information), or FULL SPECTRUM WARFARE.
In this simulation, you will see some of the factors that commanders now must contend with to beat win a FSW (Full Spectrum War).

The game is played with 3 decks; a terrain deck, an OPFOR political power deck and a BLUFOR political power deck. Nine territories are drawn to be contended for. Players play cards out of their hand one at a time, to vie for the terrain and it's victory points. In this unique system, the different political power cards (Military, Commerce, World Opinion, etc) have different values depending on the territory being contested.

The first player to win over half of the territorial points is the victor.

name: Big-Bobby Car und seine Freunde
description:
Objective: bet on the car which is going to be the first to pass finish line
- moving by turn -
very simple 'Roll & Move' game
choose a die to roll with - depending on age - colours/numbers
bet on one of three cars
move - by choice - one of the 3 bobby cars according your roll

name: Cow Tipper
description:
The newest 2 Player PnP Dexterity, Strategy and Press your Luck Game

Goal of the Game: To score 10 cows points by tipping them over and avoiding tipping over bulls.

Players will draw tiles from the tile pool and strategically place them in their pasture or their opponents pasture. If you draw the tipper tile you get to try and knock over your opponents tiles to see how many cow points you get. Be careful, if you knock over a bull you will lose cow points!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Hamsterdam 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
This expansion does exactly what it's title would imply and no more: it supplies the components necessary to make a Hamsterdam base set (which can only accommodate a max of 4 players) playable with 5 or 6 players. It does not include any new types of cards or components, new rules, or anything else that changes the game-play.

Hamsterdam is a primarily card-based game, where each player gets a set of 11 numbered "dam" cards, a set of 20 identical regular "hamster" cards and 2 "special" hamster cards drawn from a deck of 16 (which includes 2 each of 8 special types of hamsters).

The Hamsterdam 5-6 Player Expansion includes 2 additional sets of dam cards, 2 additional 20-card regular-hamster decks, and an 8-card specialty hamster deck including 1 of each type.

The expansion does not include other components needed to play the game (flood tokens, dice), thus it cannot be used as a stand-alone game.


Game-play of Hamsterdam when incorporating this expansion proceeds exactly as the base game does: Players create a "dam" made up of a line of cards numbered 2 through 12 and distribute their hamster cards (20 regular + 2 special) on top of the numbered cards. Players take turns rolling 2 d6 to see which spot in the dam is weakened. If a hamster is on top of that number, that hamster is used to plug to the hole and is placed to the side in a reserve pile to come back into play in the next round. If a hamster is not on that number, a flood token is placed there until the end of the round, at which time it can be removed by taking a hamster card permanently out of play. If a flood token is already located on a number that is rolled, another flood token is placed in a special pile of tokens belonging to that player which cannot be removed. As flood tokens pile up, your stock of hamster saviors dwindles, and flood tokens pile up all the faster. The game ends when any player accumulates 10 flood tokens (counting both those in the permanent pile and those currently on the dam). The winner is the player with the fewest flood tokens. In the case of a tie, the player with the most remaining hamster cards wins.

name: Rubovia Around the Castle Game
description:
Rubovia was a children's television series and this game relates to the characters in the show.

RULES:
1. Each player chooses a coloured pawn.
2. To decide who goes first each player turns the spinner. The highest scorer goes first, next one on the left and so on in a clockwise direction.
3. Each taking his turn, the players move along the track from the START by the number of spaces shown by the spinner.
4. When a player stops on a YELLOW or ORANGE square, he must obey the instructions in the panel beside the square.
5. If a player spins a number which takes him to a square already occupied by another player, that player must leave the square and go back three spaces.
6. The player to reach the FINISH first is the winner. He must spin the exact number needed to arrive and must keep spinning in his turn, until he does.

Information supplied by Telegoons
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Autofahrt für alle
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/moving by turn -
each player rolls the die an moves forward according number
landing on a marked area follow instructions cover inside

name: Spangle
description:
Spangle is a deduction game for 4-10 players that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4 set of stacking spheres in 3 colors.

The players are members of a family who are decorating their new house. The winner is the player or players who have succeeded in decorating most of the house with the color of their choice.

At the end of the game, when the thirtieth ball is placed on top of the pyramid, count the balls left in the sack. The color that has the fewest balls left in the sack is the winning color and any player that chose this color at the beginning of the game wins. In case of a tie between colors, count the number of players that have chosen each color. The winning group is the one that has the fewest members. In case of another tie, both group win.

name: Cypher
description: An abstract game for two to four players. The game board has an inner area of 6x6 spaces with numbers 0,1,2,4,8,16 printed on them, and an outer ring with numbers from 1-31. Players take turns to place, move, or remove one of their 6 tokens on the board; only one token of a colour can be placed on the outer ring. None of the tokens placed may be on the same horizontal or vertical line as another of the same colour. The winner is the first player to place their six tokens on the board so that the sum of the five tokens on the inner board equals the number that the sixth token is placed on on the outer board.

name: See New York 'Round the Town Game
description: Published by Transogram in 1964. This game is a roll (actually a Spin the Spinner) and move game where players take tours of Times Square, Central Park, The Lincoln Center, Chinatown, Rockerfeller Center, Greenwich Village and the 1964 Worlds Fair trying to make the most money.

name: The Adventures of Davy Crockett
description:
The objective is to get your Davy Crockett playing piece to the Alamo.

Movement is by rolling a number on the spinner.
If you land on a white spot - Obey the printed instructions
If you land on a Green spot - Take another turn
If you land on a Red spot - If the spinner is pointing at that spot, lose your next turn
If you land on a Blue spot - Breathe a sigh of relief, you are safe

name: Chip
description:
The game consists of 60 numbered color disks (five colors, numbers 1-6, two of each number in each color). 25 of these are shuffled and placed face-up on the table in a 5x5 grid. A pawn is placed on the chip in the center.
The players now take turns rolling a 1/2/3 die and moving the pawn the respective distance over the grid (orthogonally only).At the end of their move, they can pick up the chip they are standing on and replace it by a new one.
The game continues until there are no replacement chips left. Then the players count their score: Each set of three chips in three different colors with the same number and each set of three with a sequence of consecutive numbers (i.e. 3,4,5) counts as many points as the sum of the numbers. A set of only one color counts double. The player with the highest score wins.
publishers: Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., WIN: Das Spielejournal

name: Crazy Geography
description:
Party game for four to eight individual guests or teams.

The participants are given a card with 23 cryptic clues to names with a geographical link. For example;

A cold country near to the Equator would be CHILI

The guest or team that gets them all correct first, wins. Or the guest or team win, that have the most correct answers when the host calls time

name: Zagorgs
description:
Answering to a distress call, teams of space marines descend into a mine on another planet. There, they must rescue captured miners, avoid the mysterious Shanalgar and fight a terrible alien species of unknown origin: the Zagorgs.

Each player controls a team of two marines, a Shanalgar "knight" and, to hinder the other players, a constantly renewed supply of Zagorgs. The players score points by rescuing miners, healing other players' wounded marines and, of course, killing Zagorgs. The game ends when the last miner is safe.

name: Milton Keynes Go
description:
A variant board for the classical game Go, based on a street map of Milton Keynes. Milton Keynes has approximately grid-style plan, but the boundaries of the map are irregular, and there are four places where two "parallel" streets intersect.

Other rules are as in normal Go. However, the tactical properties of the irregular boundary majorly affect gameplay: for example, there are places where it is possible to create an eye by playing only one stone. Also, because the Milton Keynes board (77 points) is much smaller than even the reduced-size 13×13 Go board (169 points), the game is much shorter.

This game was created as a side event at the 2001 Milton Keynes Go Tournament, and subsequently made available on the Web as print-and-play.

name: Backcountry
description:
Backcountry takes the thrill of a big mountain event and transforms it into a fun and exciting board game for the kids to share with friends and family. Take on the role of one of four unique characters, and compete in the uncharted backcountry of the mountain for ultimate bragging rights. With five cards in hand, can you devise the best strategy to cross the finish line with the most points and claim victory over your friends, and the mountain? A simple yet fun game, with high levels of social interaction, make for a great experience for anyone ages 7 & up.

Basic Game Play:

Roll dice
Move piece
Play cards, if available


Types of cards:

Trick - Single action; double combos are possible for 5 extra points; triple combos can be done for 10 extra points.
Grab
Spin
Flip

Knockdown - Opposing player looses a turn and you get the space; can be used to defend against Knockdown card and both players loose a turn.
Boost - Advance down the track the indicated number of spaces.


How to win:

Total Trick Points (consider combos) + Points per place finished = Total Points
Highest total wins.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Battlegrounds: New York City
description:
From Publisher Website

It's time to rumble in the Bronx - giant-monster style!

This 10-page PDF sequel in the acclaimed Monster Island series of tabletop fighting games by Firefly Games presents New York City for your kaiju rampages. Battlegrounds: New York City covers the history, ayout, boroughs, key buildings, landmarks, and defenders of the Big Apple. Featuring art by Richard Cox, this product also includes expansion rules for battles set in the 1930s. You must have Monster Island and Escape from Monster Island to use this product, and Invasion of Monster Island and Revenge of Monster Island are recommended.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlegrounds: Los Angeles
description:
From Publisher Website

Flatten freeways, hammer Hollywood, or crush City Hall – it's up to you!

This 8-page PDF sequel in the acclaimed Monster Island series of tabletop fighting games by Firefly Games presents Los Angeles for your kaiju rampages. Battlegrounds: Los Angeles covers the history, layout, neighborhoods, key buildings, landmarks, and defenders of the city. Featuring art by Richard Cox, this product also includes a new guardian kaiju for the city.

You must have Monster Island and Escape from Monster Island to use this product, and Invasion of Monster Island and Revenge of Monster Island are recommended.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlegrounds: San Francisco
description:
From Publisher Website

Attack Alcatraz, bash the Bay Bridge, or trample the TransAmerica Tower – it's up to you!

This 7-page PDF sequel in the acclaimed Monster Island series of tabletop fighting games by Firefly Games presents San Francisco for your kaiju rampages. Battlegrounds: San Francisco covers the history, layout, neighborhoods, key buildings, landmarks, and defenders of the Golden Gate. Featuring art by Richard Cox, this product also includes a new guardian kaiju for the city – the fierce Chinese Dragon. You must have Monster Island and Escape from Monster Island to use this product, and Invasion of Monster Island and Revenge of Monster Island are recommended.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Die schöne Schweiz
description:
Objective:
be the first to pass finish line: field 80 (Rhine Falls at Schaffhausen)
- moving by turn/'Roll & Move' game -
each player rolls the die moving foreward according thrown number;
landing on a marked area follow instructions printed cover inside

game was published during the 1920's

name: Danziger Heimat-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first passing finish line (field 100 ==> Baltic sea spa Zoppot)
- moving by turn/'Roll and Move' game -
each player starts at 'Bischofsberg' and throws the die moving foreward according rolled number;
landing on a marked area follow instructions printed on cover inside
similar to 'Game of Goose', but linking all places in and around Gdansk before WW II.
The game can be classified as a 'children game' due to mechanics, but very often these types of games were played by adults combined with more or less high wagers for each participant;
winner usually got 50% of total amount, 2nd and 3rd the rest

The game was produced by the Rucks & Co. GmbH about 1949 after the artist Erich Scholtis moved to Kiel. It was produced till well after 1959 when the artist moved to Aachen. The last editions were published in the 1970s.

name: Doctor Who: War Games
description:
War Games is a strategy board game based on the Doctor Who series of the same name, which originally aired in 1969. Players take the roles of War Lords, a race of aliens who have abducted human soldiers from across time in order to build an army to conquer the universe. One player controls the Doctor, who is striving to foil their plans. Players fight each other, capture territory, and form alliances through an engaging, card-based combat system that emphasizes skill and strategy over luck. Eventually though, the Time Lords have to be called in, and the game changes into a fast-paced capture the flag style race to get to the TARDIS and escape before they arrive.

Each turn, players take three actions by playing a card for each action. Playing cards in this way allows players to move, attack other generals and their bases, fortify their bases, or use strong utility actions or delayed tactical responses. The Doctor can influence zone bases to join the Resistance and otherwise interfere with the general's plans.

During play there are several War Chief cards that provide environmental effects when they are face-up. These cards become face-up or face-down due to actions in the game such as forcing another player to be your lieutenant or capturing zones. The game proceeds to the second phase when one player controls the majority of zones or all the War Chief cards are face-up or face-down.

In the second phase of the game, action is faster, as each player plays one action at a time and moves, and doesn't draw any cards to replace their hand. Players fight over the key to the TARDIS and race to escape the world they're on before the Time Lords arrive.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Crosslets
description:
Described as "A Game for the Black-Out", so that dates it to the early 1940's.

It is for two players. Each player gets a board with a 5 x 5 grid on it. The first player selects a letter from the 250 provided and announces it. Both players must now write it into one of the 25 squares on their board. Then the next player draws a tile and both players must now fit that into their grid. Once a letter is placed, it cannot be changed.

The object is to score the most points. Points are rewarded with a specific score, which increase as the length of the word increases. A perfect game would be 5 five-letter words across and 5 five-letter words downwards. I suspect, that would have an absolutely zero chance of happening.

Back to the box - it also says "More Entertaining than Crosswords" and "An Ideal Fireside Game".

name: I Shoot Randy!
description:
I Shoot Randy is a card game for 2 to 6 players ages 13 and up with average length of playtime between 10-15 minutes.

One player takes on the role of Randy and must survive the onslaught of attacks from the other players by countering the effects of their played cards.

If Randy's health is reduced to 0, the player in the role of Randy looses the game. However, if Randy survives all valid attacks from the other players, then he wins the game.

name: Entdecke die Tiere
description:
"Discover the animals" in English
Trivia game with questions about a nature.
You must answer correctly to advance on the game board and collect all the profit from the first part. A question is read aloud along with three possible answers, the players put in their opinion, the correct prediction chip face down on the table. Who has been right moves on the board in front of a field may turn around the chip and win the corresponding part. For higher income parts players have to move higher by answering further questions, but falls back on the base part with a wrong answer. Who first had all the pieces turned on the colored side wins.

name: Hidden Trees
description:
A Faulkner party game.

Each guest at your party is given a card with 24 cryptic clues about various types of tree.

Example
Clue: A Joiner's Tool
Answer: A Plane tree

The participant who gets the most correct answers during the evening, wins.

name: Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Zuhause
description:
Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Zuhause

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Ole, Marie and Zeki comes to visit you. While you going to your house you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which on the gameboard shows you which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the evening rise and you have to go to bed..

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Association Football
description:
A football board game. No publisher on the box but that hasn't stopped him from a liitle hyperbole; the most "Exciting and Thrilling Game Ever Known".

The board is a checkered surface. Dice move the football piece or the footballer pieces. That's it!

The one who scores the most goals, wins.

name: Bang It In
description:
A football related target game. The target has 3 holes in it and a goal. The idea is to get the football into one of these scoring areas. You get 5 points if you get it past the goalkeeper, and 10, 15 and 20 respectively for the circular holes.

The mode of getting the ball to the target is to use the footballer provided. His leg is attached to a spring so you can lever it backwards and then let go. If you are lucky, you might score some points. I expect a lot of practice is required.

The target says '50 UP' so I assume the first player to score 50 points, wins.

name: Pferde, Pferde, Pferde
description:
There are 32 cards with 2 questions and 3 answers for both questions in this game.
Player gets a card if he has answered both questions correctly. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Lissy Pferderassen
description:
Players have 3-6 cards in hand depending on the number of the players. The first player reads the question and answer choices and his/her left neighbor answers -
if it was correct, then the second question asked, is this also answered correctly, the neighbor gets the card.
If it was incorrect the next player may risk with card answering this question.
If somebody runs out of cards in his/her hand, game ends and the player with the most collected cards wins.

name: Schlaumeier
description:
Figure 5 cards face up and one for each category is determined. Then a letter uncovered and away you go. Each category must be an appropriate word to be found. Once the first player has to find an appropriate word to all categories he calls wise guy and all others must immediately stop writing.
If you're thinking: Urban-rural River, which is quite correct.5 cards are turned so they are face up and each get a category applied to.
Now one letter is to be uncovered and away you go. For each category the players find an appropriate word that begins with this letter, the words are to be written down. Once the first player finds an appropriate word for all categories he shouts : SCHLAUMEIER and the other Players must immediately stop writing.

Wer findet als Erster die richtigen Wörter?

Text from the Cover

name: OutRank
description:
OutRank your opponents and be the first person to exhaust their playing hand. OutRank features the five branches of the Military. Army, Navy, Marines, Air Force and Coast Guard.
In OutRank each player is dealt 7 cards, the remaining cards become the draw pile. The first player challenges the player to their left with 1-5 cards of the same rank from their hand. The player answering the challenge can either surrender or try and OutRank each card with a card from their hand of the same suit and higher rank. The answering player may choose to surrender at any time by picking up all cards in play and adding them to their hand. All other players are in a support phase and have the option of supporting a challenge with cards from their hand which have the same rank as cards already in play. If all the challenging cards are answered and there are no other cards being played then the cards in play are removed from the game. The player who was answering becomes the new attacker and play continues clockwise. A game is over when a player has used all of the cards in their hand.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Betz Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Lissy Pferdeverhalten
description:
"Lissy horse behavior" in English
Players have 3-6 cards in hand depending on the number of the players. The first player reads the question and answer choices and his/her left neighbor answers -
if it was correct, then the second question asked, is this also answered correctly, the neighbor gets the card.
If it was incorrect the next player may risk with card answering this question.
If somebody runs out of cards in his/her hand, game ends and the player with the most collected cards wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Lissy Rund ums Pferd
description:
"Lissy Around the horse" in English
Players have 3-6 cards in hand depending on the number of the players. The first player reads the question and answer choices and his/her left neighbor answers -
if it was correct, then the second question asked, is this also answered correctly, the neighbor gets the card.
If it was incorrect the next player may risk with card answering this question.
If somebody runs out of cards in his/her hand, game ends and the player with the most collected cards wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Hexe Lilli Zauberhafter Abenteuerspaß
description:
Lilly the Witch conjures up animals into the nursery and the player must find the correct counter-spell to let the animals disappear before the parents come home. The animal cards are laid out in a 5 x 5 square and there are witch figure in front of four rows. You take one of the characters, places them in front of the free row/column, revealing the cards and if he/she can disapear any animal he takes card.
If there is a empty row/column in this game, player with the most animals wins
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Welt der Hunde
description:
World of dogs
Which is the fastest dog in the world? Where the Cocker Spaniel gets its name? Here, players learn amazing facts about the most popular dog breeds.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: Welt der Katzen
description:
World of cats
In which country cats were worshiped as gods? Why do cats eyes glow in the dark when light falls on them? How do cats orient in complete darkness? Interesting facts about cats.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: Faszination Pferd
description:
"Fascination with horse" in English

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: Unglaublich, aber wahr!
description:
"Unbelievable, but true!" in English
The cards are divided into eight habitats: forests, lakes, rivers, mountain rain forests, savannas, steppes, deserts.
The habitats have different frame colors for clarity. For each habitat, there is one card each of the following five groups, ie a total of 5 cards: mammals, birds, amphibians and reptiles, spiders and insects, and plants. The aim of the game is to win by correctly answering the questions, all five cards of a habitat. For each question there are three possible answers,

name: Rekorde in der Luft
description:
Records in the air
Trivia game on nature, on each card there are four questions, each with three possible answers, the players put chips on one of three answers and place their bet on any of the three betting cards with the corresponding response of the habitat.
The one who relies on an incorrect answer loses his chips. The players who have bet on the correct answer will receive back the double bet.

name: Magic Wand
description:
Educational trivia game for 5's and under.

Simple trivia questions (for us!) but challenging to a 4 year old. It works by battery. The child answer the questions on the game cards by pushing the wand into the appropriate holes. It "smiles" at the right answer, "frowns" at the wrong one.

There are 141 Questions and 16 game cards that fit over the electronics. The rules are inside the lid.

name: Schatzkisten stapeln
description:
Objective:
gain the largest amount/value of coins stored in treasure chests
- acting by turn -
coins (gold, silver, copper) are going to be distributed randomly into treasure chests - 6 per chest
chests are going to be stapled (start position)
throw the die - now you may distribute/split rolled number on one or more chests to move with: if you succeed placing the very last moved chest on a space showing the same colour:
open the chest picking out the topmost coin
forming gaps in between chests is not allowed, they must touch at least another one;
game ends if chests are empty:
counting coins: gold 10, silver 5, copper 1 point(s)

name: Der Zirkus
description:
Objective: gain 8 (knowledge) chips, acquired by successful answered questions
- acting by turn -
each player moves according rolled die - drawing a question card due to space landed on - correct answer (multiple chice - 1 out of 4) get a chip
landing on an image get 2 chips;
if the answer was wrong you are going to loose chips
content: 55 question cards (all about circus), board, 6 meeples, 1 d6 die, 48 knowlegde-chips, a 30 min DVD movie about the circus, rules
Remarks:
Game belongs to the Noris-series
'Wer-Wie-Was-Warum+Wo?' ==> other games with very similar approach:
'Krankenhaus, Reiterhof, Zoo',
series previously named 'Sehen-Spielen-Lernen'
Each game comes with a DVD which should be viewed before playing the game

name: Tune Up
description:
Tune Up, "where you are the mechanic," published by Total Source Parts and Accessories,

For ages 6 and up, 1 or more "mechanics." It plays like the classic game OPERATION, but instead of a human patient, you're working on a cartoonish forklift, dealing with items like an empty tank, sparkless plug, squeaky wheel, sore bottom, kinked hose, etc., that need to be replaced with a TotalSource replacement part.

name: Sportmagazin Kicker  Champions Quiz
description:
Objective:
collect 5 chips before you are allowed answering the final questions
- acting by turn -
determine difficulty level first
level one: give 1 correct answer for 1 question (5 times out of 5 different terms); level two: 2 correct answers for 2 questions ...; level three: 3 correct answers...
roll the die, move your meeple, draw appropiate (colour) question or event card, follow instructions if you land on a space with a symbol.. if you had bad luck even back to starting point.
As soon as you've acquired 5 chips reaching target spaces you are protected - now you only have to find the correct answer(s) for the final question(s)

name: Sheltie und seine Freunde
description:
Sheltie and the other ponies escape and the players try to catch them. In order to retrieve as many ponies on the paddock, you need luck, courage and the right spin with the spinner.

The top card is revealed, the player spins the spinner and press down the edge of the roundabout before the roundabout even touched the table. Is the subject form the card is touched the next card is revealed and player may continue her turn but if the sucject is not touched she loses all cards revealed this turn. Sheltie acts as a wildcard.

Player with the most cards revealed = ponies catched at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: Feed The Animals
description: Simple spin and move game from the mid-1950's from the Whitman Company. Object is to feed animals of the game in order to score extra points.

name: "Blackout"
description:
Educational game recommended for Sunday School teachers to help children with their numbers' recognition.

In a turn, the child spins a number and then reads out the word on their board relating to that number. That word can then be crossed off, i.e. a Blackout counter is put on to it. Play proceeds until one child has crossed off all their words.

The lessons can be graded. Younger children can start with Blue cards, the Yellow can be attempted, then Green, and finally Red. It is suggested that Red is not used until the teacher is sure that the children are ready
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Number, Word Game

name: Tout est bien qui finit bien
description:
40 illustrated cards. The cards are divided into four series designated by different colored borders and by an illustration in the upper left corner of either la Maison, le Chäteau, le Jardin, or le Moulin. Each series is further divided into cards illustrated with the same objects, i.e. a dog, a cat, a key, a door, a banner, a man, a woman, a young boy, and a mousetrap.

The object of the game appears to be to collect all the keys, all the doors, etc by asking other players for the cards you need, in a Quartet or Authors fashion

name: Spin-A-Word
description:
Children's game, aimed at improving their spelling.

In a turn, the player spins the spinner and this will indicate two letters. He writes them down and, if it is the very first turn, he spins again and notes two more letters. If he can now make a word, using the letters, he tells the other players and he scores some points. If he cannot make a word, he passes. When it is his turn again, he spins the spinner but only once now, and gets two more letters. The longer the word, the more points. The first to score 30 points is the winner.

name: Shootin' Ladders: Glass of Milk
description:
This is a mini-expansion for Shootin' Ladders. It adds the board hazard 'Glass of Milk'.

From the rules:
It should come as no surprise that milk & cookies are a lethal combination - for cookies, that is. And so, much like Oil Barrels in other shooter games, Glasses of Milk can be used as explosive hazards in SHOOTIN' LADDERS.

This expansion comes on a single 8.5" x 11" glosssy thick sheet of paper. The lower section of the paper is designed to be cut apart giving six different glasses of milk.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jonnakas Jott
description:
The game was published in 2005 as a part of a local educational program called "Mina Ise" (I myself). The game consists of 45 different cards, where there are 22 card pairs, where each pair has a regular (local Estonian, non-foregin) letters and J letter as being a part vowel and part consonant alone, making it to be 45 cards.
Each card pair has something drawn on it, either a living thing or some item. Under the picture there are a word and under a word a sentence to use the word in. Trick is the correct "kääne" (word ending).
Scoring has multiple possibilities.

Variant 1: Naming the thing on the picture and the letter it begins with scores you the card. 10 cards wins the game.

Variant 2: Each word has parts of it different colored, while yellow part is 1 point, red part 3 points and blue part 5 points. 35 points and you win the game.

name: Midrimäng
description:
First game in a series of 4, in which each game is one season in the year.
The series in meant to be education for children.

Each game in the series is meant for 2-12 young players. The first game called "Midrimäng" is about winter and the wonder of Christmas. All games later can be combines into one large game.

Game is played very easily.
Each player is a small elf that must hide behind pine trees and deliver candies into the shoes of kids. Game has a eyes of children part (for adult player) that once each turn moves around and tries to find little elves.
Do you hide or deliver for points - you decide!

Winner is the first to deliver all candies.

name: Da Vinci
description:
From the publisher:
This is a game about finding connections between different things. Game comes with so many great cards that will blow your mind.
Each player moves around the game board (Monopoly like board), where each space is a category.
Under that category someone will draw a card and asks you something. Example: "How is connected chicken egg and A4 paper format?".
Answer correct, collect the card and keep moving. Idea is to reach the center field and be crowned as smart as Da Vinci himself.

name: Läbi lodu rabast randa
description:
Educational game made for schools to introduce 4 parts of the nature. Game is simple, just roll and move through the game board and collect knowledge.
On the way to the end, you must stop on card spaces and answer what it on the picture.

Also, the rule book is 76 pages and can be used as small RPG with d20 dice and a journey to the nature.
On they way you have to get out of swamps and make choices of roads and so on. Goal is still to reach the end, but this way the game is more educational than the regular way.

First one to reach the end is the winner.

Game was created as a part of a student program and was put together by over 50 student ideas.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Puhta vee ABC
description:
From the publisher:
"Clean water ABC" is a educational game about saving pure water. Game board is a pipeline to different parts in a house and all players starts from a plant that pumps water.
Goal is to reduce the water consume.
Players go around the house and stop leaks, not using water while washing hands etc.
When you have certain amount of points, you can proceed to the end - waste water plant.
First one there is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kuidas valmib leib?
description:
Promotional game for bread. The game is about making bread.

Game is played on a Monopoly like game board, with outer track being the break making track and inner snake like track for getting points to reach next levels on your bread making track.

Game is played in turns and in the inner track. You move there according to dice rolls and do what the spaces say. Each time you reach red space, you can take next step on the bread making track and reading out loud, how the process is made.
Winner is the first player to finish the bread.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Expell
description:
"When two wizards test their strengths against eachother in a magic duel several factors decides the outcome; the ability to learn and adapt fast to changes, flexibility in strategy and tactics when necessary, master of both attack and defense, courage to try the unknown and wits to outsmart the other combatant."
All these things matter when playing Expell.

Expell is a deck building game set in a magical environment. Two or more players compete for survival as wizards. Make the best use of the Grimoire to optimize your deck of spells to defeat your enemies. The objective of the game is to exhaust the opponent(s) willpower with a good combination of spells and magical items.

"No strategy is good but the strategy to observe, adapt and act faster than your enemy."

The game components:

216 Spell cards (24 different spells with 9 cards each)
48 Power cards
48 Darkness cards
Willpower tokens
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: FISCHE FANGEN Ein frohes Petri Heil
description:
Objective: catch as many valuable fishes as possible before returning safely to fisherman's cottage
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die, move according rolled number; ending on an 'A' marked space roll the die again 1-3 ==> bad luck; 4-6 lucky
sometime you may - if position is marked with 2 or 3 - try again.
Places are suitable for different sorts of fish - more or less valuable ==> see table
you may also take a more risky decision: get a boat and reach very rich in fish position - but you can get lost, too;
game ends if last (surviving) player has returned to fisherman's cottage

name: Gute Zeiten, Schlechte Zeiten Quiz
description:
Objective: be the first gaining 6 different chips
- moving/acting by turn -
roll the die, move & draw appropiate question card; if your answer was right ==> get a chip with correspondent colour

question categories (out of TV-series):
love & passion; emotions & jealousy; cheeky & fatal; reality & character; sadness & fate; tricks & deception;
it is not allowed collecting more than 3 chips of same colour
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: LET's go!
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 25 (finish line)
- acting/moving by turn -
a 'Trivia' approach with (some) unusual challenges
1. roll the die, move your (question) meeple
2. ending on a coloured space your right neighbour draws a card
3. Colour of the space determines sort of question, symbol if you may look out searching a partner - not your neighbour on the right - for current challenge
4. the faster (with less hints) you find the correct answer the further you (and your partner) may move your (tracking) meeple
terms you are challenged with frequently:
find/name a wanted: person, place, profession, thing, brain-twister...
techniques you may apply are puzzling, drawing, something to puzzle over, yes/no questions ....

remarks:
game was produced by Ravensburger, developed by PwC and Ravensburger
categories: Deduction, Dice, Racing, Trivia, Word Game

name: Der Bocksprung
description:
Objective: get most of all chips out of the bank
- moving by turn -
each player gets a square (numbered 1-6) and a correspondent round (1-6) wooden marker - surplus will be placed on the board as neutral ones;
place your marker on the board into appropiate spaces
roll the die - move your round marker as many spaces foreward by neglecting other ones; take off the very last square marker and put it ahead of the others: now check the new formed patterns: 2 of 3 with same value: gain 1 chip: 3 of 3: gain 2 chips: 3 in an increasing column: gain 4
nothing: pay penalty: 1 chip
game ends if all chips are gone

Remarks: game was produced early 1930's; target group were adults who had to buy into

name: "Waddle" The Duck Shooting Game
description:
This is a shooting game with a moving target.

Instructions for setting the game up:
Fit the round uprights into the wood bases, highest to the right, shortest to the left, and ensure the slots run inline down the board. Fit the printed housings or "pens" to the uprights. Target to the highest. "Home" to the shortest. The slope or ramp is made in two halves; join these together and fit into the slots in the uprights, but before securing to the highest upright, thread the Duck on the ramp. Move the Duck to its starting pen and the game is then ready for playing.

After that, if you still have energy to play;
Load the repeater gun with an agreed number of rubber bands and take aim at the target to start the duck in motion. When this has been accomplished fire the remaining bands on the gun to knock over the Duck before it reaches the "Home" pen.

Scoring is calculated according to the number of points indicated by the duck's head on the base board when it is pointing downwards,

If a player has some remaining bands on his gun after scoring, the Duck is returned to the starting pen for further play.

name: Sphlag
description:
Summary:
Sphlag is a capture-the-flag game for two players.

This is a novel Capture-the-phlag game design for the Shibumi game family.
In this game, 2 players face each other, and try to surround their opponent's flag (or, in this case, "phlag") with their own spherical pawns.
The game uses the 4x4 Shibumi board, with a pre-defined inset of immobile pieces, creating a battleground for rounds of joy with capture-the-phlag.

Rules:
Starting position:
The board starts with four Red spheres, two in opposite corners, and two diagonally to an imagined line between these corners in the center of the board. The two players sit opposite each other. The sphere in front of each player represents their respective flag (or, in this case, "phlag"). The spheres in the middle represent a wall. These four spheres cannot be moved.

Movement rules:
Two players, White and Black, take turns either placing a sphere of their color within their half of the game board (the half facing the player, e.g. anywhere within the triangle B7-G2-G7 for the lower player, and A6-F1-A1 for the upper player), in any level possible, or by moving their sphere up to a total of 4 spaces. No spheres can be initially placed along the diagonal line indicated by the wall (A7-G1), or the opponent’s half, although spheres can be moved into these positions.
A "space" is defined as a space on the grid (not the holes). This means that moving from one hole to the next (for example, E7-C7) involves moving 2 spaces. Player movements may involve movements up or down levels. If a sphere that supports only one other sphere is moved, the top sphere drops down into the vacated hole. If a sphere supports more than one other sphere, it is locked into place.

Other rules:
The last turn's board position cannot be repeated (ko rule). Passing is allowed. If a player cannot make a legal move, the player passes.

Aim:
Players aim to touch their opponent’s flag with as many of their own spheres as possible. There are three legal positions at which an opponent’s flag can be "touched"; E7, F6, G5 for the lower flag, and A3, B2, C1 for the upper flag.

Winning conditions:
Players win instantly upon moving at least two of their spheres into touching contact with the opponent’s flag. Otherwise, the game ends when both players pass sequentially or if both players agree to end the game. The player that has more spheres touching the opponent’s flag after ending the game wins. In case of a draw with respect to the number of spheres touching the opponent’s flag, the player with fewer spheres on the board wins. If both players have identical numbers of spheres touching their opponent’s flag, and equal numbers of spheres in the game, the game ends in a draw.

Examples of legal moves are shown in the files section.

Designed by Lars Rose, 2011.

name: Venezia & I Veneti: I Cicchetti
description:
Venezia & I Veneti: I Cicchetti (aka, "Venice and the Venetians") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and sights of Venice. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

Geography & Nature
Art & Culture
History
Food & Wine
Famous People
Venice and The Venetians Today

name: Match Barraze
description:
Soccer Game published by Perma Toys.

The game has plastic players that are set into the game board in depressions. Those depressions attract the soccer ball. The players are spring loaded and when the soccer ball falls into their area you can attempt to pass the ball or score a goal by flicking the player pieces. There is a goalie who can block shots on goal.

name: The Original Spot Game
description: Action game. The board is a red circle and the idea is to drop 5 white smaller circles on to the board from around a yard above, so that the red circle is completely covered. First to achieve this, wins.

name: Micky ist der Grösste
description:
Objective: gain as many of the 44 Micky cards as possible
- moving/acting by turn -
each player moves according the die into a free of coice direction; ending on a marked/coloured space draw a question card;
name - according colour - a land (green); a town (red), a river/lake (blue), a mountain (brown) starting with the letter printed on card; if you are quick enough keep the card;
ending on a 'Mickymouse' symbol draw a 'term' card to determine the colour, hereafter a question card; proceed like described above - but if you are successful you'll get a 2nd chance to win an additional card
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Q-Boot Das Quiz
description:
The exciting knowledge quiz show on Super RTL!
You go with your friends on a breathtaking ride on the Q-boat at 10,000 feet down and recover the treasure. Along the way, you have to answer tricky questions and collect valuable points. Secure your points across on the cargo hatch.

The teams try to find a common solution for each correct answer and win oxygen, with which they dive deeper into the sea of knowledge. A wrong answer leads the team to the next secured surface place. There are a questions about professions, geography, medicine, nature or sports in this game with the help of two Jokers. After three dives each with 10 questions, the player/team who has emerged the greatest overall depth, is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, Trivia

name: Quick-Quiz: Berühmtheiten
description:
"Celebrities" in English
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

108 playing cards,
notepad and pencil

name: Bare Your Fangs: The Hunt is On
description:
"Bare Your Fangs: The Hunt is On" is an expansion to the "Bare Your Fangs" game and requires the core game to play. It adds a third active player by replacing the non-player-character (NPC) Hunter die with 5 new customized Hunter character dice. The NPC dice can be kept in case there aren't 3 active players. Also included is a bloodstone life tracker and rules, which will fit and be shipped in the zippered game pouch.

Now up to 3 people can battle royale! As with the core game, multiple copies will allow for team play.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror

name: Vähendame võidu
description:
The game about reducing the waste produced for The Environmental Board of Estonia.

Usual roll and move game where winner is the player who reaches first to finish. Player who landed space with logo must say before next rolling something about reducing or avoiding the waste.

name: Ferda sordib pakendeid
description:
There are 4 cards with different garbage can and 46 different packages for sorting the correct garbage cans.

Players place the cards from their hands for the garbage cans and write down their card numbers. If the deck is exhausted they check cards have they placed to correct garbage can.
Player who has played the most cards correctly is the winner.

name: Levi
description:
From the back cover:
Who's got the most extensive telecoms coverage? Who has the best quality? Whose coverage includes every village, town and city - right through to the most far flung corner of every region across the whole country?
COVERAGE! is a challenging and exciting board game where you have to develop your won telecoms network. Your playground is whole Estonia - so competition is fierce!

The telecommunications sector is developing rapidly: you have to be in it to win it, with victory going to a truly talented network operative - one who's able to plan several steps ahead, able to think big and act local, one who's not afraid of taking risks!

Elisa'a new board game COVERAGE! is a tricky, fast paced showdown between players who need to rely on both cunning and luck to win. The gauntlet has been thrown down: let the game begin!

Includes: game board, 60 game cards, 186 tokens, 15 coverage markers

name: Tactyx
description:
Tactyx is played on a 12 x 12 board. There are 4 coloured sections on each edge of the board. Diagonal moves are not allowed. To make this important rule visible all the time, the board is painted with 12 x 12 circles which are connected with vertical and horizontal lines (and no diagonal ones).

There are 2 red and 2 black banks on two opposing sides of the board. These bands are used to determine the coordinates of each place in a section on the board.

Each player has 6 tokens. At the beginning of the game the board is empty. By throwing the 2 dice, one red, the other black, the players determine the location where their tokens enter the game (in the section corresponding their color).

The goal of the game is to move all 6 tokens from the starting section to the diagonally opposing section. The first player who reached this, is the winner.

name: Teadlik Tarbija
description:
From the back cover:
Board game "Teadlik Tarbija" (Smart Consumer) got started in the Consumer Protection Department competition for school children named "We can do it". The game was designed by a Tartu Hiie school children and they presented it in 2005 for the named competition. All the art were made by a local school girl Cathlyn Olev (from Viimsi High 7th grade).

In the Tartu Hiie school all children there wither have a hearing or seeing disability. They say about the game they made like this:

"It was really hard to find the idea for the game at first. We looked at many different types of games and finally we thought to make something like Monopoly, but simpler. We thought, that a usual dice game with questions would be simple enough for us to do. We thought up the questions and made the cards. So that we wouldn't have to know all the answers, we made few cards with answers already on them, so we could move forward and backwards as well. The goal of the game is to learn about consuming and how to do it with reason!"

Game is played with dice rolls and answering questions. First person to reach the end, will win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Étoiles filantes
description:
On a hexagonal gameboard, two or three players must move their pawns and drive out competitors. Each piece has the potential to force and displacement different in each of its six sides, respectively 1, 6, 3, 5, 2 and 4. At each turn, you can either move or rotate a sixth one of his pawns to move into position to attack later. Étoiles filantes (Shooting Star) is also very interesting for three players. Players must then negotiate alliances point while being cautious of reversals that are sure to occur as soon as your partner suddenly finds you too threatening.

Object of the game is to remove opponent's pawns from the board.

The game has won the 1988 Golden Pawn Award in strategy games category.
Winner of the 1980 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société.

name: Marco Polo Reise-Spiel Deutschland
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
- tactical (geographical) quiz - so called on back of box
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area
I move around collecting cards/images
II answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
III get back home (can be difficult); don't arrive being the very last one; whatever you'd collected it doesn't count
content:
1 board, 60 cards/images, 6 ports/cards, 20 red chips, 4 vehicles with stand-ups, 8 'double-sided' stones to point out directions, 2 rain slides, 1 die, 1 rule
3 similar editions existing for France, Italy & US
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Travel, Trivia

name: Snow White's Party
description:
From the game box:
Snow White made a little party for her friends. She is still waiting for the seven dwarves, who are on their why home from the mines. Help the all get home as fast as you can. Road is long and Snow White is waiting them badly.
Snow White's Party - fun game on 3D game board.

Each player plays one dwarf and game is simple roll and move game. On the way to the house, there are many paths and on each path there are many spaces for a dwarf to land on.
Butterfly stone - roll more than 4, you get +3 moves, you roll less then 4, you miss 2 turn, you roll 1, you go back to the beginning.
White cloud - change places with who ever on the board.
Rabbit - +2 moves
Mushroom - -2 moves
Squirrel - miss a turn
Little bird - miss a turn
Evil witch - miss 2 turn
Sleepy - whoever reaches him first, must carry him with himself. Trick is that with Sleepy, you only move when you roll odd number (1,3,5), so be wise.

First player to reach Snow White, is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Durchs herrliche Märchenland
description:
Objective: be the first passing finish line (field 100) -
learn maths & more about fairy tales
- moving by turns/'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die & moves; ending on a marked area ==> follow instructions printed on the board
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Fantasy, Math, Racing

name: Ziel Mars
description:
Objective: be the first bringing all of your 3 spaceships back to Earth
- simple 'Roll & Move' game -
each player gets 3 spaceships;
roll the die and follow the red line to mars unless you end up on a space forcing you to change the route;
you may follow the green line back to earth only if all of your spaceships are landed successfully on mars - same approach compared to outward flight
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Space Exploration

name: 'Cocub' The 'Cococubs' Game
description:
Promotional game published by Cadbury's. It must have been quite expensive to make because it utilised three companies. Cadbury paid for the project. Britains, the world famous maker of toy soldiers, made the playing pieces. And De La Rue printed everything.

The rules;

1. Each player may choose their favourite Cococub playing piece. During the game you should address yourself by his name.
2. Each player starts from Mr. Pie Porker's garden (in the centre of the board). A player throws the die and moves along the track, the number thrown.
3. The blue and black squares are penalties. The yellow squares are rewards.
4. You cannot land on the same square as another Cococub. If that should happen, then you don't move at all for that turn.
5. The first player to get back to Pie Porker's garden, wins. It is necessary to roll the exact number to get back into the garden.
6. The winner should ask mother for a bar of Cadbury's Milk Chocolate.

name: Zoo Zoo Land
description:
Each player takes a set of cards and place before him the map engine. At the same time, players will return the first card in their deck and place it next to the locomotive. The following cards are drawn and then:

1) be placed at the end of the train if the number of animals is greater than the last card of the convoy
2) be placed on a card already in the convoy when the number of animals is less than or equal to the last card of the convoy

When all cards have been drawn, the player with the longest convoy wins. A tie, the one with the largest number of animals visible wins

name: In the Aviary
description:
"How many birds can you discover".

Party game. Each guest or team is given list of 14 different cards (which are placed around the room). Each card has a little rhyme that is a cryptic clue to the name of a bird.

First player or team to get all 14 right, wins.

name: "Derby Winner" Race Game and Roulette
description:
A game purely about gambling.

There are 8 previous English Derby winners and players are invited to place a bet or bets. The wheel is something like a Roulette wheel but features only the names of the horses. Once bets are placed, spin the wheel, and collect your profit if you are lucky. The role of Bookie should be passed on until everyone has had a turn of being the Bookie.

The Eight Derby winners featured in the game;
Blue Peter (1939)
Dante (1945)
Airborne (1946)
Pearl Diver (1947)
My Love (1948)
Nimbus (1949)
Galcador (1950)
Arctic Prince (1951)

name: Mr. Turnip's Aerial Rings
description:
Hoopla version, where you try to land your rings on parts od Mr. Turnip's body. On the board that the Mr. Turnip figure sits, there are also scoring areas, four with a positive score, two with a negative score.

Mr. Turnip was created by puppeteer Joy Laurey (credited in the top left corner of the box lid), for the children's programme, Whirligig. The show was a Saturday, fortnightly, BBC TV children's programme, broadcast at 5pm. It ran from November 1950 to 1956. It was the first TV variety show specifically for children and was broadcast live from the studios in Lime Grove. Not many people owned TV sets in those early years, but those that did usually opened their homes to others, especially when children's programmes featured. Virtually the whole country watched this one and only TV channel.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Roadwise
description:
Promotional board game, published by the British roadside assistance company, Green Flag.

Box says it "Contains the Official Theory Test Questions."
It should prepare the learner driver - Assist the young cyclist - and refreshes the experienced driver.

Approved by the Department of Transport, the questions are mainly from the government's Learner Driver's Official Theory Test.

The object is to be the first player to reach the National Car Park barrier. Movement is with a dice and the game has car playing pieces. Answer various questions as you travel round the board. Watch out for penalty cards and direction arrows.

Contents
1 Game Board.
6 Car Playing Pieces.
3 Packs of Cards.
1 Die and Shaker.
1 Set of Rules.

name: Electric Derby
description:
A game of pure chance.

The game consists of a wheel with six horses on it. The wheel can be made to spin, causing the horses to go past the Winning Post each circuit of the spin.

Players bet on which horse will be last to go past the Winning Post. That horse will be numbered and that number light comes on at the side of the board.

The onjective is to have the most tokens that you used to bet with (you might even try to bet with real money).

name: Ins Frankenland hinein
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 88)
learn more about Franconia
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

each player buys in getting an equal amount of (numbered sightseeing) city cards (18 in total);
(pewter) meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a space possessing a card of it should be flipped, read and can be used as a joker, if later player ends on a marked space (see rules) with bad news...
remark: game belongs to the series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele" with very nice graphics/images
game was published early 1930's
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Durch den Thüringer Wald
description:
Objective: be first to pass finish line (field 100)
- moving by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
rolling the die each player moves und follows instructions (rule sheet) ending on a marked space

- one of Spika's very typical games -
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Coin Table
description:
Abstract:
A strategy game for two players in which each attempts to control the most space on the hexagonal table by placing and flipping coins.

Overview:

Board: A hexagonal board divided up into a number of hexagons, resembing a honeycomb. Standard board size has 61 hexagon spaces measuring 1.25 inch across arranged in a hexagon shape, with each side of the board the length of five hexagon spaces and the middle of the board being nine hexagon spaces wide if measured between any two opposite corners. Non standard boards may be used, as long as the shape is a true hexagon.

Pieces: 100 coins with distinctive heads and tails markings. Standard coins are the same size and weight as US pennies, with each face painted a distinctive color.
Coins may also be used in place of standard game coins.

Objective: to control the most spaces on the hexagonal board.

Rules:
1. For two players. Players alternate turns. Each player chooses a color or coin face On a player's turn, he may do one of the following:

A: place a coin on any space on the hexagon spaces on the board, with his own color or his own face up.

B: touch a coin that is already on the board. see "touching a coin"

C: Flip a coin of his opponents over to his own color(or face). see "flipping a coin"

D: make a castle. see "making a castle".

2. The last coin that has been put on the board, flipped, or touched cannot be flipped. It is "safe" until another coin has been put on the board, touched or flipped.

3. The game ends when all spaces on the board are filled. Count up the number of spaces each player controls. The player who controls the most spaces wins.

TOUCHING A COIN
On your turn, if you choose, you may touch a coin with your finger. That coin cannot be flipped until another coin has been touched, flipped, or put on the board. Use this to defend a coin for one turn.

FLIPPING A COIN
A coin of an opponents color may be flipped to your color if These criteria are met:
A: You have two coins of your color/face on hexagonal spaces adjoining the coin you want to flip
B: The coin is not "safe"(has been put on the board, flipped, or touched on the opponent's most recent turn.
C: The coin is not part of a castle.

MAKING A CASTLE:
If there are three coins of your color on adjoining spaces arranged in a triangle, you can place a coin on top of those three to make a castle*. Now these coins cannot be flipped for the entire game. A coin can be part of more than one castle, as long as the coin making the castle is placed on top of three coins on the board.

Note that only one coin may be flipped or placed per turn. A castle will take a minimum of 4 turns to build.

name: CHIP-A-TAK
description:
Chip-A-Tak is an abstract, checkers-like game that allows both capture and recapture of an opponent's pieces. Unlike checkers, Chip-A-Tak employs a dice roll to determine the number of spaces that a player may move his chips as he attempts to reach the other side of the board.

Originally intended as a gambling game, Chip-A-Tak includes rules for wagering and for repurchasing captured chips using either actual currency or the imitation money included with the game.

Chip-A-Tak is played on an 8x10 checkers-style board, with each player having a rear row of 8 spaces filled with chips and an adjacent row with the center four spaces filled.

name: Safari dans les Pays de la Loire
