description:
Cultural and historical quizz about a french district.
Players must reach the finish (Nantes) by rolling dice and answering questions.
For each error a player set back one space (city) and must answer an other question (we go back 3 spaces maximum).
For a good answer, the player stay in the city and the next player take its turn.

name: Indian Shoot
description:
Shooting target game. The target is unusual, as it stands on a tripod and spins freely. When the Red Indian target is hit, the targets spins around.

Most hits, wins

name: That's Life!
description:
That's Life! was a magazine-style television series on BBC1 which aired from 1973 to 1994, presented by Esther Rantzen (1940 - ) throughout the entire run. Esther features on the box for this game. The show concerned itself with consumer problems and complaints and this theme is addressed in this game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to acquire a Bath, a TV Set, a Cooker, a Car and a Footballing Dog for their home. (That is right, I did say a Footballing Dog - the show often featured viewer's pets that were rather unusual).

Players move around the board in order to try to obtain the items. There are the usual squares, such as trade squares (players can trade amongst themselves if they wish).

Watch out! If you sell a leaky bath or a broken-down car,you could be put in the hot seat by Esther. Esther can Be called in to expose the rogue traders.

Contents
1 Game Board.
4 Playing Pieces.
4 Sets of Pieces(Bath,TV Set,Cooker,Dog and Car).
1 Pack of Service Cards.
1 TV Camera Piece
1 Die
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.
categories: Economic, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sooty's Game
description:
"Race Around the House With Sooty and Friends"

The object of the game is to be the first player,to race around each of the rooms in Sooty's home. You must avoid being caught for the 'Mischief Doings', and arrive at the finish with an exact throw. Instructions on squares must be obeyed (miss a turn, etc.).

When a player lands on a Mischief Square it is read out. The player who holds that Mischief Card is deemed to have caused the mischief and must miss the set number of turns.

There are two routes to take in the bedroom - If you cannot get over the bed in one throw, you will miss extra turns (so, you cannot 'bounce' on the bed!!)

Contents
1 3D Game Board.
3 Card Sections.
15 Mischief Cards.
4 Playing Pieces With Stands.
1 Die.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Eine Reise durch Thüringen
description:
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point
learn more about folks and country
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -

rolling the die each player moves forward:
you can't kick opponents - ending on a marked space
follow instructions ==> see rule sheet
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel
publishers: (Unknown), Brückner Spiele, SPIKA GmbH, VEB Meiningen

name: Es weihnachtet sehr
description:
Objective: be the first ending on field 24
- acting by turn -
all stars -coloured on 1 side - are flipped, tools (e.g. crib) are assembled
starting on field 1
each player draws a 'star' (instead of using a die);
if the star shows a colour of one of the next three spaces ==>
move forward to that space - otherwise don't move
if that space is marked follow instructions printed on cover inside
if all stars are discarded ==> shuffle and draw again
remarks:
cute meeples
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Racing, Religious

name: The Shape Game
description:
A game in the vein of Pictionary, played in teams where one team member draws a picture and the other team members try to guess what is being drawn.

One difference to Pictionary is that the game consists of 40 laminated cards, wipeclean pen and cloth, where each card already has a squiggle drawn on it that should be included in what you want to draw. Another difference is that the drawer chooses themselves what to draw, and has 30 seconds to draw as many pictures as they can, with the card being wiped clean as soon as someone guesses correctly.

name: Build your own Business
description:
This unique board game can be played by yourself or with friends.
You will start with $2000 dollars and try to build 40 successful businesses while earning hundreds of thousands of dollars, or you may go bankrupt trying.

Each player will have 20 spaces on a round board to place white chips. These chips cost different amounts according to the zone in which they are placed.These chips will also determine the amount of sales collected.there is one icon on the board his is the customer icon. The customer icon will travel around the board starting at the Alpha/Omega spot. As the customer travels around the board the players collect the sales if it lands on spaces they have chips on each players goal will be to earn enough money to buy 10 white chips for all 20 spaces they own. The player with the most money wins.

From the Website:
Thanks for investing in Build Your Own Business (BYOB), the game that lets the Player fulfill the American dream of owning and operating businesses. More than a decade of research and development led to the creation of this best new game in America and the World. One, two, or four Players play BYOB.

Playing BYOB presents the Player with the ups and downs of the typical startup business and gives motivated Players a chance to try their hand at “reaching the top.” Players select to invest from the specific business types in the Business Title Cards included in BYOB or create custom businesses with the blank Business Title Cards provided.

No matter the type(s) of business chosen, the goal in each of BYOB’s Five Phases, beginning with Phase 1, is to make the right management decisions to maximize the initial investment in each one. A business investment is “maximized” when it becomes a Preferred Asset on a Raw Land Parcel owned by the Player. Phase 1 is a game in itself. At the end of Phase 1, Players may move on to the subsequent Phases, suspend play to a future time, or quit the Game.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Training
description:
Football-related game.

The 'board' consists of a tinplate area from the kicking spot to the goal at the other end. One player is the penalty taker, the other is the goalkeeper. The kicker must try to 'kick' the ball into the goal. This is harder than it looks.

After equal turns as being the goalkeeper, the player who scores the most goals, wins.

The board surround has adverts for Ford, Shell, Maxwell House Coffee, and Cinzano.

name: Miracle Tivoli
description:
A curious mix of a shooting target game and bagatelle.

The tinplate board features a gun at one end and four supports at the other. On these supports are, the balls are placed. In your turn, you fire the gun, hoping to knock a ball off its support. If you are successful, the ball will fall on to the board and roll down into the scoring area. Into which indent the ball finally rests, determines the score you get for that ball.

After equal turns, the won with the most points, wins.

name: Tootsietoy Speedway
description:
The only board game I have ever found that was published by Tootsietoy, they were much better known as a toy company.

This game is a simple 'spin' a number and move around the track. All squares with instructions must be obeyed. Although the game comes with eight cars, only a maximum of four people can play (the track is only four lanes and each car uses its own lane). First to the finish line, wins.

The cars in the set are;
No.1 Stutz Bearcat, white
No.2 Duesenberg Special, gold
o.3 Marmon, yellow
No.4 Packard, red
No.5 Blitzen Benz, green
No.6 Studebaker Champion, silver
No.7 Peugeot Special, orange
No.8 National, lilac

name: The Trapper Greyhound Racing Game
description:
Each player has a board that attaches to a centre base, where the hare is sat. A string is attached to the end of each board and at the word "Go", players must frantically wind in their string, which will send their greyhound towards the centre. The first greyhound to reach it, wins that race
Box dimensions: 14 x 7"

name: Brain Gain
description:
A series of 6 memory, Maths and word ability games played in a sequence with players keeping score of each game.

The players decide which of the six games they will play. They keep score of each gamer separately and after playing all the chosen games the winner is the one with the highest aggregate score.

The games:
Word Recall -- You try to remember as many words from the deck as possible. Then your opponent turns over all of the cards, snuffles removes some cards. And replaces them with others. The players must now name the five missing words.

Word sequence -- 10 words cards are dealt out. The player memorise the words on the cards and the order that they are laid out in. They are then turned over and the players must recite them ini the order they are laid out, if he makes a mistake thier turn is over.

Matching pairs -- The cards are split the matching pairs cards Into 2 sets - both need to contain one of each symbol Shuffle one set and arrange them, face up, in a grid formation,. One set is retained by the player.
The player then monitors the location of each card on the table, and the opponent turns them face down. The player must now match them with the ones In your hand When you find a match, remove the cards from your hand and the table and place the pair where your opponent can see it.

What's missing -- Ten of the shape cards are removed from the deck and placed, face up, on the table The player memorises the cards (you don't need to remember their locations). The opposing player to turns them over and shuffle them on (he also removes one of die cards). The cards are turned back over and the players must guess which of the cards is missing.

Number locate -- The ten number cards (0-9) are removed from the deck and place them, in a random order, in 2 rows of 5. The player now tries to remember where each number is. the other player turns them over, and then takes a number locate card and reads out each of the simple maths Questions in order. You must know the answer to the question and the location of the relevant number or numbers

Shape locate -- The shape cards are shuffled and laid out. face up. in a grid formation. You now have to memorise the location of each of the cards, before your opposing player turns them face down. Your opponent then takes one of the shape locate cards and reads out the shape that you need to find. After each sentence, you must try and find the specified shape and/or colour (e.g. find the red circle) by turning over one of the cards.

name: Bugs Bunny Shooting Game
description:
Shooting game linked to characters in the Warner Brothers' cartoons.

Players take turns shooting at the target. If they can make one of the plastic rabbits spin round, it counts as a success and will score 5, 10, 15 or 20 points.

After an agreed number of turns, the player with the most points, wins.

It might be compulsory to call out "Hunt the Wabbit" as you play.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Big Game
description:
The target is set up and placed inside the box. The rifle is then loaded with two corks. Players stand about five feet in front of the target and are allowed a round of six shots. When a target is hit, the target falls backwards and the score revealed.

The player who scores the most points after an agreed number of rounds is the winner.

Contents
1 Target With Six Animal Targets and Stand.
1 Double Shot Rifle.
4 Corks.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

name: Disneyland Pop-Up Race Game
description:
Colourful game with Donald, Pluto, Goofy and Mickey character pieces.

Three-dimensional race game. A simple roll and move game but with the added feature, the track takes you upwards as well as along the flat part of the board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Markover
description:
A shooting target game but much more realistic than usual.

It comprises of double sided cardboard game birds including pheasants, ducks and grouse.

It comes with two elastic band repeater guns, and all the components are housed in a fitted wooden case. The rules are pasted on to the inside of the box lid.

Both players fire away at the same time, the most successful hits is the winner.

name: Dodge the Daleks
description:
The first Doctor Who board game published.

It is a simple roll and move game, where players advance their pawns and obey instructions encountered along the way. The track winds in and out until you reach the Secret City. The first to do so, wins.

If you encounter a Dalek, you are knocked out of the game

This game dates back to the series when William Hartnell was the Doctor.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Thelwell's Penelope and Kipper Race Game
description:
Players each take one of the coloured Penelope and Kipper playing pieces.

A simple roll and move game. The objective is to reach the finish first. You must obey penalties for landing on a red square, But if you land on a pink square, you gain an advantage. There are additional penalties and advantages on some water Jumps.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
4 Horse Playing Pieces
4 Bases.
1 Die and Shaker.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

name: Sinking
description:
"Sinking" is a board game in which every player is the commander of a pirate ship that is sinking. To do so you have to give orders to your crew so that they can create opportunities to attack, defend and take water out of the ship.

This is achieved through blind-bidding. Each turn the players hide their boards using the provided shields and bid on the several actions and functions (attack and drain water out of the boat) so that they can gain more resources or affect the other players's bids. Then they all reveal the boards and compare their bids. Only one player solves each action so be sure to pay extra for the ones you want. At the end of the turn the ships sink according to the amount of water the players let into the boat.

name: Das Wissensquiz Pferde
description: Question game with three possible answers, the question is' diced, the issues are keeping, breeding, equestrian sports, races, riders, diseases, equipment, ponies and care. Depending on the version you have to collect a small plate of each color or get rid of the flakes to win the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Quand les cochons sauront voler
description:
Players lay their cards, add up the values ​​and when there is enough wings, pigs can fly!

In his turn, player pick a card and plays against the pig of his choice.
Once a player manages to have enough wings to at least match the weight of the pig, he wins the card and the pig is replaced
Some cards are action cards. They will give bonuses to help you be faster than others, by replaying a wing card, doubling the value of one of them or by decreasing the weight of a pig.

If the Pig deck is exhausted the game ends and the player with the most pigs is the winner.

name: Chute-2
description:
The balls are placed in random order on both sides of the chute. The Pattern Cards are placed face down.

The first Pattern Card is turned over. Players then flip their balls into the chute, so that they pass through the tunnel trap gate, in the same colour sequence as the Pattern Card. As soon as the last ball is through, close the gate and trap your opponent. Points are scored and play continues with the next card. There are penalties for balls placed in the wrong order.

The winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the game.

"Flick,Roll and Race Through the Tunnel Traps in a Contest of Skill and Excitement."

Contents
1 Play Area.
1 Tunnel Trap Piece.
22 Balls.
10 Pattern Cards.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

name: Charad'Mania
description:
Nearly 400 charades divided into seven themes: History, Geography, Politics, Art, Sport, Showbiz and Animals.
Each player receives a card with a card theme and mime. Each player in turn takes a card, reads the charade and made ​​the mime. The player who finds the correct answer first wins the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

400 cards
1 die
an hourglass
chips
pions

name: Charad Mania! Junior
description:
Charad'Mania version suitable also for younger audiance.
Play charades around the animals, crafts, nature and geography. Each player receives a card with a card theme and mime. Each player in turn takes a card, reads the charade and made ​​the mime. The player who finds the correct answer first wins the card. This game is easily adjustable to reduce the playing time or to facilitate the parties in sorting the cards. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

200 cards (160 charades and mimes 40 mimes cards)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Objectif Zéro
description:
"Target Zero" in English

Players roll 5 x d20 dice and everyone try to find the best possible number closest to zero doing 4 mathematical operations.

In "Expert" variant each elementary operation is to be used once and only once.

name: Tribal-Zone
description:
Tribal-Zone consists is a small set of tiles with 3x3 grids of different symbols and background colors.
In his turn player draws a tile and place it to score points. Each newly formed alignment of at least three boxes with the same background color is worth 1 point. Each alignment of at least three identical symbols 3 points.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: L'École des fans
description:
Game based on French TV-show.
The object of the game is to be the first to reach the "podium" so that you can sing your favourite song! The players begin at the Ecole des Fans® school and go through each step of the interview, using the microphone to speak. They each rolling the dice and move their character on the stage-shaped board, with activities along the way (singing, duets, dancing, exercising, miming, making faces, kissing, pledging and a surprise).

Contents:

1 amplifier microphone (requires 2 AAA batteries, not included)
5 erasable blackboards and 2 erasers
1 stage-shaped game board
110 cards
1 pad of scoring sheets
6 character pieces with stands
1 die
1 game rulebook
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Gingerbread Race
description:
From the package front:
Just throw the dice and race your way to the top!
Makes a great stocking stuffer!
Net Contents: (1) Board, (2) Pegs, (2) Dice

Rules (from the back):
1. Each player picks a Gingerbread Peg.
2. Each player rolls 1 die... the highest rolled number goes first.
3. Throw both dice and add up the number of dots and move the Gingerbread Peg up the race course.
4. The first one to reach the Finish Line, wins.

name: A Visit to Disneyland
description:
The plastic board has a spinner and holes where the Donald Duck playing pieces fit.

Roll and move except that you spin the spinner rather than roll a die. Move forward the amount spun. Land on +, move on extra spaces. Land on -, go back spaces. The first person to reach No. 100 is the winner.

Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Spinner Piece.
6 Donald Duck Playing Pieces.

French name: Visite A Disneyland
Dutch name: Reis In Disneyland
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Duncan Hamilton Invites You to Race at Oulton Park
description:
The board is a rendition of the Oulton Park circuit which is in Cheshire, England.

The player must negotiate the track in the fastest time to win. Magnets under the board move the cars when you turn the steering wheel

Duncan Hamilton (1920 - 1994) was a British racing driver

name: Maschinengewehr mit Schiess-Scheibe
description:
Target game, circa 1935, when militarism was very popular in German society. The title means 'Machine Gun with Target'.

The gun is a crank operated Model 08 Heavy Machine Gun on a sled mount. Made of wood with metal barrel. The gun fires wooden bullets at four card targets enclosed within the game box lid. Complete with charger clip [for automatic loading] and 10 wooden bullets.

The targets are worth between 1 and 4 points. Most points earned wins the game.

name: Snap Judgment
description:
"The Photo-Recognizing Game"

Intended to be a party game I suspect.

Each player receives a scoresheet. A page of 12 photographs is chosen and on the word "Go", all players (or teams) write down as many of the people on that page that they recognize.

The winner is the player or team with the most correct answers.

The ever-hopeful publisher recommends that you buy another copy so that you can play with a bigger group of people.

name: Lucky Shot
description:
Objective: score most points by flipping the ball/marble into the marked holes
- acting by turn -
very similar to 'Tiddlywinks' but using a catapult (cardboard) and a marple
at least 2 different editions 1935

name: Mixed Nationalities
description:
Party guests are given a card with the names of countries on them, but they are all messed around, anagrams and the like.

The guest or team who get the most right answers, wins.

name: Flitsch
description:
objective: be the first shuffling all your pucks into opponent's territory
main game:
- acting by turn -
each player is shuffling his 6 pucks (black or white) into opponent's territory with a tensed shirr;
try to push back already placed opponent's pucks, too.
1st round ends after all pucks are moved;
bad luck: if you hit opponent's shirr and your puck is pushed back into your own territory;
2nd round: remove successful positioned pucks and start playing the game with the residual pucks
3rd round: dito...
related to:
jakkolo, shuffle-board games...
remarks: mainly positioned for army people - see cover

name: Philibert
description:
There are 50 cards divided into two families, 25 cards with Philibert the quirky cat and 25 cards with Philibert's wardrobe and clothes.

The 25 cards with wardrobes are placed face-up on the table. The 25 cards with Philibert is placed face down as a deck and is drawn. The first child that identifies the missing garment in the right color from the Philibert's card gets this card. The winner is the player with the most cards at the end of the game.

There are more variants available.

name: Countries
description:
Promotional game.

In a turn, you draw the top card and give the top clue to the next player. If he knows the correct answer, he claims the card. If he gives the wrong answer or passes, the next clue is given to the player on his left, who will claim the card if they get the answer right. And so on, around the group, until the card is won.

Most cards, wins.

The publisher, a coffee supplier, claims that this is one of 60 games they have published!

name: Ein Licht geht auf
description:
Objective: collect as many points as possible knowing most of the questions
The game has various sets of quiz cards ranging from maths, geography, arts, music to inventions (8).
Upon completing the circuit by touching the two probes to the correct question and answer a light turns on;
additional sets (21) were available;
there are 2 different editions:
small (cardboard) and large (wood)

Comparable with games like Electric Contact Quiz and or Knapp Electric Questioner

name: White House Egg Rolling Game
description:
The board is slanted and it has five holes, each scoring either 10, 25, 50, 75 or 100 points. It is placed at one end of a dining table or on the floor, and players must roll balls at it, hoping to get the ball to stay in one of the holes. The player with the most points, wins.

Bizarre title but that might have been its attraction.

name: Pa and Ma
description:
Party game. Guests are given a card with 24 'questions' on it. The question takes the form of two clues to two diffent subjects, but the correct answers will rhyme.

Example
Recreation Ground - Answer is Park
Sign - Answer is Mark

The guest with the highest amount of correct answers, wins.

One in the Dainty Series of games.

name: Champion Road Race
description:
A standard roll and move game, published as a promotion by Champion Spark Plugs in the mid-thirties.

The track winds around and features special squares where you have to obey the instructions. You can also take shortcuts and longcuts, if you know what I mean.

First to finish, wins.

name: Alphabet Game
description:
Game published by Chevrolet in their promotional publication called Chevrolet Motoring Fun Game Book.

In this game you are provided with a scene of the family enjoying a picnic. The game is to see how many things you can find that begin with a different letter of the alphabet. I think it was intended to be played in the car on a long journey. So, after a pre-agreed time limit, the first player must pass the picture over to the next player, probably in the seat next to him or her, and that player must see if they can find more than the first player, and so on, until everyone in the car (hopefully not including the driver) has had a turn. The board suggests that if you can get 18 right that would be rated as a 'Fair', 20 right 'Good' and 22 'Very good'.

name: Euro Miljonairs
description:
The object of the game is to earn as many euros as possible.

The game takes three rounds. Each player receives a set of fifteen cards with pictures of eight coin and seven banknote values. There are twelve European countries marked with flags. During the rounds players try to gain flags by strategically playing money cards and having the highest deposit for each country. Flags can change hands each round.

At the end of the three rounds, players score according to the flags they have collected. Countries whose flags share a common border allow a player to multiply the value of euro in these countries by 2, 3, or 4. Two countries multiply values by two, three countries by three, etc.

The winner is the player with the most money.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management

name: The Game of Merry Christmas
description: The Game of Merry Christmas is probably the earliest known version of Mall Madness type game. In the game, players roll the dice and move to make their way through the streets of the village. Players visit the local shops and spend their money to purchase all the items on their families Christmas wishlists. The first player to buy all their items and returns home will be the winner in this vintage Parker's Brothers game.

name: Duck Hunter
description:
The whole family can experience real-life hunting – rules, safety, decoys, waterfowl identities, fun, excitement, laughs! Great fun for a hunter, birdwatcher, or anyone interested in waterfowl because it involves 2-4 players in hunting strategy, bird identification, and safety practices used by good sportsmen. The object is to be the first player back to the Clubhouse with the "bag limit" of birds (at least 4 bird pictures with matching description cards).

Starting at the clubhouse, roll the dice and move that number of colored spaces. You may move either way on the board, and you may choose to take an inside path to reach the color space that you want. At each space you collect a card of the matching color: Green for a bird picture, orange for a bird description, or yellow for a situation card which explains a safety tip or legal point. When drawing a situation card, follow the instructions; it may send you to the Dog Training School, Sporting Goods Store, or Skeet Shooting Field! (The tan square has no matching deck, so no card is drawn.) When you have collected four different bird cards and their matching descriptions, hurry back to the Club House to claim your win!

Duck Hunter is packaged in a handsome, full-color box which contains the game board, instructions, four tokens, two dice and three card decks. One deck contains beautifully executed, full-color pictures of birds, the second deck has full descriptions of birds and their habitats and the third deck contains situation cards which remind players of proper hunting procedures, present comedic pitfalls, and provide penalties and bonuses.

The bird pictures are by internationally renowned wildlife artist Bob Hines. He was the only National Wildlife Artist to be employed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.

name: Grand-Stand Base Ball
description:
Promotional game, published by Pluto Water, a leading laxative supplier around 1910 onwards.

The game is a simple spin and see the result. The spinner has a remarkable 24 'sections' it can point towards after it stops spinning. No skill needed, just record the game with paper and pencil.

name: Wir rufen Deutschland
description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your puzzle pieces (= federal states of reunified -after WW II- Germany with all territories around 1936)
- acting by turn -
1. a 'white' map of pre WW II Germany is laid down (4 pieces)
2. each player gets an equal amount of federal states (puzzles)
and their emblems
3. turn the spinner - showing the name of a federal state: if you possess correspondent puzzle place it on the map (should fit); hereafter or if you didn't possess it ==> next player
4. game ends if someone places his/her last puzzle piece
remarks:
produced mid 50's it's design is simulating a game published before WW II (may be to fool collectors spending too much money for it); the design of federal states in the east of Germany is like 'wishful thinking' but political incorrect
no product no., no date... maps produced by Atlantik-Verlag Paul List, Munich

name: Winko Baseball
description:
Tiddlywinks mechanic.

The board is a baseball field, with green felt at home plate. You place your tiddlywink there and flick it on to the board. Where it lands determines the result of the action Possible results include;
Strike
Batter Out/Sacrifice
Base on Balls
Single
Out
Two Base Hit
Three Base Hit
Home Run

Basic baseball rules apply to any result. Take turns at bat and aim to make as many runs as possible.

name: Quiz & Co. Junior, 5-6 Jahre
description:
190 questions and answers for 5-6 years old children.

First assignment of colors, shapes, numbers and the first knowledge questions with colorful illustrations.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Quiz & Co. Rätsel, Spaß, Rekorde
description:
"Puzzles, Fun, Records"

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Quiz & Co. 1. Schuljahr
description:
750 questions and answers for 1st grade - 6-7 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Quiz & Co. 2. Schuljahr
description:
1000 questions and answers for 2nd grade - 7-8 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Quiz & Co. 3. Schuljahr
description:
1000 questions and answers for 3rd grade - 8-9 years old children.

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Quiz & Co. Pferde
description:
Questions and answers about horses

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Quiz & Co. Rund um die Welt
description:
500 questions and answers Around the World

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.

name: Quiz & Co. Sport
description:
500 questions and answers about sport

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Quiz & Co. Tiere
description:
Questions and answers about animals

The game can be played with questioning and answering by points. 10 points are the final goal, or it can also be played by time. Who has the most points after a certain time wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Quiz 2008
description:
110 quiz cards with a total of 1760 questions with three answer choices.
Who answers correctly may roll the dice and move accordingly on the game board who answers incorrectly stops. First player who reaches to the last week of the year wins the game.

name: Lustiges Einmaleins
description:
Objective: be the first calculating fast & correct - placing all required slides on your board forming a completed puzzle
- acting by turn -
1 one player acts as question master
2 each player gets a small board with 2 x 4 empty spaces
3 question master draws a hidden slide (bag) with a math multiplication function (within times table)
4 player whose board shows correct answer must reply (if not within a certain time: penalty; wrong: even higher penalty)
5 slide is put properly on the board
6 next slide is drawn...
remark:
early published game ~ 1900
publishers: Abel Klinger, Liliput, Otto Maier Verlag

name: The Red Crown Game
description:
Promotional item by Red Crown, the oil and petrol supplier.

It is a simple spin and move game. If you land on a square with instructions, they must be obeyed. The track is described in the rules as the 'Road to Better Mileage'. This would have been a much better name for the game, but they went for the safe, mundane option.

The first one to reach the end of the 'road', wins.

name: Scat
description:
Objective: be the first achieving 100 points by flipping/snapping your puck/disc with a stick into holes
- acting by turn -
1 place board on a flat surface & get your coloured disc and a wooden stick
2 snap the disc by using your stick into scoring holes
remarks:
should be published during 1940's

name: Der Zoo
description:
Basis of the learning game is the DVD with many interesting things to learn about a zooparks, from the perspective and experience of a child.
In this game players look at the movie and then play the game. In his turn player roll the dice, draw a card and answer a question at the current field. For correct answers he gets a chip. Who has 8 chips first, wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Der Reiterhof
description:
Basis of the learning game is the DVD with many interesting things to learn about a horses and riding, from the perspective and experience of a child.
In this game players look at the movie and then play the game. In his turn player roll the dice, draw a card and answer a question at the current field. For correct answers he gets a chip. Who has 8 chips first, wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Das Krankenhaus
description:
Basis of the learning game is the DVD with many interesting things to learn about a hospital, from the perspective and experience of a child.
In this game players look at the movie and then play the game. In his turn player roll the dice, draw a card and answer a question at the current field. For correct answers he gets a chip. Who has 8 chips first, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Medical, Trivia

name: Horse Race Game
description:
Promotional game, published by Milton Bradley, but for Coca-Cola.

The board has six lanes, each numbered. To move a horse, throw three dice. The three numbers on the dice means that those three horses move forward one space. Of course, if the same number is rolled on two of the dice, that horse moves forward two spaces. Treat three of the same number accordingly.

Crossing the finish line is a little different for this game. If a horse is one square from the finish, it can only move forward if only one die shows that number (so if two or three dice are that number, the horse cannot move.

I would think the game plays best with 2, 3 or 6 players.

name: Frisch's Baseball Game
description:
Promotional game made by the Frisch's Big Boy chain of restaurants.

There are two panels to cut out and you can make little cards for them. Once you have your cards, you can play.

Shuffle the cards and draw one, to determine what the batter does: One team is called Big Boy and one is called Buddy Boy. The instructions say to use a button or small token as the batter.

And that is it, draw a card, determine the result, move your button player marker if needed. I have seen games with a little more skill!!!

name: Spellbee
description:
Promotional game from the Gulf petrol company.

Each player is given a 'pad' on which to write their answers. This pad is called in Britain, a Magic Slate. You write on it, then peel the cover and, hey presto, the writing disappears.

Everyone plays at the same time. A word is read out and each player spells it as best they can. The first player to get an agreed number right, wins.

I suspect this was intended as an in-car game, to pass the time on a long drive. That connection would explain the fact that it was made by a petrol supplier.

name: Game of Purchase
description:
A promotional game from Quaker Oats, probably in the 1920's. Simple spin and move game.

First you have to make a spinner yourself. Having done that, you have to spin a 1 before you can start moving along the track.

You start the game at Home and, to win, you must advance to the Grocery Store. Along the way you must follow instructions. They are of the variety, 'Forget honey, go back to the start', that sort of thing.

Of course, as usual in these basic games, you need to spin an exact number to finish.

name: World of Refreshment
description:
Published to coincide with the 1964 New York World's Fair.

It is a simple track game. Movement is a little different though. The game is supposed to be played with special Coca Cola bottle caps, a set of 120 with illustrations of the fair. You are supposed to draw a bottle cap out of a container and move the number of spaces of the last digit on the cap. 120 caps is an awfully large amount of Coca-Cola to drink before you can play!

If you land on a red or black space, follow the instructions.

The first one to reach the centre of the board, wins.

name: Das kleine Allgäuquiz
description: Pocket version triva board game from "Das Kleine Quiz" serie. The question are presented on a notepad, with multiple choice answers. This travel game is designed to ask some questions during a car drive, a flight or something like that.

name: Das kleine Cocktailquiz
description: A small trivia game about coctails; with 100 questions and answers from the "Das Kleine quiz" serie. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Das kleine Berlinquiz
description: A small trivia game about Berlin; with 100 questions and answers from the "Das Kleine Quiz" serie. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Köln, Das Spiel zur Stadt
description:
Objective: give correct answers collecting most points after agreed time
- acting by turn -
typical 'local (= Cologne)' trivia game (dice/cards/local map) moving around and finding correct answers (music, arts, people, building....)

content:
300 image cards, 1 board, 6 meeples, 1 d6, 1 coloured die, rules

name: Nice: the Expansion
description:
"It's War!! ...and it just got a whole lot nicer"
Just when you thought it couldn't get any better, Nice: the Expansion comes along! With over 50 new powers, more scenarios, more miniature bonuses, vehicle rules, civilian rules, even new ways to play! Powers like Goodzilla, Star Student and Combine; Fireball, Mechanic and Shindig Pandemic; even all the benefits of lobbing shoes at your opponent. Scenarios that involve taking a grand tour of the gaming board, miniatures bonuses for Fish-Handedness, and so much more...
Continuing with the now familiar - "No miniatures - no Problem!" shenanigans, the rules still allow you to have a cucumber and a croissant in a pitched battle to the death! Only now they include Vehicles and Civilians. Even the vehicles gain bonuses for how big they are and how many guns they have strapped to them. Civilians respond to the fight going on around them; either by running for cover or attacking like a mob - but they still need to be weary of falling debris...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Harvest Fun
description:
Promotional game published for promoting the International Harvest company, who made agricultural vehicles and machines.

You compete against other farmers and aim to be the first one to harvest your crop. You can chose either wheat, hay, cotton, or corn to plant (what you choose makes no difference to your tactics or ambitions).

You throw dice to move up your section of the board. At intervals there are white boxes. This is where you must change your implement before moving past the white boxes. Again, it doesn't affect your tactics about which implement to use next, you must use all of them at some stage if you want to win the game. First to do just that, wins. At times you will be instructed to draw a 'Whoa' card. As usual, this will perhaps help you or hinder you.

This game was distributed by International Harvester dealers. The playing board is made of vinyl and folds up easily to fit in the box. The game consists of 2 small dice, Whoa cards and Implement cards.

name: Blitzschnell
description:
Objective: collect as many question cards as possible making the correct and fastest reply
1 draw a question card and read content to everyone - e.g. 'river'
2 turn the wheel - it determines the initial letter of the river to be named
3 the fastest reply receives the card (1 winning point)
4 if answer was wrong return an additional card

remarks:
predecessor of 'Stadt-Land-Fluss'
can be played as teams, too
due to the spelling of Cologne 'Cöln', which was recommended between 1900 and 1919, game had to be published at that period

name: Nos Cinq Sens
description: Translated, Our Five Senses. This is an educational game (entirely in French) to help kids learn about their senses. You roll and attach the puzzle pieces that correspond to the sense you have on your play board (hearing, smell, touch, sight, or taste). This game also comes with a corresponding educational guide for parents to assist them in helping children explore their five senses. Comes with 5 player boards, a die, and 6 puzzle pieces per board that attach to it.

name: Know Your States
description:
The object of the game is to make the names of the states, building each name, syllable by syllable, beginning with the first syllable. There are two decks of cards, one for the states east of the Mississippi River, and one for the states west. The decks contain one card for each syllable in each state name (the card backs show a picture of the state). One deck is used in a game.

To start, one deck is split into six piles with the word side up. The first player takes a card with the first syllable of a state. Only one first syllable can be taken, and only four states can be started at a time. A player may then take as many additional syllable cards that are available in the open piles for the states they are building, including from uncovered cards.

If a player cannot use any of the top cards or no first syllables are available, the player turns up a new set by putting each top card face down next to each pile. If the player still cannot use any of these newly turned cards, play goes to the next player, who can then turn up a new set if necessary. When all word side facing cards have been used, the next player may turn back over the covered card and use it if they can.

Completed states are set aside and a player can then start a new state, up to four.

When all states are built, the game is over and the largest number of states wins. Alternatively, the largest number of cards may win.

An alternate rule set is included to use the picture side, building up to six states, by matching pictures.

name: Good King Banana
description:
A children's game modelled on pin-the-tail-on-the-donkey, only in this case, the object is to pin bananas in the proper place on a linen-like cloth with bright lithographed cartoon-like characters and the image of a boy holding a banana.

Bananas with green tips go into the fruit bowl, bananas that are all yellow and ripe go into the boy's hand.
The players are blindfolded, and the one who pins his/her banana nearest to its correct position wins.

The game promoted the banana as the healthy "friend of little folks".

name: Protégeons la planète
description:
Book and trivia game for protecting our Planet.

There are 250 cards with trivia questions rather easy, affordable at eight years. When correctly answering to a question, you can take a piece of tree and begin to build.
If the tree has built to be ready the players have saved the Earth.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Trivia

name: SMS Madness
description:
SMS Madness is a card game composed of 50 cards divided into 5 decks of 10 cards : "no look!", "upside down!", "quick!", "nonsense!" and "photo/mms!".
The goal is for the players to send their answers via text messages to the game master.

BEFORE THE GAME
The players have to check the following :
• The numbers of all the players are recorded in their cell phones.
• Their phones make sounds when they receive text messages (bleep, music, etc.)

THE GAME
The first player is the game master. He picks a card and reads the instructions to the other players. Each deck of cards is a particular type of skill challenge :
- "no look!" : the players write and send their SMS without looking at their cell phones.
- "upside down!" : the players write and send their SMS with their telephones upside down.
- "quick!" : the players write their SMS and send them as fast as possible.
- "nonsense!" : the players write a sentence that uses the letters on the card. The letters are the acronyms of a sentence that players make up and send as fast as possible to the game master.
- "photo/mms!" : the players take a picture with their phone and send the MMS to the game master.

When the 1st text message is received, the game master counts down from 10 to 0. Only the messages received between the first SMS and 0 are accepted.
The best text message wins. If more than one is correct, the quickest wins.

Next round, the game master changes, and the former game master becomes a player.

The first player who wins 3 cards wins the game.

name: Quibble Das schnelle Kreuzwortspiel
description:
Objective:
gain as many winning points as possible placing words using crossword approach;
- acting by turn -
comparable with Scrabble, but with following differences:
1. the faster the more points (hour glass) - if you exceed max. time (~30 sec) ==> no points at all
2. the far to the edge the more points
3. no rating for letters
remarks:
even you can play this game with children (no time limit) Noris has published different editions for this segment, too

name: Top Score
description: Australian game. Each player is given a set of four plastic spinning tops in their chosen colour. The board has an area where you should start spinning your tops, and various holes into which you hope a top will fall, giving you points. Any top not falling into a hole does not score. After spinning all your tops, add up your score. Highest score wins.

name: Gedächtnis
description:
Objective: 5 different games for kids to train memory
- 168 images/pictures, 4 large pictured boards -
game 1: memorize as many details of a large picture as possible
game 2: train your associative memory of pictures in combination with colours
game 3: train sequences (similar to game 6)
game 4: memorize as many images as possible
game 5: functional activities (e.g. what belongs into my suitcase?) to describe items
game 6: memorize sequence of cards predicting as many as possible

name: Soldaten Kameraden!
description:
This game is pure pre-WWII propaganda aimed at encouraging Germans to enlist in the military. It is a simple roll-and-move affair, with the objective of reaching the final square first while obeying special instructions for each of the illustrated spaces. The game instructions are printed on the underside of the box lid.

The board has two sides, each with a distinct game and message. The title side shows the wonderful experiences awaiting recruits to the army, navy and air forces: being taught how to make a bed properly by a kindly drill sergeant, learning how to gamble with cards, eating gourmet food from a field kitchen, meeting pretty ladies at a military dance, and engaging in a variety of sports, drama and musical activities. Along the way, recruits also learn how to shoot, how to march, how to swim a river in full kit, how to climb a mast and how to fly, before marching happily out the gate as their service comes to an end.

The second side of the board has a similar roll-and-move game that sends players on a grand tour of a newly expanded Germany. The map shows a Germany that includes Austria and the Sudetenland (with the former borders of Czechoslovakia still outlined), but does not yet extend into Poland. This clearly dates the game to late 1938 or early 1939.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Racing, World War II

name: Script Poker
description:
Script Poker is cardgame with letters played like Texas Hold'em. Five consonant-cards are in the hands of players, five vowel-cards on the table common to all players.
The players bet and then a fourth vowel-card is drawn on the table, The players bet again and the fifth vowel-card is drawn, Players bet last time.
The player whose word has the most consonants win all bets.
The richiest player at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Esel streck' dich!
description:
Objective: gain as many winning points as possible by lobbing/tugging your donkey into target/shed
- acting simultaniously -
game can be played with teams - or round robin
1. place the donkeys on one side of the table
2. starting at the same time each player pulls (very carefully) on a string to move his/her donkey towards the shed
3. construction of the donkey often leads to tumble over - if you haste
4. depending on previous agreed arrangements you may 'rebound' or start again
remarks:
publishing date around mid 1930's

name: Auf Caesars Spuren
description:
In this educational game 3 to 6 players roll a die and move their pawns along a track through ancient Europe (and the Mediterranean , answering questions to collect coins as rewards.

The goal is to have the most coins by the time the game ends, which happens when the bank runs out of coins.

The main purpose of the game is to teach players about ancient Rome.

name: Mako-quilibre
description:
In this game players have basis with some pieces and they must hold a position indicated with special spinner in the time of an hourglass.

Who slips up and let the pieces fall from the basis is removed from the game. Winner is the last player in the game.

name: Es ist zum Kugeln
description:
Objective: move your 5 balls to the outer circle; beaten balls are pushed down - try to keep your very last ball(s) alive

Each turn:

Each player starts moving through the inner circle with 5 balls; as long as the balls are hit by others they must be moved back to their starting point;
As soon as they moved all around the inner circle balls are shifted (transition points) into the outer circle
Hunt all other balls - hitting them they are pushed down delivering winning points to the very last remaining player


The title has a deeper meaning, too: "to be rolling in the aisles"

name: Duck Pins
description: Duck Pins is a bowling game that was created by J Pressman early in the 1900's. Duck pin bowling is a game that is played in the state of Rhode Island and is somewhat similar to the Candlepin Bowling that is done in the Northeast, especially Massachusetts and New Hampshire. Each frame consists of 3 balls and not just two. Unlike Candlepin bowling where the fallen pins stay on the lane as "deadwood" which can be used to help or hinder a second or third shot, in Duck Pins the pins are cleared from the lane before the next shot is taken. One can score a STRIKE, a SPARE or a TEN (3 balls to knock all the pins down!)

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Was bin ich?
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

"Was bin ich?" ("What am I"?) is a small deduction game, comparable to "What's My Line?". The active player straps a card to his forehead and guesses the depicted item, with a maximum of 10 questions. The inactive player(s) answer with yes or no. The first player to score 5 cards wins the game.

The box contains 20 cards and a blue headband.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Piraten-Schatz
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

"Piraten-Schatz" ("Pirate's Treasure"?) is a small roll-and-move game where players compete to collect the most treasure cards. First, a circular board is laid out randomly using the treasure cards (containing treasures in the range from 1-6). Players take turns rolling a d6 and moving the pirate ship clockwise along the treasure cards. When the ship stops at a card, the player may take it if his die result is equal or higher compared to the treasure card. Alternatively, the player may place the conch on the treasure card and roll a second time, potentially getting a second treasure card (or none at all!). The player with the most treasure cards in the end wins the game.

The box contains 21 treasure cards, a wooden pirate ship, a small plastic conch and a die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Spirale à billes
description:
The Spiral Ball is a game of balance. The large ramp gradually gets the balls placed by the players according to dice. When a ball is placed, it may cause to land some other balls placed below.

In his turn player roll the 2 dice, number die indicates number of balls player may place on the spirale and color die indicates the section where the balls must be placed. But be careful of placing the marbles because it may cause the tumble and some of the marbles may roll away from the spirale.

The first player who places all his marbles on the spiral will be the winner.

name: Auf der Reichsautobahn
description:
Der Weg zum Ziel ein deutsches Spiel (subtitle)
Objective: be the first finishing the chosen travel route
- moving by turn -
1 each player chooses a travel route (blue, brown, green, red)
(each route touches 28 cities and 10 'bad luck' places)
1a with more than 4 players routes should be used backwards, too
2 roll the 2 dice (three times) - if the total result shows a number you need to enter a city/place ==> move forward; if not, don't move
3 ending on a place with 'bad luck' follow instructions printed cover inside

remarks:
game was published ~ 1936/8
a few years later ~ 1940 an updated version has been published ==> 'Auf der Reichsautobahn durch Großdeutschland' (Neu-Ausgabe)

name: Auf der Reichsautobahn durch Großdeutschland (Neu-Ausgabe)
description:
Der Weg zum Ziel ein deutsches Spiel (subtitle)
Objective: be the first finishing the chosen travel route
- moving by turn -
1 each player chooses a travel route (blue, brown, green, red)
(each route touches 28 cities and 10 'bad luck' places)
1a with more than 4 players routes should be used backwards, too
2 roll the 2 dice (three times) - if the total result shows a number you need to enter a city/place ==> move forward; if not, don't move
3 ending on a place with 'bad luck' follow instructions printed cover inside

remarks:
game was published ~ 1940
a few years before ~ 1936/8 a predecessor version had been published ==> http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/116974/auf-der-reichsauto...
differences: borders are changed, Austria included, meeples are replaced by pewter cars ==> Fröha, Hilpoltstein (German producer of high quality meeples)
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Phineas and Ferb
description: Phineas and Ferb is an unreleased LEGO Games set that was originally scheduled for release in 2012. Its LEGO set number would have been #3868. It was based on the Disney Channel TV Series "Phineas and Ferb". LEGO dropped the entire LEGO Games product line before this game was released, so it was cancelled. However, the assembly instructions were made available online.

name: Step Game
description: Step Game is for very young players. The goal is to bring the first of his play the other side of the course. One piece consists of two balls attached by a cord. Player roll the color dice and advance his game piece one or the other side to a plot of the color indicated.

name: En-Ar-Co Auto Game
description:
Promotional game published by the National Refining Co., to advertise the brand name En-Ar-Co Motor oil plus White Rose gasoline.

A simple roll and move game with spaces good and bad, and a shortcut of course.

They also supplied a checker's board on the reverse of the Auto Game board.

See Also:

En-Ar-Co Automobile Tour A similar 1919 game also issued by En-Ar-Co, with a different track.

name: For  the Motherland!
description:
For Motherland! is a miniatures game without miniatures, which enables players to fight platoon-level combined arms engagements during WW II.
There will be various types of combat arms. Such as tanks, artillery, AT self-propelled guns, trucks and many more.

Players takes role of officers and leading their platoons towards victory thru different types of objectives. It can be sturm, rescue mission, covert operations behind enemy lines etc. There will be mission generator in future expansions.

Every unit in the game has its own characteristics.
Such as: military drill, speed, attributes, etc.
For officers there will be one more characteristic: Respect. If you are new officer, you must earn Respect from your soldiers if you want command them better.

Everything that players need for a game will be in a core game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Range Rider Stockade Game
description:
Promotional item made to advertise the merits of using Peter Pan bread. It is a simple roll and move game along a track, but it does have a little originality in the shortcuts or detours available. You start at the Peter Pan Ranch and must get to the Range Rider Stockade.

Linked to a TV series.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spectacular Tumble
description:
Spectacular Tumble is a two-player game for the Shibumi set.

Play begins with a full pyramid of balls, two of which are black scoring balls and the rest evenly divided between the players' colors.

Players Red and White take turns removing balls but they may not remove the scoring balls or leave any empty position in the bottom 4x4 layer of the pyramid.

The game ends when there is only a single 4x4 layer of balls; a player scores points when balls of her color are adjacent to the scoring balls.

name: Jamie Swise Mystery Games: Who Killed Lowell Weenaman?
description:
Mystery party game for 3 male and 3 female characters.

Local television personality Lowell Weenaman, better known as Captain Weenie, was found murdered last night at Readenweep Racetrack. Mr. Weenaman was making a personal appearance, in costume, as part of the track's season opening festivities. The Captain Weenie Show, which totally lost its school age audience years ago, had become the rage of the age 25 to 45 crowd. While scratchy cartoons and local magicians provided the bulk of the show's content, the program took on grotesque proportions when Weenaman peddled his Captain Weenie VCR Covers and Weenamagic, a do-it-all food processor.

This is a role playing game for 6 players, great for a fun evening. The suspect characters include three local T.V. news personalities, a female sulky driver, a state racing board official, and a track character named Paddock Pete. Cast yourself and friends in these roles and play to learn who murdered this most unusual nostalgia act.

The Time: December 1, 1985 The Place: Galesburg, OH

Note: This game includes an audio cassette tape which, although not mandatory, is played at the start to set the mood.

name: Michael Jordan's Cosmic Court
description: Cosmic Court is a children's game based off of the Warner Brothers movie Space Jam starring Michael Jordan and the Looney Tunes Cartoon Characters. You play as Michael Jordan, spinning and moving around the 3D board. This game could be classified as a low dexterity game, as you attempt to make "shots" by throwing a small purple basketball at the court to make a basket.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Play Ball with Atlantic..
description:
A baseball game that encourages people to smoke whilst playing.

It is a game that you play with a lit cigarette. It has pieces of paper on which you guess if the play will be a single, double, triple or out. When the center of the paper that has a baseball field printed on it is touched with a lit cigarette the paper burns and I assume somehow t is an indicator of whether the play is an out, single, double or triple.

The fact that one or two of these games have survived is a miracle.

name: Ziunta
description:
Ziunta is a trivia game with questions - answers about the Soule, part of the Basque country in France.

Each player is one of the typical character of the world of Soule and shall, for each person, together six items belonging to his character.

For this, the player navigate with his character on the game board, representing the map of the Soule rolling the dice, and answering the questions.

The questions relate to the Soule and offer three choices each time. They can be read in French (front) or Basque (back). In addition, on each card, there is a small comment about local culture.

With correct answers players continue his move and thus increase its chances of hitting the boxes to win needed objects.

The first player to fill the carton with 6 objects wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hans im Glück
description:
Objective: win most money if dice show 2 or 3 matching symbols
- acting by turn -
1. each player buys in - pays same amount of money into the bank
2. each player's individual wager is put onto the board
3. active player rolls the 3 d6 dice (numbers/colours/symbols):
if 2 of them show correspondent tops (the right way up ==> see board image) you'll get 12 times the money you bet; 3 matching tops: 36 times
no matching top: bank wins
game stops after agreed time or if bank goes bankrupt
remarks:
game was published ~ 1920
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Josef Rösler

name: Wirbel auf dem Ponyhof
description:
Horse-themed dexterity/action game for children.

Components: one metal tin, one cardboard chit, 40 cards

The first player to collect 6 cards wins the game. The cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table. The active player puts the metal tin on or next to the cards, compresses its lid and places the chit on the lid. Then the lid is compressed at the sides, which catapults the chit into the air. If the chit doesn't land on one of the cards, the active player selects a card to be returned to the box and it's the next player's turn.
If the chit does land on a card, the active player turns that card over and does what the card requires: text-based cards are read aloud and the player tries to complete the task (e.g. pretending to be an excited horse, making a few steps on all fours with a book on one's back). If he/she is successful, he/she earns that card. Other cards are earned by being the fastest to grab the tin or the chit. If the chit lands on the tin, the active player gets to steal a card from another player.

The game ends when one player has collected 6 cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game

name: SuperPo
description:
Each player has strips of images of different sizes that will position on the board in order to match his illustrations, overlapping with those already in place on the game board.
The winner is the one with the fewer images on hand at the end of the game where the deck is exhausted..

name: Clubhouse Baseball Card Game
description:
Baseball Card Game "Club-House Baseball". Invented by an ardent Canadian fan and fine tuned by Ernie Harwell, Hall Of Fame announcer and the voice of WJR Detroit and the Detroit Tigers, contains every conceivable play in baseball.

Two decks 69 home team (white) and 69 visiting team (blue) plus 13 pinch hit cards (red) are the cards you need to play 9 innings of baseball in 10-15 minutes.

RULES:
Shuffle the two decks separately and place face down. Visiting Team (blue) turns over cards until there are three out. Home Team White) repeats this procedure until one inning is completed. If for instance, a "stolen base", "passed ball", etc. is turned up with no runners o base it is disregarded.

S1 and D1 cards simply advance a runner an extra base as compared to to ordinary singles and doubles.

Pinch Hit cards can be used only from the seventh inning until the end of the game. They cannot be used with bases empty. They must be re-shuffled after each use.

Pitching Change cards - Defensive team has the option of changing pitchers. If accepted, each team must re-shuffle all cards and discards in own deck.

READ EACH CARD. Every game situation is covered.

name: Zig Zag
description:
A children's game that promotes colour recognition, attention and fine motor skills.

Components:
- 1 wooden shirt
- 16 wooden buttons
- 1 wooden needle with thread
- 1 spinner
- 10 winning chips

The active player spins the spinner that is shaped like a pair of scissors. The player chooses one of the two colours selected by the spinner and gets a button in the corresponding colour. If the player already has a button of the same colour he/she is allowed to sew it onto the wooden shirt and receives a winning chip. The first player to collect three chips wins the game.

name: Kolorosuite
description:
Four cards is placed in the middle of the players with the different color lines.
In his turn player must place one of the three card from his hand on the table so that it follows the line and the sequence of decreasing or increasing numbers with the other cards on the table. If player can't play a card he draws a new card, places it if possible or passes. The game ends if any player gets rid of his cards. He is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Bobadaboum
description:
A game of manipulation and concentration.
The goal is to earn as much Bojonautes cards as possible by building a tower made ​​up of plates and modules that are in balance!

In his turn player places a star board or module on the star board until the demanded number of modules are on this board.
If the player places the new star board he wins 1 Bojonautes card. If the player places the last board of last module succesfully wins 2 Bojonautes card.
If the tower breaks then... Bobadaboum the party continues from the start.
When all Bojonautes cards have been won the game ends. Who has the greates number of these cards wins the game.

Contents:

9 Bojonautes cards
4 "star" boards
16 modules

name: JBT Interceptor
description:
Trivia game where players move around the board answering the questions about sports, culture, techincs, history etc.
Correct answers are rewarded with point-cards
Player who accumulates 10 point-cards, must answer the final question to win the game.

name: La Bourre
description:
Racing game of bikers.
The goal is to complete the first ten laps of the neighborhood on the game board first. In his turn player roll the dice and advance the number indicated. There are some obstacles like : radar, traffic lights, ice etc. and some special cards allow to neutralize these to move at full speed
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scottyopoly
description:
The object of the game is to gain wealth or influence by owning events and power points/chips which each represent 10,000 protestors at your event. Wealth & Influence win the game. Being driven to Poverty produces the loser.

A Monopoly-inspired game for 1-4 players inspired by Wisconsin politics in early 2011.

name: California Trivia
description: A Monopoly type game featuring different colored landing spots which requires answering trivia questions about the state of California. A roll of the dice determined which kind of question had to be answered in order to move on to another space.

name: À l'attaque!!!
description:
Distribute all the cards between the players. Everyone keeps his cards face down in front of him without looking.
In his turn player turns a card face up in the middle of the table.

If it is a "Gauls", it nothing happens.
If it is a "Roman", The first who shouts it wins all the cards from the table. He shuffles his cards and continues the play.
If it is "Boar" The first who shouts "Pig"! draws 2 cards from any any players.

Player who wins all the cards is the winner.

name: Mit dem KDF Wagen durch Großdeutschland
description:
Objective: be the first reaching the target & back passage
- moving by turn -
choose a route e.g. North-South A: Flensburg-Hamburg-Hanover-Nuremberg-Munich-Vienna
each player rolls the die - ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on the board (e.g. slow down, roll an odd number, move back...)
after target was reached/passed turn back to starting point
board shows alternative routes
remarks:
game was published ~ 1940 - at least 2 different editions
inspired by a test drive 1938 done by engineers of VW, comparing the new developed VW with Opel, Ford cars...
meeples: the well known/wanted 'Fröha' cars
rare collector's item
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Astérix: Les Baffes
description:
There are 28 cards in this game: 20 "slap" cards + 8 "special" cards.

The object is to provide a maximum of slaps to the Romans!

In his turn player draws a card and keep it face up in front of him.
"Baffes": slap cards - these are the points you earn in battle.
"Banquet" pass the next round, it's time for wild boar!
"Julius Caesar" give your best card "slap" to your neighbor on the right.
"Magic Potion" your neighbor left his cards mixed and makes you draw a card at random!

When all the cards were drawn, each one counts the number of data slaps to the Romans. Whoever has the most slaps won!

name: Safari Parc
description: In Safari Park, players try to become expert zoologists. To achieve this, they must travel through the various animal parks and answer the questions about animals and nature. They must choose wisely which parks to visit according to the card objectives that they receive at the beginning of the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Travel, Trivia

name: Scavenger
description:
Remember when you were young and you would look out the window on road trips and name off the out-of-state license plates that passed by? What about the different road signs? Scavenger has turned this travel activity into a travel game, perfect for your next road trip.

Scavenger travel games are compact travel tins with magnetic game pieces. Each magnet represents the images (either license plates or road signs) you need to find.

How to play:
Each player receives a travel tin. While traveling look for the license plates or road signs that you still need. Mark off your finds by moving the matching magnets over to the other side. The person who finds the most is the winner.

The game was designed for multiple players but works equally well as a solo game.

name: Fooba-Rou Quarterback Football Game
description: This is a simple spin the spinner game. The spinner has a metal ball that is spun around and where it stops determines the result of the play. You are the quarterback and you can either chose to spin the Running Spinner or try to throw using the Passing Spinner in order to get results for the play. There is also a Extra Point/Kickoff/Field Goal Spinner and a Punt Spinner.

name: Match & Matrimony
description:
In Match & Matrimony you are trying to marry your daughters off during the British Regency era.

The game is played over a number of rounds. Each round two eligible suitors are available to be won. Each player secretly chooses a daughter to send in an attempt win over one the suitors. Each daughter has unique values in 4 attributes, and each suitor has a preference for one attribute. Some suitors are worth more than others, and in addition players are attempting to collect sets of suitors to increase their worth.

All but one of your daughters will be married by the end of the game, so it is important to choose suitors wisely. It's not enough to marry your daughters to just anyone.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Livid Visage
description:
Livid Visage is a combat based Card Game where you control a team of characters to defeat your opponents crew. Play events to manipulate the board state and get livid.

Each player constructs a 40 card deck from a set pack that contains all the cards of the game. The game starts with each player putting in to play a character with powers 3,2,1,0 from their deck and as the game progresses each player is allowed to play a new character in their character zones. Each player has 5 character zones in which they can play characters in. Additionally there are Event cards that help players manipulate the board state and acquire an edge over the opponent.

The goal of the game is to defeat all of the opposing characters and leave your opponent with no characters to defend with. When this happens that player loses the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Country Music Celebrity Game
description: This game pits players against each other in a country music star setting. The objective of the game is to make it all around the board and arrive in Music City with the most money. Players roll the dice to get to destinations or complete objectives like getting a hit record where each player will either be rewarded or have to pay. "Stars on tour"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Leap Frog!
description:
Leap Frog! is a game for 2-4 players. In Leap Frog! each player takes control of a frog in a pond filled with lily pads of varying heights. Players then hop their frogs between lily pads in an attempt to eat a variety of different flies. At the end of the game, each player counts the point value of the flies his or her frog has eaten. The frog that has had the tastiest meal (scored the most points) is the winner.

The movement/hopping mechanic in Leap Frog! uses a small deck of cards, containing distance values between 1 and 4. In order to hop to a lily pad, a player must play a card from his hand equal to the distance of the jump. Leap Frog uses a simple, yet novel, system to determine jumping distance, which takes into account both the number of spaces and the height a frog must jump.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Cric Crac Croc
description:
Each player rolls the dice and moves on the course to finish in the home of an animal or the house of all animals.

From the house of all animals, the player chooses the food for the animal of their choice.

When a player arrives at the home of an opponent's animal which has all types of food collected, he can steal chosen food..

Whoever has the most food at the end wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Four-handed Chivalry
description:
This four-handed pure abstract has both partnership and individual versions. The object is to capture all opponents' pieces.

Pieces jump like in checkers but in all directions and can jump (without capturing) friendly pieces before capturing any opponents' pieces. So the jumps can become very complex.

Uusually a clear vitor will emerge before the final pieces are atually taken-- but not always.

For those familiar with Chivalry (1888) or Camelot (1930):

Four-Handed Chivalry uses the standard Chivalry board, but is very different in several ways from the standard Chivalry game, as well as from Camelot or any Camelot variant:

1. Unlike all other Camelot variants, only Knights are used.

2. Unlike all other Camelot variants, the solitary object of the game is to capture all opposing Knights; moving Knights into a Castle has no significance.

3. Unlike Grand Camelot, in the partnership version of Four-Handed Chivalry, partners sit opposite each other, and move rotation passes clockwise around the table.

name: Grand Cam
description:
Grand Cam is a four-player analog of the game Cam. This is a partnership pure abstract game. Partners sit next to each other. To win, one player has to move a piece into the goal opposite his pieces' starting position or all the losing partnership's pieces must be captured.

This has the marked differences in play between Camelot and Cam combined with two pairs of immediate opponents whose pieces generally move in directions orthogonal to each other.

The design of the Grand Cam piece setup and the design and construction of the first Grand Cam game board in 2005 owe themselves to WCF member Paul Bramwell Smith, who is deservedly acknowledged as the game's inventor.

Grand Cam is different than Grand Camelot in the following ways:

1. The Grand Cam board has 93 squares. The Grand Camelot board has 180 squares.

2. Each side in Grand Cam has two Knights and five Men. Each side in Grand Camelot has four Knights and eight Men.

name: Tri-Camelot
description:
Ostesibly a 3-handed analog of Camelot, this game bares some resemblance to Cam in that it has a single goal each player must protect. Additionally the board is markedly different than any game in the Camelot family and uses hexagons.

The game is a three-handed pure abstract. Each player protects a single goal space from both opponents.
