In spite of the name, this game is a three-handed version of Cam, not Camelot in that the first first to enter a goal wins and so ends the game. Often this means that a player can block one but not both opponents. Hence these games can end suddenly and kingmaking can be involved.

name: Spillway
description: A 2-player abstract game created for the Shibumi Challenge. Players attempt to connect opposite sides of the board with their color, but doing so clears all of your marbles out of the spillway!

name: Animaux et Réserves de France
description:
Attractive trivia game, centred around the players' knowledge of animals within the regions of France. The six areas deemed to have these animals resident in them, are Vanoise, Corse, Pyrénées, Camargue, Armorique and Lorraine.

Each player receives animal tiles which act like jigsaw puzzle pieces i.e. they fit onto the board thus filling the map-board of France. To place a piece you must answer a question correctly. The questions, of course, are related to the subject of the game. First to place all their pieces, wins.

name: Géorami
description:
Educational game about the geography of France. It has a board showing all the separate regions of the country, but it is really a card game,

Three 'Contracts' are revealed. The contract might say "Regions that begin with the same letter", that sort of thing. Each player has 10 cards and can claim a contract if you reveal the cards asked for. Each contract is worth points - easy to do might be 3 points, more difficult 6 points, very difficult 10 points. When a contract is taken another one replaces it.

The first player to obtain 10 contracts scores the points on each contract, plus two points for each contract that another player has less then ten, plus 20 points for going out first. The player with the highest score, wins.

name: Über Land und Meer
description:
Objective: find as many of wanted nations/capitals as possible

- acting by turn/simple 'draw & place' geographic game -

Flip tiles upside down
Draw a tile (flag/capital) and find the corresponding place on the map(s)
6 different maps Africa, Asia, Australia and Oceania, Europe, North America & Central America, South America.
Remarks:
Version held by National Library of Australia dated 1890s.
The individual maps were subsequently updated, another version having maps showing borders as follows: South America ~ 1905, Africa ~ 1885, Europe ~ 1920.

name: Eisenbahn-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
roll the die - ending on a marked space draw a card and follow instructions
remarks
huge board: 49 x 71.5 cm (19.3" x 28.1")
cover shows 3 well known mountains: Eiger, Mönch, Jungfrau.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: The Hunt: Carpathia, 1897
description:
The Hunt: Carpathia, 1897 is a period specific tabletop adventure game, set in the dangerous monster-ridden land of Carpathia.

Players of The Hunt will take turns moving around the game board, fighting monsters, avoiding hazards, collecting bounties, and trying to kill one another - all while trying to find better weapons and gear. Ultimately they want to take down one of the unique Prey monsters, each of whom grants a unique ability to their vanquisher.

Weapons, items, monsters and hazards are all represented on detailed cards with unique art relevant (we hope) to the time period. Players roll dice (d8) to move and attack, using their own special abilities and items to their best advantage. Each player is one of 6 unique characters, each with different strengths.

Death in The Hunt is by no means final - when a player loses all vitality points (players start with and have a max of 3) he/she is turned into a "cursed" player, remains on the board with new abilities, and is now turned against the remaining live players. Nobody is ever "out of the hunt."

Players battle monsters and each other earning trophy points for each monster vanquished. A player must collect a certain number of trophy points and make it back to the ship for the win! If all players become cursed, the cursed player with the most trophy points wins.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Sploink
description:
The first dexterity game using the Shibumi set!

Players roll their marbles onto the board (using paper as a ramp) to score points and multipliers.

Who can Zing the pyramid?

(Note, it is recommended to play this only with the Ninja set. Game may damage marbles from the Samurai set.)

name: Play Trays Sound & Sort Game
description: Sound/picture matching game for 1 or 2 players. Players pick picture tiles and must deduce the first letter of the matching word. Supplied with non-competitive rules.

name: River Plate
description:
A Naval Game, British made with Prov Pat No 2649. "River Platte". produced by Victory Games during World War II. Features a large scaled down model of a ship along with some miniature ships in different colors used by the players as player pieces. Also is sort of a search board numbered from 1-100 where different spaces might produce attacks by the enemy.

From Ebayer daviddunne who I have contacted for more info about the game

name: Tru-Action Electric Horse Race Game
description: By Tudor. Game features vibrating base turned on by electricity. Line the horses up and watch them race around the track to see who crosses the finish line first. Bet on who wins the race.

name: Major League Baseball Game
description: By GABRIEL from the 1950's. A game featuring spinners and 6 plastic men. Spin the spinner to see what happens in the game

name: Spack
description:
Spack is a two-player game for the Shibumi set.

The board is initially empty. Each player ownes 24 balls (8 white, 8 black, 8 red)

Players take turns adding one of their balls.
Under certain conditions, they can return balls to their supply too.

The game ends, as soon as a player can´t make a legal move.

The winner is determined by the number of balls, the players have left.

Spack is an entry in the Shibumi Challenge.

name: Narrspelet
description:
Old cardgame published in Sweden probably in the 40s or 50s.

You try to complete pair of two cards by taking one card from your neighbour. If you get a pair you put down the cards infront of you. The first one who get rids of all the cards win.

name: Das Quiz der Schlager & Volksmusik
description:
Objective: move to finish line knowing correct answers on questions out of the world of German Schlager music
- moving/acting by turn -
roll the die, move forward, draw a correspondent card, find correct answer (out of 4 - multiple choice); questions like (samples):
Andrea Berg was married with? Adamo - which nationality?
Flippers, Peter Alexander, Kastelruther Spatzen ... songs, text

content: 1 board - 2 different maps, 110 cards, 6 meeples, 2 Joker-meeples, 1 die, rules
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: The One True King
description:
The King is dead and three powerful Lords vie for the throne. They will use everything in their power to win (Military Power, Allies, Knights, Nobles, Spies, the church, mercenaries, whatever it takes). Although 3 contend for the crown, in the end there can only be ONE TRUE KING!

In the game, each player plays out 3 columns of cards consisting of Knights, Nobles, Allies, and Army units. The total strengths of the columns are compared. Then, Intrigue Cards are played to change the balance of power. Intrigue Cards include assassinations, bribery, desertions, reserves, etc. The final column strengths are revealed and the player who wins 2 of the 3 columns is the victor.

name: Overkill: Last Man Standing
description:
Overkill: Last Man Standing is a board game about space ships, guns and blood! The players control a spaceship crew fighting against the invaders.

This game has a deck of cards, four dice, eight paper figures, a game board and the rulebook.

Each player controls four soldiers lost in a space station. Every turn, you move your soldiers in the game board, finding items (by buying cards) and fighting the other players in order to survive.
There is three missions: Steal data (Capture the flag), Invasion ( Time race ) and Overkill (Last Man Standing). In each mission you need to remake your strategy to win.

name: Battlejack
description:
Battlejack is a player versus player high-stakes mock gambling game. Players Draft their Fighters in secret. Actions are resolved using Blackjack but the players play versus each other instead of a dealer. The players are gamblers who create electronic avatars to fight in a virtual arena. Players may use the included Fighters, or create a custom Fighter using a combination of Abilities and Gear. Players also have a Cheat which breaks the rules and an Exploit which gives your Fighter a huge short term boost. Momemtum Tokens are earned for successfully attacking and defending and can be used to increase a Fighter's Abilities.

Game Flow:
Players may have their Fighter Run or Attack on their turn. If they Attack, the player may wager points on the Attack, if the Attack hits, it deals additional damage based upon the size of the wager. If the Attack misses, the wager is lost. Attack damage is also modified by weapon type and a random damage element based upon margin of success.

When a Fighter runs out of points they die. A Buy In oppurtunity allows players to bring their Fighter back into the Arena. In the end the last Fighter standing in the Arena wins the match.

An additional copy of Battlejack may be used at the same to increase the number of players from 2-4 to 5-8.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Combat in the Lists
description:
Combat in the Lists is a small hand to hand combat game/simulator that incorporates card management and strategy.

During the medieval period skilled knights were famous throughout the land and the lords of the realm would hold grand tournaments to demonstrate the skills of each knights in his service. These tournaments brought together knights from across the realm to fight for glory and honor. “Combat in the lists” is a game of hand-to-hand combat that pits knight against knight in pitch battle. These battles were never fought to the death and the weapons used were usually dull or blunted to render an opponent unconscious but sometimes deaths did occur. It wasn’t uncommon for a battle in the list to last for hours and end only when the last knight was left standing. It was this lone knight that was honored as the tournament champion.

The goal of the tournament was to be the last knight standing inside the list!

Some of the objectives and actions within Combat in the lists:

1. 7 possible movement obtions
2. Multiple attack and defense possibilities
3. Sneak Attacks
4. Backside attacks
5. Pushed from hex - As you take damage you can get knocked into another hex
6. Knocked Down - Get hit hard and you could get knocked down
7. Multiple weapons that are used in either the Right or Left hand during battle
8. Your weapon could get knocked out of your hand
9. Special type of Attacks and Defenses
10. A revolutionary Attack and Defense system with multiple defense stages

Now WEAPON SPECIFIC ATTACK RESULTS
1. BROKEN BONES
2. SPRAINED WRIST
3. PUSH from HEX and KNOCKED DOWN
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Motim Pirata
description:
Motim Pirata (Pirate Riot) is a fun dice game were the players are pirates in the same ship trying to take the ship from the captain.
In this dice game, every die represents a pirate that you need to turn on you side to make a riot and than take the ship. Rolling the dice you have, you choose one of them and use its spacial. There is three kinds of active pirates (dice): Thug (represented by the red dice; the one that can kill another pirate), Smart (represented by the blue dice; the one that can recruit one more pirate to you side) and Drunk (represented by the green dice; useless but you can use them insted of any other die when kill). There is the captain die (represented by a black die). When you have enough thugs, you can make the riot. You roll all the red dice and the sum must be equal or greater than the sum of the captain die plus his mates, you win. Otherwise you loose and your dice goes to the captain.

name: Zum Schulanfang
description:
Objective: be the first entering space '100' (finish school)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
Roll the die - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside
remarks:
published ~ mid 1950's

name: Die Grosse Walze
description:
Objective:
A.) become owner of 'Die Grosse Walze' ='Big Barrel' catching more than 50 % of your opponents - or
B.) save most of your meeples (more than any other); but 'Big Barrel' must catch less than 50 % of all, only
- moving by turn; sequence: green, yellow, red, blue -
1 roll the die inserting all of your meeples (8) first
2 try to become owner of 'Big Barrel' (roll '1' after you've entered space 12)
3a if successful: remove all your meeples and chase the rest (1 step forward per turn)
3b if not: optimize your number of saved meeples (back to starting point, allowed only with matching numbers)
remarks:
coproduction with 'Elo Spiele'

name: Revolt and Revolution
description:
Revolt and Revolution is the newest offering from our strategic partnership with Victory Point Games, and the first game we are producing from their immensely popular States of Siege series. The idea for this and future volumes is to thematically take two existing titles from VPG's States of Siege line and add a third as-yet-unpublished game to the pack to create a GMT boxed set using larger counters, full sized cards, and mounted maps, all utilizing the talents of GMT's art and production team.

The States of Siege game system from Victory Point Games features solitaire play in which the player is thrust into the role of defending a central position from attackers advancing on a number of fronts using area movement. Event cards provide the challenges and opportunities players use to fend off defeat while they battle for victory. Each game in the series introduces new elements to the robust game engine and expands the possibilities of what can be simulated. With each event card, players have a variety of actions possible but are limited by the number of action points on a given turn...in a States of Siege game there are just never enough points to get all the things done they would like.

Revolt and Revolution puts the player at the center of the epic clashes of ideology and culture in Europe through the 17th, 18th, 19th and 20th centuries. You, the player, get to participate in the conflicts of Divine Right vs Parliamentarianism, Absolutism vs Republicanism, and Despotism vs Bolshevism. You'll rub (simulated) elbows around your game table with King Charles I and Cromwell, King Louis XVI and Robespierre, Czar Nicholas II and Lenin, and participate in historic conflicts as Cavaliers battle Roundheads, Monarchists battle Jacobins, and 'Whites' battle 'Reds' across the fields, towns and cities of England, France and Russia. The outcome of these wars changed the face of Europe and the World forever.

The titles in Revolt and Revolution are dynamic -- your decisions affect the course of events in both the short and long term. Unlike most historical games which enforce a linear outcome and constrain you to the path of history, in the States of Siege game system your decisions and strategies can alter the existing timeline. Now you have a chance to take command and make history or change it!

The first game in the pack is by series creator Darin Leviloff. Soviet Dawn: The Russian Civil War, 1918-1921: The Russian Civil War 1918 - 1921 puts you in the position of defending the Bolshevik Revolution from the array of 'White' forces bent on its destruction. Can you deal with the great crises of that time and defend the revolution? Will you withdraw from the Great War (WWI) or exercise the Bukharin Option and fight on? Can you execute the Czar in time, or will the 'Whites' rescue him? Will you fortify Petrograd or press your offensives home? How will you deal with internal and external dissent? These are just some of the challenges to meet as you decide the fate of Communism in the 20th century. Revolt and Revolution will include both the base game Soviet Dawn and its expansion pack.

The second game in the tri-pack is from series developer John Welch. Levee En Masse: The Wars of the French Revolution 1789 - 1802 puts you in the position of defending the Republican Revolution from forces both within and outside of France, during the tumultuous years of the French. Can you suppress the forces of Monarchy and Despotism to maintain the Republican spirit in France? Can you export the revolution by liberating neighboring states and creating sister Republics? Will you be able to keep order in Paris as it suffers from riot after riot? Can you rally your armies to defeat those of rival European states like Britain, Prussia and Austria? These are just a few of the obstacles you must overcome to end Monarchy and bring forth the era of Republican government that will transform Europe in the 19th century. Revolt and Revolution will include both the base game Levée en Masse and its expansion pack.

The third game in Volume I is a never-before-published game in the States of Siege series! John Welch's Cruel Necessity: The English Civil Wars 1640-1653: The English Civil Wars 1640 - 1653 puts you in charge of Puritanism and Parliament and their attempts to usher in the Reformation and Age of Reason. Can you create a fighting force capable of defeating the Royalist Armies of Charles I? Can you foster Puritan religious reforms while suppressing those of your rival Protestants and hated Catholics? Can you forge an alliance with the Covenanters of Scotland and prevent them for going over to the King? Can you manage the rebellions in Ireland without draining too many men and resources to do so? These are just some of the dilemmas you must balance in order to bring an end to Divine Right Monarchy and usher in the Age of Revolution. The GMT edition will include a grand tactical combat mini-game in addition to the base game of Cruel Necessity - after all, what fun would an English Civil War game be without the charge of cavalry and the push-of-pikes?

Components:

● Three 17" x 22" mounted maps
● 88 Large Square counters
● 56 Round counters
● 180 Event cards (60 for each game)
● Three 10-page Rules booklets (one for each game)
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Velocipede Wedrennen
description:
A late Victorian game which looks a lot like an English game called Bikee from roughly the same vintage. In the Bikee game, the board is assembled by laying cards next to each other but here there is a more traditional board. The graphics are extremely similar.

Velocipede Wedrennen is a promotional game for Mado & Co Utrecht (still in business today but now Mado B.V. Utrecht). 1981 was the company's 50th anniversary so that would explain why they might like promotional game.

The game is a simple roll and move game. If you land on the illustrated spaces, you must follow the instructions (Miss a Go, Go Forward 3 spaces, that sort of thing).

name: Confetti The Clown
description:
Objective:
place Confetti The clown on the board, trying to match three colours before the time runs out & completing your puzzle
- acting by turn -
roll the three coloured dice:
try to match the 3 colours with Confetti before the hour glass runs out
successful: complete your puzzle step by step
remarks:
game was republished by Merit J & L Randall 1969

name: Krypto Fraction Supplement
description: This expansion of twenty fraction cards can be added to the base Krypto deck. Aside from removing the prohibition against fractions from the basic game, play remains the same

name: The Fifth Horseman
description:
The Four Horsemen... They’ve always been here. Whenever humanity has stepped too close to the abyss, they’ve come. Often taking the guise of whatever was causing the Apocalypse of that particular age. The Fall of Rome, the Black Plague, World War 2, they were here. Ready to help usher in the end of man. United in the goal, but never the means. Because of this, either by some sort of grand plan or merely by chance, a balance has formed, preserving the time of man again and again. The Horsemen’s individual desires to be "The One" to snuff the candle of mankind’s light actually thwarting the very event they hoped to cause. Then came the Zombie Apocalypse, and again they came. War, relishing the conflict and self destruction of humans- now even after death. Famine, bringing hunger and desperation to both the living and the undead. Pestilence, with pain and suffering that could last this time even after one’s last breath was drawn. And finally Death, savoring the slow rot of a person’s demise more than ever before. But this time they weren’t alone. A Fifth Horseman has also come. One that could never exist before now. A Horseman born of music, technology, and the anger of a species on the brink. Will this new Horseman break the ages old balance that has existed and finally bring about the end of us all? Or is something else at play?

The Fifth Horseman is a 2 Player game where the aim is to bring about the end of man by defeating your fellow Horsemen and laying sole claim to the final Apocalypse. You accomplish this by landing various Strikes that lower your opponent’s Life and Hand Size, as well as increasing your own. The Fifth Horseman uses 6 sided hex cards that allow each card the ability to use one of 6 different effects (Strikes). Victory is achieved when your opponent is depleted of Life points.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Music, Zombies

name: The New Game Aphelion or The Race to the Sun
description:
A game where the players follow different orbis with the aim to reach the centre of the board.

Players all contribute a number of counters to the Pool before the game starts Movement is by the roll of one die. When you land on certain spaces you will probably be told to add or take some counters from the Pool

The intention was that this game would educate people about the known Solar System of the time.

name: Tacotac
description:
A dominoes game for 1 to 4 players, on the theme of road traffic, by the author of the 1000 bornes.

RULES OF THE GAME

The box is placed flat and serves as a model.

A "contiguous" fragment is a fragment extending properly, either in the longitudinal direction or in the width direction, the image portion represented by the fragments or neighbors. Two neighboring fragments only by the edges should not be considered contiguous.

A "bad" fragment is one that involves a road user committing a careless or a contravention of the rules of the road. These fragments are shaded and numbered on the image model.

Mix all the fragments of the game, then share them with partners.

The first player chooses a piece and places. If he has a fragment neighbor, he also raises, etc. Each fragment must be placed with the previous close.

The next player selected a fragment close to the last set by the previous player, and the pose. He can continue, if another fragment placed next to last, etc.

If there is in the game, a hole (empty space on all sides by fragments), or a slot (slot in the periphery of the image), it is possible to plug this hole or that niche instead of asking a neighbor of the last fragment. Every time a player mouth hole or a slot, he can play again and where he wants to continue to ask neighboring fragments.

A player can pass. If all players pass, the one whose turn to play may be a fragment anywhere near a fragment already made.

The winner is the first who got rid of all its fragments. The other players count how many they have left fragments. The "bad" fragments are worth 4 points unless the player may explain the mistake, In this case, it counts two points.

name: Quer durch die Welt
description:
Objective: be the first walking round the map & arriving at starting point by finding wanted terms first
- acting/moving by turn -
1 active player draws a card & gives a hint about wanted term
e.g. Italy (wanted is Colosseum)
2 left player asks for a letter the term probably contains
2a if the answer is matching (e.g. 'e') a slide with the letter 'e' is placed on position 7 of the letter field on the board
2b if not next player may guess
3 first player who makes a correct guess about the wanted term may move forward number of (still) missing letters (max. 5)
categories: Dice, Educational, Racing, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mit den Sputniks um die Erde
description:
Objective: be the first returning from space trip
- moving by turn -
1. reset the three big wheels (adjust them showing 'Ende')
2. roll the die & move forward - choosing 1 of the 3 large circles
3. meeting an 'obstacle' - rockets or sputnik - your roll must move your meeple excact into it (rear position)
3a. no matching move ==> rest
3b. matching move ==> turn your wheel one position forward
4. move according die roll
5. turning wheel: if the message 'Ende' appears - good job
categories: Children's Game, Political, Racing, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Skepp ohoj
description: Old swedish game published by Aristogame. The goal of the game is to transport gargo from all over the world back home to Sweden. It is a simple roll-and-move game and each player has their own ship that they move around on the board to reach all continents. Each continent has some plastic chips representing goods that you brin back home.

name: Campingspelet
description:
Old swedish cardgame about camping.
Published by Charts before 1950.

The game consist of cards in for colors between 1-11. The first players starts with playing one card and the other player must play a card in hte same color. The highest card wins. The goal is to win as many and high card as possible but at the same ttime avoid all nines. In the end the one whit the least nines wins. If two players has the same amount of nines the one with highest cards win.

name: CAPUA
description:
In Capua players try to make a name and fortune with gladiators.
Buy gladiators and send them into the arena to win victories for the Lanista and fortune and honor to his Ludus.

The game takes place in four phases
- Auction of gladiators
- Fighting in arena
- Negotiation
- Maintenance of ludus

An auction game, where we must be careful what gladiators opponents are recruiting, and what they might plan to do with them.

A fighting game, where through the dices players give order to the gladiators.

A game of negotiation, where the alliances can cover some lanista with gold - but not for long, as a rich Ludus covet the treacherous eyes of others. And in the end only one can win.

An easy game to learn and play, with a dynamic auction, combat and negotiation that never becomes repetitive, and where alliances shift like the roll of a die.

Dare to be the best lanista of Capua! Conduct the Gladiators to Glory!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Viecherei
description:
Objective: build as many 'matching' animals with your puzzle pieces as possible
acting by turn
1 turn the puzzle pieces of 6 animals (total 24) upside down
2 roll the coloured die and pick a correspondent puzzle piece
3 try to form/build/complete an animal; only a completed one will deliver winning points - fantasy or real - both are accepted

name: Monopolio Comercial: Conociendo Santiago
description: This version of Monopoly set in Santiago, Chile uses local streets and commercial districts. It features attractive reproductions of bank notes from Banco de Chile.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Space Fleet Alpha
description:
This game draws its inspiration from and aims to re-create the large scale space battles of Star Wars and Babylon 5. The premise for SPACE FLEET ALPHA is simple, to be the last man standing in a great big battle royale between a number of opposing starship fleets.

At the start of the game each player elects to represent one of the six available factions, each of which has a unique technological advantage and disadvantage and then is dealt a number of cards face up. Players then take turns using their cards to attack and destroy their opponents' cards until all other players have been eliminated. Depending on players play styles, the gameplay can be brutally fast and efficient with fleets of ships disappearing in the blink of an eye or slow and tense as players nip at each other's heels.

Cards are roughly divided into ship cards, which are the most numerous and the main targets of your opponent's fleet, and bonus cards which perform a variety of special abilities ranging from defensive shields, technological bonuses, reinforcements, espionage cards and thermonuclear warheads. The first thing to realize when playing SPACE FLEET ALPHA is that the playing field is definitely not level and no two games will ever play out the same. The random nature of the deal ensures that one player will always start out on top however, fortunes can quickly change requiring players to adapt their strategy accordingly. In order to deal with this, the game actively encourages the weaker players to ally against stronger opponents as well as use any leverage they might have to blackmail other players into doing their bidding for them.

Of course these temporary situations only last for so long as there can be only one winner and its this aspect of the game that makes it so exciting to play. While SPACE FLEET ALPHA can be played with 2 players, the game really starts to shine with a group of 4 or more players. Independantly designed and published, SPACE FLEET ALPHA can be ordered direct from the website of the publisher The Game Crafter which prints, produces and ships the game on demand. Overall SPACE FLEET ALPHA is definitely worth a look for anyone into space battles and looking for something on the lighter side that can be played by anyone.
publishers: Gravitysoft Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Stalingrad II
description:
Published in S&T in from Volume 1, issue 3, through Volume 2, issue 1. The game materials content was a bit limited; you were given a list of the unit counters and a photograph of the map, which was a giant Stalingrad board with a few extra terrain features, especially in Finland. The limited assertions in 2.1 appear to imply that the game was played using the rules for Stalingrad, though references in Stalingrad III to Divisional Stalingrad imply that you could also use the Stalingrad III rules. Nonetheless, it really is a game, a bit under-presented like many other early games, such as Operation Gigantis (which eventually became Confrontation).

The theme is the German invasion of Russia in World War 2. The goals and game play could be identical (except for the new map and new list of counters) with either AH Stalingrad or Poultron Press Stalingrad III, depending on the optional rules choice made by the players, because the optional rules choice was to use one rules book or the other rules book.

If the game was played using the Stalingrad rules, the core rules were:

Stalingrad uses a move-combat sequence, alternating between players. There is limited advance (one square) or retreat (two squares) after combat. Units have one-square thick zones of control; movement directly from one square in the zone of control of a unit into an adjoining square of the zone of control of the same unit is not allowed. Functional terrain includes swamp (one square per turn movement), mountains (one square per turn movement, defenders are doubled), major cities (defenders doubled), rivers (defenders behind rivers are doubled if attacked only across the river), railroads (ten square movement bonus, must be taken all at once), lakes (impassible). Weather is good in summer, snow in winter, and governed by a table in the spring and fall. Mud halves ground movement. Snow halves ground and rail movement, and freezes (converts to clear terrain) some swamps, rivers, lakes, and oceans. Combat is mandatory between units that are adjacent at the end of each turn, but the attacker chooses which units attack which other units, so long as all adjacent units are in some battle. The classical Avalon Hill D6 table, with results such as D Elim, A Elim, etc is in use. Germans have limited replacements; Russian replacement rates escalate as the game goes on. The objective is to capture the opposition's key cities (for the Russians, Leningrad, Moscow, Stalingrad) or to destroy the other side's army. The Russian (implicit in rules) can also win by taking Helsinki, Warsaw, and Bucharest, and holding them for two complete turns.

Stalingrad was the first board war game with the modern placement of rivers down the middle of hexagons, rather than the old-fashioned placement of rivers on hex edges, as also seen in Stlingrad II.

name: On Belay
description:
Game Title: On belay – The Rock Climbing Game

Players: 1 or 2 players

Game Description: A game where 1 to 2 players start on the bottom of a rock face and take turns trying to make their way up to the top of the summit without falling off. Along the way your opponent and Mother Nature will try to sabotage your route and prevent you from making it to the top. As you climb you will be confronted with diverse weather conditions, faulty equipment, hazardous conditions, physical endurance, and a host of other factors, which will work against you and try to prevent you from making it to the summit.

Winning Conditions: The winner is the first player to make it to the summit.

The following are the [7] types of Weather Condition Cards and they’re affects:
1. Snowing – These conditions cause the climbers to become DISORIENTED due to falling snow.
2. Raining – These conditions may cause the climbers to SLIP while climbing due to rainfall.
3. Sunny & Clear Skies – These conditions have no negative affect on the climbers.
4. Night Climbing – These conditions cause the climbers to become DISORIENTED due to the darkness and will affect the SPEED of the climbers which will take twice as long.
5. Icy – These conditions may cause the climbers to SLIP due to the ice covered rocks.
6. Fog Cover – These conditions cause the climbers to become DISORIENTED due to low visibility from the fog.
7. Windy – These conditions cause the climbers to take twice as long and will affect the SPEED of the climbers due to the windy conditions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Moon Beans
description:
The elderly wizard Zeljin zipped and zapped around the woods collecting ingredients for his dinner. Looking forward to his world-famous toadstool and cactus burgers, he returned at sunset to his treehouse hidden atop an ancient sturdysprout tree on the edge of Gnarlwood Forest. Removing his cloak, he discovered a hole in his bag of Magic Jelly Beans. Oh, no! they must be scattered all over the forest floor. Even worse, these were Moon Beans, which can only be seen by the light of the moon. Dangerous creatures come out at night in those woods and the old wizard can’t see in the dark. He needs you and your friends to find them and bring them back. He has promised a reward of fun treats and magic spells made with the mashed magic beans, but only if you can bring them back in the right combinations.

Players attempt to find matching pairs of jelly beans from a pool of face down tokens and collect amusement (victory) points.

When a player discovers unmatched pairs, he or she can collect recipe cards for amusement points instead. Players must also watch out for monsters hiding among the jelly bean tokens, waiting to steal their jellybeans.

This is a family fun game of matching and memory with a drop of strategy to help kids develop these lines of thinking and to keep the parents engaged as well.
publishers: Bonsai Entertainment, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Deadworld
description:
It is the age old question: what would you do if there was a zombie apocalypse? How would you find food? Or ammo? Where would you hole-up to protect you and your loved ones from the hungry dead? Could you survive with the people that you call your friends or would you be forced to leave them on the side of the road?

Welcome to Deadworld.

In Deadworld, you and your friends play yourselves by choosing the trait cards that best fit your true personas; this is done at the start of the game. After everyone makes their "game-self", players take turns searching the ruins of civilization for supplies, fighting off the growing legions of undead, building defenses and improvements to their home base, and doing their best to live with those they considered their peers before the world fell into chaos.

Be careful: the allure of anarchy and unbridled wickedness is powerful in Deadworld. You and your friends may choose to follow the path of good or you all may quickly descend along the road to evil. It's your choice. But that choice will affect how you interact with events and other survivors.

Ultimately, the goal of Deadworld is to survive. If all players can make it to the end of the chosen scenario, then the player with the highest survival points is the winner.

Can you survive a Deadworld?

name: Fingerlinge
description:
Fingerlinge is a childrens game played with hair ties in different colors.

Firs, all players randomly draw 5 hair ties an put them over one of their hands (1 tie per finger).
Than 5 goal cards are revealed, showing a sequence of ties in different colors.

Players take turn by randomly drawing a tie and putting it over a finger.
As soon a p player has the sequece shown on a card on one of his fingers, he gets that card and a new on is revealed.

The first player to have 3 cards is the winner.

name: A Question of Sport: Famous Sporting Faces
description:
Set of cards for board game based on popular BBC TV-Show. This time with questions about famous athletes

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: A Question of Sport: Rugby
description:
Set of cards for board game based on popular BBC TV-Show. This time with questions about rugby.

Players roll the dice, answer the question and if it was correct move the number of spaces he rolled. Player who reaches finish first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Elexikon 2020
description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers about nature, technology, etc.
Players answer the questions with an electronic pen, which flashes green if the answer is correct.
Whoever has the most correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Elexikon 1150
description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers about animals and nature.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Elexikon Langenscheidt Englisch
description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers for learning English.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Elexikon 1440
description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with questions and answers about nature, technology etc.
Players answer the questions with electronic pen what flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Elexikon Ergänzungsmappe 4
description:
Some new boards with 12 new themes for the Elexikon game that replace the board from the base game.
Some new themes with new questions are:
"In the Film Studio", "Protected animals" etc.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

description:

categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia
