name: word MAX
description:
"Makes Literacy a Game"
A word game designed to be played in English, French, Italian and Spanish concurrently. Players choose to play individual games in 1, 2, 3 or all 4 of the languages. There are 3 Play Variations: Word Play, Sentence Play, or Theme Play.
In Word Play: Players randomly select 8 letter tiles from the bag. A player spells a word using all/some of their tiles, and takes coloured tokens corresponding to their point score. Players can also Borrow words previously played to create another word by Adding, Subtracting, Replacing, or Rearranging the tiles and so earn more tokens.
The game ends when there are no more tiles in the bag and one of the players uses up all their tiles. The winner is the one with the highest value of tokens.
Sentence Play requires words played in a meaningful sentence.
Theme Play requires the words are used in a sentence in the context of a chosen theme (e.g., environment, fairy tales, countries, etc)
Can be played competitively or cooperatively.

name: Wineology
description:
Wineology: The Extraordinary Wine Tasting Game" is a marketing/promotional board game released by E & J Gallo Winery, to promote their line of "Turning Leaf" wines. It is a wine-themed derivative of Trivial Pursuit and is similar to Trivial Pursuit in some respects.

The game involves tasting five varietals of "Turning Leaf" wines (Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay, Merlot, Zinfandel, and Cabernet Sauvignon) and answering specific questions about them. The players (or team of players) taste one wine at a time, in a specific order, and must correctly answer questions in four categories (Wine Senses, Food & Wine, Wine Making, & Wild Card) in order to move on to the next varietal.

The first player (or team of players) to answer all four questions correctly in each of the five varietals is declared the winner.

name: Le Petit Poucet
description:
Players have six tiles in hand. They choose one to create a path that leads to the center, the blue flower.

There are many obstacles on the tiles. Sometimes a player is completely blocked, and has no other choice but to give up.

Player who reach first to the tile with blue flower is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Addigolo
description:
Players collect cards of the same color pairs when their sum is equal to 10, 20 or 30.
The goal is to get the most out of the red cards.
The part may take place in one or more rounds.
A round ends when players have more cards.

name: Groove
description:
You must be the first to bring your four pawns of their starting line to their finish line: The only slight problem is that the finish line is located on the side of your opponent. So we have to use tricks to get there.
You have several techniques: one to protect your camp, another, called GROOVE to move your pieces strategically. But in both cases it will sacrifice one of your pieces!

name: Lapipoker
description:
the object of the gmae is to earn money wagered at the parties To do this You must have a combination of higher than your opponent to win the this..

LAPIPOKER cards represent two cards at once which are situated in two lines: one red and one black.
Cards are on the table next to each other respecting the colored lines and each player will build the best poker on its own line of color - it should be noted that the cards are of the game for two players simultaneously. So, each player makes his own game but also try to ruin the game for his opponent playing the card on the table.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Stoïck
description: The goal is to create a family of four cards of the same color clover. To do this, you can share hands, draw a cards, share your game with someone, complete your family with one or more jokers, bring down the joker of an opponent and especially announce "Stoick" when you made ​​your family.

name: Bibliophile
description:
The game of literary knowledge and skill

Object of the Game
To win the most cards.

Bibliophile Cards
Each card consists of the opening and closing lines of a well known piece of literature as well as its title, author and publication date.

To Win a Card
Players or teams of players must identify from the opening and closing lines, any one of the following: Title, Author or Decade of publication.

name: Escriba
description:
Escriba is an adventure game based on Bible stories. The game is set in the Old Testament times. One player is the Master and will coordinate the adventure. The other players are pilgrims on the land, facing several adversities.

The Master will lead the pilgrims through one of 20 adventures contained in the Adventure Book. As the game goes on, the pilgrims will collect points from the results of the battles against the adversities and from a list of Bible questions they have to answer. The player with the most points in the end of the adventure wins the game.

name: T-Coincé
description:
The object is to block Your opponents so that they can't play a card.
To succeed, you need to use addition and subtraction to the total of the discard pile is as close (or equal) to 22 without exceeding this value.
Over the rounds the player who can not discard one of his cards will be eliminated. The last player to ask a card is declared the winner.

name: Verbillico version junior
description:
The version for the younger audience of the game Verbillico.
The goal is to gain the maximum time cards and Challenge by combining the verbs correctly. The game ends when all the time and challenge boxes are occupied by the players.
Verbillico combines many qualities. During the course of the game to win, it is obviously necessary to combine correctly, but also be a strategist, negotiator and have a good luck, because the path is strewn with pitfalls.

In his turn player roll the dice and move. There are 3 types of boxes in this game:
1. Time boxes that indicate the time together;
2. Challenge boxes that are testing the players;
3. Trap boxes that reveal the chance of the moment.

If player answers correctly to aquestions and conjugates verbs he places he marks this box with his token.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Verbillico version mini
description:
The compact version of the game Verbillico.
The goal is to gain the maximum time cards and Challenge by combining the verbs correctly. The game ends when all the time and challenge boxes are occupied by the players.
Verbillico combines many qualities. During the course of the game to win, it is obviously necessary to combine correctly, but also be a strategist, negotiator and have a good luck, because the path is strewn with pitfalls.

In his turn player roll the dice and move. There are 3 types of boxes in this game:
1. Time boxes that indicate the time together;
2. Challenge boxes that are testing the players;
3. Trap boxes that reveal the chance of the moment.

If player answers correctly to aquestions and conjugates verbs he places he marks this box with his token.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Verbillico version excellence
description:
The most harder version of the game Verbillico.
The goal is to gain the maximum time cards and Challenge by combining the verbs correctly. The game ends when all the time and challenge boxes are occupied by the players.
Verbillico combines many qualities. During the course of the game to win, it is obviously necessary to combine correctly, but also be a strategist, negotiator and have a good luck, because the path is strewn with pitfalls.

In his turn player roll the dice and move. There are 3 types of boxes in this game:
1. Time boxes that indicate the time together;
2. Challenge boxes that are testing the players;
3. Trap boxes that reveal the chance of the moment.

If player answers correctly to aquestions and conjugates verbs he places he marks this box with his token.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Numé Cat's Kid
description:
Numé Cat's for younger players

Each player has a stack of green cards face down in front of him. The 18 yellow cards with the numbers are placed in the center of the table.

In his turn player turns a card face-up and reads an enigma.
The other players must hit as fast as possible on the number they think is the right answer. The fastest receives the "enigma" card.

When all the "enigma" cards have been given, each player counts the number of cards he has won. The winner is the one with the most cards.

There are 180 simple mathematical problems, divided into 3 categories : "French language and numbers", "Mathematical language" and "Operations".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Word Game

name: Numé Cat's junior
description:
In every turn players turn cards over and compare the number they get with the other players' numbers.

If 2 players have the same number (for instance six squares, "six" or "6"), they must hit as fast as possible on the "cheese" card placed in the center of the table.

The quickest player gives his cards to his opponent and plays again by turning a new card over.

The first player who gets rid of all his cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Conju Cat's
description:
Each their turn, players turn a card over and compare the tense of their verb with the tenses of the other players. If 2 players have the same tense (for instance "présent" and "finissons"), they must hit the "cheese" card placed in the center of the table as fast as possible.
The fastest player gives his cards to his opponent. Six different special cards give more intrust to the game.

The first player to have no more cards left wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Math

name: Grammi Cat's
description:
Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 9 cards with the grammatical categories are placed in the center of the table.

The players take turns turning their cards over, read a sentence then one of the bold words. The other players must hit the right grammatical category as fast as possible. The quickest receives the "sentences" card.

When all the "sentences" cards have been given out, each player count the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most "sentences" cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Ortho Cat's 3: Les mots
description:
The game covers 10 sounds and their writings: en/an/em/am, on/om, in/un/ain/un, o/au/eau, è/ê/ai/e/ei, j/g, s/z, f/ff/ph, s/c/ç/ss/t, c/k/qu.

Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 18 ending cards are placed at the center of the table.

Each his turn, players turn a card over, give the sound of the ending and then read the sentence. The other players must hit on the right ending as fast as possible. The fastest player receives the "sentence" card. And you start over,the next player turns his card over...

When all the "sentence" cards have been given out, each player counts the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Ortho Cat's 2: Les homophones grammaticaux
description:
The game is on 18 grammatical homophones :
ou/où, on/ont, a/à, est/et, ce/se, c'est/s'est/ses/ces, son/sont, leur/leurs.

Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 18 ending cards are placed at the center of the table.

Each his turn, players turn a card over, give the sound of the ending and then read the sentence. The other players must hit on the right ending as fast as possible. The fastest player receives the "sentence" card. And you start over,the next player turns his card over...

When all the "sentence" cards have been given out, each player counts the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Ortho Cat's
description:
Ortho Cat's is a fun way to considerably improve your level in french spelling concernant of words with endings in "i", "é" and "u" : past participles, conjugated verbs, adjectives.

Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 18 ending cards are placed at the center of the table.

Each his turn, players turn a card over, give the sound of the ending and then read the sentence. The other players must hit on the right ending as fast as possible. The fastest player receives the "sentence" card. And you start over,the next player turns his card over...

When all the "sentence" cards have been given out, each player counts the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Alpha Cat's
description:
The players take turns turning their cards over and compare their letter with the other players' letters. If two players have the same letter (capital or small), they must hit the "Cheese" card in the center of the table as fast as possible.
The fastest player gives his cards to his opponent. Six different Action cards give more punch to the game.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

name: Serial Bluffer
description:
The set of 50 cards consists of combinations of 5 colors and 5 figures. The order of the numbers, everyone knows, but there is also an order of colors, shown in part on a special card, and recalled the other on the back of each card.

The goal is to get rid of his cards by asking a sequence dictated by a die type: numbers, or color, and 1 to 3 cards. The cards are face down except the last. We can blame the previous player for asking illegal cards, of course at his own risk.

name: Holding Pattern
description:
Holding Pattern is an adult air travel game designed for 2-4 players.

Players move their tokens from the start position to the finish position. players must use the assigned course on the game board paying appropriate tariffs and fees. The player who reaches the finish position with the most money wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Legend Dominoes
description:
Very rare game from around the turn of the 20th century.

The cards feature characters and scenes from famous fairy stories. When laid out in a set of four, the bottom of each card can be read, in squence, and providing a précis of the story.

Deal out a number of cards and stack the rest in a draw pile (called the Pool back then). On your turn you must add a card to one of the stories (and it must be the correct card in the sequence, not just a card related to that story). If you cannot go, you draw a card from the Pool. The first player to use their last card, wins.

If reversed, the cards can be used as a regular set of dominoes.

name: 23,000ft
description:
A Ludo style roll the dice and move game, with 3 different variations.

Take Off
Each player has four planes, 1 at the airfield and 3 in the terminal. Roll the dice and move your plane from the airfield or along the flight path, if you land on another plane they go back to the nearest empty space. Rolling a six allows you to bring a plane from your terminal to the airfield and gives you another go. When one of your planes reaches 32,000ft (this does not have to be an exact throw) you remove it to your '32' spaces next to your terminal. The first to get all four planes to 32,000ft is the winner.

Land
Play works as above, but you start at 32,000ft and work your way down to the airfield, landing has to be an exact throw or you overshoot the runway.

Take Off & Land
Choose which players are going to 'Take Off' and which players are going to 'Land' and place planes accordingly. Enter the flight path either way by the amount you throw with the dice. If you settle into airspace that is occupied by another player then your opponents plane must leave the flight path altogether and return to its starting position.
Roll a six to get another plane on the flight path, after rolling a six place the plane six airspaces in. You do not need to throw the exact number when finishing. Then put your plane either at 23,000ft or in your terminal and airfield depending on whether you were Taking Off or Landing. The first person to successfully complete their flight with all their aircraft is the winner.

name: The Blue & The Grey
description:
The Blue & The Grey is a Civil War card game which pits two players against one another in a battle between the United States of America and the Confederate States of America.

Two players choose and play as one of four famous Generals who possess their own special bonuses.

Both sides have in their arsenal Conscripts, Career Infantrymen, Cavalry, Cannons, and Gatling Guns. Additionally, each deck has Research & Development cards which allow for certain advantages over the other player. Some of these include: Balloon Reconnaissance, rifling, and the hiring of mercenary Native Americans!

Will your battle change history for the Confederacy or follow history and reunite the Union?
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Trick-taking
publishers: (Web published), TalkingBullGames, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Special cake
description:
Special cake is a two players game playable with the Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 holes board and 30 balls of the set. The game consists of three variants, created together, at the same time: "mint and liquorice candies", "sugar candies" and "mint, liquorice and cherry candies (aka the poisoned candy)".

Mint and liquorice candies
In the “mint and liquorice candies” variant the balls are 15 white (mint candies) and 15 black (liquorice candies).
Rules
Set up: a player places a mint candy and the other a liquorice candy until the pyramid (the cake) is complete. The candies can be placed either on empty board holes or stacking on 2x2 platforms of existing candies.
Game: the game starts when the cake is complete. Players take turns eating (removing) a candy, either mint or liquorice, or a line of mint and liquorice candies. The candies forming the line can be removed, one-by-one, in any desired order.
A line is a straight group (in 3D) of at least two tastes touching candies, either orthogonally if they are in the same level or one on top of the other if they are in different levels. The lines don't wrap around corners or edges (since in this case they are not really straight when you consider the 3D space).
The player who eats the last candy loses the game.

Sugar candies
The “sugar candies” variant of the game uses 30 balls, randomly selected among the whole Shibumi set of 16 white balls, 16 black balls and 16 red balls.
Rules
The game starts with all the 30 candies placed to form the complete square pyramid (the cake). Players take turns eating (removing) a candy or a line of touching candies. The candies forming the line can be removed, one-by-one, in any desired order.
A line is a straight group (in 3D) of at least two touching candies, either orthogonally if they are in the same level or one on top of the other if they are in different levels. The lines don't wrap around corners or edges (since in this case they are not really straight when you consider the 3D space).
The player who eats the last candy loses the game.

Mint, liquorice and cherry candies (aka the poisoned candy)
In the mint, liquorice and cherry candies variant of the game the balls are 15 white (mint candies), 14 black (liquorice candies) and one red ball (cherry candy).
Rules
Set up: a player places a mint candy and the other a liquorice candy till the 29th candy, then the cherry candy is placed on the top of the pyramid (the cake). The candies can be placed either on empty board holes or stacking on 2x2 platforms of existing candies.
Game: the game starts when the cake is complete. Players take turns eating (removing) a candy, either mint or liquorice, or a line of mint and liquorice candies. The candies forming the line can be removed, one-by-one, in any desired order.
A line is a straight group (in 3D) of at least two tastes touching candies, either orthogonally if they are in the same level or one on top of the other if they are in different levels. The lines don't wrap around corners or edges (since in this case they are not really straight when you consider the 3D space).
The player who eats the cherry candy loses the game (and, if it is poisoned, the life, too!).

Notes
According to the Shibumi drop mechanism, when a ball is removed, then any others that it supports will drop. Any ball that directly supports two or more on the level above is pinned and cannot be removed.
Due to the drop mechanism and to the possibility to remove a straight group of balls, one-by-one, a ball of the line that you want to remove, pinned at the beginning of the move, can become unpinned during the move after the removal of another ball of the group, thus allowing its removing. The players are not forced to remove full lines, i.e. the longest lines in that direction.

Online play

Special cake can be played online (real time) at igGameCenter - http://www.iggamecenter.com/info/en/sandboxshibumi.html
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition

name: Marketeer
description:
A "persistent world" multiplayer boardgame designed to be run continuously for at least 48 hours, preferably more.

Marketeer is a card-based sci-fi exploration, trading and combat game in a persistent board game universe. It requires one game master and one book keeper on deck at all times. A minimum of three of each is recommended for anyone attempting to set up a session. I've listed 8 players as a minimum, but that would probably be pretty sparse. 30-50 is probably recommended. any more than that, and you will probably have people waiting in line to play for most of the peak hours.

Players set up corporations made up of up to three players. Each corporation collects and trades resources, makes bets on the stock market and can battle other players. The goal is to be the corporation with the highest score at the end of the game session. There are also individual goals (called Legend Trials) and many other accolades for achievements throughout the game, such as being the first to build a star base.

The game is divided into four phases with slightly different rules and prerequisites. Each card in the game has four different functions: as ship part, as cybernetic upgrade, natural resource and combat maneuver. How to collect and transform cards is one of the main mechanics of the game, the second is the card-vs-card combat system and the last the financial betting system.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Space: The Game Expansion Kit #1
description:
"This is the first of two additions you can make to the starter set. With this set you will learn to develop alliances, experience multiple battle fronts, and engage in complex battle scenes." (from www.space-the-game.com)

Expansion Kit #1 is meant to be added to the 2-Player Starter Kit Game. Since it includes 1 additional fleet, using it means including 1 additional player.

Expansion Kit #1 includes:
1 Fleet: (2 Starcruisers, 4 Starships, 14 Fighters, 1 Space station, 1 Large Planet, 1 Small Planet)
1 sun
3 Solar Panels
1 set of hit markers (15 of each color)
10 Spindys (space money)
8 Holding rods
1 Holding Bag
Scenario #4

name: Space: The Game Expansion Kit #2
description:
"This is the second of two additions you can make to the starter set. With this set you will build on what you have develop with the starter set and the first expansion kit, mastering your skills in alliances, multiple battle fronts, and complex battle scenes." (from www.space-the-game.com)

Expansion Kit #2 is meant to be added to the 2-Player Starter Kit Game in conjunction with Expansion Kit #1. This means there will be a total of 4 fleets in play and thus 4 players.

Expansion Kit #1 includes:
1 Fleet: (2 Starcruisers, 4 Starships, 14 Fighters, 1 Space station, 1 Large Planet, 1 Small Planet, 1 Holding Bag)
1 set of hit markers (15 of each color)
10 Spindys (space money)
8 Holding rods
1 handmade storage box
Scenario #5

name: Scout: Rechen-Hexe
description:
In Scout: Rechen-Hexe, players are witches who try to combine ingredients to fill their cauldrons to the proper level.

Each player has her own set of tiles numbered 1-10, with each tile being 1-10 units long. Players are presented with an easy target (a number up to ten) or a hard target (a number between 11-20), then they stack at least two tiles (for an easy target) or three or more (for a hard target) inside their personal witches' tower. Once a player does so, she grabs one of the available witch chips; the last player can't get one.

Once all players have finished constructing their towers, they flip their towers over to look at the cutout in the back to see whether their stack of tiles is as tall as the target number. If so, they advance their token on the track to the next space matching the color of the witch chip they took.

The game ends the round that one or more witches reach the house at the end of the track. Those players win!

name: Euro Gewinnt   Das grenzenlose Wissens-Spiel
description:
Objective: make the most money moving by dice on one of three rings on the board - answering multiple choice questions correctly
- moving by turn -
1 each player starts with 4000 Euros
2 chooses a ring to walk on
3 moves according the rolled die
A ending on a '500' field draw a card - answer correct ==> earn 500 Euros
B ending on a 'risk' field earn double amount of the money you bet - otherwise loose your wager
remarks: promotional edition

name: Psychic Penguins and the Voyage Home
description:
Game description from the publisher:

From the makers of Killer Bunnies comes an all-new adventure starring those mysterious characters that KB fans have always wondered about: the Psychic Penguins.

Psychic Penguins and the Voyage Home features precisely that quest, and your goal is to be the first player to send them off on their journey – but before doing so you must gather a variety of items and take advantage of plenty of opportunities to foil the attempts of your foes.

Psychic Penguins and the Voyage Home includes both an "Ocean Blue" starting deck of cards and an "Icy White" booster deck to provide more variety.

name: Cricket Terms
description:
A very 'English' subject for a game. Each guest receives a list of cryptic clues to an answer that is a well-known cricket term. Example question:
Clue - Something seen below a short skirt.
Answer - Fine leg

The guest with the most correct answers, wins.

One in the Dainty Series by this publisher.

name: Foursomes Competition
description:
Each guest receives a card showing 16 squares per question. The four middle squares are blacked out, leaving 4 squares at the perimiter all the way round. Now guests must answer the clues and place the answer into the grid, either across or down. Once you have found one answer and the right place to put it, another answer will begin or end with the letters that are in their column or line. See image for clarification.

The most correct 'squares', wins

name: Jography
description:
Cards are placed where all guests can see them and each player is given a sheet on which to write their answers. The cards all show a different outline of a country and you must answer with the name of that country.

Most right answers, wins.

name: Sphered
description:
Sphered is a very short two players game playable with the Series: Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 holes board and balls of all three colors.

Rules
The board starts empty. Two players, white and black, take turns placing a ball of their color, or a red ball, on an empty board hole.
When any 2x2 platform is created, the ball that has to be placed on the platform must be of the predominant color, or, if there is not a predominant color, the ball must be of the absent color. Established the color to place on the top, if it is red or the color of the current player, he has to place the ball on the platform in the same turn, instead if it is the color of the other player, next turn the other player has a forced move and must place that ball. Completing a platform forces the completion of other platforms.
The player who places a ball of his color on the top of the pyramid wins the game, but if he must place on the apex a red ball he loses.

Note
As for the forced move in the next turn, there are more than 16 moves, but all the levels above the first one are decided by the 16 balls on the 4x4 board. The placing of the red ball on the apex is a losing condition and a player can use the sequence of forced moves to force the other to be the player who places the red ball on the top of the pyramid.

Online play

Sphered can be played online (real time) at igGameCenter - http://www.iggamecenter.com/info/en/sandboxshibumi.html

name: The Mystery Cruise
description:
The idea is to answer cryptic clues to place names, in order, and thus creating a cruise itinerary.

Place the clue cards around the room and give each guest an answer sheet. During the evening, guests should look at the cards and work out the place names.

The player who gets most right, wins.

A game in the Dainty Series

name: Triplex
description:
Place the 24 Clue/Rhyme cards around the room where every guest can see them. On each card is a 4 line ryhme and this ditty will give a player three clues to a well known word. All the player has to do is to name that word and record it on their answer sheet.

The most correct answers, wins.

A game in the Dainty Series.

name: Speq
description:
Speq is a game for two or three players for the Shibumi set. It is an entry in the Shibumi Challenge.

Players take turns adding a ball of any colour to any empty board hole, or on any 2x2 platform provided that the tricolour triangle rule* is obeyed.

The game ends when the pyramid is full or no player can make any more moves, and is won by the player with the greatest number of balls of their colour in play (buried balls are counted).


Tricolour Triangle Rule: A ball can only be placed on a 2x2 platform if at least one side of the pyramid thus created forms an equilateral triangle with a ball of each colour at its tips. That is, at least one side of the pyramid must have a white, a black and a red ball at its corners. This must be true for every level down to the board level.

name: Sauv' Tipsy
description:
Kind of similar game to Operation.
The goal of the game is to take care of the baby dog!

Each player has five cards to play and take care to Tipsy, the dog without hurting him, who then barks in pain if the wrong treatment has done!

First player who has discarded all of its treatments.
At the end of the game, the puppy is saved: he wakes up and barks!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Medical

name: Zone Twelve
description:
Zone Twelve is a dice game for 3-6 players with some elements of gambling and lots of luck.

A game consists of 5 rounds plus one bonus round. One game takes about 15 minutes to play.

On each turn a player rolls the three dice and tries to get the dice to add up to 12. Two of the dice are 0-5 (one side is labeled "Zone") while the other die is 2-5 with a side labeled "Zone Wild", which can be any number 0-6.

In the bonus round, each player rolls a green die and wins or loses chips based on an earlier bet. This die has special sides of W, W 1/2, L, L 1/2.

At the end of the game, players count up their chip totals. The instructions state that 4 games should be played and the person with the highest cumulative chip total be declared the winner.

name: Expresso
description:
Each card of 'Expresso' contains five words on the front and five words on the back of the same figure of speech.

At the beginning of the game, the 'Expresso' cards are mixed and then placed in the center of the table. Players are divided into two teams of similar size on both sides. The starting player chooses one of five colors that correspond to words that will be played throughout the game: blue, green, pink, brown, or purple. He draws a card from under the package that held vertically between the thumb and forefinger so that both teams only see one side from the the card.

Teams must find the word of the opposite team. All players are so many proposals out loud as they want and when any player has the word that is written on the other side of the card, he wins and gets the card.

The first player or the first team to get seven cards wins the round. Obtained two rounds wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: L'Intrus
description:
"Intruder" in English.
There are 52 cards in this game and 4 words on each card.
Object of the game is to find one of the four word as a intruder who doesn't fit with other 3 words.

At the beginning of the game, some cards are distributed to players. Each card contains 6 sets of 4 words. In his turn, the player reads aloud the first set from the card. All other players try to find intruder before the others but to score a point we must not only give the intruder but also give good explanation why this word doesn't fit to set.
At the end, the player who scores the most points wins the game.

Example:
4 countries - Argentina, Peru, Brazil, Bolivia
These are Spanish-speaking countries except Brazil which is Portuguese.

name: Oups ! mon prénom...
description:
"Oops, my name ..." in English.

Word game based on French words.
In his turn player reads from his card a questions, and other players must find a name as an answer to score a point and get this card.

When there are no more cards in the hands of players, the
player who has got the most card in fron of him is the winner.

Example:
Mr. & Mrs. utan have a son .... Laurent!
His name is ... Laurent utan (sounds like the orangutan in French).

name: a+d+d+d
description:
a+d+d+d (pronounced "add")

4x5 board, squares sequentially numbered 1-20
2 sets of pawns, 12 each
1 colored die
4 plain dice


Roll the dice. Add the value of the colored die plus all, some, or none of the plain dice to total an unoccupied number on the board. (Pass if unable.) Place a pawn on the numbered square to claim it. The game ends when all squares are occupied. Points are tallied for each line of three or more pawns; the highest score wins.

Devin Stewart is credited as the inventor; Kate Jones is credited with the solitaire games.

name: Favor of Olympus
description:
Favor of Olympus is a deck customization game similar to deck building games. The game differs from others in the genre in that where a player plays his cards is important, there is a larger level of player interaction and that a player can grow or shrink his deck's size easily. Players start with 12 card decks but have the flexibility to lower the deck size to 0 cards or raise it as high as 20 or more cards. Players try to obtain the most victory points to win.

Set in mythical Greece, each player takes the role of a city ruler that must try to appease Zeus and his siblings. Each player utilizes followers and recruited heroes, each which have special powers.

Each player starts with the same deck of cards. Players choose to play their cards to wage war, recruit allies, sacrifice, go on legendary quests, increase their worship and battle powerful heralds of the gods.

The design incorporates ideas from several games including Dominion, Twilight Struggle and 7 Wonders.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Les Aventures de Carlos
description:
Game based on Franch Televison Series.

The winner is the one that accomplishes its mission and becomes the first well, the one and only, true Carlos, a friend of five characters from the TV series.

In his turn player rolls dice, representing the five characters over Carlos. Then he draws a card that corresponds to each episode of the box set. The player ends his turn by moving his pawn one square Carlos towards a figurine character to recover. Simply position the same episode box to retrieve a figurine.

When a player has recovered its five characters, it must still go on the island of Carlos to win. Therefore, the other players are in league against him to prevent him reaching the first. Each draw of Carlos, they will try to move it away from the island by sending boxes of remote episode.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mots ancrés
description:
The game combines a French game quiz with a general strategy board game.

The object of the game is to discover a word puzzle in order to reach the island and win the game.

There are letters on the sea. Before to start the game each player must choose a 6 letter word from the list provided in the rules of the game.
Each player must discover the mystery word of an opponent:
- He may ask questions about opponent's puzzle by docking the symbol 'safe' photo of the symbol box
- He may obtain a letter of this word as soon as he approaches a small island of the game board
- With the money he earns He may buy vowels or consonants of the word puzzle or even to invest in additional questions.

Holder of the puzzle can only answer YES or NO to all questions.

If any player find the word puzzle before the opponent and reach the main island wins the game.

name: Tunne iseennast
description:
"Feel Yourself" in English

Trivia game for schools. The topics are: Oriental way of thinking, Western way of thinking, psychology, environment, society, creation etc.

The question is readed and the player who answers correctly scores a point. Winner is the player who gets 3 points first.

name: Teleprompter: Cyphers of the Spiritual Hinterlands
description:
1. Players agree to play to a number of points.
2. The players take turns being the Teleprompter.
2. The Teleprompter first chooses a number of receivers equal to half the number of players rounded down and describes a situation that the first player has caused through supernatural means. The situation is actually an enciphered message to the receiving players. The Teleprompter chooses a number of guesses: 1-3, inclusive, for the round.
3. A non-receiver is allowed to guess what the message means. Then, a receiver is allowed to guess. Then, a non-receiver is allowed to guess. The two groups alternate trying to figure out the message until either:
a. someone figures out the message or
b. everyone (save the originator of the message) has the opportunity to guess the predetermined number of times determined in step 2.
4. If 3a occurs and a receiver is the correct guesser, the Teleprompter and the receiver who guesses correctly each get a point. If a non-receiver is the correct guesser, then the non-receiver gets two points. If no-one guesses correctly, then the Teleprompter loses a point. It is not possible to have negative points.
5. The first player to the predetermined number of points wins. There can be ties.

name: Snapshots: A Missionary Card Game
description:
A second game by the Church Missionary Society, educating people about their work around the world.

The game is played rather like Happy Families in that you must ask a player of your choice for a card from a set that you already a card in that set. Eventually all 12 sets will have been completed. Now the game uses its educational purpose as players need to know something about the territory related to a set. Reference sheets are provided for the sort of information required. If information is not forthcoming, or the information provided is incorrect, the player loses that set. This continues until all sets have been 'challenged' and the winner of the game is the player with the most sets.

name: Was wird hier falsch gemacht?
description:
Objective: be the first to reach finish line
learn traffic signs/rules
- acting by turn -
roll the die - ending on a marked/numbered space follow instruchtions printed cover inside
remarks:
pewter meeples - late 40's/early 50's

name: Baseball Game
description: Spinner game from McLoughlin Brothers. Spin the spinner and look for the results.

name: Spair
description:
Spair is a very simple two players game playable with two Shibumi game systems. It uses two 4×4 boards, and two whole sets of balls.

Rules
The board starts empty. Two players take turns placing a ball of one color on the first board (called A), and then a ball of another color on the second board (called B), according to the following rules:
1) a ball may be placed on a board if its color is different from the color of the ball that has been placed on the same board in the previous turn and
2) a player must place a ball of the color not placed by the opponent in the previous turn.

Balls may be placed either on empty board holes or stacking on 2x2 platforms of existing balls.

A player wins when a full line of any single color is made, orthogonally or diagonally, on any level on his board: board B for the first player and board A for the second player.

Lines on the 4x4 (board) level must be of length 4, lines on the 3x3 level must be of length 3, and lines on the 2x2 level must be of length 2.

name: Pickles' Veggie Pick
description:
Hop down the rabbit trail to pick some garden fresh veggies. But watch out! Pickles and Digger are in a playful mood. Sneak past them to bring home fresh veggies for a delicious treat!

On your turn, roll the 3 colored dice and resolve them in order:

- Blue Die: Shows which section of the garden Pickles the Farmer will visit this turn. Any rabbits in that section lose the Veggie Tile they're carrying, and must go to the farmhouse until their next turn.
- Orange Die: Shows how many spaces Digger the Dog will move around the dog run on his turn. If the dog enters a forest where a Rabbit Pawn is waiting, that rabbit drops their veggies and must return to their rabbit hole until their next turn.
- White Die: Move your Rabbit Pawn up to the number of spaces you rolled. You may stop to pick up a Veggie Tile then continue on until the number of spaces you rolled are used up. But remember...sometimes it's safer to move fewer spaces than you rolled.

Collect veggies (carrots, radishes, lettuce, or eggplants) for points -- if they're from another rabbit's corner of the garden you earn bonus points!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Sequencing, Risk vs Reward, Early Counting & Math
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Let's Drive
description:
Time to hit the open road! Visit scenic locations around the USA. Earn a point for each Destination you visit, and bonuses for collecting sets!

Each player starts with 4 Destination Cards, chooses one of them for a starting location, and places their car pawn on that city. On a player's turn, their car pawn can move three times using the roads or airlines. Events or Bonus Cards may give additional moves. Announce the names of each city you visit, so other players are aware which cities have been visited.

Each time a player stops in a city shown on a "public card" or one of their Destination Cards, they add that card face-up in their scoring area and move up the scoring track.

Always pay attention during other players' turns. If another player visits a city that matches one of the cards in your hand, ask them to send you a postcard! They score the card you were holding, but you receive a card from the Postcard Deck, which is also worth a point.

After finishing your turn, draw cards from the Destination Deck to replenish your hand back to 3 cards. If an Event Card is revealed while drawing, follow the instructions on the card first, then draw a new Destination Card to replace it.

Any time a player completes a set of 3 Destination Cards and/or Postcards of the same color, they receive a Bonus Card. These cards provide bonus points or special abilities that will help you advance.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Geography, Strategy, State Facts


Sequel to: Let's Jet
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: ANTS! The Battle For The Backyard Has Begun!
description:
ANTS! The Battle For The Backyard Has Begun is a card and modular board game where each player takes command of the black or red Ant Queen and battles for ultimate control of the backyard!

Every playthrough will be different with a large hexagonal play area that changes each time you play! Random events can impact gameplay by causing board pieces to shift unexpectedly or even be destroyed!

Players build armies of ants with various bonuses to go and take out the rival queen. Action cards offer the ability to ally with spiders, wasps, catterpillers, and hornets to aid in your conquest but beware; there is a large glass eye in the sky that fries your warriors without notice!

Build your subterranean base as well and attack your opponent at will in this game of skill and strategy! Each base will be different and no play-through will be the same!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: Lustige Autofahrt
description:
Objective: be the first making the fastest lap
- moving by turn -
each player moves according 1d6 roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on cover inside.
Last space must be reached with matching number - surplus movement points push you backwards.
remarks:
republished 1955 - still the same artist (board) Scheer (prename unknown)

name: O for a Word
description: Party game. Each guest is given a card of clues and told that the answer must end in the letter O. During the evening, they should try to answer as many correctly as they can. The player with the most correct, wins.

name: Chienlit & Cie
description:
Trivia game about history (mainly about revolutions) of France.

In his turn player spin the spinner with 2 choises: years 1968 or 2008. Question card is taken from that category. It has one minute to tell what You think and then opponents tell us are they were satisfied or not. If a majority yes, you win the points indicated on the box where it had fallen.

Winner is the player who reaches predetermined number of points.

Some example questions:
"The great struggles that everyone does not care, tell","The signs of the revolution, which were you believe."

name: Ciblux
description:
Each player has four small pawns and a larger pawn called Ciblux.
In his turn player roll dice and move one of his smaller pawn accordingly.

There are 3 areas in the game board to move.:
- A white area where small pieces can move "with impunity".
- A yellow box called 'danger zone' where small pieces can be ejected by the Ciblux of the opponent.
- A central area which is the goal for small pieces.

The object is to bring all his small pawns to the central area first. Alternative end is if player catches with Ciblux opponent's smaller pawn and wins.

name: Plury One
description:
Voting game where player has 2 minutes to answer a question or prove something etc. If time stops other players vote is Your answer satisfied them. If Yes You score a point.
Who reaches a predetermined score wins the game.

Some card examples: "Invent a sence that doesn't make any sence","Make us believe You are a Kangoroo", "What is priceless in You opinion"

name: "Summ, summ, summ, Bienchen summ herum"
description:
Objective: be the first to enter space '100'
- moving by turn -
move according rolled die - ending on a marked (red) space follow instructions...
remarks:
published in GDR early 50's

name: Marx O Matic Basketball
description:
1950's Marx O Matic children's basketball game - Tin litho.

Metal Base of the game is 22" long X 13" wide and the metal back is 11" Tall.

Game comes with an automatic scoreboard. Players use the shooter, attached to base, to lob balls into the net.

The shooter base has a counter that keeps track of 12 shots and then rings the bell when complete.

name: Red Bird Baseball
description: A small metal ball is hit by a spinning batter. The hole it falls into names the result of the play. The game probably commemorates the ST. LOUIS CARDINALS Baseball team and was made by The Measuregraph Co. of ST. LOUIS, MO. This game is shown in the BASEBALL GAMES BOOK BY MARK COOPER, M.D. OF SCHIFFER BOOKS.

name: WW2 All At Sea: World War Two Naval Wargame Rules
description:
Miniature Rules for World War Two Naval Warfare

Scale:

tactical turn = 10 minutes
strategic turns = 40 minutes
4 cm = one nautical mile
1 model = one ship or four or five aircraft.

Player's take the role of squadron or fleet commander. One die per battery. If a hit is scored, another die is rolled to determine the damage. AA fire is handled a bit differently with each ship having a number of Light AA, and AA dice dependent upon armament. Within certain restrictions these dice may be allocated to more than one enemy flight per turn as required.

Radar can be useful to detect enemy forces. Once forces come within visual range, firing is likely to commence. Damage rates may seem high. It is quite possible for a destroyer to be sunk in a single round of combat. Ships suffer damage which includes degradation of firepower, speed, or C3 systems.

C3 systems and formation command are simulated with each formation's flagship maneuvering and any ships in formation with it will conform. Ships not in the flagship’s formation roll a die to determine whether they may maneuver.

ref: http://mcmdgames.blogspot.com/2012/01/ww2-all-at-sea review.html
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: All About Scranton
description:
Promotional game for businesses in Scranton, Pennsylvania. Players travel round the town, visiting shops. To win you must be the first to collect all the items on your shopping list.

One in a large series of 'All About' games
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: All About Ulster County New York
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Ulster County, and this game was made as a promotional item for the town.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Appleton
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Appleton, and this game was made as a promotional item for the town.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Auburn - Cayuga County
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Auburn - Cayuga County, New York, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Knoxville Tennessee
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Knoxville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Lancaster Pennsylvania
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Lancaster Pennsylvania, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Mercer County
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Mercer County, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About New Orleans
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in New Orleans, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Pittsburgh
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Pittsburgh, and this game was made as a promotional item for them and the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About York
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in York, and this game was made as a promotional item for them and the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Baltimore, and this game was made as a promotional item for them and the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: All About Kansas City
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Kansas City, and this game was made as a promotional item for them and the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sexkanten
description: An old swedish wordgame based on 40 sixsided wooden pieces that can be fit to each other into a long row. On each side there are a word written. By combining different pieces and put them toghether you form sentences. There are different way of playing and scoring. The easiest way is that each player in one minute tries to form an as long sentence as possibly. After you have done a sentence you can change the meaning by twisting the wooden pieces and score extra points.

name: Dog Poop
description: Have you ever wanted to poop in someone’s yard? Well here is your chance. In Dog Poop, it is your objective to dig holes, trample flowers, knock over the garbage, and find mystery goodies in other back yards. Naturally, you are trying to do all this while keeping your own yard as clean as possible. There are special things you can get like a scoop to clean your yard or the cat to draw other dogs away. Get in touch with your inner poodle or wolf hound as the case may be. All in all, this game is a bunch of laughs for everyone involved.

name: Going to Market
description:
An especially nice promotional card game from 1915, published by the Household Words Game Company. Each of the advertisers received complete decks in maroon colored boxes with gold lettering that featured the company name.

Each player tries to collect sets of the same numbered card. They ask for cards from other players (which must be handed over) but if you are unsuccessful in your search then you end your turn by drawing a card. Once a set is collected, it is placed in front of the player who completed this task. Eventually, all sets will be collected and the player with the most sets, wins.

Each card is an advertisement for products at the time. The products are:
Pompeian Night Cream and other cosmetics
Kelly-Springfield Tires and Tubes
Several different Willys-Overland vehicles
Post cereals
Welch's Punch, Lemonade, others
Beech-Nut Chewing Gum, Peanut Butter and Bacon. (Bacon!!)
Knox Gelatin desserts
Perfection Oil Cook stoves, ovens, heaters
Western Electric, Phones, Irons, washing machines
Libby's Hawaiian Pineapple, evaporated milk, fruits
Ingersoll Dollar , Junior, Midget and Eclipse Watches
Men's and Women's Walk-Over shoes.
Sherwin-Williams SWP House Paint, varnish and wall paint.

name: Family Pok
description:
Poker meets bingo.
The goal of the game is to accumulate a maximum amount of coins into 3 parts, by collecting over the cards announced the best combinations.

The game is divided into three parts:
1) Pre flop is the phase of play before seeing cards.
2) Turn is the second time to bet after seeing the cards.
3) River is the last to bet before unveiling his game

Players bet for the cards to get better combinations for their boards.

Player who accumulated the most chips at the end of three parts is the winner.

name: Raffa la giraffa
description:
A dexterity game for 2-4 players, with a tree and 30 cubes.
Roll 2 dice, then use a cube to lengthen your giraffe's neck, according to the colour and the special action of the 2 dice.
Special actions:
- put the neck on the top of your giraffe;
- put the neck on the bottom of your giraffe;
- put the neck on the top of your giraffe, without using the thumb;
- lift the giraffe over the table, put the neck on the top;
- steal the neck from an opponent (you will take the coloured neck and the other necks over it).
The player who reaches the leaf on the tree wins.

name: Twisted Tails
description:
Each player places snake pieces on the board, either continuing an existing snake, or ending one to start another. The snakes are scored once there are two ends, and the player with the majority of the pieces in that chain scores the points.

The board has 10 snakes on it, and each snake's eye holds a special token (hole, twist, cross). These are randomly chosen and placed by all players when starting the game. A hole is impassable, but a twist allows a player to twist any snake piece on the board. This can change things considerably! The cross is an intersection that ends all snakes that touch it.

Twisted Tails was created by Kevin Kulp and J. Tagmire at the 2012 Global Game Jam. This year's theme was Ouroboros.

name: Am Spinnrad
description:
Objective:
be the first to move all of your five meeples forming a row within one of those black lines with white dots
- moving by turn -
players place their meeples into coloured start positions (spread all over the board)
players move their meeples to adjacent junctions
- allowed only if space isn't already occupied
try to find shortest way to rejoin your meeples - or block others if they could be faster than you
remarks:
produced before WWII
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Autoreise-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first crossing finish line (110)
- moving by turn -
simple roll & move game
blue fields push you forward, red fields backwards or stop you/ throw you out
remarks:
published early 1930's

name: Acquaint
description:
At last, there's a fun new way to avoid the dreaded "awkward silence" when dating someone new! Introducing ACQUAINT™ - the revolutionary "real deal" card game that helps first-, second-, or even third-time daters get better acquainted. It was designed not only to create conversation and calm nerves, but to also help daters better determine each other's "keeper" potentials; needless to say, finding out early on whether or not they are truly compatible may prove to be a time-saving, preventative measure of future heartache.

This highly interactive card game includes questions, tasks, lessons and more! It encourages 'authentic' conversation through the sharing of thoughts, experiences, feelings and values. Questions range from light-hearted topics to semi-personal and serious, and fun "off-the-wall" topics are included throughout.

OBJECT: Collect as many Rose Cards in your hand as you can by discarding as many other cards as possible. Players perform any task(s) listed on the discarded card on each turn. There are a total of 9 Rose Cards, and the player with the most in their hand at the end wins. The main point of the game, however, is for the players to get to know one another better.

CARDS: Includes 52 cards total

9 ROSE CARDS
20 'REAL DEAL' QUESTION CARDS
4 FILL-IN-THE-BLANK CARDS
6 DISCUSSION CARDS
5 SCALE ("What # Are You?") CARDS
6 MISCELLANEOUS CARDS ('Listening Check' Card, 'Deception Destroyer' Card 'Share' Card, 'Flirt' Card, 'Deal Breaker' Card, & 'Compromise' Card)
2 PROTECTION CARDS


START: SHUFFLE CARDS WELL before starting (keeping all the cards facing the same direction). Choose which player will go first. Players must also choose in advance the level of play preferred for the 'REAL DEAL' Questions from the three levels listed below.

REAL DEAL QUESTION CARD LEVELS:

LEVEL 1 ('a' questions) - Simple, light-hearted questions to learn a little about your date - questions that are generally easy to answer and don't take that much thought
LEVEL 2 ('b' questions) - Moderate get-to-know-your-date questions - questions that get a little more serious, where people can reveal a bit more about themselves
LEVEL 3 ('c' questions) - Deep questions designed to create a bonding emotional connection, or, to better spot potential 'RED FLAGS' in advance--ideal for 'bold' daters. Keep in mind DISHONESTY CAN DESTROY EVEN THE BEST OF RELATIONSHIPS! PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK! Warning: Some questions may be considered to some as personally inappropriate for a new date, even though the questions are in good taste. (The reason someone may pass on a question need not be explained -- besides, a little mystery can often prove to be an effective strategy as well.)


PLAY: Each person is dealt 7 cards (one at a time) face down. The remaining cards are placed face down in a pile in the center of the table, forming the draw pile (or the Selection Pile). The first player (aka THE DISCARDER) takes a turn by drawing the top card from the Selection Pile followed by choosing a card to discard from his/her hand, reading it out loud first. Players then respond to any directions from the card accordingly. When finished, the DISCARDER places the card face up right alongside the Selection Pile, into what will be the Discard Pile (unless otherwise directed). Similarly, the other player then takes their turn, and so on.

SCORING: The game ends as soon as soon as the last card is picked up/discarded. The players then count the number of Rose Cards in their hands, and the player with the most roses wins. (If both players end up without any roses, it's considered a tie game.).

name: Beurk: Le Jeu des crados
description:
Each player receives six cards to start representing parts of the house they will have to go. These cards are visible to all.

Players roll the die and it shows some special displays or challenges when two players meet on the same part of the house.

Example of the challenges:
- One who whistles the strongest
- One who makes the biggest burp
etc. Who wins the challenges gives his card to opponent.

The winner is the one that gets rid of his cards first.

name: Comedia Junior
description:
A French party game for younger audience in which players improvise themed performances in given characters.

Ih his turn player draws a card and try as much as possible to have success with the public with his task. He either must let the others guess a word through mime or speak text aloud, or improvise a sketch, or depict a scene with a partner.
Can be played in teams.

The most successful player/team is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Grand Prix
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 90)
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
ending on a marked space follow instructions...
remark:
published ~ late 60's/early 70's

name: Der Weg zum Haus
description:
Objective: be the first to acquire a house
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' promotional game
starting in the centre of the board you have to finish a circle, draw event cards, acquire a 'Hypo-Beraterstein' before you may cross over to the following (outer) circle; repeat this procedure until you reach the very last circle;
here yor may buy a house...
remark:
promotional edition 'Hypobank'
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Find the Goggles
description:
This game is based on the film “Finding Nemo,” specifically the scene in which Dori and Nemo’s father find the goggles at the bottom of the sea. Players play as the two fish and need to get the goggles.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
-cards
-goggles token
-special dice
-board

Players will need to prepare the following component (not included in the pdf):
-a normal 6-sided dice

Players roll a special dice to determine one’s movement. When you reach an “Info” box, you roll the normal dice and it determines the place of the goggles.

The player who gets to the goggle space the fastest is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Svenska Fåglar
description:
A old swedish card game that consist of 100 cards with birds that can be found in sweden. The goal of the game is to collect group of cards with birds related to each other. This is done by sending a card you do not want to the player next to you and at the same time you get one from the other opponent.

In the game there is also a map of 325 birds that is recommendet to be used in biologyclasses in school.

name: Vocal
description: In his turn player draws a card and announce the title and artist of song. Players then bet on your success in the interpretation of the work. Finally, you push your bellowing, and each win or lose the bet.

name: grAtitude!
description:
The "It's all about grAtitude!" project began with an idea several years ago to teach, in a fun and entertaining way, age-old universal principles of prosperity and abundance that have been taught in every major spiritual and cultural tradition. Those principles are known today by names such as Law of Attraction, Law of Allowing, Law of Gratitude, etc.

The idea, conceived by Theuns Serfontein in South Africa, was to use a board and card game (played much like a cross between Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit) to teach and promote these principles. In 2010 the Law of Attraction worked to put Theuns together with Steve Vernon (a graphic and web designer in the United States) through an online marketing company in which they both were involved and, thanks to Skype, they became not only business partners, but very close friends. A few months later, Theuns asked Steve to partner with him in his dream of creating "grAtitude!"- the game (originally called "Bridge to Success").

The grAtitude! board game is played by tossing dice, moving around the "G"-shaped track, drawing cards from any of the four decks (depending on what space you land on), and following the instructions on the card within a certain time frame. You may, for example, have 30 seconds to name as many things as possible that start with the letter "D" that you're grateful for and win 1000 grati for each thing you name, or you might be told the Universe just rewarded you with 5,000 grati because you wrote down three daily goals this morning, or you might be asked to complete a famous quote or answer a multiple choice question. With over 700 cards in the game, the possibilities are almost endless!

name: Baptism of Fire III: World War II Skirmish Wargaming Rules
description:
A development of the philosophy that started with BoF I, it features an all new game engine based on real world theories and training doctrines proven in combat.

Elegant in design, the rules allow you to focus on commanding the men, leading the action, and coming to grips with the chaos and uncertainty of combat.

Baptism of Fire III has been designed with ease of play in mind allowing players to concentrate on decisions and action.

Baptism of Fire III represents an evolution of modern skirmish game thought. Imperfect information, uncertainties of command and a fluid, action driven activation sequence make for a hot and exciting table top game unlike any other.

Baptism of Fire III is our most unique and intense game to model skirmishes in WW2 and beyond. The focus is on Leadership, training and morale using a game engine like no other game. With pace and simultaneous interaction within a turn, players will find themselves engrossed in the unfolding action.

The unique game engine is the key to all this. Evolved from earlier TFP Games rules, the system uses a non-traditional card draw, the player with the initiative deciding from 2 to 5 cards, creating a pace of play and simultaneous resolution of both sides activations.

The rules also use a sliding dice scale to reflect relative difficulty to resolve tasks or functions. No adding modifiers to create impossibilities of failure or success. BoF3 instead changes the size of the die rolling against fixed numbers, a simpler and faster system.

Leaders form the centre of attention. They allow troops a greater degree of flexibility, and better Leaders will be able to motivate and lead their men more effectively. They do this through Command Points. Points may be spent to coax and motivate, direct actions more effectively, increase die sizes and more. Leaders with reserved Command Points may also be reactivated within the same turn, pushing the men hard as they read or anticipate the tactical situation better than inferior leaders.

Supplements allow you to play post-WW2 conflicts.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Cosmic Express
description:
Cosmic Express is a quick-playing version of Fantasy Flight Games' extremely awesome Cosmic Encounter. It takes the elements of Cosmic Encounter that make it so fantastic (negotiating, backstabbing, variable alien powers, alliances) and tries to deliver it in a half hour playing time, and with far less components than the original.

The game replaces Encounter Cards with Encounter Dice, of which a player only has one at any given time. When having an Encounter, players can choose to Fight (hold the die in their fist) or Negotiate (keep their fist empty). The classic Prisoner's Dilemma outcomes apply, with mutually fighting players rolling their dice to determine a winner.

The game is completely free to print and play, and uses no artwork from Fantasy Flight Games. It is designed as a tribute to on of my favourite games of all time and as a thank-you to the BGG community, who has given me so much enjoyment and help in the last year.
categories: Fighting, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Corporation$
description:
Corporation$ is a modern economic game. Create ultimate wealth by building corporations that dominate their industries and test your investment skills by choosing which corporations to buy stock in. Expand your influence by merging corporations and starting new corporations in new industries. But be careful or you may over-extend and find yourself with no cash to keep your corporations running and then lose your influence!

Players start by choosing an industry to launch their corporation. Then they can buy stock in their corporation, increase the corporations market share, and even merge even merge with other corporations. The player has to decide which strategy will work to their benefit. Should they buy more stocks, increase their market share, or merge with other corporations.

During regular gameplay, players receive revenue from their corporations, pay expenses, buy and sell stocks, buy marketshare in the auction phase, or merge with other corporations.

The player with the most net worth at the end of the game wins!

With Corporation$ you must balance your ambitious goals of becoming the wealthiest billionaire while managing the growing needs of your corporations. Do it poorly and count yourself one of the many who have tried and failed. Do it well and you may become the greatest wealth-generating businessman and investor of all time! At least within the world of the game called Corporation$.

name: Si j'étais paysan
description:
The game consists of 31 tiles that will form the oval game board, 6 "memo" tiles with one color per side, 6 pawns and a die with six faces. When the game starts forming a path with 31 tiles oval course that will be different for each game. Tiles "memo", which have color front / back, are placed in the center of the table so as to show the four possible colors. Each player picks a color pawn.

In turn, the active player rolls the dice. If it's six, he misses a turn. If it's between 1 and 5, it has the choice between:
1: re-roll, but if it's 6 or the same number, it passes.
2: he moves his pawn to a number of dice equal to the tile.

The course ends with the tile "Peasant Confederation" and the first player to reach this tile is declared "Grand Winner".

name: Finding Words
description:
"Finding Words" is an educational game based on the movie "Finding Nemo". This game is all about coming up with words within 1 min to help Nemo.
This game play itself is simple. You simply roll the dice and move forward the number of your dice.
For you to win this game, you have to write as many words as you can. The word should somehow be related to the movie and start with the letter you stopped at.
categories: Dice, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Friendly Farm Activity Set
description:
A compilation of games includes rule sets for Checkers and Tic-Tac-Toe, plus several other games:

Meet in the Middle: One player uses a "mama" animal, the other uses a "baby" animal. They start at opposite ends of the board and alternate die rolls until the two animals meet.

Home Sweet Home: All of the animals are divided among the players. In turn, each player rolls the die and puts the number of animals rolled onto the game board. The winner is the person who gets all of their animals on first.

Suppertime!: Players get two animals and have to move them to the barn. On each turn, the player rolls one die and can split the movement between the two animals in any manner. Landing on a space occupied by another animal sends that animal back to the closest unoccupied colored space. The first player to get both of their animals to the barn wins.

Barnyard Chase: Each player selects an animal and places it on the opposite diagonal corners of the included checkerboard. In turn, players roll the die and move clockwise around the board. First player to pass the other wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quiz to go: Zitate
description:
There is a quote in one side of the card and three variants of people who could said that and answer and information about the quote in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the quote and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Gehirnjogging
description:
"Brain" in English
There is a mathematical or linquistical exercise in one side of the card and answer in another side of the card.

In his turn player solves the exercise.
If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Math, Trivia, Word Game

name: Quiz to go: Knigge
description:
"Etiquette" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Deutsche Geschichte
description:
"German History" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and answers/information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Allgemeinbildung
description:
"Public Education" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and answers/information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Redewendungen
description:
"Words" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and variants for each question and answers/information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Alltagsfragen
description:
"Everyday issues" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and variants for each question and answers/information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Intelligenztraining
description:
"Intelligence Training" in English
There is exercise in one side of the card and variants and answer in another side of the card.

In his turn player tries tosolve the exercise. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Was ist das? Fotorätsel
description:
"What is it? Photo puzzles" in English
There is a puzzle in one side of the card and variants and answers/information in another side of the card.

In his turn player choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Denksport
description:
"Puzzle" in English
There is a puzzle in one side of the card and answer in another side of the card.

In his turn player need to solve the puzzle. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Irrtümer der Allgemeinbildung
description:
"Errors of the general education" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and variants for each question and answers/information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Schrift Stadt
