description: The game was played much like Trivial Pursuit, running in a circular motion with the players collecting coloured counters upon answering various questions or completing a particular task. The colour coding defined which question would be asked and the reward for a right answer was one of the tokens. A completed set of tokens meant the player could then progress into the center circle and complete the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Thémax
description:
Object of the game is being the first team to reach the destination square, betting on issues and events, and
course by providing the correct answer.

Players/teams move on the game board and if they reach on a certain squares, the other team draws a card, reads the topic aloud and asked the current team to bet on this theme 1-3 credit. Then they answer and if it is correct they win the bet if incorrect they lose credtis and move their pawns back.

Team who first arrives to the destination square must answer the last question to win the game.

name: Pine Cone Wars
description:
This is a light war game based on two teams of kids facing off in a game of capture the flag. Their weapon of choice: Pine Cones. In this simultaneous action selection game, out think your opponents by choosing the best strategy. Each turn, you get to choose two actions in secret and then they are resolved in player order. You can move, gather pine cones, throw pine cones, or rest to recover damage.

Do you rush for the flag, or gather an armful of pine cones before you advance? Do you attack from a safe distance or close in for the knockout blow? There is no player elimination, but any player taking too much damage misses turns until he's rested enough to return to the game.

name: Les 1000 Bornes des Animaux
description:
A Mille Bornes variant with animals in much the same way as its predecessor. Here are ranging animals instead of kilometers!

Draw a card to your hand, play or discard.

The game ends when one player has placed a series of six cards and he managed to shoot down six cards in his hand. The game also ends if no cards remaining in the deck is playable.
Each series reported scores up to 40 points, 10 bonus points triggering endgame, foul play by 10 points.
The winner is the first totaling 500 points after several parties.

name: Les 1000 Bornes des Mots
description:
A Mille Bornes variant in which players must form the sentences with the words on the cards.

The goal is to make sentences with these words. Since we Dujardin, add a few cards of attack and defense. The fire becomes red misspelling, and the green light a dictionary.

Draw a card to your hand, play or discard.

The game ends when one player has placed a series of six cards and he managed to shoot down six cards in his hand. The game also ends if no cards remaining in the deck is playable.
Each series reported scores up to 40 points, 10 bonus points triggering endgame, foul play by 10 points.
The winner is the first totaling 500 points after several parties

name: Les 1000 Bornes de la Nature
description:
A Mille Bornes variant in which players must score maximum points by exposing the maximum cards in as many rounds as possible (there are 11 series: mushrooms, flowers, evergreens, deciduous trees, shrubs and fruit trees, herbs and spices, exotic plants, plants water, industrial plants, poisonous plants, medicinal plants).

Draw a card to your hand, play or discard.

The game ends when one player has placed a series of six cards and he managed to shoot down six cards in his hand. The game also ends if no cards remaining in the deck is playable.
Each series reported scores up to 40 points, 10 bonus points triggering endgame, foul play by 10 points.
The winner is the first totaling 500 points after several parties

name: Tatouvu?
description:
There are many details on the game boards.
Players spin the spinner and the arrow show tells you what to look for: a character with glasses, a striped object, (the back) is something that can run, is something that can be eaten etc.
Player who first find it scores a point.

Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle

name: American Illuminati
description:
Though the real history of how the Old World powers spread their influence and came to dominate the USA will never be known, American Illuminati gives you the opportunity to demonstrate how, as the leader of one of these old world dynasties, you would have accomplished the feat.

You will become the leader of an ancient Illuminati faction. Your objective is to infiltrate agents into the newly forming United States in order to exert control over the state governments. The more states you control, the greater your power in the federal government. The more control you have in the federal government the more power you have to dominate the world.

AI is a Euro-style board game that plays equally well with 2, 3 or 4 players. The mechanics are simple enough that you can teach most anyone to play, though strategic players are much more likely to win.

Each player is attempting to place agents into the newly forming USA. The more states your faction controls during the four major turning points in 19th century US history, the more conspiracy cards you will draw. Conspiracy cards can be used to gain advantages during the game but are also how you win the game.The Conspiracy Deck mimics a standard deck of playing cards though all the suites are different to fit the Illuminati theme. Throughout the game you are secretly attempting to form the best Poker hand (what's more American than Poker?) with your Conspiracy Cards while playing your Action Cards to maximum advantage.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Exhibit: Artifacts of the Ages
description:
An old, eccentric archeologist has died and his private collection, rich with a variety of artifacts of various types from various Cultures and Eras, is being auctioned off. These artifacts have not yet been assessed, but as a museum curator, you don't want to wait for that - you do your own research and armed with partial information, you bid based on what you think the item's value might be. Once all bids are in, the artifacts will be assessed, and any bid that's higher than the actual value will not be approved by your board of directors! So for each artifact, the highest bid that is not greater than the actual value will win the auction!

Exhibit is a set collection game with an unusual auction mechanism which is akin to multiple simultaneous games of Liar's Dice.

name: Alter Ego
description:
A cooperative deck building game of vigilante heroism.

You won't see Crime City on any map, but that's how people have come to know your hometown. Sadists, Anarchists, the Mafia, each carving out portions of the city they call their own. Hundreds of innocent bystanders caught up every day in their turf wars, or held under their oppressive thumbs. Precious few have the time, the money, the guts, or the wherewithal to do anything about it. You're one of those few... of course it means you'll have to give up that happy home life, or that cushy job. The newspaper paints vigilantism in a negative light - you'd be viewed by the community as a monster. But your city bleeds... the city bleeds and it calls your name. Will you answer?

You're a vigilante hero, one of the few in Crime City who have come together to put an end to the reign of terror the city's been trapped under. Banding together, you'll fight through a swath of henchmen in order to find and defeat one or more Arch Villains. But to get stronger as a hero, you'll have to neglect some parts of your Alter Ego life - your family, your job, or your community. Which aspect of your Alter Ego life will you neglect?

name: Dice Works
description:
Players race to complete inventions by drafting dice in real time. Build your inventions by grabbing the correct dice... you can draft dice for later by placing it in your scrapyard, but it's not as efficient that way.

Dice Works is a real-time dice drafting game. A number of dice are rolled into the center of the table, and players grab them - one at a time, using only 1 hand - and place them on their player board in an effort to fill up the boxes with the correct assortment of colors. A round ends when all of the dice have been drafted, and players advance their workers into boxes that have been completed.

Players can 'scrap' multiple dice of a single color to create any die they want of that color. The further your workers are advanced, the more efficiently you can scrap.

The winner is the first player to get a worker to the top of 1 (2 on the advanced board) column, finishing an invention!

This game might turn into a spinoff using the dice from Tasty Minstrel Games' Martian Dice game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Auto & Chauffeur
description:
Objective: be the first to finish 1050 km
- moving by turn -
1 each player throws 3 dice - a 4 gives you a car, a 2 a chauffeur; you need BOTH
2 '5' let you move forward one space (50 km), '1' two spaces (100 km)
remarks:
published during 1920's
meeples: pewter cars

name: Dirigibles of Doom!
description:
Dirigibles of Doom is a beer'n'pretzels type game that allows players to duel it out ... very slowly ... in the skies! The game takes a little planning as both momentum and latency of response are key parts of the mechanic. Too aggressive and a midair collision will wipe out you and your enemy. Too conservative and you are a sitting duck. Blimp. Whatever.

These book contains:

Six pages of rules, resplendent with diagrams
Seven scenarios for head to head, multiplayer, and tournament play
Simple snip-n-flip models for blimps, überblimps, hot air baloons and a dragon ... aw, man, how did That get in there?
Terrain flats, so you can have citites to destroy with your dirigibles
Maneuver cards, formatted to print right out on a standard 10 business card sheet
Suggestions for in-game onomatopoeia!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: La Jeu de la guerre des mots
description:
Players form the words on the Scrabble-like game board and try to lead the word path to the central cross of the board.

Players start from their own corners.
In his turn player must use the last letter of the word already on the board and forms the new word starting with this letter.
There are also possibilities to capture opponents' letters.

The player who succeeds first to reach to the central cross, thanks to the progress of his words must forms a last word and wins the game.

name: Schwarzwaldreise
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 43
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move & follow instructions printed on cover inside

remarks:
belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
game should be published during 1920's
title differs in spelling: 'Schwarzwaldreise' (rules) versus 'Schwarzwald=Reise' (cover)
meeples: pewter figures

name: Six Guns and Zombies
description:
Six Guns and Zombies is board game that has been in the works for two years. Each player begins the game controlling a cowboy that is pre-generated. The cowboys start the game in the end of a canyon near their home town just after being caught in a flash flood on their way back from a cattle drive. Throughout the canyon they see materials scattered all over and someone remembers the payroll was on the chuck-wagon and probably in one of those piles of rubble. Suddenly the players begin to eye each other suspiciously as each decides they want all the gold for themselves. To make matters worse some of the other members of the cattle drive, the ones that didn't survive are getting up and moving towards the cowboys with a hungry look in their eyes. Most of the cowboys are armed with a six gun, but these zombies are endless and their ammo isn't. Now the cowboys must work together against the army of undead in order to survive, but in the back of each cowboy's mind is the payroll, and the chance that one of their fellow cowboys will turn on them.

The main objective of the game is to escape the canyon alive. However if multiple players escape the canyon then the player with the most gold is declared the winner. For a single player game the player must search all twenty boxes and escape the canyon alive.

Ages: 8+
Games will last approximately a half hour to an hour.

name: Folimots
description: Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

name: Calculus 81
description:
Playing with four mathematical operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, thanks to two dice.
If the dice show a 6 and a 3, you choose 3 or 6 or 6-3 6x3 or 6:3

In his turn player rolls the dice and choose one of the ADDITION, SUBTRACTION, MULTIPLICATION or DIVISION to gradually bring all his chips from the start square to finish square.

name: Vorsicht! Schwarzes Loch!
description:
Objective: be the first escaping from the dark castle
- moving/acting by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
roll the die - 1d6, 1 coloured die, event cards - encounter a ghost, stop at traffic lights, try to find a shortcut, block your opponents...

remarks:
game was developed for >Industrie Und Kunst< by 'Ilse Spiel'

name: Abkürzung
description:
This game is a merchandising product of the formerly "Dresdner Bank".

Goal of the game is collecting shares, while reducing your cash to 5.000 "Drumbo"´s.

Each player gets an amount of 30.000 (3 or 4 players) or 50.000 (2 players) Drumbos.

The players move forward or backwards on the board and may draw different cards, accordingly the field they end their move. The players need to stop on the field "Bankfiliale" to change cash into shares.

End-Scoring:
In the order of arrival at the goal, the players multiply their shares with 4 (first player), 3 (second player), 2 (third player). The player with the highest amount of shares wins.

name: Mare Nostrum: The Italian Army 1935-1945
description:
Mare Nostrum is an expansion for Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers miniatures game.

From publisher website :

Mare Nostrum is a 104 page pdf download detailing the Italian army from 1935 to 1945. Plenty of platoons, artillery, vehicles, and aircraft, covering everything from the Abbysinian War, the CTV in Spain, the Regio Excritorio, elite forces such as Bersaglieri and Alpini, and even Co-Belligerent forces and RSI. Also included are sections detailing several Italian enemies, including Libyans, Greeks, Yugoslavian partisans, and Ethiopians/Abbyssinians.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Foli+
description:
Similar mechanism as in Folix but there is a addition instead of multiplication.

Players turn the cards face up, and find the two pawns whose product is equal to the number upon the card. The colors upon the card and pawns must also fit, which makes easy to check at a glance that the pair is correct. Some pawns do not bear numbers, but lead to special actions such as turn the board, play again, lose pawns. First to have 20 pawns wins the game.

name: Jugomaniac
description:
Roll the dice and if one dice show the image on the card, write it quickly with your letters, in the time shown on the second dice. Pressing the buzzer and won the card!

Can be used as an educational tool as well that as a game of speed and reflexes.
Learning mode for small, mode for the biggest challenge.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner

name: Fol English
description:
Letter-cards are shuffled and dealt to each participant in one color. Then a word is drawn and all players try to form this word with his letters. First presses the buzzerand earn the card as a point.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

1 game board,
80 double-sided cards,
a buzzer,
four batches of 60 letters in color duplex
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Real-time, Word Game

name: Das Neckteufelchen
description:
Objective: collect cards scoring most winning points
- acting by turn -
active player turns the spinner
1 draw a correspondent card if spinner points on a symbol (8 x 4 cards + 1 devil)
2 if all 4 cards of a chosen symbol are gone ==> take the devil (out of the box or from a player)
3 if devil is yours and pointer ends on devil symbol ==> discard a card (typically with lower value)
4 it all cards are picked game ends at once - winner is player who scored most points
remarks: published early 1960's

name: Moopher's Amazing Journey to the Sea!
description:
The Official Game of the Saskatchewan River Basin!

The story of Moopher begins in a gopher burrow beside a river. One day the curious gopher met a moose. They spent the day together nibbling on plants and sharing stories. The gopher was curious about the mountains the moose talked about and he wanted to go there. The moose said it was too dangerous. The gopher asked why the moose was not afraid. The moose replied that he had antlers to protect him.

That night the gopher dreamed about seeing the mountains. He even dreamed he grew a set of antlers. When he woke up he had an idea. He took the antlers from a plastic deer and taped them to his head. His friend the moose saw him and said "You are the size of a gopher but have antlers like a moose. You must be a Moopher!" Together they traveled to the mountains. One day Moopher met a trout. The trout told Moopher that all rivers run to the sea. When Moopher heard about the sea, he said good-bye to his friends and set off on his amazing journey.

Each player starts on a leaf that marks the headwaters of a river. There are three ways to help Moopher move. Each space on the board is numbered. To move ahead one space, the player must roll the exact number needed on three dice. If one die is the exact number needed, or any of the dice can be added to get the right number, the player moves. The player can also choose to play a memory game with cards or answer a river question. The first player to move their token into Hudson Bay is the winner.
publishers: (Unknown), Partners FOR the Saskatchewan River Basin

name: Der Schatz im Urwald
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target space (with matching move)
- moving by turn -
1 players take red route - first round
2 throw the die - ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on cover inside
3 players take black route - second round - same procedure

name: Club voyage 2
description:
Second compilation of ten games with three classics (f.e. Hangman) and seven other "unpublished" games.

The Boutamot:
An original word game, where a coil is formed of words that begin with the end of the previous word. The more we make big words, the more we encroach on the previous word, the more you score points.

The Tower
Word game with anagrams. At first we wrote a letter, then two, then three and so on. There is a phase five letters and six letters in which he must find a new word, changing only one letter. The first player who can not find the next word loses the game.

Snake Apple :
Tactical game inspired by the game of the Worms.

The Rides:
Car race on a circuit of hexagons. As in car racing on paper, you can change gears at every turn respecting a + or - 1.

The Beach
Mysterious interesting deduction game inspired by the naval battle. Five traps and three treasures are on a beach. We need to find the treasures in less than 100 blows. After each trip, the encoder indicates whether objects are nearby ... or if you jumped on a trap.

name: Club voyage 1
description:
There are 10 different games in this box with three classic games (f.e. the naval battle) and seven more unknown titles.

Even / Odd:
is an interesting tactical game, where players take turns to move numbers on a squares adjacent to occupied squares. The goal is to catch the opponentby playing in a box completely surrounded by occupied squares.

The crossword puzzle:
according to a original rules, each in turn wrote two more letters on a grid to score as many points as possible by lengthening words or creating new ones.

The secret message:
game of deduction and letters.

The architect:
Players move into a house of four levels, while building stairs, doors and windows. Each piece can contain only three elements. Once a player can no longer build or move, he lost the game.

The yacht race is an attempt to adapt a set of sailing race mode pen and paper. Interesting but tedious.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Number, Word Game

name: Race Fans: The Card Game
description:
START YOUR ENGINES!
A major corporation has come to today’s race looking for a team of drivers to sponsor. Unlike other sponsors, this corporation is not looking for a team that only cares about winning; they want a team that gets the crowd’s blood pumping with incredible speeds and daring maneuvers. A gutsy driver is just as likely to be remembered as a winning driver.
Race Fans is a family card game for 1-4 people that has players controlling a team of race car drivers trying to gain fans and win a major corporate sponsorship.

Race Fans is designed to be fast, fun, and easy to learn. The game revolves around 8 race cars in a row called the track. During the game, players use one of two different cards to affect the cars in an attempt to gain fans. Maneuver cards are used to change the position of the race cars on the track while thrill cards are used to gain fans.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports

name: Marlin's Journey
description:
The game is based on the film Finding Nemo, specifically scene in which the father tries to get Nemo back. Players play as Nemo’s father and need to collect the words “M A R L I N” in order. This is a print and play game.

In each round, a 6 sided dice is rolled to determine the movement of father. Then players should collect the words “M A R L I N” in order. The player hove to land exactly on the words, not pass through them. You can’t return the way. If you pass through jellyfish, you have to miss a turn. When you reach Nigel’s box, roll the dice to the goal. With odd numbers, you can finish. But with even numbers, you have to move to seagull box. The player that reaches Nemo first is the winner.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gnominia
description:
Have you ever tried to manage a community of gnomes? This is quite a difficult task as they are hard to control and they usually do whatever they want.

Gnominia puts the players in charge of managing a village inhabited by gnomes and have them competing with other villages. The first player who manages to gain 20 trophies is declared winner.

A game for 1-4 players with a dynamic set-up which allows for ever-changing experiences, Gnominia is a dice interpretation of the deck-/pool-building concept made so popular by games such as Dominion or Ascension. Every player starts with an identical set-up for his village and can activate the various buildings using a set of three dice. During the game, various cards may be purchased to modify the village, allowing for different dice results. Players can also hire mercenaries, found guilds, upgrade their buildings, complete missions, and cast spells in order to gain trophies and win the game. All of this in frantic twenty-minute game...
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: ni Oui ni Non: Géographie
description:
900 questions about geography.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

Contents:

1 game board,
110 cards, including 55 for children (orange) and 55 adult (green),
1 bell,
6 characters.

name: T'as Vu Ta Tête?
description:
Similar to headband games but there are masks instead of headbands.

Put a mask on your head without looking at what it is and guess what animal You are.
Asks questions to other players to find if you're a cow, a monkey or another!
15 funny animals for children to have fun finding out who they are.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Fist Fight Club: The Dice Game
description:
Fist Fight Club – The Dice Game (FFC) is a custom dice game for some fast and furious fist fight action with your mates.

Designed to be a fast play game, FFC is perfect for filling those times when other games are just too long (you know, like when your at your games club and have ten minutes to kill with your mates, or when you're waiting for a train).

How does it play? Well, here is the abridged version for two player games:

Players have 6 custom dice each, these dice have attack and defence icons on. They roll the dice to build up a 'fighting hand' with which to fight each other. Of the 6 dice, 3 are on show to all, three are kept secret.

The attacking players attack by playing one of their dice that shows an attack value. The defending player must play a die that shows the correct defense value to counter the attack value played on them. The attacker then plays a die with an attack value that counters the defense die just played by the defender.

This continues until one player is unable to play a die. If the defender can't play a die, they take a point of damage.

For games of more than 2 players, the actions gets even more intense as players attack who they want with the winner being the player with the least amount of damage taken when the first player to take all their damage is knocked out. So, attacking the player with the most damage isn't always the best tactic!

Capable of filling just as little as 5 minutes for two players but capable of being a big as you want. The more players you add, the more fun it is.

Being compact, it's easy to always having FFC with you. This means you and your mates never end up sitting around with nothing to do at your local club/store as you wait for your opponents to turn up. Just get out your dice and throw down with some mates for some real ‘underground fight club’ action as a warm up for your main event!

name: Reise durch Nord- und Mitteldeutschland
description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game;
each player throws the die moving forward; ending on a marked space follow instuctions of rule sheet.
Remarks:
game has two seperate boards which show north & middle region of W-Germany
printed ~ mid. 1950's
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: JAWS: The Card Sharking Game
description:
The first ever game that actually plays out the Hunt for the Great White from JAWS (1975)! Out of the only handful of games made about JAWS since 1975, none of them have been about or represented the events from the first Jaws film.

1-3 players play the Orca ship deck, 1 player plays the JAWS deck. The Orca deck wants to run the JAWS deck out of cards with various weapons, flotation barrels, a shark proof cage, strychnine, etc. During the hunt the Orca players can be expected to drink, sing, fish, work together and back stab each other. The time of day can change as the hunt progresses as well as the Orca's distance from shore.

The JAWS deck wants to eat the Orca crew, consisting of Quint (Robert Shaw), Hooper (Richard Dreyfuss), and Brody (Roy Scheider)! No better way to do this then by sinking the Orca first! Each deck has its own unique way of winning.

Everything that happens during the last hour of JAWS (1975) is in this game. Everything!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Petit Folimots: Animaux
description:
Little Folimots - Animals.

Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

Little FOLIMOTS can be used as a expansion of Folimots with 80 new cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Petit Folimots: Le Corps Humain et les Vêtements
description:
Little Folimots - The Human Body and Clothing

Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

Little FOLIMOTS can be used as a expansion of Folimots with 80 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Petit Folimots: Les Fruits, Legumes et Aliments
description:
Little Folimots - Fruits, Vegetables and Food.

Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

Little FOLIMOTS can be used as a expansion of Folimots with 80 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Bliv Borgmester i Mariagerfjord
description:
From the website:

"The game's objective is to become mayor and keep the post of mayor, which obviously gives certain advantages during the game. This is done by collecting votes throughout the game.

Besides the mayor title, it is also to acquire the city's businesses and create jobs for the city. This allows power and affects on each player's ability to gather votes. Money means a lot in the game, but is certainly not the decisive element. It's about playing the game tactically and be part of an alliance at the right time. The player can sit on power at one moment and sit with almost nothing the next minute. It is therefore important to constantly be alert and keep up with what opponents are doing. 2-6 participants. From approx. 9 years. Younger children may have practical roles. The game duration is about 100 min..."

Commercial Concept: The concept of Bormesterspillet is very simple. The city's enterprises and businesses buy advertising space on the local board. The prices for advertising slots vary by size.

Source: [www.borgmesterspil.dk The Game Website].
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading, Voting

name: YerTurn!
description: In YerTurn! each player, one at a time, draws a 'create' card and attempts to mold the object featured on the card with modeling dough. Other players attempt to guess the object the creator is molding. The player who guessed the object and the player who created the object will advance on the board. Special 'turn' cards are drawn when a player lands on a YerTurn! space; these cards include actions (double up, smash, lose a turn, etc) for use immediately or to save for later. Play consists of moving through the spaces on the board and being first to the final space!

name: Wer gewinnt den Ozeanflug Europa: Amerika
description:
Objective: be the first team (2 players) reaching target space (30) with a matching number
- Roll & Move' game with spinner/moving by turn -
each player spins a number to form/join a team
2 - 4 players must take off in USA, 5 - 8 in Europe
best number gets the Zeppelin (starting from space 11)
spin and move according the number - ending on an even-numbered space follow instructions: see cover inside

remarks:
published early/mid 1930's in Germany
very large map: 47 x 67 cm / 18.5 x 26.4 inches
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Syne-Strat 7
description:
French abstract strategy game for 2-4 players.

A chess/ draughts type game played on a board of hexagonal spaces, where the aim is to ‘secure’ the central group in order to place one of your towers there, or to capture all of the enemy towers. Securing the central group can be achieved by Majority or Totality.

If aiming for a ‘Majority’:

With two players you must occupy 5 of the 6 hexes in the central group.
With three players you must occupy 4 of them.
With four player you must occupy 3 of them


If aiming for ‘Totality’:
You must occupy at least one hex of the central group with the rest being completely empty of opposing pawns.

To win by either of the above methods the player must place
one of his towers in the central hex, which takes ‘a turn’. Victory can also be achieved by capturing all of the opposing towers thereby leaving you opponent without a tower to place in the central blank hex.

name: ไดโนฟาร์ม บิวด์เกม: เปิดฟาร์มสวนสนุกยุคไดโนเสาร์ (Dinofarm Buildgame)
description:
English Translation title
"Dinofarm Buildgame: Open Amusement Park Farm in Dinosaur Era"

The card game that be added to the educational-purposed comic-like book with same title.

This is stand alone expansion of Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm / Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm. As in Dinofarm, you are a dinosaur rancher and you build the farm and raise the dinosaurs or reptiles from Mezoic era.

All rules are as same as Dinofarm, but there are additional rules and added Event Cards as the sub-type of Farm card. The game flow - at the start of the round, 2 Assistance cards is dealt to each player. Start from the starting player each player solves their turn by drawing 2 Dinosaur cards and play 3 actions from 4 available (Build Farm, Raise dinosaur, play Assistance card and discard and re-deal the farm card in the market). At the end of round, all player discard their Assistance cards and shuffle all Assistance cards to rebuild the Assistance deck. You can buy and play as Farm card, but discard it after solving.

Winning the game by having the most victory point at the end of the game. The victory point is calculate at the end of game by the Farm Card and raised Dinosaur Card in the farm.

Combined with Dinofarm,this can be played by up to 8 players.

Integrates with:

Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm / Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm

name: The Dover Road Shooting Game
description:
Straightforward target game but with some flair for relating to the title. In the 18th century, coach travellers were often accosted by highwaymen and the Dover Road was a popular haunt, lying as it does between London and the port of Dover.

The targets, in period dress, are the coach itself, one alarmed passenger, one passenger who has just been shot and the highwayman.

The gun is operated by a rubber band but just look at the appearance, as near as they could get to an 18th century pistol.

The winner is the one with the most hits after the game ends.

name: Up and Over
description:
One of the type of game that the British, in particular, liked to play.

Each horse is attached to a length of string. By 'jiggling' the string, your horse can be made to move forward and, when a jump is reached, a different use of the string will allow your horse to 'jump' the fence. A fair amount of dexterity and finesse is needed with the aforementioned actions. The horses have two bases you might say, one flat and one rounded (it works exactly the same as a wheel would).

The first to finish the course, wins.

name: Dirt-Track Racing for Motor Cycles
description:
Speedway was so popular in Britain in the 1930's, many games reflected this.

This is a simple roll and move game. If your bike lands on one of many illustrated spaces, you must follow the instructions.

First to reach the finish-line, wins.

name: Ting-a-Ling
description:
The game consists of a board with 6 holes which stands on two wooden blocks and in each of the holes hangs a bell. There are 2 large and 6 small tiddleywinks. The idea of the game is to propel your counters, Tiddleywinks fashion, and you score points for each tiddleywink that you fire through the holes with bonus scores for ringing the bells on the way through.

The rules are on a sheet attached to the inside of the box.

Highest score wins.

name: International Football Game
description:
An action game for two football fans.

The board features several indentations which are long and thin. Each indentation has a player attached, and by moving levers at your end of the table, you can slide your footballer forward or back in order to 'kick' the ball. The ball is magnetic so that it is attracted to the nearest indentation once it has been kicked.

The winner is the one with the most goals after a pre-agreed time limit has expired.

name: Bailing Out
description: A spin and move game. The object of the game is to be the first to reach the jump space by exact spin and then descend by parachute to the landing finish area. Players spin the indicator in turn and then move along the "Take off Run" the number of spaces indicated. Any number of pieces can be on the same space. You must follow the instructions on any space that you land on. You must reach the space marked JUMP by exact spin, and when you do, you must remain there until you spin a 6 on a following turn to descend by parachute to the landing field and win the game

name: Destroy the Invaders
description:
Publisher's description:

Earth is being attacked by alien invaders. Can you defend it or will your Battle Cruisers be pulverised by the Invaders' Star Ships? Try this exciting 2000AD game and see just how ready you are for combat in the vast depths of outer space.

Abstract Strategy game given away in prog 233 of 2000AD. Players move their pieces around the triangular board in an effort to surround an opponents piece on all three sides, thereby eliminating that piece. The game is won when an opponent is reduced to two pieces.

name: Comical Tivoli Game
description:
The game consists of a board with holes in. Each hole scores a certain number of points. At the back of the board, a three-dimensional 'slide' is erected. Into the top of this slide, a player in his turn, drops a ball. The ball will bounce around the circus clowns at either side of the slide and, eventually, come out at the bottom and score points when it settles into one of the holes.

The points available range from 5 to 100, the latter hole being right in the middle of the board.

The one who earns the most points, wins.

name: Quiz to go: English Basics
description:
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Wissen für Kids
description:
Easier questions for younger players.
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Quiz to go: Martin Luther
description:
Quiz about Martin Luther
There is a question in one side of the card and 4 variants for this question and information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Reformatoren
description:
"Reformers" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Quiz to go: Weltgeschichte
description:
"World History" in English
There is a 2 or 3 questions in one side of the card and 4 variants for each question and information in another side of the card.

In his turn player reads the question and choose the variant. If it is correct he gets the card as a point.

Game ends if the deck has exhausted and player with the most points is the winner.

name: Battlemage
description:
BATTLEMAGE is a fantasy wargame for two or more players. Each person controls a small warband of warriors, each led by a powerful Battlemage. You are fighting for power and glory, but more than that you are fighting for control of the world of Ra'al.

A game of BATTLEMAGE is fought between two warbands, each led by a powerful spellcaster called a Battlemage. The game is played on a tabletop with miniature figurines.

The game uses six-sided dice to resolve the conflict. Each figure (or 'warrior' as the game calls them) has it's own set of statistics that define how good it is at fighting: MV (move), ATT (attack), DEF (defence) and W (wounds). Additionaly, they may have special rules that let them do unusual things, such as make ranged attacks, use powers, or fly through the air, to name but a few.

The book contains five different warbands, each led by a different Battlemage. They include the Whiterock Loyalists, the Shadow Academy, the Cult of the Black Wind, The Horde of Seven Peaks and the Ghostwood Raiders.

Campaign rules are also include with the game, so that your warriors can improve with each battle.

name: Lauras Weg zum Stern
description:
Objective: collect as many points (stars) as possible; alternative: be the first reaching target space with a matching number
- moving by turn; similar to 'Snakes and Ladders' -
• move according die roll - no kick out, meeples can be put on same space
• if your move ends on a rocket space move meeple to the 'top of the rocket' space
• if your move ends on a 'Robocat space' ==> move down & get a 'star' slide (as long as available)
• first one reaching target space (96) gets the big star slide
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Alley Oop Jungle Game
description:
A very old-fashioned game even in 1936. I mean the rules, not the sparkling illustrations by V.T.Hamlin.

You have to get to the end of the trail. A spinner is used rather than a die. You move as directed by the spinner. If you land on a special space, you must follow the instructions. If you land on the same space as another player, that player must go back 5 spaces.

First to the end of the track (by exact spin, of course), wins.

name: C'est pas sorcier DVD Game
description:
Follow the road of knowledge with Fred and Jamy and let yourself be guided by the DVD to arrive first at the end of the road! 850 questions on five topics around the Earth and the Universe. Questions and explanations images with almost 350 experts from the program.

Contents:

1 board,
6 pawns,
an interactive DVD,
220 cards

name: C'est pas sorcier écologie
description:
C'est pas Sorcier version with ecological questions.

The objective of this quiz game is to return to the Studio first while absorbing a load of knowledge! Along the way, the players must answer questions. Each card includes a question, three wrong answers, the right answer and most importantly its explanation!

name: Cannons & Cutthroats
description:
Play as a pirate, Captain of your own ship! Your goal is to obtain the most gold: the pirating way! In game you will: obtain precious treasures, hold prisoners captive, blast your opponents with cannons, and board enemy ships to steal their booty!

C&C uses a unique cannon combat mechanic where players must find or trade for gunpowder and ammunition in order to fire their cannons. Players can use cannonballs to sink enemy ships, chain-shot to make players lose turns (to repair their masts!), or grapeshot to clear the opponent's deck of crew.

Crew are used for boarding enemy ships to steal their cargo. Crew can be equipped with pistols, muskets, rapiers, or cutlasses in order to increase their chance of success. If victorious, crew are able to steal cards from the opposing player, whether that be supplies or gold. Treasure cards will trade hands multiple times before the next Port! card is found where the players can take a breather before the next round of raids and cannon bombardments begin.

This is a dice and card game that relies heavily on luck. In this sense, its best suited for casual gamers who are looking for a medium length game (30-60 minutes) that has excitement in every turn.

The game includes rules, two D6 dice, and 136 poker-size cards.

name: New Men Checkers
description:
It is played on a 8x8 checkerboard. Every rank has 24 men, 20 ordinary and 4 with determined characteristics. The board is numbered from a1 to h8.

The pieces are collocated on squares dark and clear. Pieces on a1 and h1 (a8 and h8 for Black) are called asterisk, because are marked with a green asterisk. They move and capture diagonally and vertically (forwards and backwards) but capture diagonally forwards with a long jump like flying king. When it reaches the last row and become king, this one moves diagonally, vertically and horizontally with a long jump, but captures diagonally and vertically.

The pieces on d1 (e8 for Black) are marked with a blue exclamation point and are called expoint. They move and capture diagonally and vertically (forward and backwards), but capture diagonally backwards with a long jump like flying king. When it reached the last row and become king, it moves and captures diagonally vertically and horizontally.

The pieces collocated on e1 (d8 for Black) are marked with a red across, and are called across. It move and capture diagonally and vertically (backwards and forwards), but capture horizontally with a long jump. When they reach the last row and become king, this one moves and captures (diagonally, vertically and horizontally),and it can not captured by men.

Simple men when it reach the last row after a capture and have still possibilities to catch, it go on to capture and not become King at the moment.Wins who blocks or captures all enemy pieces.

name: Titeuf zizi sexuel le jeu
description:
Characters from the comic strip ask questions about love and sex and make various funny tests for younger audiance 8+.

On certain squares players have a different tasks: ask questions, making mimes, making objects with clay, drawing, truth test, challenges etc.

The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the square "arrived". For this, players move from square to square and make succesfully different tests and answer different questions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wouégo: Le Quiz Musical
description:
Wouégo is a music quiz, which means that players must recognize musical excerpts.

The game features three CDs containing 99 tracks of original music clips and 600 questions on the cards.
The goal of the game is to find who sings and answer questions.

The game can be played as a team.

name: Ein neues Märchenspiel
description:
Objective: be the first to reach target space 'E' (101)
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/moving by turn -
move your meeple according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside

name: Der verrückte Kreisel
description:
Objective: score most points spinning a top
- acting by turn -
each players spins a top inside the - with dents adored - box
the dent where the top ends shows the winning points you get

remarks:
several editions - first one ~ 1925
in comparison with other spinning-top-scoring-zone games the top docks in, not a marble, a pin...

name: Corroboree
description:
A simple track game designed and illustrated by Jessie MacQueen Mackintosh (1892–1958). In the game, Mackintosh used not only Aboriginal motifs, but also illustrations of traditional Aboriginal life and cultural events.

Being a roll and move game, there are plenty of special spaces and you must obey them if you end your move on one. Special spaces include No. 5 Dig for honey ants — miss a turn? No. 13 Throw boomerang — run to the emu space; No. 45 Pointing bone — you are knocked out of the game; No. 87 Lost churinga (shield), go back to No. 71’. And so on.

The explanatory notes that accompany the game are an attempt to broaden the knowledge of the players about indigenous culture.

I cannot be absolutely certain but it would appear the game was never boxed (highly plausible in the 40's after the war).

name: Cosmic ConneXion
description:
Cosmic ConneXion is an entertaining and educational word search card game created to familiarize players with the Greek alphabet and objects of the cosmos. The deck consists of 2 sets of cards, letter cards and celestial point value cards. The letter cards consist of all 24 letters of the Greek alphabet from Alpha to Omega. Each letter card displays the name, uppercase & lowercase Greek letter, along with English equivalents and variants. The letter cards are played in a diamond arrangement to create words. The celestial point value cards consist of 28 objects of the cosmos from our local solar system to the constellations of the zodiac along with wild cards of the cosmos. For each word formed, a player acquires a celestial point value card from the draw pile. The object of the game is to aquire as many celestial point value cards as possible. However, after all the letter cards have been played, the player who has acquired the sun card during regular play has a final opportunity to score additional points during the bonus round by forming a grammatically correct sentence from the words formed during regular play. The player with the highest point value wins.
Age Range: 8 and up

name: Obsolescence
description:
Develop, upgrade, and recycle electronic gadgets by laying tiles representing components on a circuit board.

Designed during 48-hour 2012 Global Game Jam at NYU Game Center. (Minimal playtesting, rules and tile mix require further fine tuning and balancing.)

Tile Placement game in which players develop, upgrade, and recycle successive generations of Apple gadgets by laying tiles representing components on a circuit board, connector edge to connector edge in order to form closed loops consisting of newly laid and previously laid components.

Component Tiles can only be placed adjacent to a tile with a shared connector edge (border) OR on top of one another to create Gadgets. Each successive generation of gadget is built on top of the prior generation's components. Components on the stack level corresponding to the current device generation are added to the builder's score, components hidden by others on higher stack levels are subtracted from the score. A completed gadget-- a closed loop of component tiles also referred to as a device-- is defined by it's most numerous component type, with each component corresponding to a different device, and scores a bonus upon completion. Gadget Cards depict their majority component requirement and keep track of descending bonus values for each device generation of that type built by all players (the first one built is worth more).

name: Acrab'Tout!
description:
Similar to Crazy Crab, where a mechanical device is attempting to thwart your mission to grab all of your food pieces. Players try to pick up with the forks seahorses, shells or starfishes. But watch out! The terrible Crab terrible watching You and jump on You if you touch the plate.
Be the first to pick up all of Your food.

name: Comment naissent les bébés?
description:
"How babies are born?" in English

Educational game where players move around the board drawing cards with the associate questions and their answers or to make small tests.
Twelve illustrated plates contain a summary of all the concepts discussed, and the answers to most questions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: Gesund gewinnt
description:
Objective: know as many questions as possible out of health
care
- acting by turn -
promotional edition (Bristol-Myers-Squibb)
draw cards, move your meeple as fast as you can answering multiple choice questions correctly

name: Diamino poker
description:
Like a Poker Dice, but there are letters on dice.
Player rolls dice and may choose to reroll two times some of the dice.
Each letter is worth certain number of points.
If player forms a word he adds up the values of the letters.
Player with the most points for his word wins.

name: Fjör til enda
description:
From the back of the box: Fjör til enda is a fun, varied game where players travel around the world and have exciting adventures and all kinds of troubles. Players can win a trip with a private jet to South America, ride a bike, train, taxi or stay for a visit at the North Pole. Everybody is active the whole time and anything can happen.

The player who is the first one to get six continent cards (one for each continent) wins the game. Players roll two dice and move accordingly on the map. They can use the Forward/Not cards to add/subtract from their rolls. Luck/Bad luck cards are as the name implies good or bad for the one who draws them. Continent cards are the object of the game, players have to roll a die and depending on the number, perform some action to win that card.

name: Veiðirím
description: From the publisher: Veiðirím is a new game aimed at children four to eight years old who are learning to read. The game is also useful for children who have trouble learning to read and also for children learning Icelandic. Veiðirím is a memory game with nouns and adjectives that rhyme, which players learn to read by seeing the pictures.

name: Reise in's Märchenland
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (100)
- moving by turn -
roll the die (1d6) & move forward; ending on an occupied space: meeple is going to be replaced; ending on a marked space: follow instructions glued on cover inside
remarks: published ~ early 1950's in the GDR

name: Super 1000 Bornes électronique
description:
Like in Mille Bornes the goal is to be the first to reach the 1000 miles with some new attack cards included.

This game includes also electronique game console who decides attacking.

players compete to drive 1000 km, dealing with hazards along the way. Draw a card to your hand, play or discard. You must lay a green traffic light to start, play cards showing mileage, dump hazards (flat tire, speed limit) on the other players, remedy hazards (spare tire, end of limit) from yourself, play safety cards (puncture proof), and try to be the first to clock up the distance.

name: Super Kem's
description:
There are 2 teams in this card game.
Players exchange the cards with each other trying to be the first to match 4 indetical cards in hand and make the secret, pre-agreed sign with their partner, who must quickly ring the bell and say "Kem's!" to score a point. But if opponent team rings the bell first and shouts "Counter-Kem's!" they score a point instead.

Team who has the most points at the end of the game wins the game.

Contents:

52 cards,
6 sign cards,
2 wild cards,
a doorbell,
a bag

name: Super Zero
description:
Due to budget cuts,the entire police force in your city has been laid off and now every villain in town is running wild!
The crime wave is raging out of control and it's up to you and your fellow costumed heroes to take matters into your own hands!
Each player begins as an inexperienced vigilante with barely enough crime fighting skill to take on even the most inept villain. On each turn, players divide their time between training their hero, fighting crimes, and reverse-engineering villain technology to use as their own.
By the end of the game each Hero is stronger, faster and equipped with the re-purposed Villain Technology he needs to take on even the toughest Arch Villain! The player who brings the most notorious villains to justice wins.

name: La Bouteille Infernale
description:
Truth or dare game with hellish bottle the game machine what is placed at the center of the table, the mechanism is triggered, and the bottle spins itself. When it stops, the player pointed by the bottle: must respond questions truthfully or make an action previously agreed to score a point.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Crac Pied
description:
A crack up is a memory game based on the bolts to be manipulated.
Once a bolt has been screwed more than 8 times, the foot begins to cry.

The first player spins the arrow at the top of the foot. He discovers Hits (number of screws) he must perform. The player may screw his hits to one bolt or multiple bolts.

Player who screw one bolt the 8th turn is eliminated from the game.

The last player in the game is the winner!

name: Ein fröhlicher Kinderausflug
description:
Objective: be the first to finish the circle (climbing up to '20' & getting back
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; each player rolls the die (1d6) & moves forward; ending on a red space you have to calculate (addition or subtraction) printed numbers moving to new space

remarks:
cute meeples
published ~ 1920's
belongs to series: 'Scholz künstlerische Spiele'

name: Hexagonias
description:
Game uses 6 dice (3x3d6 + joker dice) and a game board with triangles, squares, pentas and hexes.

Object of the game is to perform the first all contracts with the dice. It may be possible to carry out two contracts simultaneously.

The contracts are:
6 SUITES with different figures.
Fill the Triangle or roll 3 dice with the number 3
Fill the QUADRA or roll 4 dice with the number 4
Fill the PENTA or roll 5 dice with the number 5
Fill the HEX or roll 6 dice with the number 6

Player who perform all contracts first is the winner

name: Fractionus
description:
The game about fractions.
Play with fractions through the two dice.
e.g. The dice show a 3 and 5. Will you choose 3/5 or 5/3?

Object of the game is to roll the dice and choose the most appropriate fraction to bring all his chips from the first box to box DEPARTURE ARRIVAL crossing the proposed route.

Also player can opposing his opponents to block him or slow its progression.

name: Trigaxial
description:
Each player or team has 18 pieces on a circular chess board.
The pieces move at angles corresponding to their nature:
1/2 turn, 1/4 turn, 1/8 of a turn, check box, etc.
The game has richness and variety of movement of each piece result in many combinations.

Object of the game is make a contract making himself master of an area agreed in advance.

In his turn players:
- Make one or more threats against the adversaries,
- Defense against the opponent's attack,

name: Kinty
description:
Play it like a poker, by building words from two to five letters.

There are following combinations in this game in ascending order:
1. five unpaired cards
2. a pair - a two-letter word
3. two pairs - two two-letter words
4. three of a kind - a three letter word
5. a full house - a three letter word and a two-letter word
6. a square - a four letter word
7. a straight - a five-letter word bicolor
8. a straight black - a black four-letter word
9. a straight red - a red five-letter word
10. the kinty - a red five-letter word, starting with a "Z".

Contents:

The 104 cards consist of:


a) an alphabet of red color as a 52 cards.
b) an alphabet of black color as a 52 cards.
Red always wins black.

name: Eine Wanderung im Harz
description:
Objective: be the first ending the circle in Wernigerode
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
red marked spaces: skip a turn
blue marked spaces: follow instructions glued on cover inside

remarks:
at least 2 different editions from LIK & Spika
there was also inserted a small booklet 'Das kleine Harzbuch' for travel information
numbering system of GDR games not always easy to understand: three copies got three different codes
seems that the sequence '742/2/72' describes year of production (1972) of this specific copy
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: All About Richmond
description: This is a roll and move game about visiting places in Richmond and collecting 8 Travel Cards and then return their residence. The locations are popular places in Richmond from the 1980s or historic locations (like the Poe Museum). It was a limited edition game when it came out and included $100 in coupons (yippee!).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Round O' Golf
description:
From the back of the box:

"An 18-Hole Adventure Game

Fast, Action Golf that's easy to Play. Beginners or Experienced players will feel the excitement of real golf action.

Play real 18-Hole, Par 72 Golf on this colorful Gameboard. Roll the dice, avoid the hazards and land on the green to beat or match the par of the hole. Lowest Score wins."

The game comes with a spiral bound book of the course, which is covered with dots. On your turn, you choose how many dice to roll based on a chart (dependent on if you are on the Tee, Fairway, Rough, Trees, Sand or Green) and move the number of dots based on the outcome of the dice. All the other rules for golf apply. Lowest score at the end of the 18 holes wins.

name: Vertellekes, das neue
description:
Objective: train memory, improve relationships/communication
target group: senior living groups
- to be played with moderator only -
1 place (round) theme cards on the table, forming a circle
2 active player moves big meeple according die roll, ending on a theme card
3 moderator draws correspondent card announcing the task
4 all players are invited to 'act' like singing a song, answering a question, pantomiming...

remarks:
- first edition published ~ 2000
- new edition with improved materials
- game is designated for people suffering from dementia, too
- depending on participants themes can be reduced, time limits changed...
- background of German title: low German minimization of 'stories'
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Educational, Mature / Adult, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: Vocabulon des Petits
description:
Vocabulon game for the youngest children to learn and memorize a dynamic way and step by letters of the alphabet. Object is to find the words from their picture first. Players conquers letters of their secret words by rolling the dice and moving around the board and answering questions, solving puzzles.

Contents:

6 picture boards
6 word boards
120 words cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Faszination  Die Welt mit Audi spielend entdecken
description:
Objective: be the first to reach destination ending the circle around the world
- acting/moving by turn -
each player moves according die roll, draws question cards (on appropriate spaces), plays poker getting 'smilies' which make the task easier...

remarks:
promotional edition, manufactured by Ravensburger

name: Experten Quiz für Feinschmecker
description:
Objective:
find correct answers for questions out of the world of connoisseurs/gastronomes
- acting by turn -
decision: form teams or acting as 'lone fighter'
give fast & correct answers on questions like:
What is the correct name of 'The Queen of Spice'?
What do you need as a cook if you want to 'bard'?
content:
50 cards with 150 questions, multiple-choice-answers and detailed explanations on the back of the cards
remarks:
game belongs to a series: 'Experten Quiz'
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Twiga
description:
Each player chooses an animal to build.
Twiga the giraffe and the monkey Chim are cut into 9 pieces. Each piece is available in 6 sizes.

In his turn player rolls the dice to determine the size of the next piece and place the piece with that size in front of him in correct order.
(If player roll 1, he gets the lowest piece, but if he rolls 6 he gets the highest piece of animal)

Player who has the highest animal is the winner

name: Greekopoly
description:
User Summary

This an unusual take on the usual Monopoly theme. In Greekopoly the object of the game is for the players to travel around the board collecting colonies (fraternities & sororities), build on these, and force other players to go broke. (Players have to pay dues when landing on other player's properties.) When only one solvent player is left, that player is the Winner.

There are several interesting wrinkles in this title. Unlike in Monopoly where the properties for a neighborhood are within a few spaces of each other, Greekopoly Triads (a combination of 2 fraternities & 1 sorority of the same color) are distributed on different sides of the board. In order to start building on these properties all the properties of a Triad must be owned by the same player. There are also Independent Colonies. Players may build on these without owning other properties, but only when they land on them. (This is in contrast to a Triad which may be built on at the rate of one building or upgrade per turn.) Other properties, simply referred to as Independents (like Greek Sportswear, Campus Pub, etc.) can be bought, but may not be built on.

The game's IFC cards and TGIF cards fulfill the roll that Community Chest & Chance have in classic Monopoly. They introduce the role of chance (with positive and negative outcomes) with the draw of a card. There are also some special spaces on the board, some positive, and some negative… like the Dean's Office, where a player may be stuck so long he has to forfeit one of his Colonies.

This title was clearly meant to capitalize on the enduring popularity of the 1978 film National Lampoon's Animal House" while skirting the need to pay licensing fees. Even the cover art, which also appears on the game board, strongly resembles the style and the content of the poster for Animal House's theatrical release.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hamlet
description: Hamlet is a tile placing area-control game for two to four players that revolves around each player taking on a specific role for the turn in an attempt to build a medieval village. Each turn is divided into two phases. During the first phase, each player secretly selects a role from a limited set that will determine the play order for the round, as well as granting either a positive or negative benefit. During the second phase, player's place location tiles and play events while jockeying to place their tokens in such a way as to gain control of the largest point producing areas. Once each player has gone through all of their roles, the game ends and the player with the most victory points win.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Ore no Shikabane wo Koeteyuke -Jigoku Meguri-
description:
It's the expansion of Dungeon Star Dungeon Star

It's changed to the corporate rule to be arranged from the original version by Kenichi Tanabe.

The system is based on the original rule.
The components are only 20 cards.

The players make the party for the dungeon of the hell imaged in Japan.
The turn player rolls the special dices with a few V mark, when he/she gets two or more V mark, the party marker advance the dungeon. The rolled dices will be changed to more difficult.

Then the players will battle with the bosses.

The players have the special activities, and will be up the level. So the player can use more special activities.

It's like the Japanese RPG. However, it's kept the corporate board game.

The player's HP is nothing. All are needed the V mark of dices.

name: Wonderland
description:
Two players play as the Red or White Queens of Wonderland.

Through playing cards as either events or as influence, players can spread their ifluence throughout a modular map of Wonderland in order to gain control of the magical world.

Players also can try to control the mysterious Alice and help woo her to their cause.

The Queen who can influence Wonderland the greatest wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Push
description:
Push is played on a 15X15 square board with each player having 10 stones. Pieces move one as a chess king, and a player has three moves on a turn.

There must always be a one place buffer between opposing pieces. When a piece is moved next to an opponent piece it is pushed away one space to create the buffer. If a piece is pushed into another piece, or the side, it is captured. A player loses when they are down to one piece.

Push was an entry in the THE THOUSAND-YEAR GAME DESIGN CHALLENGE

name: Antipode
description:
Antipode is played on a 5-hexagon, with elements of Hex, Othello, Yinsh

On a turn a player places a token of his color, flipping any adjacent tokens (ala Othello).

And the second step of your turn is to move your pawn. You may move your pawn any number of spaces in a straight line, making no turns in the process.

Your pawn must come to rest on a token of your own color. You may not land on an empty space, or one of your opponent’s tokens. While you are allowed to pass over as many tokens and empty spaces as you wish, you may not, under any circumstances, pass over your opponent’s pawn. Passing over tokens causes them to be flip.

The game ends when one player successfully makes a connection from any one corner to that corner’s exact opposite (Hex-like). The connection will cover a minimum of nine spaces, but the connection does not need to form a straight line.

name: Rush Run Riot
description:
Rush Run Riot is played in an 8X8 board.

Each player has a king (unmoveable) set in opposite corners.

Players also have 4 pawns which can move as rook up to 3 spaces. Players move two pawns per time.

A pawn may jump a pawn of its own color.

There are also four neutral 'bouncers' which are shared. They move as a chess king (and are moved in lieu of a pawn move.

Players must move their pawns across the board and surround the opponent's king.

It was an entry in the Thousand-Year Game Design Challenge.

name: Mulan Matchin' Fashion Puzzle Game
description:
Game contains 4 pagodas and 16 puzzle pieces, along with a spinner. To start, all puzzle pieces are placed face down in the center and each player takes one pagoda.

On each turn, the player spins the spinner. If it lands on black, you turn over a black piece from the pile. If it lands on white, you turn over a white piece from the pile. If the upturned piece matches the player's pagoda color, they keep it. If not, it is shown to all players and returned to the center, white or black side up. If the spinner lands on Mushu, the player must trade their pagoda with another player. First player to complete their pagoda with all 4 pieces wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Whirligig
description:
Party game for children. 12 cards with different photographs are placed where every participant can see them. They get a sheet to record their answers on. Each picture will have in it at least 4 items beginning with a letter of the alphabet. Picture 1 might be letter D, Picture 2 might be letter A, and so on.

The child with the most correct answers, wins.

It was selected as a favourite game by the BBC's Children's Hour programme.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Chiens et Chats du monde
description:
A set of travel and hunting dogs and cats must walk around the board (in the opposite direction, to join their boxes with their pictures. Tokens are moved by rolling the dice. A little dog chasing a cat (or vice versa) arrived exactly on his square. The first player to put all his chips into the opponent's side triggers scoring.
10 points is earned for a chip on his arrival box, for a token in the opponent's camp, -5 is earned for a token that has not moved.

Contents:

A plateau with 148 boxes
24 dogs and 24 cats chips
48 action cards representing tokens
An explanatory booklet on the 48 dogs and cats.

name: Write the Word "Cricket"
description: Party game. Each guest is given a card with questions on it. The twist is that each answer will be a word related to the game of cricket. For example, 'Imposed by a judge' would be 'bail'. There are 12 answers in all. The most correct answers, wins

name: Wild West Shooting Gallery
description:
A target shooting game with some humour. Just look at the outlaw target, shooting his own foot.

Here are the complete rules:

WILD WEST SHOOTING GALLERY
Here we have four lawless characters from way out in the Wild West, at present in a gay mood. Little do they know that the Sheriff’s posse is hot on their trail.
Why not join the Sheriff and his men and try your skill at shooting these rascals down?
HOW TO PLAY
Stand the target in the slotted wooden blocks at the sides of the box, then place it at a distance of four to five feet from the players.
Hold gun in your right hand and insert the metal end of the dart into the muzzle, resting rubber head of dart against palm of left hand, press home dart until spring “clicks" into loaded position.
Play can be for a pre-arranged total score, the first player reaching such score being the winner, or for a certain number of rounds, the highest scorer being the winner, 2nd and 3rd highest runners-up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Children's Game

name: Omphalos
description: By placing their tiles and moving tiles opposing players together form a square of 5x5 (2 or 3 players) or 7x7 (4 players). Within this square that moved over the part at the option of poses and movements of tiles, each aims to create rows of his color (an alignment with at least three tiles) and antagonize those of its opponents. But the player who occupies one of the tiles with the center of the square at the end of the game double its alignment points (2 players, it double its strongest alignment).
publishers: Jeux sur un Plateau, Olpan Edition

name: Wise Saws
description:
Party game.

Each guest receives a card with 20 lines from a saying I would think. They have to fill in the second line which must rhyme with the first line. The bizarre example given is;

"You may find, once you've got her for better or worse"
"That ---------------"

Did you get it? Me neither. The actual winning line is;
"That the Grey Mare's the better horse"

Come on Delgado - Worse and Horse do not rhyme!

The guest getting the most right answers, wins.

name: Fantail Athletism
description:
Board Game based on Athletic Disciplines

You will enjoy a real board game where athletic events are simulated on a track and field. Such as 100/200/400 metres, 110 metres hurdles, 4x100 metres, long, high and triple jump, and throwing events including: javelin, hammer discus and shot put.
The goal is to achieve the highest score in the different athletic disciplines that are considered before the event.

The board represents the field and running track. On the track disciplines are developed throws and jumps, and on the track racing. The players will use 2/5 dice of different colors, depending on how many of the same discipline to develop. Difficulties in the disciplines are taken into account with one of the dice to use. In each discipline each player (athlete) will move its piece on the board in the room or location that corresponds to the number thrown with the dice and thereby indicate the regulations in each discipline.

The player who collected the most points at the end of the disciplines developed will be the winner of the competition.

name: Face-Off Hockey
description:
Face-Off Hockey is an abstract sports game that uses unique dice and a morale point system to simulate all the exciting action of hockey.

Easy to learn and teach, even if you've never watched or played the sport.

Face-Off Hockey uses 16 unique dice. Each player will select a set of 7 that include, 4 Forwards, 2 Defencemen, and a Goalie. The dice use a straight forward color scheme making them easy to identify, with glyphs that are universally recognisable.

Fight for puck possession and attempt to generate offence in order score goals and win the game.

The morale system simulates the highs and lows that your team will encounter throughout the course of a game. Use your morale boost to perform special actions which could lead to a turning point in the game!

Track scores, turns, period and any penalties with the cleverly designed play mat.

Face-Offs, Checking, turnovers, breakaways, odd man rushes, penalties, short handed goals, overtime, shootouts and more!
publishers: Nvader Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Das große Brandenburg-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first ending your round trip through Brandenburg
- acting by turn -
1. draw a starting card & 3 places/cards you have to visit
2. form the best route connecting these places
3. travel along this route, draw (travel) cards (and use them to speed up), follow instructions (if any), read statements of places (sightseeing)...

name: Was ist Was Deutschland Quiz
description:
Objective:
get most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point
content:
64 question- & answer cards (backside), wide range (geography, people, politics, history...)
remarks:
supplemented/enhanced by 16 different, German federal states related editions

name: Les dents de la pub
description:
Object of the game is to obtain five budgets, four departments and one agency speaker's chair.

Players roll 2 dice moving on the game board in the "the budget route."
When you have your five budgets, You go to the circular route to win the "departments within your agency."
When you have four departments, simply drop the box "Armchair President" to win the game. Whether it budgets or departments, it is necessary to earn them by answering a questions.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Die Jagd nach dem Kristall
description:
Objective: be the first bringing the treasure (to be found by you or others) back home
- moving by turn -
- there's a treasure (= crystal) - in Hamburg or elsewhere - hidden on the map (one of those flipped markers);
- roll the dice, move & find it;
- but prepare yourself in advance with counter/marker to escape (lightning) or defense/fighting ones, because your opponents are going to hunt you;
- bring it back to your starting place in order to win.
Content:
1 board, 4 meeples, 36 marker/counter, 2 dice, rule sheet

name: Un fin de semana en Madrid
description:
The game board shows a map of Madrid. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Other means of transportation can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the Spanish speaking ability.

name: Experten Quiz Golf
description:
Objective:
find correct answers for questions out of the golf world
- acting by turn -
decision: form teams or acting as 'lone fighter'
give fast & correct answers on questions like:
Who has won 18 major tournaments?
What is a Mulligan?

content:
50 cards with 150 questions, multiple-choice-answers and detailed explanations on the back of the cards
remarks:
game belongs to a series: 'Experten Quiz'
second edition 2009 got a 'streamlined' design
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Eineltis-forvarnarspilið Trabb
