The pieces moved on a single turn are considered to move simultaneously, so for example it's possible for the 2 and 1 to swap positions if the 1 is in front of the 2.

The first player to not have a legal move wins.

name: Tremble ye Tyrants
description:
Fast play rules for Napoleonic Wargaming c.1805 to 1815. A soft cover book of 38 pages in black & white print.
Tremble ye Tyrants! is a set of rules for medium to large scale wargames set in the last decade or so of the Napoleonic Wars, or roughly between 1805 and 1815. This is the classic Napoleonic “Empire” period, including the great campaigns of Austerlitz, Jena, Eylau and Friedland, Aspern and Wagram, as well as the invasions of Spain and Russia, and the decisive allied victories at Leipzig and Waterloo. Tabletop armies can represent a wide variety of real life levels of organisation, from a division up to a full scale army.

Tremble ye Tyrants! is aimed at players who want a fast playing and enjoyable game with a minimum of complex mechanisms, but which retains as much as possible of the tactical flavour of the period, and makes large scale manoeuvres feasible within the confines of an evening’s game. Although designed mainly with 28mm figures in mind, it is suitable for any scale and any size of game.
publishers: Arcane Scenery and Models, Ruga Ruga/North Star miniatures

name: Unser Deutschland
description:
Objective: be the first marking 20 locations on your map
- acting by turn -
each player selects a geographic board/map (Germany before WWII , splitted into 5 different areas);
the moderator draws a card asking all players - if anyone knows correct answer a geographical place is questioned.
If successfully found place is marked with a needle by correspondent player;
if not, place may be searched later on at the end of the game; if no one has found 20 locations after all cards are drawn, unknown places are questioned again, but correspondent map is mentioned.
remarks:
game should be published 1937 +/-1
moderator becomes 6th player, with less players function is rotating

name: Veno's Aviation Race O'er Land and Sea
description:
An early C20th magazine advertising insert for Veno's cough cure, featuring a board game. All playing pieces have to be cut out and pasted to card. The pieces are all types of flying machine, a Veno, Farman, Latham, Wright and Zeppelin. I didn't know there was a plane called a Veno but obviously the publishers decided this was an opportunity too good to miss and thus made an aviation-linked game.
The spinner with ‘hand’ pointer must be assembled.

Players take off from Manchester and 20 squares later, you return to Manchester. The first to arrive on Square 20, wins.

name: Bruin Boys Tidleywinks
description:
A variation on Tidleywinks in that there are five cups to target. Mrs Bruin cup is worth 10 points, the other four being worth 5 points. There is no board, if you miss a cup with a counter, it doesn't score.The first player to score 50 points, wins.

Tiger Tim and the Bruin Boys were comic strip characters created by Julius Stafford Baker.

name: Jet Race Across the USA
description:
Each player begins with their plane in the Boston airport. The winner is the first plane to reach LA. It is simple spin and move game.

This game doesn't seem to have been packaged in a box. The planes "snug" into tabs on the board, and the spinner is part of the board.

Rules from the game board:

At the begging of the race all planes are lined up at Boston airport.

Each player selects the color plane or planes he wishes to race.

Each player in turn spins and advances a plane one city according
to the color on which the spinner stops. Planes must move on their
own colored route.

The first plane to reach Los Angeles Airport is the winner.

name: Le Avventure di Pinocchio
description:
Simple roll and move game along the lines of classic 'Goose' games. Advance around the board. If you land on special spaces, you must obey the instructions.

Made by Cicogna who released many board games from Disney cartoon film, so the game is probably circa 1957 to 1975, main period of activity of this publisher.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Gita in Automobile
description: Simple roll and move game. Players must get from the start to space number 70. If you land on the yellow spaces you must obey the instructions. First to get to the end of the track, wins. Exceptionally nice 1950's graphics.

name: Space Station Alcatraz
description:
You have been sent to Space Station Alcatraz; the hardest rock this side of the galaxy, for crimes you did not commit. Alcatraz is a semi-automated prison placed on an asteroid floating around a black hole. No-one has ever escaped from Alcatraz, but that's about to change.

One player will take the role of the Prison Station Officer, charged with keeping everyone in prison until the end of his shift on the station, the rest of the players will take the part of the prisoners; working together (or sometimes against each other), to escape before the current shift ends and they are all placed into cryo-stasis for the next hundred years - trapped until their next opportunity to try and escape comes along.

The game is an action point based system, with the prisoners using their points to search for escape items, hide in vents, avoid patrolling guards and construct their escape plans and the Station Officer using his to perform sweeps, change robot patrol orders, search for stashes and activate the deadly, deadly vent cleaning laser grid. Play continues for a number of turns until either one player has managed to free their entire team of convicts or cryo-sleep time kicks in. If escapes have happened, but enough prisoners have been kept in Alcatraz then the Prison Officer gets a stern telling off but is the winner, otherwise the player who has managed to free the most valuable members of their team (or escape first in the case of a tie) wins!

So bolt together your space glider, hitch a lift on a passing transport ship or just make a break for it across the asteroid towards an arranged rendezvous and get the heck out of here!

1st Draft has neared completion, and testing is underway.

name: Project Management Master
description:
Project Management Master is a Trivia-style board game with questions about Project Management on different knowledge areas, such as scope, time and quality management. The player, who first responds correctly one question of each of the nine knowledge areas, wins the game.

The game is intended as a supplement instructional strategy for teaching project management in university or professional training courses. Its learning objective is to review and reinforce basic project management concepts in conformance with PMBOK (4. Ed) focusing specifically on the management of software projects.

name: Caccia al Ladro
description:
Promotional game by Nivea, makers of face cream etc.

The title means 'To Catch a Thief'. Players must leave the police station and the first one to arrive back at the police station, wins. As usual with these games, if you land on a square with instructions, they must be obeyed.

name: 10 e 10
description:
Promotional game for Nivea, manufacturer of face-cream, etc., by Italian publisher Edizioni Giochi Lasco.

The title relates to a police call on their radio (I think CB users in the 80's used the call of 10/10).

The board looks extremely complicated, with a path that crosses over and under itself, but it is a standard 'Goose' like game. 122 spaces have been crammed into the board. Set off from home to travel to the Piazza Italia. First to arrive at the Piazza, wins. Remember to follow any instructions on special squares should you land on one.

name: Modern Wormfare 9
description:
Four angry, hungry worms battle it out for food. They want to grow longer and heavier. And they have it in for their opponents.

During the game, players will want to make their worm grow. At the same time, a vital part of battle is to protect the weaker parts of the worms' bodies (mainly the head) by utilizing the cover available in the playing area. They will also try to weaken the enemy worms either through battle or by eating their food.

But all this can't be done at the same time. For instance, you can't eat and fight. Good worms never shoot with their mouths full. So certain decisions must be made. Should they engage in battle or fulfill their hunger? Should they eat food of their own color or that of their enemies? Will they use the food they ate to grow longer or to gain in bulk? Or maybe they should grab that token which will allow them to draw some cards. And what if that bomb detonates when they get close to it?

Depending on the size of their worm, each player has a certain number of dice available to them. These can be used to pay for the cost of Action cards he wishes to play, to move his worm, to defend his worm, etc.

Each player has a hand limit of 8 cards. There are two types of card. Action cards allow the player to take certain good or bad actions. Dice cards are used as dice.

To cut a long story short....... is reminiscent of an arcade game from a decade or two ago.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Biotopia
description:
"Intact biotopes do not only offer plants and animals a chance to live and thrive - they are also immensely important for us humans.

For this reason the players in BIOTOPIA decided to track down environment polluters and to become comitted with the preservation of biotopes. But to achieve this, everybody has to break one's way to the forest first...

A game full of interaction and suspense."

In his turn every player draws 2 path-tiles in the first round and 1 path-tile in each following round. With his path-tiles every player tries to build his path to the forest and to be the first to reach it.
The player in turn always has 2 path-tiles, one of which he may add to his own path or uses it to sabotage the paths of his fellow players and to leave them behind as far as possible.
A blocked path can be reopened by drawing an ecology-card and convincing a jury by giving examples from the players own experiences concerning the topic given on the card. A jury formed of the fellow players decides on the success of this actions.
The jury also decides about success when the players try to convince polluters which they may meet during the course of the game and about the successes of preserving habitats.

name: Eurofortissimo
description:
All players start with the same starting money and travel through all those european countries in which adopted the Euro as their currency. Which of the players will earn the most money? Who will be most successful at the stock markets? Who is going to secure the most valuable business shares?

The player in turn rolls a dice and places his meeple in the matching country, where he can secure business shares, book an overnight stay, live through some events and possibly operate at the stock market or pass on the dice.

When all business shares are in private ownership one last turn of stock market operation follows and then the winner (the player holding the most stocks at the stock market) is determined.

name: The Fox and the Hound Giant Card Game
description:
A card game featuring the characters from the film.

Players try to play all the cards in their hands by making books or sets. A book is three or four cards of the same character. A set is 4 or more cards with the same number. The first player to use all their cards, wins.

The 'Giant' reference in the title refers to the actual size of the cards, not the quantity of cards in the box.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Floor War
description:
A sort of homemade miniatures game. Each player's units (infantry, cavalry, cannon) and the board terrain (hills, houses, trees) are made in a prescribed way from construction paper and household items including matchboxes, egg cartons, pencils etc.

The game is played on a 6' square cloth divided into a 9×9 grid, with some squares occupied by terrain. Players alternate turns moving all their units each turn — cavalry can move 3 squares per turn and other units 1, and infantry cannot enter squares with terrain.

The object is to destroy all the enemy infantry and cavalry using one's cannons. A cannon can be fired only when there are four friendly soldiers in the same square as it. To simulate the effect of firing a cannon, a player shoots a "bullet" of rolled-up paper directly over the cannon using a rubber band in his or her fingers. Any units which he or she knocks over are considered "destroyed" and removed from the game.

This game is from the book The KnowHow Book of Action Games.

name: Cops and Robbers
description:
A game for two or for two teams of two. In the four-player version each player controls three cops or three robbers; in the two-player version each player controls six. The object of the cops is to kill all the robbers, and vice versa.

The game is played on a 13×13 grid which is divided by impenetrable hedges into a maze. Three cops start at each of two opposite corners; three robbers start at each of the other two.

Each player on his/her turn moves one of his/her men up to five spaces. If the man lands adjacent to an enemy man, that man is killed and removed from the board.

This game is from the book The KnowHow Book of Action Games.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Race, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Space War
description:
A race game played on a rectangular board with Alquerque-style board topology (alternate spaces have 8 and 4 neighbors).

The board represents space, and twelve regions of five spaces each are marked as "galaxies" numbered 1 through 12. Each player has three spaceships, and the object of the game is to visit each galaxy with at least one ship, in numerical order.

On their turn each player rolls three dice and moves each of his/her spaceship the number of spaces shown on the corresponding die (the dice are differently colored to correspond to the three spaceships). Spaceships may only enter the numbered galaxies in order.

A player scores 1 point when the spaceship enters a new galaxy, and scores a bonus of 3 and 5 points respectively if his/her second and third spaceships enter the same galaxy before the first one leaves. The game ends when one player moves all three spaceships to the "exit" in one corner of the board, after galaxy 12. The player with the highest score wins.

This game is from the book The KnowHow Book of Action Games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Mecha Carnage
description:
Mecha Carnage is a fast playing, versatile set of miniature wargame rules designed for recreating anime and managa style mech engagements on the tabletop.

The system is generic allowing for creation of custom mechs, vehicles, and infantry from any style of mecha or giant robot based background. It includes rules for genre specific tropes such as transforming mecha (e.g. Robotech), combining mecha (e.g. Voltron), and macro class mecha (e.g. skyscraper sized robots). The design system is simple. but comprehensive.

The game uses an alternating activating system. When a unit is activated it has a certain nmuber of action points (typically 2, but more for heroes) that it can spend to perform actions in the game, including movement, attacks, and trasnforming. Combat is handled via a d20 roll against a target number, which is defined by various modifiers such as the attacker's tech level, target's size, range, & weapon accuracy. If a hit is scored, damage is rolled against the target's armor.

name: Presidential Quiz
description:
"An Educational Card Game" says the box. Cards feature 400 questions and the answers. The subject matter covers Presidents from George Washington to Bill Clinton.

Game published by Safari for the Smithsonian Museum. The museum often collaborates with this publisher, I assume games like this will be sold in the museum's shops.

name: Soap Opera Challenge: Days of Our Lives
description:
Card trivia game. Answer a question correctly and you get to keep the card. Once the deck has been exhausted, the player with the most cards wins.

The game can be very difficult if you are not an obsessive fan of the TV series.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Chipmunk
description:
A set collecting card game from a publisher who specialises in games relating to the animal and plant world.

The cards have 3 different animals in various categories such as Squirrels, Cats, Bears, Weasels, Water Animals, Gnawing Animals, Dogs, Rodents, Strange Animals, Hoofed Animals, Large Hoofed Animals, Zoo Animals, and Tall Zoo Animals. The images are drawn by Nellie Wilkinson.

Various games are suggested by the designer but all follow similar rules to games like Authors, Rummy or Happy Families.

name: Monarch
description:
Card game about Butterflies and Moths.

The game is a set collecting game in the manner of Authors or Quartets, but other variant game rules are included.

The artwork is superb. This designer often worked with this artist and it has proven to be a delightful collaboration.

name: Jeu Des Personnages Celebres de la France
description:
Antique card game.

The cards feature famous historical Frenchmen in sets of subjects like Poets, Artists, Orators, Musicians, and so on. The game is similar to Jaques games in the 19th century in England. Players must collect sets by enquiring and asking other players for cards. A complete set is laid down and the one with the most sets when the cards run out, wins.

The actual set names (in French of course, are;
Hommes utiles, Ecrivains, Femmes celebres, Souverains, Genereaux ou chefs d'armee, Marins, Orateurs, Peintres, Musiciens, Poetes and Recreations Parisiennes.

name: Jeu des Chemins de Fer Européens
description:
A beautiful game to look at, taking a route through France and her neighbours.

The mechanic is roll and move (as in the Goose-type games). If you land on a red space, you are penalised but if you land on a green space, you get some assistance.

The publisher says the game will be most instructive, not only for learning about French towns, you will also learn about the towns in neighbouring countries.

name: Sold! An Auction Game
description:
This game is a battle for the prize of the best loot you can find!
Be a modern day treasure hunter as you outbid your opponents for the best lockers, but be careful that they don't run the price up and leave you with loads of worthless items.

"Sold! An auction game" is a modern day treasure adventure where storage lockers are the treasure chest. The key to this game is using bidding and bluffing techniques to win the best lockers and have a chance to find high end items. Bonuses are built in to give players an element of surprise adding a challenging aspect to the game. The player with the highest combined worth is the winner.

name: Verkehrszeichen kennen
description:
Publishers description from the game box backside translated in English:
A safe way to school. Children are the weakest participants in traffic and are - justified - protected. But it is important, that the children themselves know traffic rules, so they can use their knowledge in real life. The basics for this are the traffic signs, one must know the signs and what they mean. In this game children learn the most important traffic signs just by playing. Each player that knows what a traffic sign mean can move his pawn on a symbolic pedestrians crossing one "move" ahead. Who knows the most traffic signs and is first to reach the goal?

Verkehrszeichen kennen is a quiz game. One player draws a card from the tile, shows the sign and asks the question. Usually along the lines of "what does this traffic sign mean". He hides the answer on the bottom of the card. For a correct answer the player who answered can go one step ahead of the playing board, which is made to look like a pedestrian crossing.

name: Lets Have Church
description:
Throughout the years no three words have captured the essence of "Church-folks" having a good time better than "Let's Have Church!!!" Finally all of your favorite Sunday Morning "faithful phrases" & "funny faux pas" have been made into a hilarious game the whole family can enjoy-"LET'S HAVE CHURCH!!!"

Answer Church surveys & Gospel music trivia, draw outrageous pictures, shake your neighbor's hand, & do your dance. Guess if the phrase, "He's a lawyer in the courtroom" is in the Bible or not? But don't think too long! The Church music timer is playing real "shouting" music in the background. Faster, faster, faster...TIMES UP!!!

With over 500 unique answer choices & challenges, your team can earn up to 7000 points in one action packed game! The team with the most points at the end of three rounds wins the game! So turn off the T.V. and open the box. It's time to play "LET'S HAVE CHURCH!!!"

name: Surrender: Walk Through the Valley of the Shadow of Death
description:
A miraculous experience happened on Earth, JESUS the Christ!

Long-ago Jesus descended from heaven and he is one with the God. Meet and travel with your friend Jesus, he is the same yesterday, today and forever.

Surrender more than just a game it's an experience! a Bible Trivia board game. The game is stimulating, the artwork is captivating but the message is real. Ultimately, Jesus desires for us to get to know him. Travel the Surrender trail of 33 spaces, from Alpha to Omega you will land on circumstances and strengthen your bible knowledge through sentence-completion.

Get excited! Have fun and Surrender all to Jesus, its rewarding!

name: Foreclosure-opoly
description:
Finish the game with the highest credit score and most money, while navigating through life's twists and turns, and avoiding foreclosure.

The unique feature of ForeclosureOpoly is that there are 18 Trivia spaces on the board. When you answer the trivia questions correctly, your credit score increases and you earn cash. Challenge your knowledge. When you answer the trivia questions incorrectly, your credit score drops and you must pay a penalty to the bank. If you don't have enough money to pay your yearly mortgage payment (every time you pass Home) YOU LAND IN FORECLOSURE. That's when staying in the game really gets tough!

Only the smart, savvy and educated can stay out of foreclosure...or GET OUT OF FORECLOSURE!

name: Chariot Tag
description: Roll the dice to determine where you will start your hunt. After reaching your hunting destination, begin your hunt by drawing a card. Each card will tell you what you have to roll to harvest your duck. Ducks move around the board as "shots" are made - hunt where the ducks are! First player to the limit of 10 ducks wins the game!

name: Island Hopping
description:
This is a game about animal behavior. Learn who is your PREDATOR and which animals are you their PREDATOR. Or who can kill you and who can you kill.

When (2) animals land on the same island as another they are in a challenge because there is enough room on the island and a fight must occur.

Hop from island to island until you reach you pre-selected island from a card selected from the deck of cards.

name: Ornitorum
description:
Ornitorum is the first game of Riachuelo Ludum labs, a games design workshop class, in Rio de Janeiro, Brasil . Our games course have two classes in year : march and august. And we search for new designs and game designers.

History :
In this Earth discover the power of ornitorrinco´s eggs and use them in spaceship propulsions. The player are space colonists and have to "produce" eggs for the fuel market. The market is savage and dangerous, but you can gain a lot of profit ! Robbery, traition, laughs and fun are present in this game !

Main Goal :
Each player has your "ornitorrinco´s farm", and needs to "plant" eggs for produce new ornittorincos. The players needs to steal ornitorrinco´s eggs from another players to win the game. But it´s not a easy task, because we can use antimatter traps to protect the eggs.

Winning the game :
The player with more cards with more points is the winner.

The rules are in Portuguese and English, but the cards are language independent.

Game Designers (1st Student Class - March 2012)

Antonio Marcelo
Carlos Monteiro
Fabio Corato
Fabricio Kolk
Jorge Barbosa
Rodrigo Rego
Thiago Escobar
Wilerson Lucas

Artists

Carlos Cade
Marcelo Bissoli

Note: The game will be published in a free PNP.

name: Magtspillet
description:
Magtspillet (The Power Game) is a political incorrect game about Danish politic, which can be played by 2-4 players.

You strive to collect the largest team of ministers, to be able to take power in the "Tinget" (Danish Parliament), and become statsminister (Prime Minister). Betrayal, lawbreaking and slander are just three of powers the players can use.

Magtspillet uses a broad selection of politicians from the last 25 years from Folketinget.

All cards are dealt out, and players take turn to select any card from their collection, choose a category, and beat a random card from an opponents hand. Whoever ends up with all cards, or just the most cards after a predetermined time, wins the game.

The game can also be player like Top Trumps, where the categories are: Scandals, Years in power, Party memberships, Minister seats, and Books published.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Political

name: Glücks-Dynastie
description:
Objective of the game is the construction of a far branched family dynasty. There is no board; every player builds up his own dynasty by skillfully connecting special pieces. The clan with the most widespread structure wins the game.

The 10 different pieces made of strong cardboard have recessions and connectiong cones similar to a jigsaw puzzle. They stand symbolically for love, night, luck, possession, life, success, youth, mind and power.
The player can can 'purchase' them by rolling a 10-sided die and include them into the existing dynasty.

At the beginning every player receives four figures: Two adult figures, a heart and a cloverleaf which stand for love and luck. A family is founded whith these and can be extended with dice-luck and also with tactical planning. In addition to the dice result you can receive points from chips.

Some examples of dice results:
With a thrown '4' you purchase a house, which stands for possession and security. Mind and enducation (symbolized by a star) are added into the dynasty by rolling an '8'. When a '2' is rolled, the moon signals night, end of luck and a stroke of fate; the player should get rid of it again as soon as possible. With a '7' a child (boy/girl) comes into the dynasty, which stands for future and development. A second child in the dynasty will form the foundation for further generations in the construction of the dynasty.

The numerological and color-psychological background on which the game is based are explained in the appendix of the rules of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Director's Cut Survival Horror: The Card Game
description:
The first set of cards is the initial deck, the first movie Zombie Hospital that we wrote for the Director’s Cut Survival Horror role-playing system. There are card sets for two more movies, and plans to release expansions of items and characters at set times during the year. The plan is to write more movies for the Director’s Cut Survival Horror role-playing system and convert them over to the collectible card game. The premise is that anyone can pick up a deck and start playing. The goal of this game is to simply survive the movie, with fewer injuries than your opponents.

Each game consists of a 50-card Scene Deck, required to play the game. The Scene Deck is the movie as a whole. Each player has a deck of 50 cards that they have compiled from the available cards and one archetype card. The archetype is the character they are playing in the movie. Each deck is filled with Items, Actions, and Skills to handle the scenes as well as Wounds and other cards that affect game play and the other players.

While the card game is ideal for two or even eight players, because players are playing against Scenes as well as other players, this game can be played in a solitaire fashion. The whole premise of the game is to recreate surviving a horror movie, without too many rules to learn.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Orkhorde
description:
Orkhorde is a card game based around the daily life of an orc horde. Planning their actions, the orcs can decide to favor their own tribe or to cooperate with larger raids. In the end, it's important how many trophies the tribes gather.

Each game turn, each tribe decides for its members how much work they will spend at the tasks, which is limited by the health of the orcs. Afterwards, these tasks are resolved: the shaman runs a ritual assisted by the other orcs to improve the warbands' chances, the male orcs go hunting alone and as the big warband, the female orcs educate the children and gather fruits and herbs, and in the end the orcs have a chance to improve their position in the pecking order by fighting their immediate superiors. Hunting, raiding and fighting for a better place in the pecking order can net an orc not only food – orcs that go hungry, starve and lose health and thus have fewer activity points to spend for tasks – but also trophies (trophy points) which determine which tribe is the most successful in the end. Part of the rule system has been taken from Wolfsspuren and is used with permission.

Due to the planning phase and inter-horde rivalries, there is lots of competition and backstabbing as well.

name: Postman Pat: Delivery Round Game
description:
Players are postmen travelling round Greendale competing to deliver letters. At the start of the game players are given some letters to deliver. Each time one of these letters is delivered by arriving by exact count on a particular square you take a stamp. The stamps have varying values.

The games ends when one player has delivered all their letters. The winner is the player with the highest total value of stamps, not the player who finished first.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Muckraker: Race for the White House
description:
Welcome to the biggest Media Circus in the world! You have chosen to throw your hat in the ring hoping to become the most powerful person in the world, the leader of the free world, the President of the United States. But to get there you must fight all the others who want the same prize. The fight is guaranteed to be dirty with all the Media Frenzy surrounding it.

In this lighthearted dig at American presidential politics players take on the role of candidates like Congressman Daddy’s Boy or Senator Green with attributes like Tree Hugger, Veteran, Fat Cat, Religious, etc. and compete to win the delegates from twenty-one groups of states or Regions like Hurricane Landfall (the Carolinas), Extra Shipping (Hawaii & Alaska), and Second Biggest (Texas).

Who doesn’t know what politics and elections are about? The candidates definitely do… and so they start with a war chest of funds ranging from $4 million to $10 million. Once used, the funds are gone till the next round of seven regions. So candidates must choose where to use how much carefully. They can also choose to stay out of the race in a region and instead use the funds to Dig for Dirt on the competition.

Each of the regions have their preferences for what kind of candidates they like, so if your attributes match that of a region, your funds go further, and vice versa. But once the campaign funds are spent the outcome is not guaranteed for the leader in spending. That’s when the Media Frenzy begins! Candidates can now play to the Media and either bring-out Support or Protest Rallies, they can use the dirt they collected and expose Scandals about the competition. Each media event can make your spending go further or not so much.

Candidates must be careful not to indulge the media too much, because if more than one person is spending at the same level, the fickle crowd tunes them out, and the highest unique spender win the delegates.

We hope you have the support of your base, you have the fortitude to let a few protests roll off your back, and you don’t have too many scandals in your past. If you do… you might just be the next Commander in Chief!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Denksportkarten Fussball
description:
On the frontside of each card has an IQ task, on the backside there is a solution. For each task, you get a certain number of IQ points credited, you will find in the IQ-log of each card.

Shuffle the cards and distribute to each group the same card number. The groups oppose each other alternately, for each task now. What group solve the task first gets the card.
The winner is the group that holds most of the cards at the end of the game.

name: Blind Test: Classique
description:
Classical Music.
The game consists of an audio CD, including 99 musical excerpts, 20 cards and a "Track List".

Before starting the game, one player will be designated DJ. Its role will be to manage the CD and watching the responses on the "Track Liszt". The option of reading the CD will be on "Random" or "Schuffle" so that the extracts are chosen randomly by the machine.

When the game starts, the 20 cards are shuffled. 19 of them have one of three issues of the Blind Test:
- Who wrote the song?
- When the piece was composed?
- What is the song title?
The music is played and the first player to find the correct answer wins the card.

When all 19 cards have been drawn, each player add the value of his cards. The player who scored the most points is the winner.

name: Blind Test: Piano
description:
The game consists of an audio CD, including 97 musical excerpts, 20 cards and a "Track List".

Before starting the game, one player will be designated DJ. Its role will be to manage the CD and watching the responses on the "Track Liszt". The option of reading the CD will be on "Random" or "Schuffle" so that the extracts are chosen randomly by the machine.

When the game starts, the 20 cards are shuffled. 19 of them have one of three issues of the Blind Test:
- Who wrote the song?
- When the piece was composed?
- What is the song title?
The music is played and the first player to find the correct answer wins the card.

When all 19 cards have been drawn, each player add the value of his cards. The player who scored the most points is the winner.

name: Blind Test: Opéra
description:
The game consists of an audio CD, including 99 musical excerpts, 20 cards and a "Track List".

Before starting the game, one player will be designated DJ. Its role will be to manage the CD and watching the responses on the "Track Liszt". The option of reading the CD will be on "Random" or "Schuffle" so that the extracts are chosen randomly by the machine.

When the game starts, the 20 cards are shuffled. 19 of them have one of three issues of the Blind Test:
- Who wrote the song?
- When the piece was composed?
- What is the song title?
The music is played and the first player to find the correct answer wins the card.

When all 19 cards have been drawn, each player add the value of his cards. The player who scored the most points is the winner.

name: Hermie & Friends Card Game
description:
A card game for 2 to 6 players ages 4 and up. The deck consists of 96 cards, 10 each numbered 1 to 8 and showing a picture of Hermie or one of his friends, and 16 wild cards. Each player starts with a small stack of cards (their 'stock pile') and a hand of 4, played face up. Players take turns playing their cards onto 4 stacks in the center, each central stack starting with a #1 or a wild card, and counting up. First player to get rid of his or her stock pile wins.
Hermie and his friends are from a line of christian children's book by Max Lucado.

name: Im Flugzeug
description:
Objective:
be the first stepping on field 70
- moving by turn -
roll the die - define starting player with a '6'
ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside

remarks:
belongs to series 'Scholz' künstlerische Spiele'
schould be published ~ 1930's
equipped with cute plane meeples
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Les villages
description:
The goal of the game is to build the best buildings in his village like church, school, town hall, fire fighters, homes and businesses.

At the beginning of the game, each player chooses his village and receives a color pawn.
In turn the player draws a card and cards allow you to either acquire a building or to move his pawn. Different buildings scores differently.
The first to reach 100 points wins. Otherwise the game ends when all the buildings are placed and the player who has the most points wins.

name: Holes
description:
In the mid-2000's, something is opening Holes, corridors into other dimensions, which are destroying the Earth's ecological balance. These passages are filled with hostile aliens and mechanical life-forms.

Your objective as a Trained Holebusting Operative is to get to the core and destroy it.

Holes has a wicked sense of humor, with such hostile and funky aliens as Brats, Kagoody, Klowns, Zonies, and Rats. It's a great beer and peanuts game, and lavishly illustrated.

This game is a cross between an RPG and a miniatures game. Players command a squad of 12 humans as they battle their way into a randomly generated maze of corridors. The game uses a d100 for all combat resolution and lets players choose a few modifiers if they want to expand the No-Frills Combat System.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Player Judge, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Superpion
description:
Object of the game
Superpion is a kind of checkers that can play up to four players. Besides the number of players, with the notable difference is that the ladies are orthogonal movement while catches are diagonal. The goal is to capture the most of his opponents pieces without getting caught hers: at the end of the game, each captured pawn is worth 1 point, 2 points each pin retained. Each player can also try one or more Superpions reaching the bottom line of the opposing camps. The Superpions allow increased catches by scanning the plate with a larger amplitude (equivalent of a Lady).

The game ends when there are only pawns in a single player on the board, or when taken have become impossible.
Each player add up points: 1 point per captured pieces, 2 points per his own pieces on the board.
The player who has scored the most points is the winner!

name: Par Monts & Par Vaux
description:
Elaborate game of chance.

Before play, the game has to be assembled. When finished there will be a three-piece slide. At the top of the slide you place a ball. The ball will now trundle downwards, going from one part of the slide to another until it comes out at the end and on to the board. With luck, it will settle into one of the holes and the player scores points for where it has ended up. The winner would be the first to reach a pre-agreed total.

This doesn't seem to have any skill at all. You cannot influence the speed of the ball so it is sheer luck where it ends up. However, I can see it having novelty value, especially for children. And it is rather beautiful to look at.

name: CQS
description:
CQS or Close Quarter Slaughter is a fast-paced brutal skirmish wargame about gray and black ops in cyberpunk Japan.
During various scenarios players will be in command of a squad of ex-military rebellions or multinational special forces. Also there is a third side controlled by the game and used for dynamic showdowns in each scenario.
Players will simultaneously give order to their unites and than resolve them with special mechanic Action Drop. Players will not be limited by turns but the more turns they spend the harder it will be to accomplish their objectives and survive in a firefight.

CQS is attempt to create small wargame were a player know about opponent's forces as few as possible during a course of the game.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Drôles de déchets
description:
At each turn, a card "waste" is returned to the center of the table.

If it is a sort recyclable waste and you have the corresponding large bin, seized the card as soon as possible and throw "the waste" inside.

Be careful not to get overtaken by one of your opponents, since one of them has the mini-trash can and then you fight!

The player with the most sorted and discarded waste at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Tell-a-Tale
description:
You have a pack of word cards, and a spinner. The spinner has two windows, one shows a number, take that number of cards, the other shows a sad or happy face.

You have one minute to use all your word cards to make up a happy or a sad story. If you do this you score 1 point. When all the cards have been used, count up who has most points.

name: Kölle  das Stadt-Spiel
description:
Objective: be the first getting most winning points after agreed time
- moving/acting by turn -
throw the die, move & draw a card due to space ending on

very similar to Bärlin: Das Stadtspiel
content:
230 'sag-mal' cards (trivia)
90 'mach-mal' cards (action)
30 'moment-mal' cards (tactical decisions)
1 board
1 die
1 rule
8 meeples
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Humor, Trivia

name: The Dream Stone
description: Role the dice to travel round the board collecting four different segments of Dreamstone Tokens. When you have all four make your way to the to the finish square. Along the way you may land on squares that will hinder your progress. The first person to reach the finish square with four different Dreamstone Tokens wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Robin Hood & His Merry Men: Sherwood Races
description:
A game for two, three or four players.

On their turn each player rolls the dice and moves their piece that number forward. If you land on a multiple of ten square (10,20,30 etc) your piece is returned to its former position and the player forfeits their turn. This also applies if a piece lands on a log or puddle.

The first player to pass the finishing line wins the race.

name: The Activist Game
description: This game abstractly represents the struggle of an activist group to spread its message and convert the world. It is a single player game played on a 6 by 6 grid, involving the use of two dice and also a number of checker pieces and one piece representing a core group. Players struggle with trying to recruit, and losing support due to attrition and dissension.

name: Tune-In TV Bingo
description: Very unusual item. It plays like a regular picture Bingo game but with the difference that the children must play it whilst they are watching television. If an image appears on screen, if you call out that it is on your Bingo card, then you can mark it as seen. First to get all the images on their card, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: American Football Pursual
description:
British version of an American Football related game.

The game is in two stages. First you have to get round a track (like Game of Goose games) until you get to the centre of the board. On the track you will get various things happen to you, it is just a game of chance.

Once you reach the centre, it becomes an American Football trivia game.

The winner is the first to score a touchdown by asking questions correctly and advancing to the end-zone.

name: Des lettres et des mots
description:
Object of the game is to earn maximum points by getting rid of his letters. To do this, form new words from words already installed.

Each player draws a number of letters: 12 letters each with 2 players, nine letters of 2 to 4 players.
Based on number of players, each laying one or two 3-letter words on the board. These are the starting points they placed horizontally: 2 bases each with 2 players and one each in base 3 and 4 players.

In his turn player must add one of his letters to one of the words posed by changing it to form a new word and the player gets the points corresponding to the number of letters in the word and receives these points in chips.
- If the player can't reconstruct any word, it can exchange a letter from his game with a letter from the deck. In this case, it passes.
The game ends when a player places his last letter.
The player with the most points in chips is the winner.

Some more game-variants included.

name: Toners: Let Us Sing Into The Mouths Of One Another
description:
Using a paper towel tube, two players position the tube so it covers each of their mouths.
On the third player's signal, the two players adjoined by a tube intone a tone. Their goal is to stop and start the tone as many times as possible before the get out of sync. If one of them stops the tone for longer than a second before the other stops, then their turn is over.
The non-intoning player is responsible for counting the number of stops and for judging when the turn should end. Players are awarded one point for each successful start and stop. Play rotates so that the non-intoning player becomes one of the two intoning players in a new round of play.
The player with the most points after a predetermined number of rounds wins.

name: Daniela Katzenberger Party-Time
description:
Objective: score winning points by achieving most accordance;
learn more about your teammates
- acting by turn -
draw a card and ask questions about life-style, fashion, love, partnership... (according to the coloured die roll) out of the world of 'Daniela Katzenberger'
the better you can judge the opinion of your teammates the more points you are going to score ==> judging questions like:
Who trusts somebody to do something?
Who is willing to do delicate things?

name: The Rolling Dead
description:
A competitive or cooperative, dice rolling, Zombie survival experience.
In the game, each player rolls dice to acquire different resources. These resources are used to build and maintain a group of survivors who are working to eliminate the Zombie horde while trying to survive. Each roll of the dice presents difficult choices as players must decide which of these valuable resources they will keep, spend, or chance in order to best equip their survivors!

As the game begins players take turns rolling dice. Players must work to feed their survivors, buy items such as weapons, or special skills that allow players to manipulate their dice rolls to best benefit their survivors. Players will work their way through Town, battling Zombies and gaining Victory Points for each Zombie eliminated and each survivor that remains alive. But players must beware of opponents who can draw Zombies to their location as they try to move in and steal Victory Points and other valuable rewards that are specific to each location in Town. The pace is frantic, the Zombies are hungry and survivors can easily turn on one another!

Can you survive?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Alteration
description:
Alteration is a post apocalyptic card game set in a science fantasy futuristic world that has been destroyed by the cataclysm known as The Great War. In Alteration players take on the roles of mutants, plants, animals, and even pure strain humans in a struggle to claim powerful technology left from before the great war! players take turns acquiring new mutations and researching technology to defeat the opponents.

In Alteration each player receives a random character card that they will use to get their stats, hit points, and special abilities. Each turn players will chose different actions to get more mutation cards, try to research technology, Attack an opponent, or use a power on one of there cards. many of these actions use dice to determine if the attack or power hits or if you can repair the tech you are trying to use and gain its card for use next turn. play continues until only one player has hit points left. The last mutant standing is the winner!

Do you have what it takes to traverse the irradiated wastes of Alteration?

name: Le Goûter de Winnie
description:
Object of the game is to be ​​the first to go home with the full pie, the party favors, sandwiches, drinks and masks.

Setup: The players put up their houses on the corner of the game and choos the characters.
In his turn player spins the wheel. Either the arrow indicates a number to advance his charakter to field with something he doesn't have (party favors, sandwich, drink, masks) and he takes it.
If the arrow indicates "pie" in which case the player chooses a pie face down and shows it to everyone. if the share belongs to his pie he keeps it.

When a player has all the elements of pie he returns to home. First player to reach his house is the winner
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das kleine Kölnquiz
description:
Objective:
give correct answers on questions abouut Cologne -
- acting by turn -
A small trivia game about Cologne with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.
Questions like: Whats the name of a non-Cologne-citizen?
How long was Adenauer senior mayor?
What is a 'Bangendresser', what's a 'Pittermännchen*?
categories: Book, Educational, Party Game, Travel, Trivia

name: Welt der Hansestadt Hamburg das Quiz
description:
Objective: score most winning points knowing correct answers about Hamburg.

With this quiz game the players will learn (with 220 questions) some detailed information about the city of Hamburg. From the box: 'With this game another lifestyle trend arrives now in the world of board games'.
2 different playing versions:
Version 1: active player draws a card and reads the question & 4 possible answers (of which 1, 2 or 3 may be right); now each player may invest gradually chips to be placed betting on different answers; correct answer(s) is(are) printed on the back of the card;
Version 2: find out the proper sequence of three answers regarding posted question
